original: sgrub pa de rnams par sbyor bar byed cing bya ba yang dag par len du 'jug pa po ni ji skad smra ba de bzhin byed pa yin no zhes bya bar rig nas yun ring por gus pas sgrub pa de sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: sgrub pa de rnams par sbyor bar byed cing bya ba yang dag par len du 'jug pa po ni ji skad smra ba de bzhin byed pa yin no zhes bya bar rig nas yun ring por gus pas sgrub pa de sbyor bar byed do //
translated: The one who is a doer of what he says is one who is a doer of what he says, and he is one who is a doer of what he says because he is one who is a doer of what he says.

original: gang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul ba mdor bsdus pa la dad pa la ltos nas /
analyzed: gang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul ba mdor bsdus pa la dad pa la ltos nas /
translated: The Blessed One, in dependence upon faith in the brief summary of disciples,

original: bsdu ba gzhan gnyis gsungs pa'i bsdu ba gnyis po des kyang bsdu ba bzhi po 'di dag bsdus so //
analyzed: bsdu ba gzhan gnyis gsungs pa'i bsdu ba gnyis po des kyang bsdu ba bzhi po 'di dag bsdus so //
translated: has stated two other summaries. By means of those two summaries, he has also summarized the four persuasions.

original: dmigs pa'i chos ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i chos ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos so //
translated: The objective teaching is the perfection teaching.

original: dmigs pa'i chos des nyan par smra ba bsdus te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i chos des nyan par smra ba bsdus te /
translated: The one who speaks of listening to that objective teaching is included in the persuasion of speaking.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos la dmigs nas gzhan dag la bye brag tu shes par yang byed ;
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos la dmigs nas gzhan dag la bye brag tu shes par yang byed ;
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva, having taken the perfection teaching as his objective, causes others to understand it in particular,

original: the tshom gcod par yang byed do //
analyzed: the tshom gcod par yang byed do //
translated: and he also cuts off their doubts.

original: sgrub pa'i chos kyis ni don spyod pa bsdus te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos kyis ni don spyod pa bsdus te /
translated: The teaching of practice is included in the persuasion of benefiting.

original: sgrub pas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la rab tu sbyor ba na don spyod pa la rab brtson pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la rab tu sbyor ba na don spyod pa la rab brtson pa yin no //
translated: When he is engaged in the perfections through practice, he is intent on benefiting others.

original: de rnam par sbyong ba'i chos kyis ni don mthun pa bsdus te /
analyzed: de rnam par sbyong ba'i chos kyis ni don mthun pa bsdus te /
translated: By the Dharma of purification, he attracts those who are to be disciplined by the common weal.

original: don mthun pas sgrub pa de rnam par sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: don mthun pas sgrub pa de rnam par sbyong bar byed do //
translated: For, by the common weal, he purifies that practice.

original: phal cher don med pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la'o zhes bya ba ni gdul ba rnams kyi bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir de kho na nyid ma mthong ba'i phal cher don medüîΩpa yin no //
analyzed: phal cher don med pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la'o zhes bya ba ni gdul ba rnams kyi bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir de kho na nyid ma mthong ba'i phal cher don med pa yin no //
translated: For the most part, it is without a basis in reality on the stage of action out of faith, because he does not know the thoughts and the proclivities of those to be disciplined as they are in reality, and so he does not see reality.

original: phal cher zhes smos pas rnam pa thams cad du don med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phal cher zhes smos pas rnam pa thams cad du don med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Since he says ‚Äúfor the most part,‚Äù it is not that there is no reality at all.

original: de ltar rtag tu longs spyod ma chags blo //
analyzed: de ltar rtag tu longs spyod ma chags blo //
translated: Thus, his mind is always unattached to enjoyments.

original: zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas longs spyod dag la ma chags pa ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas longs spyod dag la ma chags pa ston to //
translated: This shows that, by the perfection of generosity, his mind is unattached to enjoyments.

original: zhi zhes smos pas ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston te /
analyzed: zhi zhes smos pas ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston te /
translated: The word pacification indicates the perfection of morality,

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las mi dge ba nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las mi dge ba nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it pacifies the unwholesome actions of body, speech, and mind.

original: sdom zhes smos pas ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ston to //
analyzed: sdom zhes smos pas ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ston to //
translated: The word restraint indicates the perfection of patience,

original: 'di ltar sdom pa zhes bya ba'i skad kyi byings ni nye bar zhi ba'i don du 'don te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sdom pa zhes bya ba'i skad kyi byings ni nye bar zhi ba'i don du 'don te /
translated: because the verbal root in the word restraint has the meaning of pacification.

original: bzod pa dang ldan pa ni gshe ba dang brdeg pa thams cad bzod do //üîΩsrid yul mtshan ma rnam par mi rtog pa //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzod pa dang ldan pa ni gshe ba dang brdeg pa thams cad bzod do // srid yul mtshan ma rnam par mi rtog pa // zhes bya ba la /
translated: One who is patient endures all abuse and beatings.

original: srid pa zhes smos pas ni nang gi chos rnams gzung ngo //
analyzed: srid pa zhes smos pas ni nang gi chos rnams gzung ngo //
translated: The word existence indicates internal phenomena,

original: yul zhes smos pas ni phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams bzung ste /
analyzed: yul zhes smos pas ni phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams bzung ste /
translated: and the word object indicates external things.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir de dag la rnam par rtog par mi byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir de dag la rnam par rtog par mi byed do //
translated: Because the bodhisattva has attained nonconceptual wisdom, he does not conceptualize them.

original: de ni sems can tshogs sdud byed pa yin //
analyzed: de ni sems can tshogs sdud byed pa yin //
translated: He is the one who gathers the hosts of sentient beings.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can gyis tshogs sdud par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can gyis tshogs sdud par byed do //
translated: Thus, he attracts beings by means of the four social practices.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on the social practices is completed.

original: // / @131a * //  'di man chad ni sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dang / tshad med pa rnams te /
analyzed: // / @131a * //  'di man chad ni sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dang / tshad med pa rnams te /
translated: From here on, the topics are worship of the buddhas, reliance on spiritual friends, and the immeasurables.

original: 'di dag gi 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag gi 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is their connection?

original: rang la phan pa bsgrub pa'i phyir sngar pha rol tu phyin pa rnams bstan to //üîΩgzhan la phan par bya ba bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang la phan pa bsgrub pa'i phyir sngar pha rol tu phyin pa rnams bstan to // gzhan la phan par bya ba bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: The transcendences were taught previously in order to accomplish benefit for oneself.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams bstan to //üîΩrang la phan pa phun sum tshogs pa la bde ba la lhag par zhen pa srid pas de'i phyir de'i 'og tu bde ba la lhag par zhen pa'i gnyen por sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / bshes gnyen la brten pa ste /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams bstan to // rang la phan pa phun sum tshogs pa la bde ba la lhag par zhen pa srid pas de'i phyir de'i 'og tu bde ba la lhag par zhen pa'i gnyen por sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / bshes gnyen la brten pa ste /
translated: The social practices were taught in order to accomplish benefit for others.üîΩWorship of the buddhas and reliance on spiritual friends are taught immediately after the social practices in order to accomplish both benefits.üîΩWorship of the buddhas and reliance on spiritual friends are taught in order to accomplish both benefits, since it is possible that one who has attained the perfection of benefit for oneself might cling to happiness.

original: sangs rgyas la mchod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la mchod pa'i phyir /
translated: Worship of the buddhas is taught as the antidote to clinging to happiness.

original: sgrub pa'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba la goms pas longs spyod kyi bde ba la lhag par zhen par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba la goms pas longs spyod kyi bde ba la lhag par zhen par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Through habituation to giving away the things that are accomplished, one does not become attached to the happiness of wealth.

original: lus dang srog la mi lta zhing bshes gnyen mgu bar bya ba la rab tu zhugs pa yang bdag nyid bde ba la longs spyod par mi 'gyur bas sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa 'di gnyi ga la yang bde ba la lhag par zhen pa'i gnyen por bshad do //
analyzed: lus dang srog la mi lta zhing bshes gnyen mgu bar bya ba la rab tu zhugs pa yang bdag nyid bde ba la longs spyod par mi 'gyur bas sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa 'di gnyi ga la yang bde ba la lhag par zhen pa'i gnyen por bshad do //
translated: And through not caring for body and life and through being engaged in pleasing the spiritual master, one does not enjoy one's own happiness. Thus, both worship of the Buddha and reliance on the spiritual master are explained as antidotes to attachment to happiness.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams kyis gzhan la phan pa la 'jug par rab tu sbyor ba la de'i log par bsgrubs pas sdug bsngal yal bar 'dor te /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams kyis gzhan la phan pa la 'jug par rab tu sbyor ba la de'i log par bsgrubs pas sdug bsngal yal bar 'dor te /
translated: One is engaged in benefiting others through the means of gathering disciples, but one endures the suffering of their ingratitude.

original: ji lta ji ltar sems can de dag yongs su smin par byed pa ni log par sgrub cing 'dul ba la mi gnas pa de lta de ltar byang chub sems dpa' de dag yal bar 'dor bar 'gyur ba de'i gnyen por tshad med pa rnams so //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar sems can de dag yongs su smin par byed pa ni log par sgrub cing 'dul ba la mi gnas pa de lta de ltar byang chub sems dpa' de dag yal bar 'dor bar 'gyur ba de'i gnyen por tshad med pa rnams so //
translated: The immeasurables are the antidote to the fact that the more bodhisattvas work to bring beings to full maturity, the more they are abused and not disciplined.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' byams pa la sogs pas yongs su bsgom pas ni gnas skabs gang du yang sems can rnams yal bar mi 'dor bas de'i phyir tshad med pa dag bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' byams pa la sogs pas yongs su bsgom pas ni gnas skabs gang du yang sems can rnams yal bar mi 'dor bas de'i phyir tshad med pa dag bstan to //
translated: Since bodhisattvas such as Maitreya, the great being, never abandon beings at any time, the immeasurables are taught.üîΩThe dedication brings the accumulations of merit and wisdom to completion.

original: yongs su bsngo ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni mchod pa 'dis ring por mi thogs par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig ces bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa de'i
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni mchod pa 'dis ring por mi thogs par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig ces bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa de'i
translated: The dedication is the wish that through this offering, may the accumulations of merit and wisdom be completed before long.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i don du yongs su sngo bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i don du yongs su sngo bar byed pa'o //
translated: He dedicates for the sake of completing the stores of merit and knowledge.

original: rgyu ni sngon gyi smon lam mo //
analyzed: rgyu ni sngon gyi smon lam mo //
translated: The cause is the former aspiration.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs @131b gzhan dag na smon lam btab pa gang yin pa de rgyu yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs @131b gzhan dag na smon lam btab pa gang yin pa de rgyu yin te /
translated: That is the cause which is the former aspiration that was made in other lives.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mjug thogs su /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mjug thogs su /
translated: For that very reason, immediately after that,

original: bdag la sangs rgyas 'byung ba don yod par gyur cig ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bdag la sangs rgyas 'byung ba don yod par gyur cig ces bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúMay the appearance of the Buddha be meaningful for me.‚Äù

original: zhing ni sems can tshad med pa rnams te /
analyzed: zhing ni sems can tshad med pa rnams te /
translated: The field is immeasurable sentient beings.

original: de yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: For the sake of their complete maturation means for the sake of the complete maturation of sentient beings.

original: de dag gis de la rab tu sbyar bas zhes bya ba'i ni sems can de dag gis mchod pa de la rab tu sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag gis de la rab tu sbyar bas zhes bya ba'i ni sems can de dag gis mchod pa de la rab tu sbyor bar byed do //
translated: They apply themselves to that means those sentient beings apply themselves to that worship.

original: de dag gis rab tu sbyar bas sems can zhing lta bu de dag la mchod pa sa bon la sogs pa lta bu ma 'ongs pa na sangs rgyas la mchod pa'i me tog skye bar bya ba'i don du zhes bya ba'i phyir btab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis rab tu sbyar bas sems can zhing lta bu de dag la mchod pa sa bon la sogs pa lta bu ma 'ongs pa na sangs rgyas la mchod pa'i me tog skye bar bya ba'i don du zhes bya ba'i phyir btab par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they are applied to those sentient beings who are like fields, those offerings are planted in them, like seeds, in order to generate the future flowers of offerings to the Buddhas.

original: mos pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni mos pa dang / bsam pa dang / dbang 'byor ba nyid do //
analyzed: mos pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni mos pa dang / bsam pa dang / dbang 'byor ba nyid do //
translated: Interest and so on means interest, intention, and mastery.

original: de la mos pa ni 'di lta ste mchod pa dang ldan pa'i theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa'o //
analyzed: de la mos pa ni 'di lta ste mchod pa dang ldan pa'i theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa'o //
translated: Among them, interest is, for example, interest in the Mahayana teachings that are endowed with offerings.

original: bsam pa ni bsam pa dgu po ro myang ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / mngon par dga' ba'i bsam pa dag pa dang / ngoms mi shes pa dang / rgya chen po dang / dga' ba dang / phan pa dang / ma gos pa dang /
analyzed: bsam pa ni bsam pa dgu po ro myang ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / mngon par dga' ba'i bsam pa dag pa dang / ngoms mi shes pa dang / rgya chen po dang / dga' ba dang / phan pa dang / ma gos pa dang /
translated: Intention is the nine intentions: the pure intentions of relishing, rejoicing, and delighting, the insatiable, the vast, the joyful, the beneficial, the uncontaminated,

original: dge ba'i bsam pa dag go //
analyzed: dge ba'i bsam pa dag go //
translated: and the virtuous.

original: dbang 'byor ba nyid ni nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: dbang 'byor ba nyid ni nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: Mastery is the meditative concentration of the sky treasury and so on.

original: 'di ni sems la brten pa'i mchod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sems la brten pa'i mchod pa yin no //
translated: This is worship based on the mind.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ste /
translated: The generation of the spirit of enlightenment.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa sbyar ba'i dor smon lam nyid smon par bshad pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar tshigs su bcad pa ni smon pa zhes sbyar ro //üîΩsmon lam gang yin pa de sems bskyed pa yin no zhes sems bskyed pa'i rnam grangs su yang ston te /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa sbyar ba'i dor smon lam nyid smon par bshad pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar tshigs su bcad pa ni smon pa zhes sbyar ro // smon lam gang yin pa de sems bskyed pa yin no zhes sems bskyed pa'i rnam grangs su yang ston te /
translated: Here, the verse is applied to the vow, and the vow is explained as the aspiration.üîΩAnd the vow is the generation of the spirit of enlightenment.

original: 'di yang sems la brten pa'i mchod pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: 'di yang sems la brten pa'i mchod pa kho na yin la /
translated: This is also worship based on the mind.

original: sems can la brtse ba'i mchod pa gang yin pa de yang sems la brten pa kho na yin par blta'o //
analyzed: sems can la brtse ba'i mchod pa gang yin pa de yang sems la brten pa kho na yin par blta'o //
translated: And the worship of beings out of compassion is also to be regarded as based on the mind.üîΩThe verse:

original: gzhi la gtod dang rtogs pa dang // zhes bya ba ni gzhi la gtod pa dang / gzhi rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhi la gtod dang rtogs pa dang // zhes bya ba ni gzhi la gtod pa dang / gzhi rtogs pa ste /
translated: The basis, the application, and the realization,

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba yin par ston te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba yin par ston te /
translated: shows the proper mental attention and the right view.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi sgo nas ni byang chub chen po 'thob pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas @132a * //üîΩnyid 'thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi sgo nas ni byang chub chen po 'thob pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas @132a * // nyid 'thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This is synonymous with attaining buddhahood.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas la mchod pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis 'jug pa rnams sangs rgyas nyid 'thob pa gang yin pa 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la mchod pa'i mchog yin no //üîΩrgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas la mchod pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis 'jug pa rnams sangs rgyas nyid 'thob pa gang yin pa 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la mchod pa'i mchog yin no // rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang ni /
translated: This attainment of buddhahood by bodhisattvas who enter into the stages of worship of the Buddha and so on is the supreme worship of the transcendent lords, the buddhas.üîΩWorship is to be understood as past, future, and present, internal and external, gross and subtle, inferior and superior.

original: zhes bya ba nas bzung ste da ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas bzung ste da ni /
translated: From the verse, ‚ÄúWorship is to be understood as cause and effect,

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / nang dang phyi dang / rags pa dang phra ba dang / dman pa dang / gya nom pa'i dbye bas mchod pa shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / nang dang phyi dang / rags pa dang phra ba dang / dman pa dang / gya nom pa'i dbye bas mchod pa shes par bya ste /
translated: up to the verse, ‚ÄúWorship is to be understood as past, future, and present, internal and external, gross and subtle, inferior and superior.‚Äù

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i sgo nas mchod pa la rnyed pa ni chos gos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i sgo nas mchod pa la rnyed pa ni chos gos la sogs pa'o //
translated: Worship by means of gain and honor. Gain is robes and so on.

original: bkur sti ni bstod pa dang phyag bya ba dang / thal mo sbyar ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bkur sti ni bstod pa dang phyag bya ba dang / thal mo sbyar ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Respect is praise, homage, and the like.

original: yang nga rgyal dang bcas pa ni dman pa'o //
analyzed: yang nga rgyal dang bcas pa ni dman pa'o //
translated: Again, the inferior is that which is accompanied by pride.üîΩThe excellent is that which is free from pride.

original: nga rgyal med pa ni gya nom pa ste zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa las de rnam gnyis zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de yang zhes bya ba'i sgras rnam pa gnyis nyid ston to //
analyzed: nga rgyal med pa ni gya nom pa ste zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa las de rnam gnyis zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de yang zhes bya ba'i sgras rnam pa gnyis nyid ston to //
translated: The verse states that it is twofold. The word ‚Äúagain‚Äù in the commentary indicates that it is twofold.

original: sgrub pa de'i dman pa nyid chung ngu'i dbye ba dang nga rgyal gyi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis su ston te /
analyzed: sgrub pa de'i dman pa nyid chung ngu'i dbye ba dang nga rgyal gyi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis su ston te /
translated: The inferior is shown to be twofold, as a lesser form of practice and as a form of practice that is accompanied by pride.

original: sgrub pa chung ngu yang dman pa yin la /
analyzed: sgrub pa chung ngu yang dman pa yin la /
translated: A lesser form of practice is inferior.

original: nga rgyal dang bcas pa yang dman pa yin no //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang bcas pa yang dman pa yin no //
translated: A form of practice that is accompanied by pride is also inferior.

original: sgrub pa'i gya nom pa nyid kyang rnam pa gnyis su ston te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i gya nom pa nyid kyang rnam pa gnyis su ston te /
translated: The excellent is shown to be twofold, as a greater form of practice and as a form of practice that is free from pride.

original: sgrub pa chen po yang gya nom pa yin la /
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po yang gya nom pa yin la /
translated: A greater form of practice is excellent.

original: nga rgyal med pa yang gya nom pa yin no //
analyzed: nga rgyal med pa yang gya nom pa yin no //
translated: A form of practice that is free from pride is also excellent.

original: sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan dang / de'i dus su sbyor ba'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan dang / de'i dus su sbyor ba'i bye brag gis so //
translated: Application is in terms of the distinction of time and the distinction of the time of application.

original: 'gro ba rnams bar chad pas ni ring po'o zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs gzhan mang po zhig 'das nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa thob par 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams bar chad pas ni ring po'o zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs gzhan mang po zhig 'das nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa thob par 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The distant is due to the interruption of the transmigrations, i.e., that worship of the Lord which is attained after many rebirths have elapsed.

original: de ma thag pa'i nye ba'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i nye ba'o //
translated: The proximate is immediate,

original: zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi dus kyi mchod pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi dus kyi mchod pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: i.e., that worship which is in the present time.

original: de ni thob ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa la 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni thob ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa la 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That is the worship of the Lord which is undertaken immediately upon its attainment.üîΩBecause all the meanings are mixed and thoroughly mixed,

original: don thams cad ni 'dres pa nye bar 'dres pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dres pa phul du byung bar ston to //
analyzed: don thams cad ni 'dres pa nye bar 'dres pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dres pa phul du byung bar ston to //
translated: i.e., the excellence of the mixing is shown.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i gnas skabs su bde ba la lhag par zhen pa'i gnyen po ni bshad ma thag pa kho na sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i gnas skabs su bde ba la lhag par zhen pa'i gnyen po ni bshad ma thag pa kho na sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The remedy for the attachment to pleasure in the stage of reliance on the spiritual mentor should be applied just as it has been explained.

original: dul ba ni tshul khrims @132b dang ldan pa'i phyir dbang po dul bas so zhes bya ba ni kun tu chags par gyur pa'i dngos po dag la mtshan mar 'dzin par mi byed /
analyzed: dul ba ni tshul khrims @132b dang ldan pa'i phyir dbang po dul bas so zhes bya ba ni kun tu chags par gyur pa'i dngos po dag la mtshan mar 'dzin par mi byed /
translated: He is self-controlled because he is endowed with morality and because he has controlled his senses. He does not grasp the signs of things that are objects of attachment.

original: mngon rtags su 'dzin par mi byed par mi dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams te /
analyzed: mngon rtags su 'dzin par mi byed par mi dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams te /
translated: He does not grasp their indications.

original: gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa yin no //
translated: He is one who dwells with his senses controlled.

original: zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: He is peaceful because he is endowed with meditative concentration.

original: sems nang du zhi bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sems nang du zhi bar gnas pa'o //
translated: His mind dwells in inner peace.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe sems phyi rol du 'phros pa zhi gnas kyi stobs kyis dmigs pa gcig la 'jug pa de'i tshe zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe sems phyi rol du 'phros pa zhi gnas kyi stobs kyis dmigs pa gcig la 'jug pa de'i tshe zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When his mind, which has been scattered externally, is brought into a single area of focus by the power of meditative concentration, then it is said to be peaceful.

original: nye bar zhi ba ni shes rab dang ldan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pas nye bar gnas pa nye bar zhi bas so zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe 'di'i sems rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis phyi rol du 'phro zhing nyon mongs pa rnams kyis dmigs pa las rab
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba ni shes rab dang ldan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pas nye bar gnas pa nye bar zhi bas so zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe 'di'i sems rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis phyi rol du 'phro zhing nyon mongs pa rnams kyis dmigs pa las rab
translated: He is calm because he is endowed with wisdom and because he has calmed the disturbance of the mental afflictions. When his mind is scattered externally by some means, he brings it back into its proper place by the power of wisdom.

original: tu bskyod pa de'i tshe yang shes rab kyi gnyen po'i stobs kyis myur ba myur ba kho nar nye bar zhi bar byed pas so //
analyzed: tu bskyod pa de'i tshe yang shes rab kyi gnyen po'i stobs kyis myur ba myur ba kho nar nye bar zhi bar byed pas so //
translated: and when they arise, he quickly pacifies them by the power of the antidote of wisdom.üîΩHe honors the spiritual friend with service,

original: bkur sti rnyed pa dag dang rim gro dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bkur sti rnyed pa dag dang rim gro dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: with material support, and with practice.

original: bkur sti ni yang dag pa'i yon tan bsgrags pa dang phyag 'tshal ba dang / ldang ba dang thal mo sbyar ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bkur sti ni yang dag pa'i yon tan bsgrags pa dang phyag 'tshal ba dang / ldang ba dang thal mo sbyar ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Service is proclaiming his good qualities, bowing down to him, rising up for him, respectfully saluting him with joined palms, etc.

original: rnyed pa ni chos gos dang bsod snyoms la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa ni chos gos dang bsod snyoms la sogs pa ste /
translated: Material support is Dharma robes, alms, etc.

original: 'di dag gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen mchod par byed do //üîΩrim gro ni bsku ba dang / phyi ba dang / bkru ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen mchod par byed do // rim gro ni bsku ba dang / phyi ba dang / bkru ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: With these he honors the spiritual friend.

original: sgrub pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis ji skad gdams pa de kho na bzhin du bsgrubs pas sgrub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis ji skad gdams pa de kho na bzhin du bsgrubs pas sgrub par byed pa ste /
translated: Practice is the accomplishment of what the spiritual friend has enjoined.

original: bsgrubs pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen mchod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgrubs pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen mchod par 'gyur ro //
translated: By practicing, he honors the spiritual friend.

original: de bzhin blo ldan chos la ni //
analyzed: de bzhin blo ldan chos la ni //
translated: The wise one honors the Dharma

original: shes sam dus su 'dud pas bshes gnyen bgrod //
analyzed: shes sam dus su 'dud pas bshes gnyen bgrod //
translated: with humility, and at the proper time.

original: ces bya ba ni kun shes par 'dod pa nyid ston te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni kun shes par 'dod pa nyid ston te /
translated: This shows the desire to know.

original: kun shes par 'dod pa'i bsam pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen bgrod kyi /
analyzed: kun shes par 'dod pa'i bsam pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen bgrod kyi /
translated: One should approach spiritual teachers with the intention of knowing everything,

original: rnam par mtho 'tsham pa'i bsam pas kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: rnam par mtho 'tsham pa'i bsam pas kyang ma yin la /
translated: not with the intention of finding fault,

original: chos brku ba'i phyir yang ma yin no //
analyzed: chos brku ba'i phyir yang ma yin no //
translated: and not for the purpose of stealing the Dharma.

original: dus su zhes bya ba ni dus shes pa nyid ston te /
analyzed: dus su zhes bya ba ni dus shes pa nyid ston te /
translated: The proper time is the time for learning.

original: dus su dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro'i /
analyzed: dus su dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro'i /
translated: One should approach spiritual teachers at the proper time,

original: zan za ba la sogs pa'i dus su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zan za ba la sogs pa'i dus su ni ma yin no //
translated: not at mealtime, etc.

original: 'dud pas zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal bcag cing dman pa'i sems kyis nye bar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'dud pas zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal bcag cing dman pa'i sems kyis nye bar 'gro ba'o //
translated: With humility means with a humble mind, having set aside pride.

original: de ni bsnyen bkur rnyed la 'dod pa med //
analyzed: de ni bsnyen bkur rnyed la 'dod pa med //
translated: One should not desire gain and honor.

original: bsgrub par bya phyir de @133a * //üîΩyongs sngo bar byed //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya phyir de @133a * // yongs sngo bar byed //
translated: One should dedicate oneself to practice.

original: ces bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i don du dge ba'i bshes gnyen brten gyi /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i don du dge ba'i bshes gnyen brten gyi /
translated: One should approach spiritual teachers for the purpose of practice,

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i don du ni ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i don du ni ma yin pa ste /
translated: not for the purpose of gain and honor.

original: bdag dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrub par gyur cig / rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa la sogs pa'i don du ni /üîΩma gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrub par gyur cig / rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa la sogs pa'i don du ni / ma gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: May I not practice for the sake of gain, honor, or fame.

original: zhing dag pa yang sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zhing dag pa sbyang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: zhing dag pa yang sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zhing dag pa sbyang ba ma yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin order to purify the pure field‚Äù means that the field is not to be purified.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa ci 'dra ba de lta bur bdag gis kyang yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //üîΩzhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa ci 'dra ba de lta bur bdag gis kyang yongs su sbyang bar bya'o // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as the Buddha‚Äôs field is purified, so I will purify it.‚ÄùüîΩThe wise one, by cause and effect,

original: blo ldan rgyu dang 'bras bu dang // zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dad pas ni ltar byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: blo ldan rgyu dang 'bras bu dang // zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dad pas ni ltar byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: means that the cause of the arising of faith is reliance on a spiritual teacher.

original: da ltar byung ba ni 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ni 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The present is the effect.

original: de nyid ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: That itself is the cause of the future.

original: 'di ni rgyu dang 'bras bur rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu dang 'bras bur rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: This is the presentation of cause and effect.

original: chos kyi sgo'i rjes su 'gro bas bshes gnyen la brten ces bya ba la /
analyzed: chos kyi sgo'i rjes su 'gro bas bshes gnyen la brten ces bya ba la /
translated: One is said to attend on the spiritual master by following the door of the Dharma.

original: chos kyi sgo'i rjes su 'gro ba ni chos kyi sgo'i rgyun gyi ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: chos kyi sgo'i rjes su 'gro ba ni chos kyi sgo'i rgyun gyi ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: Following the door of the Dharma is the meditative concentration called the stream of the door of the Dharma.

original: gang gi tshe dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad nas ting nge 'dzin de thob la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad nas ting nge 'dzin de thob la /
translated: When one meets a spiritual master and attains that meditative concentration,

original: chos kyi rgyun de yang dang yang du sgom par byed na /
analyzed: chos kyi rgyun de yang dang yang du sgom par byed na /
translated: and cultivates that stream of the Dharma again and again,

original: de ltar na dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: then one attends on the spiritual master.

original: blo ldan sbyor dang 'gro ba dang / mos pa'i sgo nas ring ba dang nye ba'i dbye ba ste /
analyzed: blo ldan sbyor dang 'gro ba dang / mos pa'i sgo nas ring ba dang nye ba'i dbye ba ste /
translated: The wise are distant or near in terms of application, going, and aspiration.

original: snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩzhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnam par chad pa'i ni ring ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o // zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnam par chad pa'i ni ring ba'o //
translated: As before, application means the application of mindfulness.

original: de ma thag pa'i ni nye ba'o //üîΩdus gzhan na sbyar bar bya ba'i ni ring ba'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i ni nye ba'o // dus gzhan na sbyar bar bya ba'i ni ring ba'o //
translated: One is said to be distant if one is separated from the spiritual master by a long time, and near if one is separated by a short time.üîΩOne is said to be distant if one is separated from the spiritual master by a long time, and near if one is separated by a short time.

original: de'i dus su sbyar bar bya ba ni nye ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dus su sbyar bar bya ba ni nye ba'o //
translated: One is said to be distant if one is separated from the spiritual master by a long time, and near if one is separated by a short time.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brnyan pa gang zhig rab tu sbyar bar smon lam 'debs pa de ni ring ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brnyan pa gang zhig rab tu sbyar bar smon lam 'debs pa de ni ring ba'o //
translated: The distant one is the aspiration to apply oneself to the spiritual teacher.

original: gang zhig bya bar smon lam 'debs pa ni nye ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig bya bar smon lam 'debs pa ni nye ba'o //
translated: The near one is the aspiration to do what he tells one to do.

original: bshes gnyen dam pa la brten pa'i mchog ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rnam pa lngas rang gi sems kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la brten pa mchog tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bshes gnyen dam pa la brten pa'i mchog ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rnam pa lngas rang gi sems kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la brten pa mchog tu rig par bya'o //
translated: The best reliance on the holy spiritual teacher is as before, i.e., by the five kinds of reliance with one's own mind.

original: 'di lta ste bstan pa dang ldan pa'i theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa dang bsam pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste bstan pa dang ldan pa'i theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa dang bsam pa ste /
translated: It is the aspiration to the teaching of the universal vehicle, and the aspiration to the intention.

original: bsam pa dgu po ro myang ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / mngon par dga' @133b ba'i bsam pa dag pa dang / ngoms mi shes pa dang / rgya chen po dang / dga' ba dang / phan pa dang / ma gos pa dang /
analyzed: bsam pa dgu po ro myang ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / mngon par dga' @133b ba'i bsam pa dag pa dang / ngoms mi shes pa dang / rgya chen po dang / dga' ba dang / phan pa dang / ma gos pa dang /
translated: The aspiration to the intention is ninefold: the aspiration to savor, to rejoice, to delight, to be insatiable, to be vast, to be joyful, to be helpful, to be unstained,üîΩand to be virtuous.

original: dge ba'i bsam pa rnams dang / dbang 'byor ba nyid de /
analyzed: dge ba'i bsam pa rnams dang / dbang 'byor ba nyid de /
translated: The aspiration to mastery is the aspiration to the ten masteries.

original: nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi thabs yongs su bzung ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po thams cad dang / don gcig pa nyid la 'jug pa'i sgo nas te /
analyzed: nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi thabs yongs su bzung ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po thams cad dang / don gcig pa nyid la 'jug pa'i sgo nas te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the perfection of generosity is not satisfied with just a little.

original: don thams cad ni 'dres pa nye bar 'dres pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde nyid sems kyi rnal 'byor yin no zhes bya ba ni bsam pa dang bsgom pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: don thams cad ni 'dres pa nye bar 'dres pa yin pa'i phyir ro // de nyid sems kyi rnal 'byor yin no zhes bya ba ni bsam pa dang bsgom pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The means of not being satisfied with just a little is the perfection of generosity.üîΩThe bodhisattva who is established in the perfection of generosity is not satisfied with just a little.

original: tshad med pa rnam par dbye ba ni gzhan gyi don bya ba dag la mi skyo ba'i thabs te /
analyzed: tshad med pa rnam par dbye ba ni gzhan gyi don bya ba dag la mi skyo ba'i thabs te /
translated: The means of not being satisfied with just a little is the perfection of generosity.üîΩThe bodhisattva who is established in the perfection of generosity is not satisfied with just a little.üîΩThe means of not being satisfied with just a little is the perfection of generosity.

original: byang chub sems dpa' tshangs pa'i gnas dag gis gnas pa ni gzhan gyi don bya ba dag la skyo bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshangs pa'i gnas dag gis gnas pa ni gzhan gyi don bya ba dag la skyo bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the perfection of generosity is not satisfied with just a little.üîΩThe means of not being satisfied with just a little is the perfection of generosity.üîΩThe bodhisattva who is established in the perfection of generosity is not satisfied with just a little.

original: btang snyoms ni tshor ba de dag la sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa med par sgrub pa'i rnam pa yin no zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med par sgrub pa'i rnam pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa sgrub pa'i rnam
analyzed: btang snyoms ni tshor ba de dag la sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa med par sgrub pa'i rnam pa yin no zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med par sgrub pa'i rnam pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa sgrub pa'i rnam
translated: The aspect of establishing the absence of defilement is the aspect of establishing the absence of defilement.

original: pas te / sems can 'di rnams tshor ba 'di dag la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba'i nyes pa 'byung bar ma gyur cig snyam pa'o //
analyzed: pas te / sems can 'di rnams tshor ba 'di dag la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba'i nyes pa 'byung bar ma gyur cig snyam pa'o //
translated: The thought: May these sentient beings not be subject to the fault of attachment and hostility in regard to these feelings is the aspect of establishing the absence of defilement.

original: dmigs pa med pa ni de bzhin nyid la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa ni de bzhin nyid la 'jug pa ste /
translated: The absence of mental support is the entry into thusness.

original: de dag tu rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag tu rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the absence of conceptual differentiation in regard to those,üîΩthe absence of mental support is similar to the absence of mental support.üîΩThe absence of mental support is the absence of mental support.

original: dmigs pa med pa dang 'dra bas na dmigs pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni kye ma bde ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa dang 'dra bas na dmigs pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni kye ma bde ba'o //
translated: Oh, what happiness!

original: sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: What suffering!

original: dga' bar gyur cig ces bya ba dang / sems can rnams so zhes bya bar rnam par mi rtog par ro gcig pa'i phyir gnas skabs de na sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs kyi rnam pa de'i rnams so sor nges pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pas dmigs pa med pa zhes bya'i //
analyzed: dga' bar gyur cig ces bya ba dang / sems can rnams so zhes bya bar rnam par mi rtog par ro gcig pa'i phyir gnas skabs de na sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs kyi rnam pa de'i rnams so sor nges pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pas dmigs pa med pa zhes bya'i //
translated: The phrase they are not objects means that at that time, the collection of mind and mental factors is not the specific characteristic of that aspect, because they are of one taste, without conceptualization, as in the statement May they be happy! and the statement sentient beings.

original: de dag la gnas skabs de na de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa med pa ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: de dag la gnas skabs de na de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa med pa ni ma yin pas /
translated: However, at that time, they are not non-objects with respect to suchness.

original: rnam par shes pa lnga rnam par mi rtog pa lta bur rnam par mi rtog pa dag ces bya'o //üîΩkhams rgyas pas de dag rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni chos dkar po 'phel bar gyur bas sdang ba la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i phyir byams pa la @134a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga rnam par mi rtog pa lta bur rnam par mi rtog pa dag ces bya'o // khams rgyas pas de dag rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni chos dkar po 'phel bar gyur bas sdang ba la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa'i phyir byams pa la @134a * //
translated: Therefore, they are called non-conceptual, like the five consciousnesses.

original: sogs pa'i sa bon rgyas pa ni khams rgyas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sa bon rgyas pa ni khams rgyas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase their increase is their purification means that the increase of the seeds of loving-kindness, etc., is called the increase of the element, because the growth of virtuous qualities eliminates the resistant tendencies, such as hatred, etc.

original: khams rgyas pas byams pa la sogs pa de dag sa brgyad pa la sogs pa la rnam par dag cing lhun gyis grub par 'jug ste /
analyzed: khams rgyas pas byams pa la sogs pa de dag sa brgyad pa la sogs pa la rnam par dag cing lhun gyis grub par 'jug ste /
translated: Because the constituents are developed, those such as love, etc., are purified and spontaneously enter the eighth stage, etc.

original: de'i phyir gnas skabs de na dmigs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas skabs de na dmigs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, at that time, they are called ‚Äúwithout objective supports.‚Äù

original: las gnyis te lus dang ngag gi las byams pa'i rgyu mthun pas bsdus pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni byams pas kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las zhi ba gang yin pa de ni byams pa'i rgyu mthun pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: las gnyis te lus dang ngag gi las byams pa'i rgyu mthun pas bsdus pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni byams pas kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las zhi ba gang yin pa de ni byams pa'i rgyu mthun pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The two actions are the actions of body and speech included in the natural outcome of love. The peace of the actions of body and speech that are motivated by love is called the natural outcome of love.

original: lus dang ngag gi las de yang gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las de yang gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: Since those actions of body and speech are included in the aggregate of form, they are without objective supports.

original: de bas na de la byams pa nye bar brtags nas byams pa dmigs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de la byams pa nye bar brtags nas byams pa dmigs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, love is imputed in relation to them, and love is called ‚Äúwithout objective support.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa zad pas tshad med pa rnams dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zad pas tshad med pa rnams dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: The immeasurables are without objective supports because of the destruction of the defilements.

original: ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How is this known?

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa ni dmigs par bshad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa ni dmigs par bshad de /
translated: It is explained that the defilements are objective supports.

original: yid kyi mdud pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir dmigs pa 'chad do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba mdo'i dum bus de ston par byed do //
analyzed: yid kyi mdud pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir dmigs pa 'chad do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba mdo'i dum bus de ston par byed do //
translated: and the sutra states: ‚ÄúThe object is explained as the relinquishment of the mental knots.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa ni dmigs par bshad pas nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni dmigs par bshad pas nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the sutra explains that the mental afflictions are the object,

original: byams pa la sogs pa dmigs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa dmigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: loving-kindness and the other immeasurables are not objects.üîΩThe mental afflictions are not objects because they are not real.üîΩThe mental afflictions are not objects because they are not real.

original: nyon mongs pa 'gags pa ni med pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa ste /üîΩ'gags pa de nub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'gags pa ni med pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa ste / 'gags pa de nub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mental afflictions are not objects because they are not real.üîΩThe mental afflictions are not objects because they are not real.üîΩThe mental afflictions are not objects because they are not real.

original: gnas pa dang khyad par du 'gyur ba'i skal ba can zhes bya ba ni gnas pa'i skal ba can dang khyad par du 'gyur ba'i skal ba can no //
analyzed: gnas pa dang khyad par du 'gyur ba'i skal ba can zhes bya ba ni gnas pa'i skal ba can dang khyad par du 'gyur ba'i skal ba can no //
translated: The mental afflictions are not objects because they are not real.

analyzed: de la chung ngu ni rnam pa drug ste / zhes bya ba rnam pa drug gang zhe na /

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / dman pa'i sa pa dang / bsam pa dman pa dang / nga rgyal dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / dman pa'i sa pa dang / bsam pa dman pa dang / nga rgyal dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: The mental afflictions are not objects because they are not real.

original: rnam pa drug po 'di dag ni dman pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa drug po 'di dag ni dman pa ste /
translated: These six types are inferior.

original: chung ngu dag yin no //
analyzed: chung ngu dag yin no //
translated: They are small.

original: gzhan nyid lhag pa'o zhes bya ba gzhan ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan nyid lhag pa'o zhes bya ba gzhan ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: The others are superior. What is the difference between them?

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa las bzlog pa mnyam par gzhag pa rnams ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa dag las lhag pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa las bzlog pa mnyam par gzhag pa rnams ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa dag las lhag pa'o //
translated: The concentrated are superior to the unconcentrated, because they are the opposite of the unconcentrated.

original: chen po rnams ni chung ngu dag pas lhag pa'o //
analyzed: chen po rnams ni chung ngu dag pas lhag pa'o //
translated: The great are superior to the small.

original: mchog gi sa pa dag ni dman pa'i sa dag pas lhag pa ste /
analyzed: mchog gi sa pa dag ni dman pa'i sa dag pas lhag pa ste /
translated: Those of the highest stage are superior to those of the lower stages.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la ni @134b chung ngu dag yin no //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la ni @134b chung ngu dag yin no //
translated: Those of the stage of action in faith are small.

original: rab tu dga' ba la ni chen po dag yin no //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la ni chen po dag yin no //
translated: Those of the stage of joy are great.

original: de la ni chung ngu dag yin no //
analyzed: de la ni chung ngu dag yin no //
translated: Those of the stage of the immunity from production are small.

original: dri ma med pa la ni chen po dag yin te /
analyzed: dri ma med pa la ni chen po dag yin te /
translated: Those of the stage of direct intuition devoid of addiction are great.

original: de bzhin du sa gong nas gong du sa 'og ma la ltos nas lhag pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa gong nas gong du sa 'og ma la ltos nas lhag pa dag yin no //
translated: In the same way, those of the higher stages are superior to those of the lower stages.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni dman pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni dman pa'o //
translated: Those of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas are inferior.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni lhag pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni lhag pa'o //
translated: Those of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas are superior.

original: nga rgyal dang bcas pa ni sa bdun pa la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa dang bral ba dag go //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang bcas pa ni sa bdun pa la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa dang bral ba dag go //
translated: Those who are proud are those who are not endowed with acquiescence in the non-production of dharmas on the seventh spiritual level.

original: de yan chad ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas lhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de yan chad ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas lhag pa yin no //
translated: From that point on, they are superior because they have attained acquiescence in the non-production of dharmas.

original: tshangs pa'i gnas pa dag gis gnas pa ni rgyu'o zhes bya ba gang gi rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas pa dag gis gnas pa ni rgyu'o zhes bya ba gang gi rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: The cause is that they abide in the stations of BrahmƒÅ. What is the cause of that?

original: rnam par smin pa la sogs pa'i ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la sogs pa'i ste /
translated: The cause is the maturation, etc.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bsam gtan gyis gnas pa ni tshangs pa'i gnas pa bsgoms pas gzugs kyi khams su skye ba'i rigs pa las 'dul ba'i skye bo la ltos nas 'dod pa'i khams su skye ste ;
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bsam gtan gyis gnas pa ni tshangs pa'i gnas pa bsgoms pas gzugs kyi khams su skye ba'i rigs pa las 'dul ba'i skye bo la ltos nas 'dod pa'i khams su skye ste ;
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who abides in the inconceivable meditative concentration, by cultivating the stations of BrahmƒÅ, is born in the world of desire, not in the world of form, in order to discipline those beings who are to be disciplined.

original: 'di ni de'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: This is the maturation result.

original: tshogs rnams rdzogs par byed do zhes bya ba'i bdag po'i 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa'i gnas pa'i dbang gis tshogs rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa gang yin pa de ni bdag po'i 'bras bu'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs rnams rdzogs par byed do zhes bya ba'i bdag po'i 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa'i gnas pa'i dbang gis tshogs rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa gang yin pa de ni bdag po'i 'bras bu'o zhes bya'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúone brings the collections to completion‚Äù is the dominant result.

original: sems can dag yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //üîΩzhes bya ba ni skyes bu byed pa yang brtson 'grus kyi khyad par las 'gyur la /

translated: The statement ‚Äúone brings sentient beings to maturity‚Äù is the result of conscious effort.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúone attains unsurpassed true and complete enlightenment‚Äù is the result of separation.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúone causes the lineage of the Three Jewels to remain uninterrupted‚Äù is the result of human effort.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúone causes the lineage of the Three Jewels to remain uninterrupted‚Äù is the result of human effort.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúone causes the lineage of the Three Jewels to remain uninterrupted‚Äù is the result of human effort.

original: rkyen mi bzad pas kyang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rtags so zhes bya ba ni gnod sems la sogs pa'i gnas lta bu'i yul mi bzad pa mthong bas kyang 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: rkyen mi bzad pas kyang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rtags so zhes bya ba ni gnod sems la sogs pa'i gnas lta bu'i yul mi bzad pa mthong bas kyang 'gyur ba med de /
translated: This is the reason: they are not changed by seeing adverse objects such as those that are the basis for malice, etc.

original: rtags 'dis na gzhan dag gis 'di ni byams pa la sogs pa thob pa yin no zhes bya bar shes so //üîΩgnod sems dang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dag ni btang snyoms kyi yin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba ste /
analyzed: rtags 'dis na gzhan dag gis 'di ni byams pa la sogs pa thob pa yin no zhes bya bar shes so // gnod sems dang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dag ni btang snyoms kyi yin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba ste /
translated: By this reason, others know that they have attained love, etc.üîΩMalice and sexual desire are for equanimity.üîΩOne is attached through desire and one is hostile through malice.

original: 'dod chags kyis ni rjes su chags la gnod sems kyis ni khong khro bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis ni rjes su chags la gnod sems kyis ni khong khro bar byed do //
translated: One is attached through desire and one is hostile through malice.

original: tshul khrims 'joms pas gnyi ga la yang gnod par @135a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'joms pas gnyi ga la yang gnod par @135a * //
translated: Both are harmed by the destruction of morality.

original: byed ces bya ba ni tshul khrims 'joms pa ni ji lta bu /
analyzed: byed ces bya ba ni tshul khrims 'joms pa ni ji lta bu /
translated: How is the destruction of morality?

original: de bcom pas ni ji ltar na gnyi ga la gnod par byed ce na /
analyzed: de bcom pas ni ji ltar na gnyi ga la gnod par byed ce na /
translated: How is it that both are harmed by its destruction?

original: gnyen po stobs chung ba ni gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba la sogs pas kun tu spyod pas tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa ni dge ba'i chos lhag par spyod pas 'joms so //
analyzed: gnyen po stobs chung ba ni gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba la sogs pas kun tu spyod pas tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa ni dge ba'i chos lhag par spyod pas 'joms so //
translated: The weak antidote is the destruction of the morality that is undertaken by the practice of malice, violence, etc.

original: de bcom pas 'di nyid la gsad pa dang bcing ba dang brdeg pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba dang / pha rol tu yang sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid la gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bcom pas 'di nyid la gsad pa dang bcing ba dang brdeg pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba dang / pha rol tu yang sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid la gnod pa yin no //
translated: The harm to oneself is the experience of suffering in this life, such as being killed, bound, beaten, etc., and in the next life, the suffering of going to a miserable realm, etc.

original: rang nyams can tshul khrims nyams pas srog gcod pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan la gnod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rang nyams can tshul khrims nyams pas srog gcod pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan la gnod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The harm to others is the engagement in killing, etc., due to the degeneration of morality.

original: de ltar na gnyis ka gnod par byed pa zhes bya'o //üîΩnyams bcas zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims nyams pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na gnyis ka gnod par byed pa zhes bya'o // nyams bcas zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims nyams pa ste /
translated: Thus, it is said that both are harmful.üîΩThe degeneration is the degeneration of morality.

original: tshul khrims ral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshul khrims ral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is the rupture of morality.

original: 'di la bdag nyid smod ces bya ba ni sems la bdag tu nye bar 'dogs te /
analyzed: 'di la bdag nyid smod ces bya ba ni sems la bdag tu nye bar 'dogs te /
translated: Here, ‚Äúself-condemnation‚Äù is the designation of the mind as the self.

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims la gnas pa ni sems bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis sems nyid la smod par byed de /
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims la gnas pa ni sems bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis sems nyid la smod par byed de /
translated: One who is established in immorality condemns the mind itself with its essential nature.

original: dge ba'i lam 'jigs pa med pa bor nas mi dge ba'i lam 'jigs pa dang bcas pa mkhas pa rnams kyis smad pa rnams la brten pa gang yin pa de ni ngan to zhes de ltar smod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i lam 'jigs pa med pa bor nas mi dge ba'i lam 'jigs pa dang bcas pa mkhas pa rnams kyis smad pa rnams la brten pa gang yin pa de ni ngan to zhes de ltar smod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one who abandons the path of virtue, which is free from fear, and relies on the path of non-virtue, which is accompanied by fear, and is despised by the wise, is indeed evil.

original: rnyed pas dman zhes bya ba ni 'di la gzhan dag smod pa yin te /
analyzed: rnyed pas dman zhes bya ba ni 'di la gzhan dag smod pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúDespised by others for lack of gain‚Äù means that others despise one.

original: chos gos dang bsod snyoms kyang mi rnyed la /
analyzed: chos gos dang bsod snyoms kyang mi rnyed la /
translated: One does not obtain robes and alms-food.

original: mthong na yang 'di skad du tshe dang ldan pa 'di ni 'di lta bu byed pa 'di lta bur spyod pa mi gtsang ba ste /
analyzed: mthong na yang 'di skad du tshe dang ldan pa 'di ni 'di lta bu byed pa 'di lta bur spyod pa mi gtsang ba ste /
translated: When seen, they say, ‚ÄúThis venerable one does such and such, acts in such and such a way, is impure,

original: grong gi tsher ma yin no //
analyzed: grong gi tsher ma yin no //
translated: is a thorn in the village.‚Äù

original: zhes smra'o // srung bas smod pa ni 'di tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i tshe bsrung ba byas pa'i lha gang dag yin pa de dag kyang smod cing srung bar mi byed do //
analyzed: zhes smra'o // srung bas smod pa ni 'di tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i tshe bsrung ba byas pa'i lha gang dag yin pa de dag kyang smod cing srung bar mi byed do //
translated: The guardians reproach him means that the gods who protect those who possess morality also reproach him and do not protect him.

original: de bzhin ston pas smad ces bya ba ni ston pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bong bu ltar bu kun tu spyod ces bya ba la sogs pas smod cing tshul khrims nyams pas 'dor ba mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin ston pas smad ces bya ba ni ston pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bong bu ltar bu kun tu spyod ces bya ba la sogs pas smod cing tshul khrims nyams pas 'dor ba mdzad do //
translated: The Teacher reproaches him means that the Teacher, the Blessed One, reproaches him, saying, ‚ÄúYou are like an ass,‚Äù and so on, and rejects him because his morality is impaired.

original: rtsod bcas zhes bya ba ni 'di la tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa gzhan dag kyang chos nyid kyis rnam par smod do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtsod bcas zhes bya ba ni 'di la tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa gzhan dag kyang chos nyid kyis rnam par smod do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He is disputed means that other wise practitioners of pure conduct also reproach him with the truth of Dharma.

original: mi snyan zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang phyogs mtshams su yang 'di'i sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa @135b mi snyan pa dag 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mi snyan zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang phyogs mtshams su yang 'di'i sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa @135b mi snyan pa dag 'byung ba'o //
translated: He has an unpleasant reputation means that unpleasant rumors about him spread in all directions.

original: de ni gzhan du mi khom rnams su skye /
analyzed: de ni gzhan du mi khom rnams su skye /
translated: He is born in other places that are inopportune

original: zhes bya ba ni tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that the offense increases in the next life.

original: thob pa las nyams pa zhes bya ba ni byams pa la sogs pa thob pa las yongs su nyams pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: thob pa las nyams pa zhes bya ba ni byams pa la sogs pa thob pa las yongs su nyams pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the loss of what has been obtained‚Äù means from the complete loss of what has been obtained, such as love.

original: 'di ni tshe kho na'i kha na ma tho ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni tshe kho na'i kha na ma tho ba yin no //
translated: This is an offense in this life.

original: ma tho ba nyams pas zhes pa 'dis ni tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba 'phel bar ston te /
analyzed: ma tho ba nyams pas zhes pa 'dis ni tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba 'phel bar ston te /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the loss of what has not been obtained‚Äù shows that the offense increases in the next life.

original: 'di ltar ngo tsha ba rnam par dbye ba las slob dpon gyis thob pa dang ma thob pa las yongs su nyams pa ni tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba dang sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ngo tsha ba rnam par dbye ba las slob dpon gyis thob pa dang ma thob pa las yongs su nyams pa ni tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba dang sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the Master says in the Exposition of Ashamed and Shameless that ‚Äúthe loss of what has been obtained and the non-obtainment of what has not been obtained are connected with the offenses of this life and the next life.‚Äù

original: yid la sdug bsngal chen po 'thob //
analyzed: yid la sdug bsngal chen po 'thob //
translated: One obtains great mental suffering.

original: ces bya ba ni de las skyes pa sems kyi sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba lus kyi dang sems kyi tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la 'thob pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni de las skyes pa sems kyi sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba lus kyi dang sems kyi tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la 'thob pa ste /
translated: One obtains mental suffering and mental distress born from that, and physical suffering in this life and the next.

original: 'di ni tshad med pa rnams spyir bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni tshad med pa rnams spyir bsam pa yin no //
translated: This is the general consideration of the immeasurables.

original: da ni khyad par te tshad med pa rnams kyi nang na snying rje mchog yin pas de dmigs pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas phal cher bsams te /üîΩrab 'bar dgra yi dbang du song //
analyzed: da ni khyad par te tshad med pa rnams kyi nang na snying rje mchog yin pas de dmigs pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas phal cher bsams te / rab 'bar dgra yi dbang du song //
translated: Now, in particular, since compassion is the best of the immeasurables, it is considered most often, in terms of its objects, etc.üîΩIt is to be undertaken by way of the distinctions of ‚Äúburning, overpowered by enemies,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye bas de brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye bas de brtsam par bya'o //
translated: and so on.

original: dgra'i dbang du song ba ni gang gi tshe bdud kyis dge ba la bar du gcod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dgra'i dbang du song ba ni gang gi tshe bdud kyis dge ba la bar du gcod par byed pa'o //
translated: Overpowered by enemies refers to when Mara creates obstacles to virtue.

original: bgrod dka' lam la kun du zhugs //
analyzed: bgrod dka' lam la kun du zhugs //
translated: Engaged in a difficult path

original: zhes bya ba la bgrod dka' ba ni 'khor ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la bgrod dka' ba ni 'khor ba ste /
translated: . The difficult path is cyclic existence.

original: der 'gro ba'i lam la kun tu zhugs pa ni bgrod dka' ba'i lam la kun tu zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: der 'gro ba'i lam la kun tu zhugs pa ni bgrod dka' ba'i lam la kun tu zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Engaged in that path is called ‚Äúengaged in a difficult path.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: ‚Äù Who are they?

original: de dag bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To indicate them, it says:

original: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can rnams te /üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can rnams te /üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Those who have the quality of not passing into complete nirvana.

original: lam rab tu stor ba ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnams te /
analyzed: lam rab tu stor ba ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnams te /
translated: Those who have lost the path are the ones who are overconfident.üîΩBecause they have erred in regard to the path of liberation.

original: thar pa'i lam nor ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de dag yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can yin pa las mngon pa'i nga rgyal can du gyur pa'i phyir yun ring mo zhig tu thogs te /
analyzed: thar pa'i lam nor ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de dag yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can yin pa las mngon pa'i nga rgyal can du gyur pa'i phyir yun ring mo zhig tu thogs te /
translated: They are destined for nirvana, but because they have become overconfident, they are delayed for a long time.

original: de dag ni de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa rtogs par nga rgyal byed do //
analyzed: de dag ni de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa rtogs par nga rgyal byed do //
translated: They are overconfident in their realization of thatness, although they have not realized it.

original: de ltar na de dag ji srid du nga rgyal kun tu spyod pa de srid du 'phags pa rnams kyi las stor bar 'gyur bas lam stor ba zhes bya'o //üîΩbyang chub mchog gi sa bon nyid kyis ni bdag po'i 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar snying rje ni byang chub mchog sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid kyi @136a * //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ji srid du nga rgyal kun tu spyod pa de srid du 'phags pa rnams kyi las stor bar 'gyur bas lam stor ba zhes bya'o // byang chub mchog gi sa bon nyid kyis ni bdag po'i 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar snying rje ni byang chub mchog sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid kyi @136a * //
translated: Thus, as long as they are engaged in overconfidence, they are said to have lost the path of the noble ones, because they have lost the path.

original: sa bon yin no //
analyzed: sa bon yin no //
translated: The supreme enlightenment is the dominant result of compassion, because compassion is the seed of the supreme enlightenment, i.e. of the state of a Buddha.

original: ji ltar sa bon yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sa bon yin zhe na /
translated: How is it the seed?

original: 'di ltar de'i dbang gis de 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i dbang gis de 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the latter is attained through its power.

original: go rims bzhin du gzhan dag bdag nyid la bde ba skyed pa dang / gdung bar byed pa nyid kyis ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba ni skyes bu byed pas ni sems can rnams kyi bde ba mtho ris dang byang grol gyi ngo bo nyid bskyed la /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du gzhan dag bdag nyid la bde ba skyed pa dang / gdung bar byed pa nyid kyis ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba ni skyes bu byed pas ni sems can rnams kyi bde ba mtho ris dang byang grol gyi ngo bo nyid bskyed la /
translated: The first two are the human results of compassion, because they generate happiness in others and because they generate affection for oneself, respectively.

original: bde ba skyed pa de la yang nang dang phyi'i dngos po yongs su gtong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba skyed pa de la yang nang dang phyi'i dngos po yongs su gtong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And in generating that happiness, one gives away inner and outer things.

original: chos la brten pa'i zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i 'bras bu lnga dang ldan pa'i snying rje'i chos la brten pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos la brten pa'i zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i 'bras bu lnga dang ldan pa'i snying rje'i chos la brten pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbased on the Dharma‚Äù means based on the compassion that possesses the five results as they have been explained.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor bar gtogs pa thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes nas snying rje dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor bar gtogs pa thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes nas snying rje dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because bodhisattvas, with their compassion, know samsara just as it is,

original: yongs su skyo bar yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: yongs su skyo bar yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: they are not discouraged by it.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa nyid ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa nyid ston te /
translated: This shows that they do not remain in nirvana.

original: snying rje'i stobs kyis nyan thos bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snying rje'i stobs kyis nyan thos bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of compassion, they do not lean toward nirvana like the Sravakas.

original: blo mchog dang ldan pa'i phyir nyes pa dag gis gnod par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'khor ba la mi gnas pa nyid ston te /
analyzed: blo mchog dang ldan pa'i phyir nyes pa dag gis gnod par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'khor ba la mi gnas pa nyid ston te /
translated: And by the power of their supreme wisdom, they are not harmed by faults. This shows that they do not dwell in samsara.

original: shes rab kyi stobs kyis 'jig rten pa bzhin du 'khor ba la gzhol bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs kyis 'jig rten pa bzhin du 'khor ba la gzhol bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of their wisdom, they do not lean toward samsara like worldly people.

original: de ltar na shes rab kyi stobs kyis so so'i skye bo bzhin du 'khor ba la yang mi gnas la /
analyzed: de ltar na shes rab kyi stobs kyis so so'i skye bo bzhin du 'khor ba la yang mi gnas la /
translated: Thus, by the power of their wisdom, they do not dwell in samsara like ordinary beings.

original: snying rje'i stobs kyis nyan thos bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa la yang mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //üîΩ'jig rten sdug bsngal bdag nyid lta ba yi //
analyzed: snying rje'i stobs kyis nyan thos bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa la yang mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o // 'jig rten sdug bsngal bdag nyid lta ba yi //
translated: And by the power of their compassion, they do not dwell in nirvana like the Sravakas. This is called ‚Äúnirvana without residual substratum.üîΩSeeing the world as suffering by nature,

original: zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This shows that they see the world as having the nature of suffering.

original: snying rje'i bdag nyid can gyi brtse ba 'di //
analyzed: snying rje'i bdag nyid can gyi brtse ba 'di //
translated: This compassion of the compassionate

original: rang bzhin dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúNature‚Äù meansüîΩ

original: rang bzhin gyi sgras ni brtse ba'i rigs bstan to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi sgras ni brtse ba'i rigs bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúBy nature‚Äù means that it is of the nature of compassion.

original: so sor brtags pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan dang skyon yongs su rtog pas so //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan dang skyon yongs su rtog pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy analysis‚Äù means that it is the result of the analysis of virtues and faults.

original: de sngon goms par byas dang ldan pa dang // zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs gzhan yongs su bsgom pas so //
analyzed: de sngon goms par byas dang ldan pa dang // zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs gzhan yongs su bsgom pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy prior cultivation‚Äù means that it is the result of cultivation in other lives.

original: mi mthun phyogs nyams rnam dag thob pas zhi //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs nyams rnam dag thob pas zhi //
translated: It is peace, because it is the attainment of purity through the destruction of its resistance.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa'i sgo nas te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa'i sgo nas te /
translated: This means that it is the result of the attainment of freedom from passion.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par 'tshe ba spangs na snying rje rnam par dag pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par 'tshe ba spangs na snying rje rnam par dag pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the resistance to it, violence, is abandoned, compassion attains purity.

original: @136b mnyam pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni brtse ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa dang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi brtse ba ni sems can sdug bsngal zhing sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas nyen pa dag kho na la brtse bas mnyam pa ma yin gyi /üîΩsangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi brtse ba ni gang ci tshor ba de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya bas khams gsum du skyes pa'i sems can rnams la mnar med pa dag la ji lta bar srid pa'i rtse mor skyes pa rnams la yang
analyzed: @136b mnyam pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni brtse ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa dang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi brtse ba ni sems can sdug bsngal zhing sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas nyen pa dag kho na la brtse bas mnyam pa ma yin gyi / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi brtse ba ni gang ci tshor ba de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya bas khams gsum du skyes pa'i sems can rnams la mnar med pa dag la ji lta bar srid pa'i rtse mor skyes pa rnams la yang
translated: The love of mundane beings, sravakas, and pratyekabuddhas is not equal, because they love only those sentient beings who are suffering and oppressed by the feeling of suffering.

original: de dang 'dra bar brtse ste /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar brtse ste /
translated: But the love of the Buddhas and bodhisattvas is equal, because they think, ‚ÄúWhatever is felt here is suffering,‚Äù and they love all sentient beings born in the three realms as if they were those born in the Avici hell, and also those born in the peak of existence.

original: de bas na sems can thams cad la mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na sems can thams cad la mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúequal toward all sentient beings.‚Äù

original: ji ltar nyan thos rnams kyi phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zad pas zad par 'gyur ba lta bu rtag tu ma yin pa de yang brtse ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar nyan thos rnams kyi phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zad pas zad par 'gyur ba lta bu rtag tu ma yin pa de yang brtse ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not constant, like the nirvƒÅ·πáa without remainder of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, which is exhausted by exhaustion.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi brtse ba ni rtag tu ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi brtse ba ni rtag tu ste /
translated: The compassion of the Lord Buddhas is constant.

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i yang zad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i yang zad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not exhausted in the nirvƒÅ·πáa without remainder.

original: de bzhin du lhag pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhag pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to all, such as the superior resolve.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bas ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par 'tshe ba spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bas ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par 'tshe ba spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
