translated: It is free from attachment, because it abandons violence, which is its counteragent. This means that it is abandoned together with its traces.

original: de ltar na nyan thos de dag las kyang khyad par du 'phags so //
analyzed: de ltar na nyan thos de dag las kyang khyad par du 'phags so //
translated: Thus, it is superior to those ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'i thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa la sogs pa la lam mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'i thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa la sogs pa la lam mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the attainment of acquiescence in the non-production of dharmas.üîΩIts root is compassion.

original: de'i rtsa ba ni snying rje'o zhes bya ba ni snying rje'i shing gi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de'i rtsa ba ni snying rje'o zhes bya ba ni snying rje'i shing gi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The root of the tree of compassion is compassion.

original: shing la ni rtsa ba med na sdong po med do //üîΩsdong po med na yal ga med do //
analyzed: shing la ni rtsa ba med na sdong po med do // sdong po med na yal ga med do //
translated: If a tree has no root, it has no trunk.üîΩIf it has no trunk, it has no branches.

original: yal ga med na lo ma med do //
analyzed: yal ga med na lo ma med do //
translated: If it has no branches, it has no leaves.

original: lo ma med na me tog med do //
analyzed: lo ma med na me tog med do //
translated: If it has no leaves, it has no flowers.

original: me tog med na 'bras bu med do //
analyzed: me tog med na 'bras bu med do //
translated: If it has no flowers, it has no fruit.

original: de bzhin du snying rje'i shing la rtsa ba snying rje med na sdong po bzod pa med do /
analyzed: de bzhin du snying rje'i shing la rtsa ba snying rje med na sdong po bzod pa med do /
translated: In the same way, if the tree of compassion has no root of compassion, it has no trunk of acquiescence.

original: sdong po bzod pa med na sems can gyi don sems pa yal ga lta bu med do //
analyzed: sdong po bzod pa med na sems can gyi don sems pa yal ga lta bu med do //
translated: If it has no trunk of acquiescence, it has no branches of thoughts of the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de med na skye ba bzang po yongs su gzung ba'i don du smon pa lo ma lta bu med do //
analyzed: de med na skye ba bzang po yongs su gzung ba'i don du smon pa lo ma lta bu med do //
translated: If it has no branches, it has no leaves of prayers for the sake of taking up good rebirths.

original: de med na sems can yongs su smin pa 'bras bu lta bu med do //
analyzed: de med na sems can yongs su smin pa 'bras bu lta bu med do //
translated: If that is not there, then there is no fruit, the full maturation of sentient beings.

original: snying rje'i shing 'di ji ltar 'phel bar 'gyur ba de bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: snying rje'i shing 'di ji ltar 'phel bar 'gyur ba de bsam par bya ste /
translated: One should consider how this tree of compassion grows.

original: @137a * // snying rje ni rtsa ba bshad do //
analyzed: @137a * // snying rje ni rtsa ba bshad do //
translated: Compassion is explained as the root.

original: rtsa ba de'i chu lta bu ni byams pa ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba de'i chu lta bu ni byams pa ste /
translated: Love is like the water for that root.

original: des rtsa ba 'chu bar byed do //
analyzed: des rtsa ba 'chu bar byed do //
translated: By that, the root is moistened.

original: snying rje'i sdug bsngal las bde ba skye ba gang yin pa'i bde ba des ni shing de'i sdong po bzod pa rgyas par byed do //
analyzed: snying rje'i sdug bsngal las bde ba skye ba gang yin pa'i bde ba des ni shing de'i sdong po bzod pa rgyas par byed do //
translated: The happiness that arises from the suffering of compassion causes the trunk of that tree to grow, which is the growth of patience.

original: snga ma phyi ma 'gag pa dang skye ba'i rim gyis smon lam gyi rgyun ma bcad pas smon lam rnams lo ma 'dor ba dang len pa dang chos mthun par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma phyi ma 'gag pa dang skye ba'i rim gyis smon lam gyi rgyun ma bcad pas smon lam rnams lo ma 'dor ba dang len pa dang chos mthun par rig par bya'o //
translated: The continuity of vows should be understood as being similar to the shedding and taking of leaves, by the process of the cessation of the former and the arising of the latter.

original: zhes bya ba ni dper na shing ni lo ma rnying pa yongs su 'dor zhing sar pa yongs su len par byed pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sngon gyi smon lam chung ngu yongs su btang nas smon lam chen po mchog 'dzin par byed deüîΩ/ de ltar na gong nas gong du bya bas smon lam chung ngu rnams ni yongs su btang la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dper na shing ni lo ma rnying pa yongs su 'dor zhing sar pa yongs su len par byed pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sngon gyi smon lam chung ngu yongs su btang nas smon lam chen po mchog 'dzin par byed de / de ltar na gong nas gong du bya bas smon lam chung ngu rnams ni yongs su btang la /
translated: Just as a tree casts off old leaves and takes on new ones, so too the bodhisattva gives up former small aspirations and takes up the supreme great aspirations.

original: chen po mchog rnams ni 'dzin par byed do //üîΩdper na dus bzang po las skyes pa'i shing dus dus su bcus pa las gdon mi za bar me tog la sogs pa 'byung ba de bzhin du nang gi rkyen grub ste rang gi rgyud yongs su smin pa las me tog la sogs pa lta bu'i skye ba
analyzed: chen po mchog rnams ni 'dzin par byed do // dper na dus bzang po las skyes pa'i shing dus dus su bcus pa las gdon mi za bar me tog la sogs pa 'byung ba de bzhin du nang gi rkyen grub ste rang gi rgyud yongs su smin pa las me tog la sogs pa lta bu'i skye ba
translated: Thus, by doing better and better, he gives up small aspirations and takes up the supreme great aspirations.

original: la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as a tree that grows in a good season and is watered from time to time certainly produces flowers and so on, so too, when the internal conditions are established and the continuum of the bodhisattva is fully ripened, birth and so on become superior, like flowers and so on.

original: de dag la chags par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i bde ba dang rang gi srog la'o ;
analyzed: de dag la chags par 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i bde ba dang rang gi srog la'o ;
translated: What need is there to mention attachment to those?

original: /'jig rten pa'i snying rjes gnas pa rnams kyi ni kha na ma tho ba med kyang 'jig rten pa yin no //
analyzed: /'jig rten pa'i snying rjes gnas pa rnams kyi ni kha na ma tho ba med kyang 'jig rten pa yin no //
translated: Those who abide in worldly compassion, even though they are without offense, are still worldly.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang zag pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang zag pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This refers to the person who is still subject to the outflows.

original: 'dren pa'i thabs gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni snying rjes byams pa'i rang bzhin gyi thabs so //
analyzed: 'dren pa'i thabs gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni snying rjes byams pa'i rang bzhin gyi thabs so //
translated: The means of guidance is the means that has love as its nature, out of compassion.

original: sems can rnams la sdug bsngal med par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i rgyu mtshan du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems can rnams la sdug bsngal med par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i rgyu mtshan du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In order to remove suffering from sentient beings means that it is the reason for removing the suffering of sentient beings.

original: bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal la yang dag pa nyid ji lta ba bzhin ma reg pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dir ji srid dus dang po ma thob pa de srid du bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid 'thob par mi 'gyur gyi /üîΩsa dang po thob na chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba rtogs pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi chos nyid rtogs pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal la yang dag pa nyid ji lta ba bzhin ma reg pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dir ji srid dus dang po ma thob pa de srid du bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid 'thob par mi 'gyur gyi / sa dang po thob na chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba rtogs pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi chos nyid rtogs pa'i sgo nas /
translated: As long as one does not attain the first stage, one does not attain the equality of self and others.

original: sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la yod pa'i sdug bsngal la reg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la yod pa'i sdug bsngal la reg par 'gyur ro //
translated: But when one attains the first stage, one touches the suffering that exists in the life-streams of all sentient beings, by realizing the reality of suffering, because one realizes the omnipresence of the reality realm.üîΩThe suffering that is generated by the compassion of the bodhisattvas becomes such a happiness that it surpasses all mundane happiness.

original: @137b byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rjes bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal nyid 'di ltar 'jig rten pa'i bde ba gang yin pa thams cad zil gyis gnon pa de lta bu'i bde bar 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can skye ba la sogs
analyzed: @137b byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rjes bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal nyid 'di ltar 'jig rten pa'i bde ba gang yin pa thams cad zil gyis gnon pa de lta bu'i bde bar 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can skye ba la sogs
translated: The suffering that is generated by the compassion of the bodhisattvas becomes such a happiness that it surpasses all mundane happiness.

original: pa'i sdug bsngal gyis g-yen spyo ba rnams kyis de las yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir zhugs pa rnams la ni /
analyzed: pa'i sdug bsngal gyis g-yen spyo ba rnams kyis de las yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir zhugs pa rnams la ni /
translated: For those who have entered to completely protect those who are tormented by the suffering of the hells,

original: sems can dmyal ba ba'i sdug bsngal skye ba gang yin pa de yang sems can yongs su bskyab pa la ltos nas de dag gi bde ba chen po yin te /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba ba'i sdug bsngal skye ba gang yin pa de yang sems can yongs su bskyab pa la ltos nas de dag gi bde ba chen po yin te /
translated: that suffering of the hells that arises is their great happiness, in consideration of the protection of sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bde ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad zil gyis gnon pa zhes bya ba ni snying rjes bskyed pa'i bde ba des so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bde ba gang yin pa de dag thams cad zil gyis gnon pa zhes bya ba ni snying rjes bskyed pa'i bde ba des so //
translated: ‚ÄúAll those worldly forms of happiness are surpassed‚Äù by that happiness generated by compassion.

original: dgra bcom pa don byas pa rnams kyang bde ba de dang mi na zhes bya ba ni snying rjes sdug bsngal las skyes pa'i bde ba gang yin pa de ni nyan thos rang gi don lhur len pa rnams med pas de dag dang de dang mi ldan pa
analyzed: dgra bcom pa don byas pa rnams kyang bde ba de dang mi na zhes bya ba ni snying rjes sdug bsngal las skyes pa'i bde ba gang yin pa de ni nyan thos rang gi don lhur len pa rnams med pas de dag dang de dang mi ldan pa
translated: ‚ÄúEven the arhats who have fulfilled their purpose do not have that happiness,‚Äù that happiness born of suffering through compassion, because the ≈õrƒÅvakas, who are intent on their own welfare, do not have that.

original: yin no // gzhan dag lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams so //
analyzed: yin no // gzhan dag lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams so //
translated: What need is there to mention others?

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis las ni sdug bsngal gyi bde ba nyams su myong ba skad du bshad la /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis las ni sdug bsngal gyi bde ba nyams su myong ba skad du bshad la /
translated: This verse explains that the activity of the bodhisattva is the experience of the happiness of suffering.

original: 'grel pa las ni snying rjes drangs pa'i bde bas bde ba nyams su myong bar bshad pa ni 'di ltar rung ngo //
analyzed: 'grel pa las ni snying rjes drangs pa'i bde bas bde ba nyams su myong bar bshad pa ni 'di ltar rung ngo //
translated: But the commentary explains that the experience of happiness is the happiness induced by compassion.

original: de lta ma yin na ji ltar don byas pa rnams kyang de dang mi ldan zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ji ltar don byas pa rnams kyang de dang mi ldan zhes brjod de /
translated: Otherwise, how could those who have done their duty be said to be devoid of that?

original: bde ba de lta bu gang yin pa de dang nyan thos rnams mi ldan gyi sdug bsngal dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba de lta bu gang yin pa de dang nyan thos rnams mi ldan gyi sdug bsngal dang ni ma yin no //
translated: They are devoid of that kind of happiness, not of suffering.

original: 'jig rten gsum gyi bde ba nye bar spyad pa rnams kyis bde ba byas pa gang yin pa des kyang zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gyi bde ba nye bar spyad pa rnams kyis bde ba byas pa gang yin pa des kyang zhes bya ba la ;
translated: The happiness that is made by the experience of the enjoyments of the three worlds,üîΩby that also.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
translated: The word also

original: brtse bas sbyin pa dang ldan pa'i bde ba gang yin pa des kyang zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: brtse bas sbyin pa dang ldan pa'i bde ba gang yin pa des kyang zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: is connected with the happiness that is possessed by the compassionate giver.

original: gsum dang de dag gi 'bras bu 'phel ba'i zhes bya ba ni gsum 'phel ba dang / gsum po de las 'bras bu bde ba rnam pa gsum po de 'phel ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: gsum dang de dag gi 'bras bu 'phel ba'i zhes bya ba ni gsum 'phel ba dang / gsum po de las 'bras bu bde ba rnam pa gsum po de 'phel ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This verse is about the increase of the three and the increase of the three kinds of happiness which are their results.

original: de'i rjes su 'dzin par byed pa'i mthus byas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'dzin par byed pa'i mthus byas pa'o //
translated: It is done by the power of their acceptance.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can rjes su 'dzin par byed pa'i mthus byas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can rjes su 'dzin par byed pa'i mthus byas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This means that it is done by the power of their acceptance of beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa sbyin pa ni yo byad kyis phongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa sbyin pa ni yo byad kyis phongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The generosity of the bodhisattva is not exhausted because of the absence of poverty.

original: yo byad kyis phongs pa med pa'i @138a * //
analyzed: yo byad kyis phongs pa med pa'i @138a * //
translated: Because of the absence of poverty,

original: phyir sbyin pa'i dus na byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin sbyin pa'i mthu thogs pa med par 'gyur te 'di ni 'bras bu gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: phyir sbyin pa'i dus na byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin sbyin pa'i mthu thogs pa med par 'gyur te 'di ni 'bras bu gsum pa yin no //
translated: at the time of giving, the bodhisattva has the power to give as much as is desired, without obstruction. This is the third result.

original: ngo bo nyid rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa sbyin pa'i snying rje rgyas par 'gyur ba 'di ni ngo bo nyid rgyas pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid rgyas pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa sbyin pa'i snying rje rgyas par 'gyur ba 'di ni ngo bo nyid rgyas pa yin no //
translated: The expansion of the nature itself is the expansion of the bodhisattva's compassion when he gives a gift.

original: 'phel ba zhes bya ba ni brtse bas sbyin pa sbyin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la brtse ba'i khyad par gyis sbyin pa chung ngu yang 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'phel ba zhes bya ba ni brtse bas sbyin pa sbyin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la brtse ba'i khyad par gyis sbyin pa chung ngu yang 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: The increase is the increase of the gift of the bodhisattva who gives out of compassion, by reason of the excellence of his compassion.

original: de bas na longs spyod dag gis snying rje 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: de bas na longs spyod dag gis snying rje 'phel bar byed do //
translated: Thus, compassion increases through enjoyments.

original: sbyin pa yongs su smin bya zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'i don du bdun pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa yongs su smin bya zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'i don du bdun pa yin te /
translated: The full maturation of giving is the seventh for the third.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'grel ba las sbyin pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'grel ba las sbyin pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the commentary explains: ‚Äúthe full maturation of beings through giving.‚Äù

original: tshogs kun du 'dren pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs kun du 'dren pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'o //
translated: The collection is the collection of giving, morality, etc.

original: snying rje can ni rtag tu rang sbyin la //
analyzed: snying rje can ni rtag tu rang sbyin la //
translated: The compassionate one always gives himself.

original: ston dang 'dra ste zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa ni phyi'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir de ni sems pa med pa yin pas de la bstan du ci zhig yod /
analyzed: ston dang 'dra ste zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa ni phyi'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir de ni sems pa med pa yin pas de la bstan du ci zhig yod /
translated: Giving is like a teacher, because it is an external thing, and it is without thought, so what can it teach?

original: de bas na ston dang 'dra zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na ston dang 'dra zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is like a teacher.

original: ji ltar sems pa dang bcas pa la rjes su ston pa de bzhin du de la rjes su ston pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sems pa dang bcas pa la rjes su ston pa de bzhin du de la rjes su ston pa yin no //
translated: Just as one teaches one who has thought, so it teaches that.

original: rang bde mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid bde bar mi 'dod kyi rnam pa thams cad du sems can rnams kho na la bde bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: rang bde mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid bde bar mi 'dod kyi rnam pa thams cad du sems can rnams kho na la bde bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: It does not seek its own happiness, because it does not seek its own happiness at all, but only the happiness of sentient beings.

original: yang na tha dad min bde bdag la'ang min //
analyzed: yang na tha dad min bde bdag la'ang min //
translated: Or, it is not different from the happiness of others, nor does it have any of its own.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not different from the happiness of sentient beings, that is, it is the same as the happiness of sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams la bde ba gang yin pa de nyid byang chub sems dpa'i bde ba yin te /
analyzed: sems can rnams la bde ba gang yin pa de nyid byang chub sems dpa'i bde ba yin te /
translated: Whatever happiness there is for sentient beings is the bodhisattva‚Äôs happiness.

original: 'di ni bdag nyid kyi bde ba sems can rnams kyi dang tha dad par mi 'dod pas tha dad pa ma yin pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag nyid kyi bde ba sems can rnams kyi dang tha dad par mi 'dod pas tha dad pa ma yin pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: This is the non-different bliss, because one does not wish for one's own bliss to be different from that of sentient beings.

original: bdag gis sbyin pa dang sbyin pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa thams cad sems can rnams kho na la sbyin na /
analyzed: bdag gis sbyin pa dang sbyin pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa thams cad sems can rnams kho na la sbyin na /
translated: If I give all my giving and the fruits of my giving to sentient beings alone,

original: ji ltar na bdag gi bde ba tha dad pa yin par sems /üîΩde dag bde ba nyid bdag gi bde ba yin pas zhes bya ba ni de dag gi bde ba ni de dag bde ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na bdag gi bde ba tha dad pa yin par sems / de dag bde ba nyid bdag gi bde ba yin pas zhes bya ba ni de dag gi bde ba ni de dag bde ba ste /
translated: how can I think that my bliss is different?üîΩ The meaning is that the bliss of those is my bliss.

original: sems can bde ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can bde ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the bliss of sentient beings is that the bliss of those is the bliss of those.

original: gang la de dag bde bas bde ba yod pa de ni de dag bde bas bde ba ste /
analyzed: gang la de dag bde bas bde ba yod pa de ni de dag bde bas bde ba ste /
translated: One who has that bliss is one who has the bliss of those.

original: de bas na de dag bde ba'i bde bas bdag bde'o zhes bya @138b bar ston to //
analyzed: de bas na de dag bde ba'i bde bas bdag bde'o zhes bya @138b bar ston to //
translated: Therefore, it is shown that I am blissful through the bliss of those.

original: bdag ni longs spyod dag de ltar nye bar gnas pa'i bde ba gang yin pa de mi 'dod ces bya ba ni longs spyod la rgyab kyis phyogs pa la longs spyod shin tu mang por 'gyur ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: bdag ni longs spyod dag de ltar nye bar gnas pa'i bde ba gang yin pa de mi 'dod ces bya ba ni longs spyod la rgyab kyis phyogs pa la longs spyod shin tu mang por 'gyur ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: This shows that one who turns away from enjoyments will have abundant enjoyments.

original: gzhan yang gal te bdag cung zad cig yongs su gtong zhing cung zad cig bdag gir byed na ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te bdag cung zad cig yongs su gtong zhing cung zad cig bdag gir byed na ni /
translated: Moreover, if one gives a little and appropriates a little,

original: de la 'di snyam du 'di ni bdag nyid kyang sbyin pa'i 'bras bu don du gnyer zhing longs spyod 'dod pas sbyin pa sbyin no zhes bya bar dogs par yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du 'di ni bdag nyid kyang sbyin pa'i 'bras bu don du gnyer zhing longs spyod 'dod pas sbyin pa sbyin no zhes bya bar dogs par yang 'gyur na /
translated: one might suspect that the giver gives gifts in order to obtain the fruit of giving and to enjoy the enjoyments.

original: gang gi tshe bdag bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong zhing de yang brtse bas te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong zhing de yang brtse bas te /
translated: But when one gives everything one owns and does so out of compassion,

original: lan dang rnam par smin pa la mi lta bar zhugs pa de nyid kyi phyir khyod kyis bdag la sbyin pa'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba med pa nyid du shes par bya'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la rjes su ston par byed do //
analyzed: lan dang rnam par smin pa la mi lta bar zhugs pa de nyid kyi phyir khyod kyis bdag la sbyin pa'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba med pa nyid du shes par bya'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la rjes su ston par byed do //
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva teaches generosity.

original: khyod kyi lan la lta dang bral bas na //
analyzed: khyod kyi lan la lta dang bral bas na //
translated: Since you are free of interest in a reward,

original: 'bras bu shin tu gzhan la gtong ba yin //
analyzed: 'bras bu shin tu gzhan la gtong ba yin //
translated: you give the results to others.üîΩIn this way, the bodhisattva teaches generosity.

original: zhes bya ba ni khyod ni thams cad du lan la lta bas 'bras bu 'byin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khyod ni thams cad du lan la lta bas 'bras bu 'byin te /
translated: You always give results in return for rewards.üîΩI give the results to others, free of interest in a reward.

original: bdag ni khyod kyi lan la lta ba dang bral bas 'bras bu gzhan la gtong ngo zhes de skad du byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la rjes su ston to //
analyzed: bdag ni khyod kyi lan la lta ba dang bral bas 'bras bu gzhan la gtong ngo zhes de skad du byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la rjes su ston to //
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva teaches generosity.

original: tshol ba med pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis ma btsal ba ste /
analyzed: tshol ba med pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis ma btsal ba ste /
translated: Without seeking means without being asked.

original: don du ma gnyer ba gzhan gyi tshul tsam gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems shes pa sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: don du ma gnyer ba gzhan gyi tshul tsam gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems shes pa sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva gives gifts without seeking anything in return, without desiring anything, simply out of compassion for others.

original: dga' ba ni so sor brtags pa med par rab tu dga' bas sbyin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyis ser sna'i sems tshar bcad nas sbyin pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dga' ba ni so sor brtags pa med par rab tu dga' bas sbyin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyis ser sna'i sems tshar bcad nas sbyin pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Joy is the giving of gifts with intense joy, without analysis. This means that it is not giving gifts after the mind of stinginess has been destroyed by wisdom.

original: sbyin pa'i sgo nas dga' ba ni sbyin pas dga' ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i sgo nas dga' ba ni sbyin pas dga' ba'o //
translated: Joy through giving is joy from giving.

original: 'di ltar snying rjes pha rol tu phyin pa rnams mngon par bsgrub par 'gyur ba de lta tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar snying rjes pha rol tu phyin pa rnams mngon par bsgrub par 'gyur ba de lta tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: Thus, compassion is the cause of the perfections.

original: snying rjes ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: snying rjes ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does compassion cause the perfections to be accomplished?

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par sun 'byin pa'i phyir de ser sna dang 'chal ba'i tshul khrims la sogs pa rnam par sun 'byin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par sun 'byin pa'i phyir de ser sna dang 'chal ba'i tshul khrims la sogs pa rnam par sun 'byin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It causes them to be accomplished because it eliminates their resistances. This means that it eliminates stinginess, immorality, and so on.

original: de ltar na de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par sun phyung bas snying rje de ni pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub pa byed par @139a * //
analyzed: de ltar na de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par sun phyung bas snying rje de ni pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub pa byed par @139a * //
translated: Thus, since it eliminates the resistances, compassion is the practice of the perfections.

original: 'gyur te / de bas na pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub pa'i snying rje zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyur te / de bas na pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub pa'i snying rje zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the compassion of the practice of the perfections.

original: snying rje'i rkyen bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba ni mdo las /
analyzed: snying rje'i rkyen bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba ni mdo las /
translated: A verse on the teaching of the conditions of compassion.

original: rkyen nyid bzhir gsungs te /
analyzed: rkyen nyid bzhir gsungs te /
translated: The S≈´tras teach four conditions:

original: dmigs pa dang / bdag po dang / mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang / rgyu'i rkyen nyid do //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang / bdag po dang / mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang / rgyu'i rkyen nyid do //
translated: the objective, the dominant, the antecedent, and the causal conditions.

original: snying rje'i dmigs pa la sogs pa'i rkyen ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: snying rje'i dmigs pa la sogs pa'i rkyen ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are the conditions of compassion?

original: de bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: de bsam par bya ste /
translated: This should be considered.

original: tshor ba rnam pa gsum car yang dmigs pa'i rkyen yin te /üîΩbde ba'i tshor ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba rnam pa gsum car yang dmigs pa'i rkyen yin te / bde ba'i tshor ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis dmigs pa yin no //
translated: All three feelings are objective conditions of compassion.üîΩPleasant feeling is the objective condition of compassion because it is the suffering of change.

original: sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid kyis so //
translated: Painful feeling is the objective condition of compassion because it is suffering by nature.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant is observed as the suffering that is the very nature of the formative forces.

original: 'di ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag gi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag gi rgyu yin te /
translated: It is the cause of both pleasure and pain,

original: yang de dag 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang de dag 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis for the arising of both.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'di yin te /
translated: The characteristic of the feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant is as follows:

original: de gnyi ga'i gnas ngan len yongs su 'dzin pas gnyis las rnam par ma grol ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i gnas ngan len yongs su 'dzin pas gnyis las rnam par ma grol ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: It is neither pleasant nor unpleasant because it is not free from both and because it is associated with impermanence.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba tshor bar bshad do ;
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba tshor bar bshad do ;
translated: The feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant is described as a feeling because it is the cause of both pleasure and pain.

original: / de bas na bde ba sdug bsngal ba nyid kyi gnas ngan len pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir /üîΩsdug bsngal yang ma yin //
analyzed: / de bas na bde ba sdug bsngal ba nyid kyi gnas ngan len pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir / sdug bsngal yang ma yin //
translated: Therefore, the feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant is taught as an object of observation for the purpose of abandoning both pleasure and pain.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dmigs pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dmigs pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: The feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant is taught as an object of observation for the purpose of abandoning both pleasure and pain.

original: rgyu'i rkyen ni snying rje'i bdag chags gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen ni snying rje'i bdag chags gang yin pa ste /
translated: The causal condition is the possession of compassion.

original: snying rje kun tu spyad pas rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa la bag chags gzhag pa de ni rgyu'i rkyen to //
analyzed: snying rje kun tu spyad pas rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa la bag chags gzhag pa de ni rgyu'i rkyen to //
translated: The causal condition is the planting of the seed of the instinct for compassion in the consciousness that is the result of evolution, by the repeated practice of compassion.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi dbang gis snying rje kun tu spyod pa gang yin pa de ni bdag po'i rkyen to //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi dbang gis snying rje kun tu spyod pa gang yin pa de ni bdag po'i rkyen to //
translated: The dominant condition is the repeated practice of compassion through the influence of a spiritual friend.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs sngar 'byung ba ni snying rje skye bar 'gyur ba'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs sngar 'byung ba ni snying rje skye bar 'gyur ba'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
translated: The condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent is the prior cessation of the collection of mind and mental functions that is conducive to the arising of compassion.

original: de'i bsam pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de sems dpa'i phyir yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bsam pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de sems dpa'i phyir yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of the intention‚Äù should be understood as ‚Äúbecause of the mind.‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa'i phyir ni bdag dang gzhan dang snying rjer mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i phyir ni bdag dang gzhan dang snying rjer mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the nonapprehension‚Äù means that one does not apprehend self, other, or compassion.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: This is the nondiscriminative stage.

original: rang gi sems kyis byams pa @139b la sogs bsgom pa mchog / ces bya ba ni sems can gyi khams la khyim dang grong dang grong khyer la sogs pa'i dbye bas nyi tshe ba'i yo byad kyi rdzas kyis byams par byed pa gang yin pa de ni mchogüîΩma yin gyi //
analyzed: rang gi sems kyis byams pa @139b la sogs bsgom pa mchog / ces bya ba ni sems can gyi khams la khyim dang grong dang grong khyer la sogs pa'i dbye bas nyi tshe ba'i yo byad kyi rdzas kyis byams par byed pa gang yin pa de ni mchog ma yin gyi //
translated: That which is love for the realm of sentient beings by means of limited objects of giving, such as houses, villages, cities, etc. is not supreme.

original: rang gi sems kyis byams pa la sogs pa bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir mchog dang gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: rang gi sems kyis byams pa la sogs pa bsgom pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir mchog dang gtso bo yin no //
translated: But that which is meditation on love, etc. with one's mind is supreme and foremost here.

original: rang gi sems kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi sems kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it with one's mind?

original: de ston te chos la mos pa'i sgo nas ni mdo la sogs pa las tshad med pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos gang yin pa thos nas chos de la shin tu snying nas mos shing sems can thams cad la dmigs nas byams pa la snyoms par 'jug pa
analyzed: de ston te chos la mos pa'i sgo nas ni mdo la sogs pa las tshad med pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos gang yin pa thos nas chos de la shin tu snying nas mos shing sems can thams cad la dmigs nas byams pa la snyoms par 'jug pa
translated: That is taught: Through interest in the Dharma, one hears the Dharma from the sutras, etc. which is governed by the immeasurables, and then, with intense interest in that Dharma, one focuses on all sentient beings and enters into the samadhi of love.

original: yin no // bsam pa'i sgo nas ni ro myang ba la sogs pa'i bsam pa dgus so //
analyzed: yin no // bsam pa'i sgo nas ni ro myang ba la sogs pa'i bsam pa dgus so //
translated: Through the door of aspiration, it is through the nine aspirations such as savoring.

original: dbang 'byor ba nyid kyis ni sems can tshad med pa la byams pa'i'o //
analyzed: dbang 'byor ba nyid kyis ni sems can tshad med pa la byams pa'i'o //
translated: By mastery, it is the love for immeasurable sentient beings.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi thabs yongs su gzung ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang don byed pa'i khyad par gyi sgo nas ni don thams cad 'dris shing nye bar 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi thabs yongs su gzung ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang don byed pa'i khyad par gyi sgo nas ni don thams cad 'dris shing nye bar 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the method of nonconceptual intuition, by the embrace of all bodhisattvas, and by the special performance of benefit, it is the acquaintance with and intimacy with all benefits.

original: rdzas chen pos zhes bya ba ni mu tig dang / bee d'u rya dang / chos gos dang / bsod snyoms pa la sogs pa rnyed pa'i gya nom pa dag gis so //
analyzed: rdzas chen pos zhes bya ba ni mu tig dang / bee d'u rya dang / chos gos dang / bsod snyoms pa la sogs pa rnyed pa'i gya nom pa dag gis so //
translated: By great substance, it is by means of the most excellent acquisitions of pearls, lapis lazuli, robes, alms, and so on.

original: bkur sti chen pos shin tu mchod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par sgrub pa'i don du mchod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrgyun ces bya ba ni rtag tu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: bkur sti chen pos shin tu mchod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par sgrub pa'i don du mchod pa'i phyir ro // rgyun ces bya ba ni rtag tu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: By great reverence, it is endowed with the most excellent worship.üîΩBy continuity, it is constant, that is, it is always engaged in worship of the Lord, and so on.

original: rtag tu bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa yin pas tshigs su bcad pa phyed po 'dis ni mchod pa bstan to ;
analyzed: rtag tu bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa yin pas tshigs su bcad pa phyed po 'dis ni mchod pa bstan to ;
translated: This half-verse teaches worship.

original: / yon tan mang ldan phan byed bshes la rtag brten pa //
analyzed: / yon tan mang ldan phan byed bshes la rtag brten pa //
translated: One should always rely on a spiritual friend who has many virtues and is helpful.

original: zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa bshad do //
translated: This explains reliance on a spiritual friend.

original: 'gro la rjes su brtse ba grub pa kun thob 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro la rjes su brtse ba grub pa kun thob 'gyur //
translated: One who has compassion for the world attains all accomplishments.

original: zhes bya ba ni rjes su brtse bar byed pa nyid kyis tshad med pa rnams ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rjes su brtse bar byed pa nyid kyis tshad med pa rnams ston to //
translated: This shows that the immeasurables are the cause of compassion.

original: de bas na tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ji skad bshad pa'i mchod pa dang / brten pa dang / tshad med pa rnams kyi go rims dang yon tan mdor bsdus nas bstan to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bas na tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ji skad bshad pa'i mchod pa dang / brten pa dang / tshad med pa rnams kyi go rims dang yon tan mdor bsdus nas bstan to zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, this verse shows in brief the order and virtues of the worship, reliance, and immeasurables as they have been explained.

original: go rims ni bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis bstan to //üîΩyon tan ni rdzas dang bkur sti chen pos zhes bya ba la @140a * //
analyzed: go rims ni bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis bstan to // yon tan ni rdzas dang bkur sti chen pos zhes bya ba la @140a * //
translated: The order is shown by the method just explained.

original: sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: sogs pas bstan to //
translated: The virtues are shown by the words ‚Äúwith great material and reverential worship.‚Äù

original: yon tan mang po dang ldan pa ni de las gzhan pa dag dang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yon tan mang po dang ldan pa ni de las gzhan pa dag dang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The one who has many virtues is the spiritual friend.

original: bshes gnyen dul ba zhi zhing nyer zhi ba //
analyzed: bshes gnyen dul ba zhi zhing nyer zhi ba //
translated: The spiritual friend is disciplined, peaceful, and calm.

original: yon tan lhag pa brtson byas lung gis phyug / de nyid rab tu rtogs pa smra mkhas ldan //üîΩbrtse ba'i bdag nyid skyo ba spangs la brten //
analyzed: yon tan lhag pa brtson byas lung gis phyug / de nyid rab tu rtogs pa smra mkhas ldan // brtse ba'i bdag nyid skyo ba spangs la brten //
translated: Endowed with the excellences of being rich in scriptures, of being skilled in teaching, of being compassionate, and of being indefatigable, he is to be relied upon.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva is endowed with the excellences of being rich in scriptures, of being skilled in teaching, of being compassionate, and of being indefatigable.üîΩThe excellences of being rich in scriptures and of being skilled in teaching are mentioned because the bodhisattva is engaged in benefiting himself and others.

original: snying rje'i skabs yin pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: snying rje'i skabs yin pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The excellences of being compassionate and of being indefatigable are mentioned because he is engaged in benefiting others.

original: mchod pa dang brten pa dang tshad med pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: mchod pa dang brten pa dang tshad med pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on worship, reliance, and the immeasurables is completed.

original: // / tshad med pa'i 'og tu ngo tsha ba'i skabs te//
analyzed: // / tshad med pa'i 'og tu ngo tsha ba'i skabs te//
translated: The chapter on the immeasurables is followed by the chapter on conscience.

original: 'di'i 'brel ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i 'brel ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is its connection?

original: 'di ltar rang dang gzhan la phan pa la zhugs pa de bsgrub pa'i don du de dang rjes su mthun pa'i lam sgom par byed pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang dang gzhan la phan pa la zhugs pa de bsgrub pa'i don du de dang rjes su mthun pa'i lam sgom par byed pas /
translated: Thus, in order to accomplish the practice of benefiting oneself and others, one cultivates the path that accords with that.

original: de'i 'og tu byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i skabs so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i skabs so //
translated: Therefore, after the immeasurables, there is the chapter on the factors of enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa'i dmigs pa rnam pa 'di ni ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par gyi sgo nas bslab pa'i lam gyi rnam pa thams cad yin pas ngo tsha ba'i skabs nas bzung ste /üîΩgang zag la bdag med pa'i skabs kyi bar thams cad ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i skabs yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa'i dmigs pa rnam pa 'di ni ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par gyi sgo nas bslab pa'i lam gyi rnam pa thams cad yin pas ngo tsha ba'i skabs nas bzung ste / gang zag la bdag med pa'i skabs kyi bar thams cad ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i skabs yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattvas' domain of training, since it is the entire form of the path of training, by way of its nature and its particulars.

original: ngo tsha mi mthun phyogs spangs dang // zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ngo tsha mi mthun phyogs spangs dang // zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis bstan pa ste /
translated: From the chapter on conscience up to the chapter on the selflessness of persons, all should be understood as the chapter on the accessories of enlightenment.üîΩThe verse: Conscience is the opposite of that.üîΩExplains the nature of conscience.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ngo tsha mi shes pa dang / khrel med pa spangs pa'i phyir ngo tsha ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs med par 'gyur bas ngo tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ngo tsha mi shes pa dang / khrel med pa spangs pa'i phyir ngo tsha ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs med par 'gyur bas ngo tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid du bshad do //
translated: Since it is the opposite of the counteragent, nonconscience, it is explained as the nature of conscience.

original: grogs ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: grogs ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Its companion is nonconceptual intuition.

original: yul kha na ma tho ba med cing dman pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas te /
analyzed: yul kha na ma tho ba med cing dman pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas te /
translated: The object is not blameworthy and inferior, i.e., the vehicles of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: zag pa med pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa yin la /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa yin la /
translated: It is not blameworthy because it is undefiled.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa yin pa'i phyir dman pa'o //üîΩbsten rnams pha rol phyin pa drug / bsten pa las ni le lo las ngo tsha bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' gang gi tshe bsten par 'os pa pha rol tu phyin pa nams le lo byed cing sten par mi byed /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa yin pa'i phyir dman pa'o // bsten rnams pha rol phyin pa drug / bsten pa las ni le lo las ngo tsha bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' gang gi tshe bsten par 'os pa pha rol tu phyin pa nams le lo byed cing sten par mi byed /
translated: It is inferior because it is the vehicle of the sravakas.üîΩThe bodhisattva becomes ashamed of laziness in the practice of the six perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la rab tu mi sbyor na des na ngo tsha bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la rab tu mi sbyor na des na ngo tsha bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the bodhisattva is not practicing the perfections which are worthy of practice, and is not applying himself to the perfections, he becomes ashamed.

original: 'di ni sbyor ba dang mi sbyor bas ngo tsha ba yin no zhes bya ba ni sbyar ba ma yin pa la sbyor ba @140b gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyor ba dang mi sbyor bas ngo tsha ba yin no zhes bya ba ni sbyar ba ma yin pa la sbyor ba @140b gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is shame in not applying oneself to what should be applied to.

original: sbyar ba ma yin pa la sbyor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: sbyar ba ma yin pa la sbyor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is not applying oneself to what should be applied to?

original: gang gi tshe le los nyon mongs pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe le los nyon mongs pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la sbyor ba'o //
translated: It is laziness that engages in things that are consistent with the afflictions.

original: 'di ni ngo tsha ba chung ngu dang chen po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni ngo tsha ba chung ngu dang chen po ste /
translated: This is lesser and greater shamelessness.üîΩIt should be understood by following the previous explanations.

original: sngar bshad pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'i ngo tsha ba dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa yang chung ngu dang 'bring dang dman pa nyan thos kyi theg pa mtshungs par ldan pa'i ngo tsha ba gang yin pa dang sa bdun po dag la nga rgyal dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'i ngo tsha ba dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa yang chung ngu dang 'bring dang dman pa nyan thos kyi theg pa mtshungs par ldan pa'i ngo tsha ba gang yin pa dang sa bdun po dag la nga rgyal dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The shamelessness of the stage of non-equipoise and the shamelessness of the stage of non-equipoise, which is lesser, middling, and inferior, and the shamelessness associated with the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle, and on the seven stages, which is accompanied by pride,

original: ngo tsha ba ji skad bstan pa da dag thams cad ni dman pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha ba ji skad bstan pa da dag thams cad ni dman pa'o //
translated: all of these shamelessnesses that have been taught are inferior.

original: sa las ngo tsha ba ltos na ni dman pa yang yin la /
analyzed: sa las ngo tsha ba ltos na ni dman pa yang yin la /
translated: Compared to the shamelessness of the stages, it is inferior.

original: lhag pa'i yang yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa'i yang yin no //
translated: And it is also superior.

original: de las bzlog pa ni lhag pa ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni lhag pa ste /
translated: The opposite of that is superior.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa gang yin pa dang mnyam par ma gzhag pa'i sa pa las kyang chung ngu dang / 'bring ma gtogs pa ngo tsha ba chen po dang / sa brgyad pa la sogs pa'i ngo tsha ba ni lhag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa gang yin pa dang mnyam par ma gzhag pa'i sa pa las kyang chung ngu dang / 'bring ma gtogs pa ngo tsha ba chen po dang / sa brgyad pa la sogs pa'i ngo tsha ba ni lhag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The shame of the eighth stage, etc. is greater than the shame of the lower stages, except for the great shame.

original: blo ldan ngo tsha med pa ni //
analyzed: blo ldan ngo tsha med pa ni //
translated: The wise one is ashamed of the passionsüîΩthrough improper attention.

original: tshul bzhin min pas nyon mongs dag / dang du len zhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa kun tu spyod pas bdag nyid la gnod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul bzhin min pas nyon mongs dag / dang du len zhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa kun tu spyod pas bdag nyid la gnod par byed pa yin no //
translated: He is ashamed of the passions through improper attention, because he is harmed by himself.

original: khong khro bas ni gzhan la gnod par byed do //
analyzed: khong khro bas ni gzhan la gnod par byed do //
translated: He is ashamed of anger because he harms others.

original: yal bar 'dor ba dang nga rgyal dag gis ni gnyi ga la gnod par byed do //
analyzed: yal bar 'dor ba dang nga rgyal dag gis ni gnyi ga la gnod par byed do //
translated: He is ashamed of negligence and pride because he harms both himself and others.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yal bar 'dor ba dang / nga rgyal gyi mjug thogs su /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yal bar 'dor ba dang / nga rgyal gyi mjug thogs su /
translated: Therefore, after negligence and pride, it is said:

original: sems can rnams dang tshul khrims 'joms //üîΩzhes bshad de /
analyzed: sems can rnams dang tshul khrims 'joms //üîΩzhes bshad de /
translated: He destroys sentient beings and morality.

original: yal bar 'dor bas ni sems can gyi don la bag med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: yal bar 'dor bas ni sems can gyi don la bag med par 'gyur la /
translated: By negligence, one is careless about the welfare of sentient beings.

original: nga rgyal gyi ni sems can gdol pa yan chad kyi drung du song nas dge ba'i chos la sbyor bar mi byed do //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi ni sems can gdol pa yan chad kyi drung du song nas dge ba'i chos la sbyor bar mi byed do //
translated: By pride, one does not go into the presence of the lowliest sentient beings in order to engage them in virtue.

original: de ltar na sems can la gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sems can la gnod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, one harms sentient beings.üîΩBy negligence, one is negligent about engaging in virtue and accepts engaging in nonvirtue.üîΩBy pride, one does not go into the presence of a spiritual master in order to serve him, to listen to the Dharma, and so on.üîΩThus, one harms oneself.üîΩBy pride, one does not go into the presence of a spiritual master in order to serve him, to listen to the Dharma, and so on.

original: bdag nyid la yang 'di ltar yal bar 'dor bas dge ba'i chos la 'jug pa yal bar 'dor zhing mi dge ba'i chos la 'jug pa dang du len to //
analyzed: bdag nyid la yang 'di ltar yal bar 'dor bas dge ba'i chos la 'jug pa yal bar 'dor zhing mi dge ba'i chos la 'jug pa dang du len to //
translated: Thus, one harms oneself.üîΩBy pride, one does not go into the presence of a spiritual master in order to serve him, to listen to the Dharma, and so on.üîΩThus, one harms oneself.üîΩBy pride, one does not go into the presence of a spiritual master in order to serve him, to listen to the Dharma, and so on.üîΩThus, one harms oneself.

original: nga rgyal gyis kyang khengs pa nyid kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro zhing bsnyen bkur bya ba dang chos mnyan pa la sogs pa la mi 'jug go //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis kyang khengs pa nyid kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro zhing bsnyen bkur bya ba dang chos mnyan pa la sogs pa la mi 'jug go //
translated: By pride, one does not go into the presence of a spiritual master in order to serve him, to listen to the Dharma, and so on.üîΩThus, one harms oneself.üîΩBy pride, one does not go into the presence of a spiritual master in order to serve him, to listen to the Dharma, and so on.üîΩThus, one harms oneself.üîΩBy pride, one does not go into the presence of a spiritual master in order to serve him, to listen to the Dharma, and so on.üîΩThus, one harms oneself.üîΩBy pride, one does not go into the presence of a spiritual master in order to serve him, to listen to the Dharma, and so on.üîΩThus, one harms oneself.üîΩBy pride, one does not go into the presence of a spiritual master in order to serve him, to listen to the Dharma, and so on.üîΩThus, one harms oneself.üîΩBy pride, one does not go into the presence of a spiritual master in order to serve him, to listen to the Dharma, and so on.

original: de bas na mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang @141a * //
analyzed: de bas na mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang @141a * //
translated: Thus, one harms oneself.üîΩBy pride, one does not go into the presence of a spiritual master in order to serve him, to listen to the Dharma, and so on.üîΩThus, one harms oneself.

original: phrad pas na 'di'i tshul khrims la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phrad pas na 'di'i tshul khrims la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: By pride, one does not go into the presence of a spiritual master in order to serve him, to listen to the Dharma, and so

original: nga rgyal gyis nyams pa ni gang cung zad shes pa yang gzhan dag la mi ston zhing song zhing song nas sems can gyi don bya ba dag la yang mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis nyams pa ni gang cung zad shes pa yang gzhan dag la mi ston zhing song zhing song nas sems can gyi don bya ba dag la yang mi 'jug ste /
translated: The degeneration of pride is that one does not teach others even a little of what one knows, and having gone here and there, one does not engage in benefiting sentient beings.üîΩIn this way, one harms oneself and others.

original: de ltar na bdag nyid dang gzhan la gnod pa yin no ;üîΩ/'gyod pas bdag nyid la gnod par byed ces bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na bdag nyid dang gzhan la gnod pa yin no ; /'gyod pas bdag nyid la gnod par byed ces bya ste /
translated: One harms oneself through regret.

original: 'di ltar bshad ma thag pa'i khong khro ba la sogs pa kun tu spyod pas 'gyod pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bshad ma thag pa'i khong khro ba la sogs pa kun tu spyod pas 'gyod pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: One has regret through the practice of anger and so on, as just explained.üîΩ Therefore, one disparages oneself through regret.

original: de bas na 'gyod par byed pas ni bdag nyid la smod do //üîΩbkur stis dman pa'i phyir gzhan dag smod do //
analyzed: de bas na 'gyod par byed pas ni bdag nyid la smod do // bkur stis dman pa'i phyir gzhan dag smod do //
translated: One disparages others through pride, thinking, I am superior to others.üîΩ The degeneration of faith is that one does not have faith in the three jewels, the three knowledges, and so on.üîΩ The degeneration of shame and embarassment is that one does not feel shame and embarassment before anyone.üîΩ The degeneration of nonviolence is that one does not have compassion for sentient beings.üîΩ The degeneration of gratitude is that one does not repay the help of others.üîΩ The degeneration of contentment is that one is not content with few resources.

original: dad ldan mi min tshogs dang ni //
analyzed: dad ldan mi min tshogs dang ni //
translated: The degeneration of magnanimity is that one does not give to others even a little of one's own resources.üîΩ The degeneration of patience is that one does not endure suffering.üîΩ The degeneration of effort is that one does not strive for virtue.üîΩ The degeneration of concentration is that one does not enter meditative concentration.

original: zhes bya ba ni lta'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lta'o //
translated: The degeneration of wisdom is that one does not seek wisdom.

original: ston pas btang snyoms su mdzad pa'i phyir ston pas bong bu ltar spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas smod de /
analyzed: ston pas btang snyoms su mdzad pa'i phyir ston pas bong bu ltar spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas smod de /
translated: The degeneration of generosity is that one does not give even a little of one's own resources to others.üîΩ The degeneration of morality is that one does not avoid even the slightest transgression.üîΩ The degeneration of effort is that one does not strive for virtue.üîΩ The degeneration of patience is that one does not endure suffering.üîΩ The degeneration of meditation is that one does not enter meditative concentration.üîΩ The degeneration of wisdom is that one does not seek wisdom.üîΩ The degeneration of skillful means is that one does not bring sentient beings to maturation.üîΩ The degeneration of aspiration is that one does not aspire to the qualities of the Buddha.üîΩ The degeneration of strength is that one does not generate the strength of effort.üîΩ The degeneration of direct intuition is that one does not seek the direct intuition of the noble levels.üîΩ The degeneration of knowledge is that one does not seek the knowledge of a knower of all aspects.üîΩ The degeneration

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ni 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi snod ma yin no zhes bya bar mkhyen nas btang snyoms su mdzad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ni 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi snod ma yin no zhes bya bar mkhyen nas btang snyoms su mdzad do //
translated: The Lord knew that he was not a vessel for the noble Dharma and so he abandoned him.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa dag chos nyid kyis rnam par smod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i ni chos mthun pa'i rnam par smad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa dag chos nyid kyis rnam par smod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i ni chos mthun pa'i rnam par smad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the wise practitioners of pure conduct condemn him by way of the Dharma,

original: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams su yang 'di mi snyan pa 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams su yang 'di mi snyan pa 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: and because his bad reputation spreads in all directions,

original: 'jig rten las mi snyan pa 'thob po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten las mi snyan pa 'thob po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: he obtains infamy in the world.

original: de las skyes pa'i sems la 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba so sor myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i sems la 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba so sor myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: He experiences the suffering and mental pain that arise from that.

original: sdug bsngal ni rnam par shes pa lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni rnam par shes pa lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: Suffering is associated with the five consciousnesses.

original: yid mi bde ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o ;
analyzed: yid mi bde ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o ;
translated: Mental pain is associated with the mental consciousness.

original: / ngo tsha bas tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed do zhes bya ba 'dis ni bdag po'i 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha ba ni yon tan thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin te /
analyzed: / ngo tsha bas tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed do zhes bya ba 'dis ni bdag po'i 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha ba ni yon tan thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin te /
translated: By means of the verse, ‚ÄúThrough shame, the stores are perfected,‚Äù the dominant result is shown. Shame is the root of all virtues.

original: de'i dbang gis tshogs yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis tshogs yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By its power, the stores are perfected.

original: 'dis ni ngo tsha med pa ni de las gzhan pa'i gos gyon yang nyes pas dri ma can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni ngo tsha med pa ni de las gzhan pa'i gos gyon yang nyes pas dri ma can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This shows that the shameless one, even though clothed in other garments, is stained by faults.

original: ngo tsha ba ni gos khyad par du 'phags pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ngo tsha ba ni gos khyad par du 'phags pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Shame is the most excellent garment.

original: byis pas gos kyis g-yogs pa ni lus la sa'i rdul la sogs pa dri ma mi 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: byis pas gos kyis g-yogs pa ni lus la sa'i rdul la sogs pa dri ma mi 'byung mod kyi /
translated: The fool, though covered with garments, is not free from the stains of the body, such as dust, etc.

original: 'on kyang nang gi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma dang ldan pas gos @141b dang bcas kyang dri ma can yin pa'i phyir dri ma dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang nang gi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma dang ldan pas gos @141b dang bcas kyang dri ma can yin pa'i phyir dri ma dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: But the shameless one, though clothed, is said to be stained because of the stains of greed, etc., within.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ngo tsha shes pa'i gos kyis g-yogs pa ni gos med kyang nang gi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ngo tsha shes pa'i gos kyis g-yogs pa ni gos med kyang nang gi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattva, covered with the garment of shame, is free of the stain of internal desire, etc., even though naked.

original: de kho na'i lus dri ma dang bral ba yin pas /
analyzed: de kho na'i lus dri ma dang bral ba yin pas /
translated: Since his body is free of stain,

original: de kho na gos dang bcas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de kho na gos dang bcas pa yin gyi /
translated: he is clothed in reality,

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: but others are not.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: rgyal sras ngo tsha shes pa'i gos can ni //
analyzed: rgyal sras ngo tsha shes pa'i gos can ni //
translated: the victors' spiritual heir, clothed in the garment of shame,

original: dgab pa med kyang nyes pa'i dri ma bral //
analyzed: dgab pa med kyang nyes pa'i dri ma bral //
translated: is free of the stain of faults, even though naked.

original: zhes bya ba bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bshad do //
translated: This is explained.

original: nam mkha' dang rgyan dang 'dra ba nyid du ston to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang rgyan dang 'dra ba nyid du ston to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It shows that shame is like space and like an ornament.

original: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba nyid dang rgyan dang 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba nyid dang rgyan dang 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: It is like space and like an ornament.

original: 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' rang bzhin gyis dri ma med pa la sprin dang khug rna la sogs pas mi gos pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' rang bzhin gyis dri ma med pa la sprin dang khug rna la sogs pas mi gos pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as space, which is naturally unstained, is not soiled by clouds, mist, and so forth,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ngo tsha dang ldan pa yang 'jig rten gyi chos rnyed pa dang mi rnyed pa la sogs pas mi gos so ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ngo tsha dang ldan pa yang 'jig rten gyi chos rnyed pa dang mi rnyed pa la sogs pas mi gos so ;
translated: The bodhisattva who has a sense of shame is also unstained by mundane things, such as gain and honor.

original: / ji ltar rgyan dang chos mthun pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: / ji ltar rgyan dang chos mthun pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it similar to an ornament?

original: ji ltar phal pa 'ga' zhig rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan te mi dag gi nang du song na mdzes pa ltar byang chub sems dpa' ngo tsha shes pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa yang de bzhin du mdzes so //üîΩbskyab par bya ba'i sems can yal bar bor nas ngo tsha ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' ni ma lta bur byams pa dang ldan pas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar phal pa 'ga' zhig rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan te mi dag gi nang du song na mdzes pa ltar byang chub sems dpa' ngo tsha shes pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa yang de bzhin du mdzes so // bskyab par bya ba'i sems can yal bar bor nas ngo tsha ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' ni ma lta bur byams pa dang ldan pas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as an ordinary person who is adorned with various ornaments is beautiful when he goes among people, so the bodhisattva who is adorned with the ornament of a sense of shame is beautiful.

original: bdag gis yal bar bor nas sems can 'ga' zhig log par ltung bar song na mi rung ngo zhes sems can gyi don du rtag tu bag tsha ba kho nar gnas pas so //
analyzed: bdag gis yal bar bor nas sems can 'ga' zhig log par ltung bar song na mi rung ngo zhes sems can gyi don du rtag tu bag tsha ba kho nar gnas pas so //
translated: Because he is ashamed to abandon sentient beings who need protection. The bodhisattva, who is compassionate like a mother, always remains anxious for the sake of sentient beings, thinking, ‚ÄúIt would not be right for me to abandon any sentient being and let him fall into an unfortunate realm.‚Äù

original: rta dang glang po che'i tshogs la sogs pa 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rgyal po glang po che dang / rta dang shing rta la sogs pas phyir rgol ba dag las bsrungs pa de bzhin du ngo tsha ba yang sems can 'khor ba pa rnams kyi nyes pa thams cad las kun tu srung bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rta dang glang po che'i tshogs la sogs pa 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rgyal po glang po che dang / rta dang shing rta la sogs pas phyir rgol ba dag las bsrungs pa de bzhin du ngo tsha ba yang sems can 'khor ba pa rnams kyi nyes pa thams cad las kun tu srung bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Just as a king is protected from his enemies by his elephants, horses, chariots, and so on, in the same way, shame protects sentient beings in cyclic existence from all faults.üîΩBy these examples of clothing, etc.,üîΩthe bodhisattva's shame is like clothing,üîΩbecause it covers the body.

original: gos la sogs pa'i dpe 'di rnams kyis ni ngo tsha bas gnas pa na /üîΩnyon mongs pa'i gnyen po nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gos la sogs pa'i dpe 'di rnams kyis ni ngo tsha bas gnas pa na / nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: The line,

original: rgyal sras ngo tsha shes pa'i gos can ni //
analyzed: rgyal sras ngo tsha shes pa'i gos can ni //
translated: The victors' spiritual heir, clothed in a sense of shame,

original: dgab pa med kyang nyes pa'i dri ma @142a * //
analyzed: dgab pa med kyang nyes pa'i dri ma @142a * //
translated: is free of the stain of faults, even without other coverings,

original: bral ; / zhes gang bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: bral ; / zhes gang bshad pa yin te /
translated: explains that shame is the antidote to the afflictions.üîΩThe line, The bodhisattva's shame is like clothing, because it covers the body, explains that shame is the antidote to the afflictions.üîΩThe line, The victors' spiritual heir, clothed in a sense of shame, is free of the stain of faults, even without other coverings, explains that shame is the antidote to the afflictions.üîΩThe line, The bodhisattva's shame is like clothing, because it covers the body, explains that shame is the antidote to the afflictions.üîΩThe line, The victors' spiritual heir, clothed in a sense of shame, is free of the stain of faults, even without other coverings, explains that shame is the antidote to the afflictions.üîΩThe line, The bodhisattva's shame is like clothing, because it covers the body, explains that shame is the antidote to the afflictions.üîΩThe line, The victors' spiritual heir, clothed in a sense of shame, is free of the stain of faults, even without other coverings, explains that shame is the antidote to the afflictions.

original: gnas pa ni skyil mo krong bcas nas bsam gtan byed pa'i nang du yang dag par 'jog pa'i gnas skabs yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa ni skyil mo krong bcas nas bsam gtan byed pa'i nang du yang dag par 'jog pa'i gnas skabs yin te /
translated: The line, The bodhisattva's shame is like clothing, because it covers the body, explains that shame is the antidote to the afflictions.üîΩThe line, The victors' spiritual heir, clothed in a sense of shame, is free of the stain of faults, even without other coverings, explains that shame is the antidote to the afflictions.üîΩThe line, The bodhisattva's shame is like clothing, because it covers the body, explains that shame is the antidote to the afflictions.

original: 'chag pa dang / nyal ba dang / 'greng ba dag na yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'chag pa dang / nyal ba dang / 'greng ba dag na yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The line, The victors' spiritual heir, clothed in a sense of shame, is free of the stain of faults, even without other coverings, explains that shame is the antidote

original: rgyu ba na 'jig rten gyi chos kyi gnyen po nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu ba na 'jig rten gyi chos kyi gnyen po nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIn movement, it is the antidote to worldly dharmas.‚Äù

original: rgyal ba'i sras ni khrel dang ldan gyur pa //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras ni khrel dang ldan gyur pa //
translated: The bodhisattva who is endowed with conscience

original: nam mkha' bzhin du chos kyis mi gos 'gyur //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du chos kyis mi gos 'gyur //
translated: is unstained by faults, like space.

original: zhes gang bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is what is explained.

original: rgyu ba ni bsod snyoms byed pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: rgyu ba ni bsod snyoms byed pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn movement‚Äù refers to the occasion of going for alms.

original: chos mthun pa dang / gnas pa dang mthun pa nyid ces bya ba ni //
analyzed: chos mthun pa dang / gnas pa dang mthun pa nyid ces bya ba ni //
translated: ‚ÄúIn conformity with the Dharma‚Äù and ‚Äúin conformity with abiding‚Äù are

original: rgyal sras rnams kyi nang du 'dus gyur pa //
analyzed: rgyal sras rnams kyi nang du 'dus gyur pa //
translated: The bodhisattvas who are gathered in the assembly

original: ngo tsha shes pas brgyan pa mdzes pa yin //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pas brgyan pa mdzes pa yin //
translated: are adorned with conscience and are beautiful.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang mthun pa nyid ni /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang mthun pa nyid ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIn conformity with the ripening of beings‚ÄùüîΩis taught by the verse

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngo tsha bas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ngo tsha bas /
translated: The bodhisattvas, through conscience,

original: gdul ba rnams la ma bzhin byams pa nyid //üîΩces bya ba 'di ston to //
analyzed: gdul ba rnams la ma bzhin byams pa nyid // ces bya ba 'di ston to //
translated: are like mothers to those who are disciplined.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin par 'khor ba dang mthun pa nyid ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin par 'khor ba dang mthun pa nyid ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIn conformity with samsara without affliction‚Äù is

original: ngo tsha ba ni nyes pa thams cad las /
analyzed: ngo tsha ba ni nyes pa thams cad las /
translated: The conscientious one is free from all faults,

original: 'khor ba kun tu srung bar byed pa'ang yin //
analyzed: 'khor ba kun tu srung bar byed pa'ang yin //
translated: It also protects from all the dangers of cyclic existence.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
translated: This is what is shown.

original: ngo tsha shes pa bsgom pa ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa bsgom pa ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o ;
translated: The cultivation of a sense of shame is to be understood as above.

original: / zhes bya ba ji ltar snga ma bzhin zhe na /üîΩji ltar dri dang phreng ba dang byug pa la sogs pas mchod pa gtso bo ma yin gyi /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ji ltar snga ma bzhin zhe na / ji ltar dri dang phreng ba dang byug pa la sogs pas mchod pa gtso bo ma yin gyi /
translated: How is it as above?

original: rang gi sems kyis mchod pa gtso bo yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rang gi sems kyis mchod pa gtso bo yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as worship with perfumes, garlands, ointments, etc. is not the best, but worship with the mind is the best,

original: gzhan la ltos nas ngo tsha ba byed pa'i ngo tsha ba ni chung la rang gi sems kyis ngo tsha ba ni gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos nas ngo tsha ba byed pa'i ngo tsha ba ni chung la rang gi sems kyis ngo tsha ba ni gtso bo yin no //
translated: so too, shame that is dependent on others is inferior, but shame with the mind is the best.

original: rang gi sems kyis ngo tsha ba de yang rnam pa lngas mchog tu rig par bya ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: rang gi sems kyis ngo tsha ba de yang rnam pa lngas mchog tu rig par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: And that shame with the mind is to be known as the best in five ways.

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang ldan pa'i theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa dang bsam pa ste /
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang ldan pa'i theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa dang bsam pa ste /
translated: It is the faith and will of one who has a sense of shame, in the Dharma of the universal vehicle.

original: bsam pa dgu po ro myong bar byed pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / mngon par dga' ba'i bsam pa dag dang / ngoms mi shes pa dang / rgya chen po dang / dga' ba dang / phan pa dang / ma gos pa dang /
analyzed: bsam pa dgu po ro myong bar byed pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / mngon par dga' ba'i bsam pa dag dang / ngoms mi shes pa dang / rgya chen po dang / dga' ba dang / phan pa dang / ma gos pa dang /
translated: The nine kinds of attitude are those of savoring the experience, rejoicing, delight, insatiable appetite, vast scope, joy, benefit, untaintedness and complete acceptance.üîΩ

original: dge ba'i bsam pa rnams dang / dbang 'byor pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i bsam pa rnams dang / dbang 'byor pa ste /
translated: The nine attitudes are the attitude of relishing, the attitude of rejoicing, the attitude of delight, the attitude of insatiability, the attitude of vast extent, the attitude of joy, the attitude of benefit, the attitude of nonattachment and the attitude of virtue.üîΩThe attitude of mastery is the attitude of the bodhisattvas who have entered the great levels.

original: sa chen po la zhugs pa rnams kyi ngo tsha ba gang yin pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ste rnam par mi @142b rtog pa'i ye shes kyi thabs yongs su gzung ba dang gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: sa chen po la zhugs pa rnams kyi ngo tsha ba gang yin pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ste rnam par mi @142b rtog pa'i ye shes kyi thabs yongs su gzung ba dang gcig pa nyid de /
translated: The attitude of shame is the attitude of the bodhisattvas who have entered the great levels and it is the attitude of nonconceptuality, which is the retention of the method of nonconceptual gnosis.

original: don thams cad 'dres pa nye bar 'dres pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang don gcig pa nyid la 'jug pas so //
analyzed: don thams cad 'dres pa nye bar 'dres pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang don gcig pa nyid la 'jug pas so //
translated: Because all meanings are mixed and combined, they engage in the single meaning of all bodhisattvas.

original: ngo tsha ba'i skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: ngo tsha ba'i skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on shame is completed.

original: // / ngo tsha ba'i 'og tu bstan pa rnam par dbye ba ste /
analyzed: // / ngo tsha ba'i 'og tu bstan pa rnam par dbye ba ste /
translated: The classification of the teachings follows shame.

original: 'di'i 'brel ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i 'brel ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is its connection?

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams kyi gtso bor gyur pa ni ngo tsha ba yin pas sngar bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams kyi gtso bor gyur pa ni ngo tsha ba yin pas sngar bstan to //
translated: Since shame is the foremost of the factors of enlightenment, it is taught first.

original: de ltar khrel dang ldan pas byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa bsgom pa la rab tu sbyor ba ni le lo dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab bsal nas brtan pa phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar khrel dang ldan pas byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa bsgom pa la rab tu sbyor ba ni le lo dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab bsal nas brtan pa phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one who is endowed with shame and is engaged in cultivating the factors of enlightenment, having eliminated laziness, distraction, and faulty wisdom, will achieve perfect firmness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chos gsum po brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab la snying stobs dang sran thub pa dang / brtan pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chos gsum po brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab la snying stobs dang sran thub pa dang / brtan pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, these three qualities‚Äîenergy, samƒÅdhi, and wisdom‚Äîare called ‚Äúcourage, endurance, and firmness.‚Äù

original: chos de dag kyang khrel dang ldan pa la 'grub pas de'i phyir ngo tsha shes pa'i 'og tu brtan pa rnam par dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: chos de dag kyang khrel dang ldan pa la 'grub pas de'i phyir ngo tsha shes pa'i 'og tu brtan pa rnam par dbye ba yin no //
translated: Since these qualities are accomplished in one who is endowed with shame, the analysis of firmness follows immediately after the explanation of shame.
