original: brtson 'grus la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus dang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab ces bya ba 'di ni brtan pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: brtson 'grus la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus dang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab ces bya ba 'di ni brtan pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The characteristic of steadfastness is effort, meditative concentration, and wisdom.

original: brtson 'grus la sogs pa'i chos gsum po 'di la snying stobs dang sran thub pa dang brtan pa zhes ming du gdags so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus la sogs pa'i chos gsum po 'di la snying stobs dang sran thub pa dang brtan pa zhes ming du gdags so //
translated: These three dharmas, effort, etc., are designated by the name ‚Äústeadfastness‚Äù because they are courage, endurance, and firmness.

original: lhag ma ni sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni /üîΩgang phyir gsum gyis byang chub sems //
analyzed: lhag ma ni sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni / gang phyir gsum gyis byang chub sems //
translated: The rest is the proof.

original: 'jigs pa med par rab tu 'jug / ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa med par rab tu 'jug / ces bya ba yin te /
translated: Because of the three, the bodhisattva proceeds fearlessly.

original: gang gi phyir chos gsum po 'di dag gis 'jig pa med par 'gyur ba de'i phyir brtan pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob po zhes bya ba ni de ltar sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos gsum po 'di dag gis 'jig pa med par 'gyur ba de'i phyir brtan pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob po zhes bya ba ni de ltar sgrub par byed do //
translated: The proof is as follows: because of these three dharmas, one becomes fearless. Therefore, one obtains the name ‚Äústeadfast.‚Äù

original: de la mi spro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zhum pa'i sems kyis bya ba dag la mi spro ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi spro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zhum pa'i sems kyis bya ba dag la mi spro ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Therein, the lack of enthusiasm is the lack of enthusiasm for activities due to a depressed mind.

original: yang na ni rmongs pas te /
analyzed: yang na ni rmongs pas te /
translated: Or, it is due to confusion.

original: de'i thabs mi shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun tu rmongs pa'i sems kyis bya ba sgrub pa'i shes pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩso sor brtags pa med par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus la sogs pa rab kyi mthar phyin cing rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / rang bzhin @143a * //
analyzed: de'i thabs mi shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun tu rmongs pa'i sems kyis bya ba sgrub pa'i shes pa gang yin pa'o // so sor brtags pa med par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus la sogs pa rab kyi mthar phyin cing rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / rang bzhin @143a * //
translated: The knowledge of the means is the knowledge of the means for accomplishing the aims of beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the means is the knowledge of the means for accomplishing the aims of beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the means is the knowledge of the means for accomplishing the aims of beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the means is the knowledge of the means for accomplishing the aims of beings.

original: zhes bya ba ni rigs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rigs so //
translated: The knowledge of the means is the knowledge of the means for accomplishing the aims of beings.

original: smon lam zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa'o //üîΩlta ba med pa nyid ni rang gi don to //üîΩsems can log par sgrub pa nyid ni gzhan gyi don to //
analyzed: smon lam zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa'o // lta ba med pa nyid ni rang gi don to // sems can log par sgrub pa nyid ni gzhan gyi don to //
translated: The knowledge of the means is the knowledge of the means for accomplishing the aims of beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the means is the knowledge of the means for accomplishing the aims of beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the means is the knowledge of the means for accomplishing the aims of beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the means is the knowledge of the means for accomplishing the aims of beings.

original: zab mo thos pa nyid ni de kho na nyid kyi don to //üîΩrgya che ba thos pa nyid ni mthu'o //
analyzed: zab mo thos pa nyid ni de kho na nyid kyi don to // rgya che ba thos pa nyid ni mthu'o //
translated: The knowledge of the means is the knowledge of the means for accomplishing the aims of beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the means is the knowledge of the means for accomplishing the aims of beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the means is the knowledge of the means for accomplishing the aims of beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the means is the knowledge of the means for accomplishing the aims of beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the means is the knowledge of the means for accomplishing the aims of beings.

original: gdul bar bya ba gdul dka' ba nyid ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'o //üîΩsku bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni byang chub mchog gi sgo nas te /
analyzed: gdul bar bya ba gdul dka' ba nyid ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'o //üîΩsku bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni byang chub mchog gi sgo nas te /
translated: The knowledge of the means is the knowledge of the means for accomplishing the aims of beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the means is the knowledge of the means for accomplishing the aims of beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the means is the knowledge of the means for accomplishing the aims of beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the means is the knowledge of the means for accomplishing the aims of beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the means is the knowledge of the means for accomplishing the aims of beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the means is the knowledge of the means for accomplishing the aims of beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the means is the knowledge of the means for accomplishing the aims of beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the means is the knowledge of the means for accomplishing the aims of beings.üîΩThe knowledge of the means is the knowledge of the means for accomplishing the aims of beings.

original: 'di ni brtan pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni brtan pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: This is the analysis of firmness.

original: yang bya dka' ba la zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pas kyang brtan pa rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: yang bya dka' ba la zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pas kyang brtan pa rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: Moreover, firmness is analyzed by such passages as ‚Äúin difficult situations.

original: ji ltar phye ma leb dag gis ri rab bskyod par mi nus pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang grogs po ngan pa dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa las g-yos par mi nus so //
analyzed: ji ltar phye ma leb dag gis ri rab bskyod par mi nus pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang grogs po ngan pa dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa las g-yos par mi nus so //
translated: Just as a mountain of jewels cannot be shaken by butterflies, so a bodhisattva cannot be shaken from the bodhisattva way of life by bad friends.

original: grogs po ngan pa byang chub sems dpa' la phye ma leb ltar yang bar snang ngo //üîΩji ltar nam mkha' lding la sogs pa bya gzhan thams cad kyi 'dab lcag gis ri rab bskyod par mi nus pa de bzhin du phyi dang nang sdug bsngal 'bab pa dag gis byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa las g-yos par mi nus so
analyzed: grogs po ngan pa byang chub sems dpa' la phye ma leb ltar yang bar snang ngo // ji ltar nam mkha' lding la sogs pa bya gzhan thams cad kyi 'dab lcag gis ri rab bskyod par mi nus pa de bzhin du phyi dang nang sdug bsngal 'bab pa dag gis byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa las g-yos par mi nus so
translated: Bad friends appear to a bodhisattva as light as butterflies.üîΩJust as a mountain of jewels cannot be shaken by the flapping of the wings of all the birds such as garu·∏ças, so a bodhisattva cannot be shaken from the bodhisattva way of life by the downpour of inner and outer suffering.

original: // ji ltar rgya mtsho dag gis ri rab bskyod par mi nus pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: // ji ltar rgya mtsho dag gis ri rab bskyod par mi nus pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a mountain of jewels cannot be shaken by the ocean, so a bodhisattva cannot be shaken by the ocean of afflictions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang theg pa chen po shin tu rgyas pa'i sde zab cing rgya cher bar thos nas de las mi g-yo'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang theg pa chen po shin tu rgyas pa'i sde zab cing rgya cher bar thos nas de las mi g-yo'o //
translated: The bodhisattva also does not waver when he hears the profound and extensive scriptures of the universal vehicle.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dpe gsum po 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa'i brtan pa'i mi 'gyur ba nyid bshad do zhes smos so /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dpe gsum po 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa'i brtan pa'i mi 'gyur ba nyid bshad do zhes smos so /
translated: Therefore, it is said that these three examples explain the steadfastness and immutability of the bodhisattva.

original: // / brtan pa'i 'og tu mi skyo ba'i skabs te /
analyzed: // / brtan pa'i 'og tu mi skyo ba'i skabs te /
translated: After steadfastness, the section on indefatigability.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar brtan pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dag la skyo bar mi 'gyur bas mi skyo ba brjod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar brtan pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dag la skyo bar mi 'gyur bas mi skyo ba brjod do //
translated: Since the bodhisattva who possesses such steadfastness does not become weary of the bodhisattva activities, indefatigability is mentioned.

original: de dag gis skyo ba skyes na ngo tsha zhing mi skyo bar yang byed do zhes bya ba ni khrel yod pa dang ngo tsha la brten pas ni skyo ba mi skyed do //
analyzed: de dag gis skyo ba skyes na ngo tsha zhing mi skyo bar yang byed do zhes bya ba ni khrel yod pa dang ngo tsha la brten pas ni skyo ba mi skyed do //
translated: When they become weary, they are ashamed and do not become weary. This means that by relying on shame and abashment, one does not generate weariness.

original: byang chub chen po la 'dun pa drag po ni ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba ji ltar ngo bo nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub chen po la 'dun pa drag po ni ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba ji ltar ngo bo nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Intense aspiration for great enlightenment is the essence. How is it the essence?

original: 'dun pa log na skyo bar 'gyur bas so zhes bya bas de ston te /
analyzed: 'dun pa log na skyo bar 'gyur bas so zhes bya bas de ston te /
translated: If aspiration is reversed, one becomes discouraged.

original: 'dir ni brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i 'dun pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir ni brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i 'dun pa gzung ngo //
translated: Here, aspiration is taken as having the nature of effort.

original: mi skyo ba ni brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: mi skyo ba ni brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Non-discouragement is the essence of effort.

original: de nyid kyi phyir @143b brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir @143b brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is said that its action is to support the undertaking of effort.

original: 'dun pa yang mi skyo ba'i rgyu yin pas rgyu las 'bras bu btags nas rgyu ngo bo nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dun pa yang mi skyo ba'i rgyu yin pas rgyu las 'bras bu btags nas rgyu ngo bo nyid du bstan to //
translated: Aspiration is also the cause of non-discouragement. The result is designated as the cause, and the cause is taught as the essence.

original: mi skyo ba'i 'og tu bstan bcos shes pa nyid de //
analyzed: mi skyo ba'i 'og tu bstan bcos shes pa nyid de //
translated: After non-discouragement, there is the knowledge of treatises.

original: mi skyo ba dang ldan pa ni bstan bcos mnyan pa'i phyir rab tu sbyor ro //
analyzed: mi skyo ba dang ldan pa ni bstan bcos mnyan pa'i phyir rab tu sbyor ro //
translated: One who has non-discouragement applies oneself to listening to the treatises.

original: bstan bcos shes pa nyid kyi gzhi ni rig pa'i gnas lnga ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bstan bcos shes pa nyid kyi gzhi ni rig pa'i gnas lnga ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The basis of the knowledge of treatises is the five sciences.

original: gzhi zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhi zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Basis means the object.

original: ched du bya ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi don bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don gyi ched du rig pa'i gnas dag la rab tu sbyor ro //
analyzed: ched du bya ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi don bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don gyi ched du rig pa'i gnas dag la rab tu sbyor ro //
translated: The purpose is to accomplish one's own and others' goals. Thus, the bodhisattvas apply themselves to the sciences for the sake of their own and others' goals.

original: gnyis pa la de'i skyon yongs su shes shing zhes bya ba ni brtsad pa'i skyon yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnyis pa la de'i skyon yongs su shes shing zhes bya ba ni brtsad pa'i skyon yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In the second, one knows its faults, which means one knows the faults of debate.

original: gzhan yid ches par byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan bcos shes pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yid ches par byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan bcos shes pa yin no //
translated: One convinces others, which is the knowledge of treatises.

original: zhes bya bar gzhan dag yid ches par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bar gzhan dag yid ches par byed pa'o //
translated: One convinces others that the treatises are like that.

original: yang na bstan bcos shes par sngar tshig gi mtshams bcad nas /
analyzed: yang na bstan bcos shes par sngar tshig gi mtshams bcad nas /
translated: Or else, the knowledge of treatises is as follows: having previously analyzed the words,

original: de'i 'og tu tshig bsdu ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam pas gzhan dag la don gtan la 'bebs pas yid ches pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tshig bsdu ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam pas gzhan dag la don gtan la 'bebs pas yid ches pa skyed par byed do //
translated: one subsequently summarizes the words. In such ways, one generates conviction in others by means of ascertaining the meaning.

original: des na yid ches par 'gyur na byang chub sems dpa'i dbang du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na yid ches par 'gyur na byang chub sems dpa'i dbang du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if one has confidence in the teaching, one becomes a bodhisattva.

original: thos nas go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni spyir thos pa'o //
analyzed: thos nas go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni spyir thos pa'o //
translated: Having heard, one becomes a bodhisattva in order, that is, in general, one hears the teaching;

original: 'dzin pas ni 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pas ni 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: by retaining it, one becomes one who retains it;

original: kha ton byed pas ni gzhung la zhugs pa'i sgo nas tshig gis byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha ton byed pas ni gzhung la zhugs pa'i sgo nas tshig gis byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: by reciting it, one becomes one who has mastered the text;

original: yid kyis legs par brtags pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu dad pa'i yid kyis don phyir ci ma log par sems pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: yid kyis legs par brtags pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu dad pa'i yid kyis don phyir ci ma log par sems pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: by properly investigating it with the mind, one becomes one who has properly investigated it with the mind, that is, one becomes one who has properly investigated the meaning with a mind of faith.

original: ji ltar don phyin ci ma log par sems dpa'i sgo nas yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar don phyin ci ma log par sems dpa'i sgo nas yin zhe na /
translated: How does one properly investigate the meaning with the mind?

original: ci rigs par de dag gis skyon dang yon tan khong du chud pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: ci rigs par de dag gis skyon dang yon tan khong du chud pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: By understanding the faults and virtues of the teachings, as appropriate.

original: ji ltar mthong bas legs par rtog pa dag yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong bas legs par rtog pa dag yin no zhe na /
translated: How does one become one who properly investigates what one has seen?

original: bshad pa ; legs par bshad pa dang / nyes par bshad pa dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bshad pa ; legs par bshad pa dang / nyes par bshad pa dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: The explanation is: because one observes the well-spoken and the badly spoken.

original: gsung rab kyi lugs kyis legs par bshad pa dag yin no //
analyzed: gsung rab kyi lugs kyis legs par bshad pa dag yin no //
translated: The teachings are well-spoken according to the system of the scriptures.

original: 'di las phyi rol pa rnams kyi ni nyes par bshad pa dag yin no //üîΩyang na zang zing med pa'i sems kyis gzhan dag la rig @144a * //
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa rnams kyi ni nyes par bshad pa dag yin no // yang na zang zing med pa'i sems kyis gzhan dag la rig @144a * //
translated: The opposite of this is the bad explanation of non-Buddhists.

original: pa'i gnas lnga po 'di dag yang dag par rab tu ston pas legs par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i gnas lnga po 'di dag yang dag par rab tu ston pas legs par bshad pa yin no //
translated: Or else, it is good explanation because one teaches these five sciences to others with a disinterested mind.

original: bzlog pa ni nyes par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni nyes par bshad pa yin no //
translated: The opposite is bad explanation.

original: yang na don bzang po sems nyid kyis yon tan du mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na don bzang po sems nyid kyis yon tan du mthong ba yin no //
translated: Or else, it is good explanation because one sees the good meaning as a quality of the mind itself.

original: bzlog pa ni skyon du mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni skyon du mthong ba yin no //
translated: The opposite is seeing it as a fault.

original: tshig 'bru bzang po rtogs pa'i phyir legs par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig 'bru bzang po rtogs pa'i phyir legs par bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is good explanation because the words are understood.

original: tshig 'bru phyin ci log tu gzung ba'i phyir nyes par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig 'bru phyin ci log tu gzung ba'i phyir nyes par bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is bad explanation because the words are misunderstood.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dag nas de'i bya ba bsgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi bya ba bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dag nas de'i bya ba bsgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi bya ba bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is good explanation because it accomplishes the task through the door of concentration.üîΩIt is bad explanation because it does not accomplish the task.

original: rdzu 'phrul dang kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul la sogs pas snod du byas nas /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul la sogs pas snod du byas nas /
translated: It is good explanation because it accomplishes the task of sentient beings, by making them fit vessels through the miracles of psychic power, reading minds, etc.

original: skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du rig pa'i gnas ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du rig pa'i gnas ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it teaches the sciences in accordance with the good fortune of the disciples.

original: dam pa'i chos 'dzin par byed pa yang yin te /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos 'dzin par byed pa yang yin te /
translated: It also holds the true Dharma,

original: gzungs dag gis de 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzungs dag gis theg pa chen po la sogs pa'i rig pa'i gnas rnams bde blag du 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: gzungs dag gis de 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzungs dag gis theg pa chen po la sogs pa'i rig pa'i gnas rnams bde blag du 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: because it holds that by means of the mnemonic powers.

original: bstan bcos shes pa nyid kyi 'og tu 'jig rten shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: bstan bcos shes pa nyid kyi 'og tu 'jig rten shes pa nyid do //
translated: The knowledge of the world follows the knowledge of the scriptures,

original: byang chub sems dpa' bstan bcos dag khong du chud nas bstan bcos thams cad la 'jigs pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bstan bcos dag khong du chud nas bstan bcos thams cad la 'jigs pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: because the bodhisattva, having understood the scriptures, becomes fearless in all the scriptures.

original: bstan bcos shes pa ni 'jig rten shes par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bstan bcos shes pa ni 'jig rten shes par 'gyur la /
translated: The knowledge of the scriptures becomes the knowledge of the world,

original: 'jig rten shes pa yang gang la gang zhig ji ltar bstan par bya ba de shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten shes pa yang gang la gang zhig ji ltar bstan par bya ba de shes pa'i phyir /
translated: and the knowledge of the world is the knowledge of how to teach each person in the world in whatever way is appropriate.

original: de la de kho na bzhin du ston to //üîΩde'i phyir bstan bcos shes pa nyid kyi 'og tu /
analyzed: de la de kho na bzhin du ston to // de'i phyir bstan bcos shes pa nyid kyi 'og tu /
translated: Therefore, one teaches in just that way.

original: 'jig rten shes pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'jig rten shes pa nyid de /
translated: Thus, the knowledge of the world follows the knowledge of the scriptures.

original: bstan bcos shes pa nyid de ni 'jig rten shes pas gsal bar byed do //üîΩgang 'byung ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos shes pa nyid de ni 'jig rten shes pas gsal bar byed do // gang 'byung ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the treatises is illuminated by the knowledge of the world.üîΩThe origination of suffering is the truth of origination.

original: gang dag gis 'byung ba ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'o //üîΩnub pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni /üîΩ'gog pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag gis 'byung ba ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'o // nub pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni / 'gog pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: The origination of suffering is the truth of origination.üîΩThe cessation of suffering is the truth of cessation.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams nub pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams nub pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa yin no //
translated: The cessation of the afflictions is the truth of cessation.

original: gang gis nub par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bden pas so /üîΩ// /'jig rten shes pa nyid kyi 'og tu ston pa rnams te /
analyzed: gang gis nub par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bden pas so / // /'jig rten shes pa nyid kyi 'og tu ston pa rnams te /
translated: The path that leads to the cessation of suffering is the truth of the path.üîΩThe teachers are the buddhas, the blessed ones.

original: de ltar 'jig rten shes pa dang bstan bcos shes pa ni 'jig rten gyi ston par 'gyur ro //üîΩgtsug lag bstan pa'i chos dang ni //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten shes pa dang bstan bcos shes pa ni 'jig rten gyi ston par 'gyur ro // gtsug lag bstan pa'i chos dang ni //
translated: The knowledge of the world and the knowledge of the treatises are the teachers of the world.üîΩThe Dharma that is taught is the Dharma of the scriptures.

original: zhes bya ba ni drang srong gis bshad pa'i @144b chos ni ston pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni drang srong gis bshad pa'i @144b chos ni ston pa yin no //
translated: The Dharma that is taught by the sages is the Dharma of the scriptures.

original: drang srong ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
analyzed: drang srong ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
translated: The sages are the buddhas and bodhisattvas,

original: gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
translated: not others.

original: de dag gis bshad cing bstan pa'i chos ni ston pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag gis bshad cing bstan pa'i chos ni ston pa yin gyi /
translated: The Dharma that they explain and teach is the Teacher,

original: gang zag phyin ci log pas bshad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zag phyin ci log pas bshad pa ma yin no //
translated: not the Dharma that is explained by a person who is mistaken.

original: de'i don dgongs pa can dang ni //
analyzed: de'i don dgongs pa can dang ni //
translated: The meaning of that is interpretable in meaning

original: zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag gi chos dag gi dgongs pa can ni ston pa yin gyi //üîΩpha dang ma ni gsad bya zhing //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag gi chos dag gi dgongs pa can ni ston pa yin gyi // pha dang ma ni gsad bya zhing //
translated: The interpretable meaning of the teachings of the scriptures is the Teacher,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'i tshig 'bru ni ma yin no //üîΩgsum pa la ni log par bsams pa'i don phyin ci log tu drangs pa'o zhes bya ba ni ji skad du kha cig gang zag gcig 'byung ba na 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'i tshig 'bru ni ma yin no // gsum pa la ni log par bsams pa'i don phyin ci log tu drangs pa'o zhes bya ba ni ji skad du kha cig gang zag gcig 'byung ba na 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis na /
translated: not the words, such as ‚Äúone should kill one‚Äôs father and mother,‚ÄùüîΩthat are interpretable in meaning.üîΩThe third is that which is drawn in a way that is contrary to the meaning that is intended,üîΩas when someone says, ‚ÄúWhen one person comes, all people come,‚Äù

original: gang zag yod do zhes zer zhing mngon par zhen pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang zag yod do zhes zer zhing mngon par zhen pa lta bu'o //
translated: and thinks that the word ‚Äúall‚Äù refers to one person.

original: don de lta bu ni brten par mi bya ste /
analyzed: don de lta bu ni brten par mi bya ste /
translated: Such a meaning should not be relied upon,

original: 'di ltar bstan pa de lta bu la sogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo gzhan las rnam par phye ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bstan pa de lta bu la sogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo gzhan las rnam par phye ste /
translated: because the Blessed One has analyzed such teachings in other s≈´tras.

original: mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnams par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs nas /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnams par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs nas /
translated: The Buddha said, The eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms.

original: de'i 'og tu 'di la sems can dang / mi dang gang zag dang shed las skyes dang shed bu zhes ming du 'dogs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de lta bu nges pa'i don la brten par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'di la sems can dang / mi dang gang zag dang shed las skyes dang shed bu zhes ming du 'dogs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de lta bu nges pa'i don la brten par bya'o //
translated: After that, he said, In this regard, sentient beings, humans, individuals, those born of Manu, and sons of Manu are designated by names.

original: brjod pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni brjod pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang ldan pa sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can /
analyzed: brjod pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni brjod pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang ldan pa sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can /
translated: The so-called conceptual consciousness is the conceptual consciousness that possesses apprehended objects and apprehending subjects, having the aspects of blue, yellow, and so on.

original: shes bya sna tshogs kyi rnam pa can /
analyzed: shes bya sna tshogs kyi rnam pa can /
translated: It has the aspects of various objects of knowledge.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa gnag yin pa de ni ston pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa gnag yin pa de ni ston pa yin no //
translated: It is the defiled consciousness that is the teacher.

original: gsum pa ni gzhan las de'i don gyi tshul phyin ci ma log par thos pa las so zhes bya ba ni ston pa tshad mar gyur pa'am /
analyzed: gsum pa ni gzhan las de'i don gyi tshul phyin ci ma log par thos pa las so zhes bya ba ni ston pa tshad mar gyur pa'am /
translated: The third is the unmistaken meaning that is heard from others.

original: des tshad mar mdzad pa nyan thos la sogs pas nges par byas shing rnam par phye ba gang yin pa de las nyams par mi 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des tshad mar mdzad pa nyan thos la sogs pas nges par byas shing rnam par phye ba gang yin pa de las nyams par mi 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The disciples and so on who have ascertained and analyzed what he has declared as valid cognition will not fall away from that.

original: ston pa'i 'og tu so so yang dag par rig pa rnams te /
analyzed: ston pa'i 'og tu so so yang dag par rig pa rnams te /
translated: After the teacher, the correct knowledges.

original: de ltar yang dag par rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang ldan pa ston par 'gyur ba ni chos dang / don dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa thob pas sems can rnams la chos ston par byed de /üîΩde bas na ston pa'i 'og tu so so yang @145a * //
analyzed: de ltar yang dag par rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang ldan pa ston par 'gyur ba ni chos dang / don dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa thob pas sems can rnams la chos ston par byed de / de bas na ston pa'i 'og tu so so yang @145a * //
translated: Thus, endowed with correct discernment, the teacher attains the correct knowledges of the teaching, the meaning, the languages, and ready speech, and he teaches the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: dag par rig pa rnams so //
analyzed: dag par rig pa rnams so //
translated: Therefore, after the teacher, the correct knowledges are mentioned.

original: rnam grangs shes pa de don re re'i ming gi rnam grangs ji snyed pa shes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dper na /
analyzed: rnam grangs shes pa de don re re'i ming gi rnam grangs ji snyed pa shes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dper na /
translated: The knowledge of the categories is the knowledge of the synonyms of each meaning.

original: ma rig pa dang mun nag dang kun tu rmongs pa dang mun pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang mun nag dang kun tu rmongs pa dang mun pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: For example, ignorance, darkness, confusion, and obscurity.

original: mtshan nyid shes pa zhes bya ba ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid shes pa zhes bya ba ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of the characteristics is the knowledge of the general and specific characteristics.

original: gsum pa ni tshig shes pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni tshig shes pa ste /
translated: The third is knowledge of language.

original: yul mi so so'i skad gang dag yin pa de dag la thogs pa med par shes pa ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yul mi so so'i skad gang dag yin pa de dag la thogs pa med par shes pa ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Knowledge of the languages of individual countries is called knowledge of language.

original: bzhi pa ni ye shes zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi spobs pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa'i ye shes shes pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni ye shes zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi spobs pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa'i ye shes shes pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The fourth is knowledge of gnosis, which is the knowledge of the gnosis that is called one's own eloquence.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gang gis na chos ston 'di'i zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas la sogs pa'i chos rab tu rnam par dbye ba la spogs pa zad mi shes pa de lta bu'i spobs pa la dbang ba nyid 'thob po //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gang gis na chos ston 'di'i zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas la sogs pa'i chos rab tu rnam par dbye ba la spogs pa zad mi shes pa de lta bu'i spobs pa la dbang ba nyid 'thob po //
translated: The bodhisattva attains mastery of such eloquence that he can teach the Dharma inexhaustibly, distinguishing the dharmas with and without impurity, compounded and uncompounded, and so forth.

original: de la chos dang don dag ston pa ni chos ston pa dang / bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la chos dang don dag ston pa ni chos ston pa dang / bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The teaching of the Dharma and its meaning is the teaching of the Dharma and its explanation.

original: gang gi tshe chos bstan nas tshig dang don gyi sgo nas 'chad par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos bstan nas tshig dang don gyi sgo nas 'chad par byed pa yin no //
translated: When the Dharma is taught, it is explained by means of words and meaning.üîΩThis shows the verbal derivation of the analytical knowledges.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.

original: 'dis ni so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig bstan no zhes bya ba ni so so rang gis zhes bya ba'i sgras ni so so zhes bya ba bsdus so //
analyzed: 'dis ni so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig bstan no zhes bya ba ni so so rang gis zhes bya ba'i sgras ni so so zhes bya ba bsdus so //
translated: Having known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.

original: mnyam pa nyid de kho na nyid rig nas zhes bya ba ni yang dag par zhes bya ba bsdus so //üîΩrnam grangs la sogs pa rab tu shes pa zhes bya ba ni rig pa zhes bya ba bsdus te /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid de kho na nyid rig nas zhes bya ba ni yang dag par zhes bya ba bsdus so // rnam grangs la sogs pa rab tu shes pa zhes bya ba ni rig pa zhes bya ba bsdus te /
translated: Having known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.

original: 'di ni so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ba'i nges pa'i tshig yin no /
analyzed: 'di ni so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ba'i nges pa'i tshig yin no /
translated: Having known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.

original: // / so so yang dag par rig pa'i 'og tu tshogs kyi skabs te /
analyzed: // / so so yang dag par rig pa'i 'og tu tshogs kyi skabs te /
translated: Having known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.üîΩHaving known reality as it is, he teaches the Dharma to others.

original: de ltar so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas tshogs kyi skabs yin no //üîΩkun nas nyon mongs pa med par 'khor bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi tshogs kyi stobs kyis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med par 'khor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas tshogs kyi skabs yin no // kun nas nyon mongs pa med par 'khor bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi tshogs kyi stobs kyis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med par 'khor bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the accumulations of merit and knowledge are completed by attaining the analytical knowledges.üîΩHe cycles in the life-cycle without defilement.üîΩBy the power of the accumulation of knowledge, he cycles in the life-cycle without defilement, because he deliberately takes up birth in existence for the sake of sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi don du ched du bsams bzhin du srid par @145b skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i nyes pa dag gis mi gos shing las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang du 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi don du ched du bsams bzhin du srid par @145b skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i nyes pa dag gis mi gos shing las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang du 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He is not defiled by the faults of the life-cycle and does not come under the control of karma and the afflictions.

original: bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis ni gnyi ga byed do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis ni gnyi ga byed do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By the power of patience, effort, and concentration, he does both.

original: gnod pa byed pa dang du len pa dang / sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dag ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa dang du len pa dang / sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dag ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis bsdus so //
translated: The patience of accepting suffering and the patience of not retaliating against harm are included in the accumulation of merit.

original: chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs kyis bsdus so //
translated: Patience that is the definite understanding of the Dharma is included in the accumulation of wisdom.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bsam tan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag dang / sems can la phan pa byed pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi bsdus so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bsam tan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag dang / sems can la phan pa byed pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi bsdus so //
translated: The mundane perfections, the formless meditative stabilizations, and the benefitting of sentient beings are included in the accumulation of merit.

original: ting nge 'dzin gang zhig la brten nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bsgrub par byed pa de ni ye shes kyi tshogs kyis bsdus te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang zhig la brten nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bsgrub par byed pa de ni ye shes kyi tshogs kyis bsdus te /
translated: The meditative stabilization on which nonconceptual wisdom is based is included in the accumulation of wisdom.

original: brtson 'grus kang de dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kang de dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that effort is also like that.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa lnga car yang ye shes kyi tshogs yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa lnga car yang ye shes kyi tshogs yin par 'dod de /
translated: The five perfections beginning with generosity are asserted to be the accumulation of wisdom,

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because generosity and so forth are dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: tshogs kyi nges pa'i tshig la rgyun du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshogs kyi nges pa'i tshig la rgyun du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The verbal root of ‚Äúaccumulation‚Äù is ‚Äúto flow.‚Äù

original: sam zhes bya ba 'di bsdus so //
analyzed: sam zhes bya ba 'di bsdus so //
translated: The word ‚Äúsam‚Äù is included in this.

original: bsgom pa thos nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsgom pa thos nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having heard the meditation,

original: bh'a zhes bya ba 'dis bsdus te /
analyzed: bh'a zhes bya ba 'dis bsdus te /
translated: the word ‚ÄúbhƒÅ‚Äù is included in this.

original: de lta bu'i tshogs kyi nges pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshogs kyi nges pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is the definition of the collection.

original: sa drug po dag gi ni mtshan ma med pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med pa'i don du yin pas /
analyzed: sa drug po dag gi ni mtshan ma med pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med pa'i don du yin pas /
translated: The sixth stage is called ‚Äúfree of characteristics,‚Äù because it is for the purpose of being free of characteristics,

original: mtshan ma med par bya zhing sa bdun pa la 'jug pa'i phyir yin te /
analyzed: mtshan ma med par bya zhing sa bdun pa la 'jug pa'i phyir yin te /
translated: in order to enter the seventh stage.

original: de mtshan ma kun tu mi spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mtshan ma kun tu mi spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not engage in characteristics.

original: gnyen pos ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gnyen pos ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it the antidote?

original: lus la sogs pa'i chos la bdag med par 'jug pa'i sgo nas phyin ci log bzhi'i gnyen po mi gtsang ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes rnams kyi yang gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'di skad du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i chos la bdag med par 'jug pa'i sgo nas phyin ci log bzhi'i gnyen po mi gtsang ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes rnams kyi yang gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'di skad du bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is the antidote to the four errors, because it is the entry into the selflessness of phenomena such as the body, and it is the antidote to the notions of purity, happiness, permanence, and self. This is what is explained in this way.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi gtsang ba la sogs par phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por gyur pa mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang dag yi pa de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi gtsang ba la sogs par phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por gyur pa mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang dag yi pa de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa yin te /
translated: The aspects of impurity, etc. are the antidote to the error of purity, etc. with regard to the disciples' body, etc. But for the bodhisattvas, they are adverse elements.

original: @146a * // 'di ltar lus la sogs pa ni byis pas kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid du med do //
analyzed: @146a * // 'di ltar lus la sogs pa ni byis pas kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid du med do //
translated: Thus, the body, etc. do not exist as the self imagined by the foolish.

original: de med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir /
translated: And because that does not exist,

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa yang gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i dngos por ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa yang gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i dngos por ma grub pa ste /
translated: the aspects of impermanence, etc. are not established as entities of grasped and grasper.

original: de bas na mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i yang gnyen po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i yang gnyen po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because they are also the antidote to the aspects of impermanence, etc.,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag ni /
translated: the bodhisattvas' applications of mindfulness

original: nyan thos rnams dang thun mong ma yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams dang thun mong ma yin zhes bya'o //
translated: are said to be not in common with the disciples.

original: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las ji skad bshad pa lta bu yin no zhes bya ba ni lus kyi ni gnas ngan len rab tu ston te /
analyzed: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las ji skad bshad pa lta bu yin no zhes bya ba ni lus kyi ni gnas ngan len rab tu ston te /
translated: as it is explained in the MadhyƒÅntavibhƒÅga.

original: de la rab tu brtags pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: de la rab tu brtags pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug go //
translated: By investigating it, one enters into the truth of suffering.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni gnas ngan len dang bcas pa'i 'du byed yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni gnas ngan len dang bcas pa'i 'du byed yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its characteristic is that it is a formation that is accompanied by negative reflex.

original: gnas ngan len ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid de /üîΩdes zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad 'phags pas /
analyzed: gnas ngan len ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid de / des zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad 'phags pas /
translated: The negative reflex is the suffering of the formative forces.

original: sdug bsngal du gzigs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal du gzigs so //
translated: Because of it, the ƒÅryas see all things that are subject to defilement as suffering.

original: sred pa'i rgyu ni tshor ba ste /
analyzed: sred pa'i rgyu ni tshor ba ste /
translated: The cause of craving is feeling.

original: de yongs su brtags pas kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: de yongs su brtags pas kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la 'jug go //
translated: By investigating that, one enters into the truth of the origin of suffering.

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi ni sems te /
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi ni sems te /
translated: The basis of the manifest clinging to a self is mind.

original: de la yongs su brtags pas 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: de la yongs su brtags pas 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'jug ste /
translated: By investigating that, one enters into the truth of cessation,

original: bdag chad par dogs pa'i 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag chad par dogs pa'i 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no fear of the annihilation of the self.

original: chos la yongs su brtags pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos la rmongs pa'i phyir lam gyi bden pa la 'jug go zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos la yongs su brtags pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos la rmongs pa'i phyir lam gyi bden pa la 'jug go zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: One enters the truth of the path by thoroughly investigating the Dharma, because one is confused about the dharmas of affliction and purification.

original: sems can thams cad kyi lus la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi lus la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has as its objective support the bodies, etc. of all sentient beings.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag gis sems can thams cad kyi lus la sogs pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa la sbyar bar bya'o snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag gis sems can thams cad kyi lus la sogs pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa la sbyar bar bya'o snyam pa yin no //
translated: One should apply oneself to the meditation on the applications of mindfulness of body, etc. of all sentient beings.

original: yid la byed pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yid la byed pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it through mental attention?

original: lus la sogs par mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' ni ji ltar byis pa rnams kyis lus la sogs pa la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid du dmigs pa de ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa yid la mi
analyzed: lus la sogs par mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' ni ji ltar byis pa rnams kyis lus la sogs pa la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid du dmigs pa de ltar dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa yid la mi
translated: Because one does not apprehend a body, etc. The bodhisattva does not mentally attend to the meditation on the applications of mindfulness in the same way that fools apprehend a body, etc. as subject and object.

original: byed kyi / 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: byed kyi / 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: But how then?

original: chos la bdag med par yid la byed do //
analyzed: chos la bdag med par yid la byed do //
translated: He mentally attends to the selflessness of dharmas.

original: thob pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: thob pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it through attainment?

original: lus la sogs pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin /
translated: Nor is it for the sake of being separated from the body, etc.,üîΩnor is it for the sake of not being separated from them.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúnor is it for the sake of being separated from the body, etc.‚Äù

original: mi bral @146b bar bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku dang ni bral bar bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin la kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi lus la sogs pa dag ni mi bral bar bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin
analyzed: mi bral @146b bar bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku dang ni bral bar bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin la kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi lus la sogs pa dag ni mi bral bar bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin
translated: means that it is not for the sake of being separated from the Dharma Body, nor is it for the sake of not being separated from the afflicted body, etc.

original: pa'o // mthun pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: pa'o // mthun pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it in accord?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang mthun pas /üîΩde'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' lus la sogs pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pas lus 'di ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa yin no snyam nas nang dang phyi'i dngos po la
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang mthun pas / de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' lus la sogs pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pas lus 'di ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa yin no snyam nas nang dang phyi'i dngos po la
translated: It is in accord with the perfections.

original: lhag par ma zhen pas nang dang phyi'i dngos po thams cad yongs su btang ngo ;
analyzed: lhag par ma zhen pas nang dang phyi'i dngos po thams cad yongs su btang ngo ;
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it is the antidote to their discordant class‚Äù means that, by cultivating the applications of mindfulness of the body, etc., the bodhisattva thinks, ‚ÄúThis body is impermanent, etc.‚Äù, and, by not clinging to internal and external things, he gives up all internal and external things.

original: / de bzhin du srog gi phyir yang srog gcod pa la sogs pa la mi 'jug go //
analyzed: / de bzhin du srog gi phyir yang srog gcod pa la sogs pa la mi 'jug go //
translated: Likewise, he does not engage in killing, etc. even for the sake of his life.

original: gshe ba dang spyo ba dang dbyug pa dang mtshon gyis bsnun pa la sogs pa thams cad kyang bzod do //
analyzed: gshe ba dang spyo ba dang dbyug pa dang mtshon gyis bsnun pa la sogs pa thams cad kyang bzod do //
translated: He also endures all abuse, ridicule, beating, and killing.

original: le lo spangs pas sems can de dang de dag gi grogs kyi ngo bor yang 'gro'o //
analyzed: le lo spangs pas sems can de dang de dag gi grogs kyi ngo bor yang 'gro'o //
translated: By abandoning laziness, he also becomes a friend to those sentient beings.

original: lus la sogs pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas rnam par g-yeng ba dang 'chal ba'i shes rab kyang rab tu spong ste /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgoms pas rnam par g-yeng ba dang 'chal ba'i shes rab kyang rab tu spong ste /
translated: By cultivating the mindfulness of body, etc. he also abandons distraction and the immorality of wisdom.

original: de ltar na de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa dang mthun par dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa dang mthun par dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the cultivation of the applications of mindfulness is in harmony with the transcendences, because they are the antidotes to their resistances.

original: de dag la de bstan pa'i phyir de dang ldan pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' ni /
analyzed: de dag la de bstan pa'i phyir de dang ldan pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' ni /
translated: In order to show that, he says, because they are the cultivation of the applications of mindfulness endowed with those.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir mdo sde la sogs pa las 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos rnams kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa bshad pa gang yin pa de la mkhas par byed do //
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir mdo sde la sogs pa las 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos rnams kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa bshad pa gang yin pa de la mkhas par byed do //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he becomes skilled in the meditative development of the applications of mindfulness that are taught in the s≈´tras etc. for the world and for the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: de kho na bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i ngo bor snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sgyu ma la sgyu ma byas pa'i glang po che la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin pa lngar lus kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i ngo bor snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sgyu ma la sgyu ma byas pa'i glang po che la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin pa lngar lus kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Because of the appearance of an unreal nature just like that. Just as the illusory elephant etc. that is created by the magician is unreal, so too is the body.

original: sems ni nam mkha' bzhin du rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yongs su shes pas so zhes bya ba la sems zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sems kyi chos nyid bzung ste /
analyzed: sems ni nam mkha' bzhin du rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yongs su shes pas so zhes bya ba la sems zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sems kyi chos nyid bzung ste /
translated: The mind is understood to be naturally luminous like space. The word ‚Äòmind‚Äô here refers to the reality of the mind.

original: de ni nam mkha' bzhin du gcig tu 'od gsal bas so //
analyzed: de ni nam mkha' bzhin du gcig tu 'od gsal bas so //
translated: It is like space because it is exclusively luminous.

original: chos rnams ni glo bur nyid du yongs su shes pas so zhes bya ba ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pas bsdus pa'i chos kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba gang dag yin @147a * //
analyzed: chos rnams ni glo bur nyid du yongs su shes pas so zhes bya ba ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pas bsdus pa'i chos kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba gang dag yin @147a * //
translated: Because phenomena are fully understood as adventitious.

original: pa de dag ni kun brtags pa ste /
analyzed: pa de dag ni kun brtags pa ste /
translated: Those phenomena that are defiled or purified are imaginary,

original: dper na nam mkha' la glo bur gyi rdul dang du ba dang sprin dang khug rna lta bu yin no //üîΩ'dres pa nye bar 'dres pa bsgom pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la glo bur gyi rdul dang du ba dang sprin dang khug rna lta bu yin no // 'dres pa nye bar 'dres pa bsgom pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: like adventitious particles, smoke, clouds, and fog in the sky.üîΩBecause of the cultivation of the thoroughly intermixed.

original: sa bcu pa dang sangs rgyas kyis la ni ma lus par yang dag par 'grub pa nyid kyis yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa bcu pa dang sangs rgyas kyis la ni ma lus par yang dag par 'grub pa nyid kyis yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: On the eighth stage and so forth, they are fully accomplished by the complete accomplishment of all.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i 'og tu yang dag par spong ba bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i 'og tu yang dag par spong ba bsgom pa ste /
translated: After the applications of mindfulness, the cultivation of the right efforts.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa ji snyed bshad pa de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyes pa rnams kyi gnyen por yang dag par spong ba bsgom mo zhes bya ba ni rten la sogs pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa bshad pa laüîΩtheg pa chen po thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab la brten nas bsgom pa bshad pa shes rab de gsum tshar gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi mnyan pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de'i gnyen por yang dag par spong ba
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa ji snyed bshad pa de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyes pa rnams kyi gnyen por yang dag par spong ba bsgom mo zhes bya ba ni rten la sogs pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa bshad pa la theg pa chen po thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab la brten nas bsgom pa bshad pa shes rab de gsum tshar gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi mnyan pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de'i gnyen por yang dag par spong ba

original: bsgom ste / de bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs lhag ma rnams kyi gnyen por yang dag pa spong ba bsgom pa yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom ste / de bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs lhag ma rnams kyi gnyen por yang dag pa spong ba bsgom pa yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The cultivation of the four perfect endeavors is explained as the antidote to the discordant class of those faults that are the discordant classes of the aforementioned meditations on the four establishments of mindfulness.üîΩThe cultivation of the four perfect endeavors is explained as the antidote to the discordant class of those faults that are the discordant

original: 'khor ba'i phun sum tshogs pa rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa med par yongs su longs spyad pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par spong ba bsgoms pas 'khor ba'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad la kun nas nyon mongs pa med par yongsüîΩsu spyod do //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i phun sum tshogs pa rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa med par yongs su longs spyad pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par spong ba bsgoms pas 'khor ba'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad la kun nas nyon mongs pa med par yongs su spyod do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe enjoys the abundance of cyclic existence without being defiled by it‚Äù means that, by cultivating the four right efforts, the bodhisattva enjoys the abundance of cyclic existence without being defiled by the afflictions.

original: 'dun pa la brten nas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bya ba'i rnal 'byor bsgom zhing 'bad do zhes bya ba ni yang dag par spong ba bsgom pa yang brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'dun pa la brten nas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bya ba'i rnal 'byor bsgom zhing 'bad do zhes bya ba ni yang dag par spong ba bsgom pa yang brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe cultivates the yoga of serenity and insight based on aspiration‚Äù means that he strives to cultivate the yoga of serenity and insight.

original: 'bad pa dang brtson 'grus rtsom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'bad pa dang brtson 'grus rtsom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo nyid yin na /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe strives with vigor‚Äù and so on also means that he strives with vigor.

original: de ji ltar 'bad do zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar 'bad do zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How can he strive?

original: de bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de bstan par bya ste /
translated: This will be explained.

original: re zhig dang po kho nar rnal 'byor pa byed 'dod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: re zhig dang po kho nar rnal 'byor pa byed 'dod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: First of all, the practitioner must have the desire to act.

original: de la brten nas 'di nyon mongs pa dag dang lhan cig 'gyed par bya ba'i phyir zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bya ba bsgom pa la rab tu brtson pa 'bad par byed do //
analyzed: de la brten nas 'di nyon mongs pa dag dang lhan cig 'gyed par bya ba'i phyir zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhes bya ba bsgom pa la rab tu brtson pa 'bad par byed do //
translated: In dependence on that, in order to fight with the afflictions, he strives, he makes effort, to cultivate ≈õamatha and special insight.

original: 'bad par byed pa de la nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams bar chad byed de /
analyzed: 'bad par byed pa de la nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams bar chad byed de /
translated: When he makes effort, the enemies, the afflictions, create obstacles for him.

original: zhi @147b gnas kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni zhum pa'o //
analyzed: zhi @147b gnas kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni zhum pa'o //
translated: The discordances with ≈õamatha are laxity and

original: lhag mthong gi ni rgod pa'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi ni rgod pa'o //
translated: the discordances with special insight are excitement.

original: de dag bsal ba'i phyir rnal 'byor pa 'di brtson 'grus rtsom pas 'bad pas brtson 'grus kyi gnas skabs ches khyad par du 'phags so //
analyzed: de dag bsal ba'i phyir rnal 'byor pa 'di brtson 'grus rtsom pas 'bad pas brtson 'grus kyi gnas skabs ches khyad par du 'phags so //
translated: In order to eliminate those, the yogiÃÑ, through the exertion of striving, makes effort. Therefore, the stage of striving is very special.

original: brtson 'grus bsgom pa des sems de zhum pa yang rab tu 'dzin la rgod pa yang yang dag par rab tu 'jog ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus bsgom pa des sems de zhum pa yang rab tu 'dzin la rgod pa yang yang dag par rab tu 'jog ste /
translated: Through the cultivation of striving, he holds the mind that is lax and he properly settles the mind that is excited.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhum pa dang rgod pa dag gi gnyen por brtson 'grus rtsom mo zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhum pa dang rgod pa dag gi gnyen por brtson 'grus rtsom mo zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that he strives with striving as the antidote to laxity and excitement.

original: gang gi tshe sems de la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa la mnyam pa thob par gyur ba de'i tshe ni btang snyoms su 'jog ste rab tu 'dzin par yang mi byed /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems de la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa la mnyam pa thob par gyur ba de'i tshe ni btang snyoms su 'jog ste rab tu 'dzin par yang mi byed /
translated: When one has attained evenness in cultivating serenity and insight in the mind, one rests in equanimity and does not apply intense concentration.

original: rab tu 'jog par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: rab tu 'jog par yang mi byed do //
translated: When one has attained equipoise in cultivating serenity and insight with regard to that mind, then one should rest in equanimity, neither applying oneself nor placing oneself.

original: yang dag par spong ba'i rab tu dbye ba ji skad bshad pa thams cad la gnyen po zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni /üîΩ'dun pa la ni brten nas su //üîΩrnal 'byor rgyu mtshan bcas bsgom pa //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba'i rab tu dbye ba ji skad bshad pa thams cad la gnyen po zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni / 'dun pa la ni brten nas su // rnal 'byor rgyu mtshan bcas bsgom pa //
translated: All the divisions of the correct exertions explained above are called antidotes.

original: zhes bshad ma thag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad ma thag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The immediately preceding text states:üîΩThe yogi/nƒ´ meditates with signs and signlessüîΩin dependence on will.üîΩIf one has faith and strives, one makes effort.

original: dad cing don du gnyer na 'bad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dad na byed 'dod pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dad cing don du gnyer na 'bad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dad na byed 'dod pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If one has faith, one comes to desire to do it.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dad pa ni 'dun pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dad pa ni 'dun pa'i rten byed pa'i las can no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is said that faith has the function of creating the basis for will.

original: byed 'dod na brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
analyzed: byed 'dod na brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
translated: If one desires to do it, one initiates effort.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'dun pa yang brtson 'grus kyi rten byed pa'i las can du bstan to //üîΩgcig gis ni sems dmigs pa las mi 'phro bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de dran pas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'dun pa yang brtson 'grus kyi rten byed pa'i las can du bstan to // gcig gis ni sems dmigs pa las mi 'phro bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de dran pas so //
translated: The first line shows the characteristic of heat.üîΩThe second shows the characteristic of summit.üîΩThe third shows the characteristic of patience.üîΩThe fourth shows the characteristic of the supreme mundane state.üîΩThe aids to penetration are fourfold: heat, summit, patience, and the supreme mundane state.

original: gnyis pas 'phro bar rab tu shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: gnyis pas 'phro bar rab tu shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes bzhin gyis so //
translated: The aids to penetration are called ‚Äúaids‚Äù because they are the aids to the path of insight.üîΩThey are called ‚Äúheat‚Äù and so on because they are similar to heat, and so on.üîΩHeat is the first aid to be attained, and it is like fire because it is a sign of the imminent burning of the fuel of the addictions by the fire of insight.üîΩSummit is so called because it is the highest point of the mundane.üîΩPatience is so called because it is the first attainment of the acceptance of the noncreation of things.

original: shes bzhin shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid kyi chos te gang gi tshe sems de dmigs pa las gud du 'phro ba de'i tshe shes bzhin gyis myur ba kho nar bdag gi sems rnam par g-yengs so zhes bya bar yongs su gcod do //
analyzed: shes bzhin shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid kyi chos te gang gi tshe sems de dmigs pa las gud du 'phro ba de'i tshe shes bzhin gyis myur ba kho nar bdag gi sems rnam par g-yengs so zhes bya bar yongs su gcod do //
translated: The supreme mundane state is so called because it is the highest of the mundane.üîΩThe aids to penetration are fourfold: heat, summit, patience, and the supreme mundane state.üîΩThe aids to penetration are called ‚Äúaids‚Äù because they are the aids to the path of insight.üîΩThey are called ‚Äúheat‚Äù and so on because they are similar to heat, and so on.

original: sems dang btang snyoms ni gnyen po'i thabs zhes bya ba ni shes bzhin gyis ni sems de rnam par g-yeng bas so zhes bya ba de tsam zhig shes pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: sems dang btang snyoms ni gnyen po'i thabs zhes bya ba ni shes bzhin gyis ni sems de rnam par g-yeng bas so zhes bya ba de tsam zhig shes pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: Heat is the first aid to be attained, and it is like fire because it is a sign of the imminent burning of the fuel of the addictions by the fire of insight.

original: sems pa ni sems kyi byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sems pa ni sems kyi byed pa yin te /
translated: Summit is so called because it is the highest point of the mundane.üîΩPatience is so called because it is the first attainment of the acceptance of the noncreation of things.üîΩThe supreme mundane state is so called because it is the highest of the mundane.

original: des sems de dge ba la gtod par byed do //
analyzed: des sems de dge ba la gtod par byed do //
translated: It causes the mind to be directed to virtue.

original: gang gi phyir sems pas zhum pa ni rab tu 'dzin la rgod pa ni rab tu 'jog pa de'i phyir sems la gnyen po zhes bya'o//
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems pas zhum pa ni rab tu 'dzin la rgod pa ni rab tu 'jog pa de'i phyir sems la gnyen po zhes bya'o//
translated: Since it holds the mind when it is slack and it releases it when it is excited, it is called the antidote for the mind.

original: @148a * // btang snyoms ni shes rab kyi khyad par te des nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams rab tu spong bas de'i phyir btang snyoms la gnyen po zhes bya'o //üîΩsha'i spyan zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bsgoms pas byang chub sems dpa' gang gis na stong gsum la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i gzugs kyi dbye ba shin tu phra ba yang mthong ba de lta bu'i rnam par smin pa la
analyzed: @148a * // btang snyoms ni shes rab kyi khyad par te des nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams rab tu spong bas de'i phyir btang snyoms la gnyen po zhes bya'o // sha'i spyan zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bsgoms pas byang chub sems dpa' gang gis na stong gsum la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i gzugs kyi dbye ba shin tu phra ba yang mthong ba de lta bu'i rnam par smin pa la
translated: Equanimity is a special kind of wisdom, since it eliminates the secondary afflictions. Therefore, equanimity is called the antidote.

original: byung ba'i mig mngon par 'grub te /
analyzed: byung ba'i mig mngon par 'grub te /
translated: The fleshly eye is the eye that is born from the cultivation of the bases of supernatural power. It is the eye that is born from the maturation of that cultivation, by which a bodhisattva sees the most subtle forms included in the world systems of a billion universes and so forth.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ji skad 'byung ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ji skad 'byung ba lta bu yin no //
translated: It is just as it is described in the noble Perfection of Wisdom.

original: lha'i spyan ni bsam gtan gyis mngon par 'dus byas pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i spyan ni bsam gtan gyis mngon par 'dus byas pa ste /
translated: The divine eye is formed by the supernormal knowledge arisen from concentration.

original: sha'i spyan pas ches khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
analyzed: sha'i spyan pas ches khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
translated: It is superior to the fleshly eye.

original: shes rab kyi spyan 'phags pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi spyan 'phags pa ni /
translated: The noble eye of wisdom

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de bzhin nyid spyod yul pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de bzhin nyid spyod yul pa yin no //
translated: is the nonconceptual intuition that has thusness for its object-field.

original: chos kyi spyan ni mdo'i sde dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde la sogs pa'i chos thams cad du thogs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi spyan ni mdo'i sde dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde la sogs pa'i chos thams cad du thogs pa med pa yin no //
translated: The Dharma eye is the nonobstruction in regard to all the Dharmas, such as the Sutras, the Geys and so on.

original: gnas pas rnam par brtse ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam par brtse ba ste /
analyzed: gnas pas rnam par brtse ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam par brtse ba ste /
translated: The samadhi called ‚Äúthe radiance of the Dharma‚Äù is the radiance of the Dharma, because it illuminates the Dharma.üîΩThe samadhi called ‚Äúthe radiance of the Dharma‚Äù is the radiance of the Dharma, because it illuminates the Dharma.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni gnas pa'i sgra brjod do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni gnas pa'i sgra brjod do //
translated: The object of the samadhi faculty is calm abiding.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'i dmigs pa ni zhi gnas yin no zhes bya ba ni gang la brten na byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan thams cad phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba zhi gnas khyad par can bzung ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'i dmigs pa ni zhi gnas yin no zhes bya ba ni gang la brten na byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan thams cad phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba zhi gnas khyad par can bzung ste /
translated: The calm abiding that is taken up is the special calm abiding in dependence on which all the bodhisattva qualities are perfected.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni 'jig rten pa'i sems rtse gcig pa tsam thob pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni 'jig rten pa'i sems rtse gcig pa tsam thob pa'o //
translated: Concentration is the mere attainment of mundane one-pointedness of mind.

original: shes rab kyi dbang po'i gzhi ni lhag mthong ngo //üîΩzhes bya ba ni 'dir yang mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs sam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang po'i gzhi ni lhag mthong ngo // zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs sam /
translated: The basis of the faculty of wisdom is insight.

original: 'jig rten pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs kyi shes rab kyi dbang po yin par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs kyi shes rab kyi dbang po yin par gzhag go //
translated: Here, the faculty of wisdom is posited as either the non-concentrated state or the mundane concentrated state.

original: lhag mthong ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: lhag mthong ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Insight is non-conceptual wisdom.

original: de bas na shes rab kyi dbang po de'i dmigs pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes yin no //
analyzed: de bas na shes rab kyi dbang po de'i dmigs pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object of the faculty of wisdom is non-conceptual wisdom.

original: de dag gi don gyi skabs kho nas dad pa la sogs pa 'di dag dbang byed pa'i don gyis dbang po rnams zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dmigs pa byang chub la sogs pa'i don gang dag yin pa de dag la de rnamsüîΩdbang byed do //
analyzed: de dag gi don gyi skabs kho nas dad pa la sogs pa 'di dag dbang byed pa'i don gyis dbang po rnams zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dmigs pa byang chub la sogs pa'i don gang dag yin pa de dag la de rnamsüîΩdbang byed do //
translated: By the very context of their meaning, these faculties of faith and so on are called faculties in the sense of dominating, because they dominate their objects, such as enlightenment, which are the objects of faith and so on.

original: sa la zhugs pa'i gnas skabs ni go rims bzhin du chos la bdag med pa dang @148b bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid kyis chos thams cad dang / sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos la bdag med pas ni chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: sa la zhugs pa'i gnas skabs ni go rims bzhin du chos la bdag med pa dang @148b bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid kyis chos thams cad dang / sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos la bdag med pas ni chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs so //
translated: The selflessness of phenomena is the realization of the equality of all phenomena.

original: gang zag la bdag med pas ni sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pas ni sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs so //
translated: The selflessness of persons is the realization of the equality of all sentient beings.

original: yang na byang chub sems dpas sa dang po thob pa'i dus na chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba rtogs pas sems can thams cad bdag tu mnyam pa nyid 'thob ste /
analyzed: yang na byang chub sems dpas sa dang po thob pa'i dus na chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba rtogs pas sems can thams cad bdag tu mnyam pa nyid 'thob ste /
translated: Or, when bodhisattvas obtain the first ground, they obtain the equality of self and all sentient beings through realizing the omnipresence of the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: sa dang po thob pa'i dus na bdag gang yin pa de nyid sems can rnams yin pas ji ltar bdag gis bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal nye bar zhi bar bya ba de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang po thob pa'i dus na bdag gang yin pa de nyid sems can rnams yin pas ji ltar bdag gis bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal nye bar zhi bar bya ba de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi bya'o //
translated: At the time of obtaining the first ground, they are the same as sentient beings, and just as they pacify their own suffering, so they do so for all sentient beings.

original: zhes sems can thams cad dang khyad par med pa nyid 'thob pas bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid kyis sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid rtogs so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes sems can thams cad dang khyad par med pa nyid 'thob pas bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid kyis sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid rtogs so zhes bya'o //
translated: Since he attains the state of being no different from all sentient beings, he realizes the sameness of all sentient beings through the sameness of self and others.üîΩIn order to conquer the unconquered knowable

original: shes bya ma rgyal rgyal bya'i phyir //
analyzed: shes bya ma rgyal rgyal bya'i phyir //
translated: In order to conquer the unconquered knowable,üîΩ

original: zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa ni sa dang po ma rgyal ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa ni sa dang po ma rgyal ba yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is in the stage of action in faith has not conquered the first stage.

original: de rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir dran pa kun tu spyod de /
analyzed: de rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir dran pa kun tu spyod de /
translated: In order to conquer it, he practices mindfulness.

original: ma rtogs pa rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni shes bya ma rgyal ba rgyal ba yin no //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni shes bya ma rgyal ba rgyal ba yin no //
translated: The conquest of the unconquered knowable is the realization of the unrealized.

original: 'di yi rnam 'byed rtog pa yi //
analyzed: 'di yi rnam 'byed rtog pa yi //
translated: The discrimination of this

original: mtshan ma thams cad 'joms par byed //
analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad 'joms par byed //
translated: destroys all signs of conceptual thought.

original: ces bya ba ni chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni gang zag dang chos su 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams 'joms par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni gang zag dang chos su 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams 'joms par byed pa yin no //
translated: The member of enlightenment that is the discrimination of dharmas destroys the conceptual thoughts that grasp person and dharmas.

original: de'i rjes la thob pa'i gnas pas gzhan dag 'bul zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyis ma rtogs pa gang yin pa de 'bul ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i rjes la thob pa'i gnas pas gzhan dag 'bul zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyis ma rtogs pa gang yin pa de 'bul ba yin no //
