translated: The non-realization that is by the subsequently-attained gnosis of the non-conceptual is the offering.

original: gzhan 'dor ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa gang yin pa de 'dor ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan 'dor ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa gang yin pa de 'dor ba yin no //
translated: The abandonment of others is the abandonment of the realization.üîΩBecause of the non-conceptual state, one abides effortlessly in that.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas pas de la rtsol ba med par gnas par byed pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi btang snyoms shes bya thams cad la phyin ci ma log pa des rgyal ba gang yin pa de la
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas pas de la rtsol ba med par gnas par byed pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi btang snyoms shes bya thams cad la phyin ci ma log pa des rgyal ba gang yin pa de la
translated: The victor who is by the equanimity of the non-conceptual gnosis, which is the non-erroneous with respect to all objects of knowledge,

original: gnas par byed do //
analyzed: gnas par byed do //
translated: abides in that.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang btang snyoms ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang btang snyoms ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The limbs of non-affliction are pliancy, samadhi, and equanimity.

original: gang @149a * //
analyzed: gang @149a * //
translated: By what is there non-affliction?

original: gis kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa ni shin tu sbyangs pas gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gis kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa ni shin tu sbyangs pas gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By pliancy, because of being free from the negative tendencies.

original: gang la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs med par byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin la brten nas rnam par g-yeng ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //üîΩkun nas nyon mongs pa med pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni btang snyoms so //
analyzed: gang la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs med par byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin la brten nas rnam par g-yeng ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro // kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni btang snyoms so //
translated: Correct conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.

original: rtog pa de nyid kyi rnam par gzhag pa yongs su gcod pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa'o zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i rtog pas ni bdag gi rnam pa 'dis kho na nyid 'di lta bu zhig rtogs so zhes de kho na nyid rtogs pa gangüîΩyin pa ste /üîΩrnam par 'jog par byed cing de kho na bzhin du gzhung du yang byed la gzhan du ga la yang ston to //
analyzed: rtog pa de nyid kyi rnam par gzhag pa yongs su gcod pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa'o zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i rtog pas ni bdag gi rnam pa 'dis kho na nyid 'di lta bu zhig rtogs so zhes de kho na nyid rtogs pa gang yin pa ste / rnam par 'jog par byed cing de kho na bzhin du gzhung du yang byed la gzhan du ga la yang ston to //
translated: Correct conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.

original: de rnam par gzhag pa mdo'i sde la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la 'jug pa yang de nyid yin te /
analyzed: de rnam par gzhag pa mdo'i sde la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la 'jug pa yang de nyid yin te /
translated: Correct conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.

original: des de'i don rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des de'i don rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Correct conceptualization is the determination of the establishment of that conceptualization.üîΩCorrect conceptualization

original: de rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa rnam par bzhag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩmdo'i sde la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa rnam par bzhag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // mdo'i sde la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúits presentation‚Äù means ‚Äúits understanding.‚Äù

original: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the scriptures spoken by the Lord‚Äù refers to the scriptures of the twelve branches of texts that were spoken by the Lord.

original: 'jug pa yang de nyid yin te zhes bya ba ni bdag ji ltar zhugs pa ltar ro ;
analyzed: 'jug pa yang de nyid yin te zhes bya ba ni bdag ji ltar zhugs pa ltar ro ;
translated: The phrase ‚Äúits engagement‚Äù means ‚Äúits understanding.‚Äù

original: / des de'i don rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi yang dag par rtog pa des de'i don te gsung rab kyi don rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: / des de'i don rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi yang dag par rtog pa des de'i don te gsung rab kyi don rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause one understands its meaning through that‚Äù means that one understands the meaning of the scriptures through that correct understanding that is preceded by understanding.

original: gsung rab la mngon sum pa'i blo dang don phyin ci ma log par mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: gsung rab la mngon sum pa'i blo dang don phyin ci ma log par mthong ba yin no //
translated: One sees the scriptures and their meaning without error.

original: las gsum rnam par dag pa ni yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba ste zhes bya ba ni ngag rnam par dag pa dang / lus rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: las gsum rnam par dag pa ni yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba ste zhes bya ba ni ngag rnam par dag pa dang / lus rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Right speech is the purification of speech; right action is the purification of body.

original: gnyi ga rnam par dag pa ni de nyid gnyi ga rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga rnam par dag pa ni de nyid gnyi ga rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: Both are the purification of both.

original: 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Right livelihood is the purification of both.

original: 'di ni las gsum rnam par dag pa yin te /üîΩngag gi kha gsag dang gcam bu la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ni las gsum rnam par dag pa yin te / ngag gi kha gsag dang gcam bu la sogs pa'am /
translated: This is the purification of the three actions.

original: lus kyi spyod lam bcos ma la sogs pas log par 'tsho bar byed na rnal 'byor pa 'di la ni mthong ba'i lam thob pa'i phyir de gnyi ga yang med la /üîΩngag gi las kha gsag dang gcam bu la @149b sogs pa'am /
analyzed: lus kyi spyod lam bcos ma la sogs pas log par 'tsho bar byed na rnal 'byor pa 'di la ni mthong ba'i lam thob pa'i phyir de gnyi ga yang med la / ngag gi las kha gsag dang gcam bu la @149b sogs pa'am /
translated: If one makes a living through wrong livelihood, such as flattery and deceit with the voice, or through artificial behavior of the body, then one is not a yogi, because one has not attained the path of seeing.üîΩOne attains the vow not to engage in the actions of the voice, such as flattery and deceit,

original: lus kyi las spyod lam bcos ma la sogs pa la mi bya ba'i sdom pa 'thob po //
analyzed: lus kyi las spyod lam bcos ma la sogs pa la mi bya ba'i sdom pa 'thob po //
translated: or the actions of the body, such as artificial behavior.

original: de thob pas log pas chos gos la sogs pa tshol bar mi byed de /
analyzed: de thob pas log pas chos gos la sogs pa tshol bar mi byed de /
translated: By attaining that, one does not seek Dharma robes and so on through wrong livelihood.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gnyi ga rnam par dag pas yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gnyi ga rnam par dag pas yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since both are pure, right livelihood is pure.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi chos 'di dag kyang byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi chos 'di dag kyang byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
translated: These dharmas of serenity and insight are the essence of the factors of enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir zhi gnas dang lhag mthong rnam par dbye ba brtsam ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhi gnas dang lhag mthong rnam par dbye ba brtsam ste /
translated: Therefore, the analysis of serenity and insight is begun.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa bsgom pa'i thabs yin no //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa bsgom pa'i thabs yin no //
translated: Serenity and insight are the means of cultivating the factors of enlightenment.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la brten nas zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi ngo bo nyid kyi yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la brten nas so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la brten nas zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi ngo bo nyid kyi yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la brten nas so //
translated: Based on right concentration means based on right concentration which is the essence of serenity.

original: sems la sems 'jog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste khams gsum pa 'di ni sems tsam mo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sems la sems 'jog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste khams gsum pa 'di ni sems tsam mo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because the mind is placed in the mind means that the three realms are mind only.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar sems la sems 'jog par gyur ba de'i tshe zhi gnas kyi ting nge 'dzin grub pa thob po //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar sems la sems 'jog par gyur ba de'i tshe zhi gnas kyi ting nge 'dzin grub pa thob po //
translated: When the mind is thus placed in the mind, then one has attained the achievement of the samadhi of serenity.

original: zhi gnas thob pas mnyam par bzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: zhi gnas thob pas mnyam par bzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: Having attained serenity, one knows reality just as it is, even when not in equipoise.

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa thob pas lhag mthong thob pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa thob pas lhag mthong thob pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Having attained the discernment of reality, one attains insight, which is nonconceptual intuition.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam thun mong ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam thun mong ma yin pa yin no //
translated: This is the uncommon path of serenity and insight for the bodhisattva.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong cha gcig pa ni gang gi tshe zhi gnas sgom par byed pa zhes bya ba ni gang tshe zhi gnas shas che ba gzugs med pa dag yin pa de'i tshe na zhi gnas sgom pa kho na rab tu shes so //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong cha gcig pa ni gang gi tshe zhi gnas sgom par byed pa zhes bya ba ni gang tshe zhi gnas shas che ba gzugs med pa dag yin pa de'i tshe na zhi gnas sgom pa kho na rab tu shes so //
translated: Serenity and insight are equalized when one cultivates serenity, that is, when serenity predominates, then one knows only the cultivation of serenity.

original: bsam gtan gsum gyi gnas skabs na ni lhag mthong gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum gyi gnas skabs na ni lhag mthong gsal ba yin no //
translated: When one is in the three meditative states of the fourth meditation, insight is clear.

original: gnyi ga'i cha ni gang gi tshe cig car gnyi ga sgom par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa la'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i cha ni gang gi tshe cig car gnyi ga sgom par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa la'o //
translated: Both aspects are when one meditates on both simultaneously.üîΩThat serenity and insight of the bodhisattvas are considered the cause for the stage of action in faith.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la rgyu yin par 'dod do zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rgyu yin par 'dod ce na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la rgyu yin par 'dod do zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rgyu yin par 'dod ce na /
translated: How are they considered the cause?

original: 'di ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang ldan pas sa dang po rtogs pa dang nges par 'byung ba'i lam la sogs pa 'gyur bas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni don de dag gi rten yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang ldan pas sa dang po rtogs pa dang nges par 'byung ba'i lam la sogs pa 'gyur bas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni don de dag gi rten yin no //
translated: Thus, serenity and insight are the basis for those goals, since one who possesses serenity and insight attains the first stage and the path of definite emergence, etc.

original: rten du gyur pa'i phyir rgyu yin no //üîΩzhi gnas dang @150a * //
analyzed: rten du gyur pa'i phyir rgyu yin no // zhi gnas dang @150a * //
translated: They are the cause because they are the basis.

original: lhag mthong gi rnal 'byor 'di ni thams cad sgrub par byed pa'i thabs yin no //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi rnal 'byor 'di ni thams cad sgrub par byed pa'i thabs yin no //
translated: This yoga of serenity and insight is the means of accomplishing everything.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa la rab tu zhugs pa thabs mkhas pas de theg pa chen por yongs su sngo bar byed pas de'i phyir thabs la mkhas pa rnam par dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa la rab tu zhugs pa thabs mkhas pas de theg pa chen por yongs su sngo bar byed pas de'i phyir thabs la mkhas pa rnam par dbye ba yin no //
translated: Skill in means is the transformation of the vehicle by the wise one who is engaged in the cultivation of serenity and insight into the universal vehicle.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams rdzogs par bya ba'i thabs gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams rdzogs par bya ba'i thabs gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the means for perfecting the qualities of a Buddha?

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: It is non-conceptual intuition.

original: myur du mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa'i thabs gang zhe na /
analyzed: myur du mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa'i thabs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the means for quickly attaining complete enlightenment?

original: sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags so //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags so //
translated: It is the confession of all one's own sins,

original: bsod nams thams cad kyi rjes su yi rang ngo //
analyzed: bsod nams thams cad kyi rjes su yi rang ngo //
translated: the rejoicing in all the merits of oneself and others,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad la gsol ba 'debs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad la gsol ba 'debs so //
translated: the entreaty to the Buddhas not to pass into nirvƒÅ·πáa,

original: bdag gi ye shes rdzogs par byang chub par gyur cig ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag gi ye shes rdzogs par byang chub par gyur cig ces bya ba ste /
translated: and the dedication of one's merits to complete enlightenment.

original: gtsug lag gi tshig bzhi po 'di dag gi don ni go rims bzhin du so sor bshags pa dang rjes su yi rang ba dang gsol ba dang yongs su bsngo ba yin no //
analyzed: gtsug lag gi tshig bzhi po 'di dag gi don ni go rims bzhin du so sor bshags pa dang rjes su yi rang ba dang gsol ba dang yongs su bsngo ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of these four scriptural statements is, respectively, confession, rejoicing, entreaty, and dedication.

original: 'di ni myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i thabs yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i thabs yin te /
translated: This is the method for quickly attaining complete enlightenment.

original: de la mkhas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la mkhas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Skill in that is the power of wisdom.üîΩThe method for not interrupting the path is non-abiding nirvana.

original: lam rgyun mi gcod pa'i thabs ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de la mkhas pa ni shes rab kyi stobs kyis 'khor bar yang 'khor la chu yi padma bzhin du 'khor ba pa'i nyes pa dag gis kyang mi gos
analyzed: lam rgyun mi gcod pa'i thabs ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de la mkhas pa ni shes rab kyi stobs kyis 'khor bar yang 'khor la chu yi padma bzhin du 'khor ba pa'i nyes pa dag gis kyang mi gos
translated: Skill in that is the power of wisdom. By the power of wisdom, one cycles in samsara but is not defiled by the faults of samsara, like a lotus in water.

original: so // snying rje'i stobs kyis nyan thos bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa la yang mi gnas te /
analyzed: so // snying rje'i stobs kyis nyan thos bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa la yang mi gnas te /
translated: By the power of compassion, one does not abide in nirvana like the sravakas.

original: 'di ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: This is skill in non-abiding nirvana.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gzungs rnams kyang byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa zhes bya ba'i ming thob pas de'i phyir gzungs bsam ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gzungs rnams kyang byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa zhes bya ba'i ming thob pas de'i phyir gzungs bsam ste /
translated: The dharanis of the bodhisattvas also obtain the name of factors conducive to enlightenment. Therefore, the dharanis are considered to be factors conducive to enlightenment.

original: de ltar thabs la mkhas pa la rab tu zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gzungs kyi stobs kyis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi bshad pa yang 'dzin par byed la /
analyzed: de ltar thabs la mkhas pa la rab tu zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gzungs kyi stobs kyis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi bshad pa yang 'dzin par byed la /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who is engaged in skill in means retains the explanations of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas by the power of retention.

original: 'di la sngon ma thos pa'i chos dag kyang rnam pa thams cad snang ngo //
analyzed: 'di la sngon ma thos pa'i chos dag kyang rnam pa thams cad snang ngo //
translated: And in this regard, the Dharma that was not previously heard appears in all its aspects.

original: gzungs kyi rab tu dbye ba las bstan gyi ngo bo nyid ma bshad pa //
analyzed: gzungs kyi rab tu dbye ba las bstan gyi ngo bo nyid ma bshad pa //
translated: The divisions of retention are taught, but its nature is not explained.

original: gzungs ni shes rab dang dran pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzungs ni shes rab dang dran pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: Retention has the nature of wisdom and mindfulness.

original: shes rab dang dran pa'i khyad par du 'phags @150b pa ni gzungs zhes bya ba'i ming thob po //
analyzed: shes rab dang dran pa'i khyad par du 'phags @150b pa ni gzungs zhes bya ba'i ming thob po //
translated: The special excellence of wisdom and mindfulness is called retention.

original: sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba ni 'dis tshe rabs gzhan dag na yi ge 'dri ba dang mchod pa la sogs pa gzungs mngon par grub par byed pa'i las bsags par gyur ba gang yin pa de'i dbang gis gang gis na lan cig
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba ni 'dis tshe rabs gzhan dag na yi ge 'dri ba dang mchod pa la sogs pa gzungs mngon par grub par byed pa'i las bsags par gyur ba gang yin pa de'i dbang gis gang gis na lan cig
translated: The ripening of previous karma means that in other lives, by the power of the accumulation of karma that produces retention, such as writing letters and making offerings, etc.,

original: gis len cing 'dzin par byed pa de lta bu'i rnam par smin pa thob ste /
analyzed: gis len cing 'dzin par byed pa de lta bu'i rnam par smin pa thob ste /
translated: One obtains such a maturation as that which is taken up and held by the perfuming of the seeds of the wholesome dharmas.

original: ji skad du chos mngon pa kun nas btus pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du chos mngon pa kun nas btus pa las /
translated: As is said in the Abhidharmasamuccaya:

original: skye bas thob pa'i dge ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: skye bas thob pa'i dge ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is wholesome by being acquired at birth?

original: dge ba'i chos rnams la sngon goms pa la brten nas gang gis na so sor brtags pa med par dge ba'i chos rnams la 'dod pa goms pa kun tu gnas pa de lta bu'i rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub pa yin no zhes bshad pa lta bu'o
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams la sngon goms pa la brten nas gang gis na so sor brtags pa med par dge ba'i chos rnams la 'dod pa goms pa kun tu gnas pa de lta bu'i rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub pa yin no zhes bshad pa lta bu'o
translated: It is that maturation which is obtained on the basis of previous practice of the wholesome dharmas, by virtue of which one is inclined to the wholesome dharmas without examination.

original: // sa la ma zhugs pa rnams kyi ni chung ngu'o zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: // sa la ma zhugs pa rnams kyi ni chung ngu'o zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: That of those who have not entered the stages is small. That of those who abide in the stage of action in faith.

original: gzhi ni ye shes so zhes bya ba ni sems pa ye shes su yongs su bsngos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi ni ye shes so zhes bya ba ni sems pa ye shes su yongs su bsngos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The basis is knowledge, because the intention is dedicated to knowledge.

original: sems las mod la 'bras bur 'gyur ba yang sems tsam las ji ltar 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa'i sgo nas rig pas bya'o //
analyzed: sems las mod la 'bras bur 'gyur ba yang sems tsam las ji ltar 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa'i sgo nas rig pas bya'o //
translated: The result is immediate, because the desired aim is accomplished by mere intention.

original: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa ni mod kyi 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa ni mod kyi 'bras bu ste /
translated: The result of the desired object is the immediate result.

original: de ltar gyur cig snyam pa de'i mjug thogs su de kho na ltar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gyur cig snyam pa de'i mjug thogs su de kho na ltar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Immediately after the thought ‚ÄúMay it be thus,‚Äù it becomes just thus.

original: lus brgya la sogs pa ni sa dang po nas bzung ste ston par byed do //
analyzed: lus brgya la sogs pa ni sa dang po nas bzung ste ston par byed do //
translated: The hundred bodies, etc., are manifested beginning with the first stage.

original: gzungs dang smon lam phun sum tshogs pa de rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi sgrib pa thams cad spang ba'i phyir sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: gzungs dang smon lam phun sum tshogs pa de rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi sgrib pa thams cad spang ba'i phyir sgrub par byed do //
translated: The perfection of retention and of vows is accomplished in order to abandon all obscurations to the three doors of liberation.

original: de la sgrub pa na bdag nyid dang gzhan dag gi phyin ci log gi nga rgyal spang ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la sgrub pa na bdag nyid dang gzhan dag gi phyin ci log gi nga rgyal spang ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no //
translated: When one is accomplishing them, one is engaged in order to abandon the pride of self and other.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum gyi spyod yul rnam pa gsum du shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa rnam gsum du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum gyi spyod yul rnam pa gsum du shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa rnam gsum du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The three aspects of the domain of the three kinds of concentration should be understood. The three kinds of objective supports are meant.

original: de gnyi ga la bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rten nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i gang zag la bdag tu 'dzin pa dang kun brtags pa'i chos la bdag tu 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga la bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rten nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i gang zag la bdag tu 'dzin pa dang kun brtags pa'i chos la bdag tu 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The five appropriating aggregates are the basis of the two kinds of self-habits.

original: chos dag la bdag ces byu ba'i sgras smos pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi don du blta bar bya'o //üîΩbdag tu 'dzin pa gnyis po 'di'i rten nye bar @151a * //
analyzed: chos dag la bdag ces byu ba'i sgras smos pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi don du blta bar bya'o // bdag tu 'dzin pa gnyis po 'di'i rten nye bar @151a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúself‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúself-habits with regard to dharmas‚Äù should be understood to mean ‚Äúown-nature.‚Äù

original: len pa'i phung po lnga ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: len pa'i phung po lnga ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The five appropriating aggregates are the objective mental support of the concentration of wishlessness, which is the basis of the two kinds of self-habits.

original: rten de nye bar zhi ba zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga nye bar zhi zhing nye bar len pa med par 'gyur ba med pas mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs pa ni nye barüîΩlen pa'i phung po lnga nye bar zhi ba ste /
analyzed: rten de nye bar zhi ba zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga nye bar zhi zhing nye bar len pa med par 'gyur ba med pas mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs pa ni nye barüîΩlen pa'i phung po lnga nye bar zhi ba ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe pacification of that basis‚Äù means that when one attains Nirvana, the five appropriating aggregates are pacified and become non-appropriated. Thus the objective mental support of the concentration of signlessness is the pacification of the five appropriating aggregates.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Nirvana is the meaning of ‚Äúextinction.‚Äù

original: gzung ba rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzung ba rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The three kinds of apprehended objectsüîΩare the two kinds of selflessness, the five appropriative aggregates, and nirvana.

original: bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis dang / nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dang mya ngan las 'das pa ste gsum po dag la 'dzin pa stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis dang / nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dang mya ngan las 'das pa ste gsum po dag la 'dzin pa stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum du shes par bya'o //
translated: The three kinds of apprehending subjects are the three meditative stabilizations of emptiness and so forth.

original: smon pa med pa ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rten de la rgyab kyis phyogs pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: smon pa med pa ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rten de la rgyab kyis phyogs pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The wishless is the turning away from the basis of the apprehension of a self.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rten ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rten ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
translated: The basis of the apprehension of a self is the five appropriative aggregates.

original: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni de dag la rgyab kyis phyogs pa yin te /
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni de dag la rgyab kyis phyogs pa yin te /
translated: The wishless meditative stabilization is the turning away from them.

original: sdug bsngal gyis bdag nyid de la smon par mi byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis bdag nyid de la smon par mi byed do //
translated: One does not wish for a self in the face of suffering.

original: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni de dag tu 'dzin pa'i rten spang ba'i phyir yin no zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni spang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni de dag tu 'dzin pa'i rten spang ba'i phyir yin no zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni spang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: The concentration of wishlessness is for the sake of abandoning the basis of grasping them as such.üîΩThe five appropriated aggregates are what is to be abandoned.

original: de spang ba'i phyir smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de spang ba'i phyir smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The concentration of wishlessness is for the sake of abandoning them.

original: 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: All formations are impermanent.

original: 'du byed thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: All formations are suffering.

original: zhes bya ba ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu'i dngos por bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu'i dngos por bstan to //
translated: This teaches the two Dharma summaries as the basis for the cause of the concentration of wishlessness.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'du byed thams cad mi rtag cing sog le bsregs pa lta bur sdug bsngal bar rig nas de dag la smon par mi byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'du byed thams cad mi rtag cing sog le bsregs pa lta bur sdug bsngal bar rig nas de dag la smon par mi byed do //
translated: Having understood that all formations are impermanent and like a burning saw, they do not wish for them.

original: de'i phyir chos kyi sdom 'di gnyis smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu'i dngos po gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos kyi sdom 'di gnyis smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu'i dngos po gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, these two Dharma summaries are called the basis for the cause of the concentration of wishlessness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi rtag pa'i don ni med pa'i don ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi rtag pa'i don ni med pa'i don ces bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning of impermanence for bodhisattvas is the meaning of non-existence.

original: mi zhes bya ba ni dag ga par brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: mi zhes bya ba ni dag ga par brjod pa yin la /
translated: The term ‚Äúperson‚Äù is a conventional expression.

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rtag pa brjod pa yin pas mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni gang dus rtag tu med pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rtag pa brjod pa yin pas mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni gang dus rtag tu med pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúpermanent‚Äù is an expression of permanence. Thus, ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù means that which does not exist at all times.

original: 'di ni mi rtag pa'i don rnam grangs med pa yin no //üîΩrtag tu med pa gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa yin pas de dag gi kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba @151b ni 'du byed de dag gi kun brtags pa'i gang zag dang chos kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni rtag
analyzed: 'di ni mi rtag pa'i don rnam grangs med pa yin no // rtag tu med pa gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa yin pas de dag gi kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba @151b ni 'du byed de dag gi kun brtags pa'i gang zag dang chos kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni rtag
translated: This is the non-enumerated meaning of ‚Äúimpermanent.‚ÄùüîΩThat which does not exist at all times is impermanent. Thus, the imagined nature of those is that which is not permanent.

original: tu med pa yin no //
analyzed: tu med pa yin no //
translated: The imagined nature of those formations is the nature of the person and of phenomena. That is not permanent.

original: sdug bsngal ba'i don yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i don te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i don yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúsuffering‚Äù is the meaning of unreal imagination.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid gang dag yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sems dang sems las byung ba phyin ci log dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa dag ni rtog par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid gang dag yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sems dang sems las byung ba phyin ci log dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa dag ni rtog par byed do //
translated: The dependent characteristic is that which is imagined by the mind and mental factors that are erroneous and unreal.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni slu ba'i bdag nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni slu ba'i bdag nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal yin te /
translated: That which is unreal is suffering because it is the nature of deception.

original: 'di skad du sems dang sems las byung ba'i phyin ci log pa rnams yang dag pa ma yin pa gang zag dang chos rnams su kun rtog par byed kyi 'di la gang zag dang chos yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du sems dang sems las byung ba'i phyin ci log pa rnams yang dag pa ma yin pa gang zag dang chos rnams su kun rtog par byed kyi 'di la gang zag dang chos yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said: The mind and mental factors that are erroneous imagine the person and phenomena that are unreal, but the person and phenomena do not exist.

original: yang na sems dang sems las byung ba /
analyzed: yang na sems dang sems las byung ba /
translated: Or, the mind and mental factors

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyin ci log pa rnams kyi skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa gang yin pa de la ni sdug bsngal ba yin no //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyin ci log pa rnams kyi skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa gang yin pa de la ni sdug bsngal ba yin no //
translated: that are erroneous and contaminated are suffering because they perish as soon as they arise.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Therefore, impermanence is of five kinds.

original: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa 'dren par byed do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa 'dren par byed do //
translated: The aspect of impermanence leads to the aspect of suffering.

original: 'dis ni 'du byed thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba ni chos kyi mdo 'di ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'du byed thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba ni chos kyi mdo 'di ston to //
translated: This shows the Dharma statement, ‚ÄúAll formations are suffering.‚Äù

original: bdag med pa'i don ni kun tu rtog pa tsam gyi don te /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i don ni kun tu rtog pa tsam gyi don te /
translated: The meaning of selflessness is the meaning of mere imagination.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba'i chos kyi mdo 'di ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba'i chos kyi mdo 'di ston te /
translated: This shows the Dharma statement, ‚ÄúAll phenomena are selfless.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du kun tu rtog pa tsam dang tha snyad tsam yod kyi don dam par ni chos thams cad kun brtags pa'i gang zag dang chos med pa'i phyir bdag med pa'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du kun tu rtog pa tsam dang tha snyad tsam yod kyi don dam par ni chos thams cad kun brtags pa'i gang zag dang chos med pa'i phyir bdag med pa'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains that mere imagination and mere convention exist, but in the ultimate all phenomena are selfless because there are no phenomena or persons that are imagined.

original: de nyid kyi phyir kho na zhes bya ba'i sgras nges par gzung ba'i phyir kun brtags pa'i bdag ni med kyi kun tu rtog pa tsam zhig yod pas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir kho na zhes bya ba'i sgras nges par gzung ba'i phyir kun brtags pa'i bdag ni med kyi kun tu rtog pa tsam zhig yod pas /
translated: Therefore, because the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is used to specify, the imagined self does not exist, but mere imagination exists.

original: gang zag dang chos med pa'i don ni bdag med pa'i don to zhes bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gang zag dang chos med pa'i don ni bdag med pa'i don to zhes bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The meaning of the non-existence of persons and things is the meaning of selflessness.

original: zhi ba'i don ni rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhi ba'i don ni rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of peace is the meaning of the pacification of conceptualization.üîΩThe characteristic of the perfected is nirvana.

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba ni chos kyi mdo 'di ston te /üîΩsems dang sems las byung ba'i phyin ci log pa sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid rnams so sor brtags pas @152a * //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba ni chos kyi mdo 'di ston te / sems dang sems las byung ba'i phyin ci log pa sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid rnams so sor brtags pas @152a * //
translated: This shows that the meaning of peace is nirvana.üîΩThe pacification of the mind and mental factors that are the inversions of suffering is nirvana.

original: 'gog pa'i phyir zhi ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i phyir zhi ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: The pacification of the mind and mental factors that are the inversions of suffering is nirvana.

original: mi rung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i mjug thogs su 'jug par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan gyi bar du gnas nas /
analyzed: mi rung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro // de'i mjug thogs su 'jug par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan gyi bar du gnas nas /
translated: Because it is impossible.üîΩIt is impossible for it to arise again immediately after that,

original: 'gag par 'gyur ba'i bar du'o//
analyzed: 'gag par 'gyur ba'i bar du'o//
translated: because it would remain for a period of time.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bstan par rgyun med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bstan par rgyun med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: because there is no continuum that can be shown to exist.

original: gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid la ni rgyun rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid la ni rgyun rung ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that a continuum exists for that which has the nature of enduring.

original: rgyu las skyes pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba 'dis ni skad cig ma nyid du bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu las skyes pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba 'dis ni skad cig ma nyid du bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs gnyis pa yin no //
translated: Because it arises from a cause is the second reason proving momentariness.

original: de lta bas na gdon mi za bar skad cig re re la snga ma'i rgyun can gzhan zhig yod do zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma dang po ni rgyu yin la phyi ma ni 'bras bu yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gdon mi za bar skad cig re re la snga ma'i rgyun can gzhan zhig yod do zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma dang po ni rgyu yin la phyi ma ni 'bras bu yin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is definitely the case that in each moment there is another that is a continuum of the previous one. The first moment is the cause and the subsequent ones are the effect.

original: dus gzhan na 'gag pa nyid kyang 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lung dang yid la byed pa dang 'gal ba ston te /
analyzed: dus gzhan na 'gag pa nyid kyang 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lung dang yid la byed pa dang 'gal ba ston te /
translated: Because it is contradictory for it to cease at another time is the third reason proving momentariness.üîΩThis shows that the assertion that things endure for a while contradicts scripture and mental activity.

original: de la lung dang 'gal ba ni chos thams cad ni skad cig pa ste /üîΩdus re zhig pa yun thung du gnas pa'o zhes 'byung bas te /
analyzed: de la lung dang 'gal ba ni chos thams cad ni skad cig pa ste / dus re zhig pa yun thung du gnas pa'o zhes 'byung bas te /
translated: Here, the contradiction with scripture is that all phenomena are momentary.üîΩThey endure for a short time, for a while.

original: dus re zhig smos pa ni skad cig tsam gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus re zhig smos pa ni skad cig tsam gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression for a while indicates that they endure for just a moment.

original: yun thung du zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma las phyin chad du mi gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yun thung du zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma las phyin chad du mi gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúFor a short time‚Äù means that it does not endure beyond a moment.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dag tu yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa dang 'gal ba ston pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dag tu yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa dang 'gal ba ston pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúOne should attend to it as arising and passing away‚Äù shows that it is incompatible with attention.

original: 'chi ba'i dus la sogs pa ni 'gag par mthong ba gzhan dag ji lta bar zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus la sogs pa ni 'gag par mthong ba gzhan dag ji lta bar zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ste /
translated: ‚ÄúJust as one sees the cessation of others at the time of death, etc.‚Äù is an example of a dissimilar case.

original: 'di skad du rnal 'byor ba yid la byed pa thob pa skad cig ma re re la skye ba dang 'jig par lta ba rnams yid byung ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rnam par grol ba dag tu 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di skad du rnal 'byor ba yid la byed pa thob pa skad cig ma re re la skye ba dang 'jig par lta ba rnams yid byung ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rnam par grol ba dag tu 'gyur gyi /
translated: This is what is being said: Yogins and yoginƒ´s who have attained attention see arising and passing away in each moment, and they become disenchanted, free from desire, and liberated.

original: gang dag skad cig re re la skye ba dang 'jig par lta ba med cing yun ring mo zhig na 'chi bar lta ba de dag ni yid byung ba la sogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag skad cig re re la skye ba dang 'jig par lta ba med cing yun ring mo zhig na 'chi bar lta ba de dag ni yid byung ba la sogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Those who do not see arising and passing away in each moment, but see death only after a long time, do not become disenchanted, and so on.

original: de'i mthu ni mi 'dra bar skye ba la rab tu grub ces bya ba ni sngon po nyid ni mtshan nyid kyis 'jig pa'i ngang can yin pa'i phyir rang nyid 'gags la me dang 'brel pas ni dmar po nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i mthu ni mi 'dra bar skye ba la rab tu grub ces bya ba ni sngon po nyid ni mtshan nyid kyis 'jig pa'i ngang can yin pa'i phyir rang nyid 'gags la me dang 'brel pas ni dmar po nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Blue itself is destroyed by its intrinsic reality because it is momentary. But when it is associated with fire, it becomes red.

original: 'di ni mi 'dra ba skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mi 'dra ba skye ba yin no //
translated: This is the generation of a different state.üîΩIt is not the case that the continuum of blue is not maintained at all when it is associated with fire, because the continuum of blue is maintained in a different state.üîΩIt is not the case that the continuum of blue is not maintained at all when it is associated with fire, because the continuum of blue is maintained in a different state.üîΩIt is not the case that the continuum of blue is not maintained at all when it is associated with fire, because the continuum of blue is maintained in a different state.üîΩIt is not the case that the continuum of blue is not maintained at all when it is associated with fire, because the continuum of blue is maintained in a different state.

original: 'di ltar de dang 'brel pa las sngon po nyid kyi rgyun mi 'dra @152b bar 'dzin gyi rnam pa thams cad du mi 'jug pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar lcags kyi thu lum bsregs pa slar sngon po nyid du 'gyur ba yang
analyzed: 'di ltar de dang 'brel pa las sngon po nyid kyi rgyun mi 'dra @152b bar 'dzin gyi rnam pa thams cad du mi 'jug pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar lcags kyi thu lum bsregs pa slar sngon po nyid du 'gyur ba yang
translated: It is not the case that the continuum of blue is not maintained at all when it is associated with fire, because the continuum of blue is maintained in a different state.üîΩIt is not the case that the continuum of blue is not maintained at all when it is associated with fire, because the continuum of blue is maintained in a different state.üîΩIt is not the case that the continuum of blue is not maintained at all when it is associated with fire, because the continuum of blue is maintained in a different state.üîΩIt is not the case that the continuum of blue is not maintained at all when it is associated with fire, because the continuum of blue is maintained in a different state.üîΩIt is not the case that the continuum of blue is not maintained at all when it is associated with fire, because the continuum of blue is maintained in a different state.üîΩIt is not the case that the continuum of blue is not maintained at all when it is associated with fire, because the continuum of blue is maintained in a different state.üîΩIt is not the case that the continuum of blue is not maintained at all when it is associated with fire, because the continuum of blue is maintained in a different state.üîΩIt is not the case that the continuum of blue is not maintained at all when it is associated with fire, because the continuum of blue is maintained in a different state.

original: lcags kyi thu lum de la sngon po nyid kyi sa bon yod pas yang sngon po nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: lcags kyi thu lum de la sngon po nyid kyi sa bon yod pas yang sngon po nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: It is not the case that the continuum of blue is not maintained at all when it is associated with fire, because the continuum of blue is maintained in a different state.

original: de lta bas na rnam pa thams cad du mi 'jug pa nyid du rab tu shes pa ni ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam pa thams cad du mi 'jug pa nyid du rab tu shes pa ni ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not the case that the continuum

original: 'on te chu shin tu 'dus pa rnams rnam pa thams cad du mi 'jug pa nyid ma yin nam snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'on te chu shin tu 'dus pa rnams rnam pa thams cad du mi 'jug pa nyid ma yin nam snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that water that is very still does not move at all,

original: de dag kyang rang gi dang kho nas 'jig ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang rang gi dang kho nas 'jig ste /
translated: it is destroyed by its own intrinsic nature.

original: me ni de dag gi rgyun 'dra ba skye ba'i rgyu yin no /
analyzed: me ni de dag gi rgyun 'dra ba skye ba'i rgyu yin no /
translated: Fire is the cause of the arising of a similar continuum of that water.

original: gal te me dang 'brel pa las 'jig par gyur na ni de'i mod kho na la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te me dang 'brel pa las 'jig par gyur na ni de'i mod kho na la 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were destroyed by contact with fire, it would be destroyed at that very moment.üîΩThe cognition of it arises because of similarity, not because it exists.

original: 'dra ba'i phyir de'i blo 'byung gi de yod pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya bar ci mngon zhes bya ba ni gnas pa ni de kho na bzhin du 'dug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i phyir de'i blo 'byung gi de yod pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya bar ci mngon zhes bya ba ni gnas pa ni de kho na bzhin du 'dug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is the evidence? It is the same as before.üîΩBecause it is not different from the first moment,

original: skad cig ma dang po dang khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gal te skyes ma thag tu mi 'jig go //üîΩyun ring mo zhig gnas nas 'jig go //
analyzed: skad cig ma dang po dang khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gal te skyes ma thag tu mi 'jig go // yun ring mo zhig gnas nas 'jig go //
translated: if you think that it is not destroyed immediately after it arises,

original: zhes bya bar bzung na /
analyzed: zhes bya bar bzung na /
translated: but is destroyed after it has endured for a long time,

original: de la gang gis na khyad par khas blangs na /
analyzed: de la gang gis na khyad par khas blangs na /
translated: then you must admit that it is different.

original: khyad par 'dis na yun ring mo zhig gnas nas phyis 'jig go zhes bya ba skad cig ma dang po nas khyad par 'ga' zhig yod dam /
analyzed: khyad par 'dis na yun ring mo zhig gnas nas phyis 'jig go zhes bya ba skad cig ma dang po nas khyad par 'ga' zhig yod dam /
translated: In particular, it is said that it endures for a long time and then perishes. Does it have some difference from the first moment?

original: des rjes su zin par 'jug pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni sems kyis rjes su zin par 'jug pa'i sgo nas te /
analyzed: des rjes su zin par 'jug pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni sems kyis rjes su zin par 'jug pa'i sgo nas te /
translated: By the door of engagement through being taken up by the mind means by the door of engagement through being taken up by the mind.

original: sems kyis yongs su zin pa'i 'du byed rnams sems de'i rjes su 'jug pas de lta bas na de ni sems kyi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: sems kyis yongs su zin pa'i 'du byed rnams sems de'i rjes su 'jug pas de lta bas na de ni sems kyi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Because formative factors that are taken up by the mind engage in accordance with that mind, therefore they are the result of the mind.üîΩSimilarly, it is said that name and form have consciousness as their condition.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes kyang gsungs pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa ni ming dang gzugs kyi bdag po'i rkyen te rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis de 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes kyang gsungs pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa ni ming dang gzugs kyi bdag po'i rkyen te rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis de 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Consciousness is the dominant condition of name and form because they are established through the power of consciousness.

original: de lta bas na sems kyi 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na sems kyi 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is said to be the result of the mind.

original: phyi'i dngos po rnams ngan par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sa yang tsha sgo dang sdong dum dang tshor ma la sogs pas gang bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: phyi'i dngos po rnams ngan par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sa yang tsha sgo dang sdong dum dang tshor ma la sogs pas gang bar 'gyur la /
translated: ‚ÄúExternal things become bad‚Äù means that the earth becomes filled with salt, stumps, thorns, and so on.

original: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya la sogs pa ngan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya la sogs pa ngan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Form, sound, smell, taste, touch, etc. become bad.

original: bzlog pa dge ba byed pa rnams la ni gya nom pa bdag yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa dge ba byed pa rnams la ni gya nom pa bdag yin no //
translated: The opposite is true for those who do good.

original: dang po zhes bya ba ni dang por skye ba ste /
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba ni dang por skye ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúFirst‚Äù means first arising.

original: @153a * // 'di ltar 'og nas /
analyzed: @153a * // 'di ltar 'og nas /
translated: As will be explained later:

original: gzugs brnyan du ni skye ba ste //üîΩzhes 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan du ni skye ba ste // zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Arising is like a reflection.üîΩ‚ÄúFirst arising‚Äù means the first establishment of a self-entity.

original: dang por skye ba ni dang po nyid du bdag gi dngos po mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa brgyal pa'i dus na nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dang por skye ba ni dang po nyid du bdag gi dngos po mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa brgyal pa'i dus na nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma gang yin pa'o //
translated: This refers to the moment of conception in the state of unconsciousness.

original: 'dod pa gzhan gyis sprul pa ni lha dag cig ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa gzhan gyis sprul pa ni lha dag cig ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDesired by others‚Äù refers to gods.

original: de dag ni bud med gang la dga' bar 'dod pa de la rang 'dod pa'i gos dang rgyan dang me tog dang sgra la sogs pa sprul par byed do //
analyzed: de dag ni bud med gang la dga' bar 'dod pa de la rang 'dod pa'i gos dang rgyan dang me tog dang sgra la sogs pa sprul par byed do //
translated: They emanate whatever clothes, ornaments, flowers, sounds, and so on are desired by those who are attracted to women.

original: bud med dag kyang skyes pa gang la dga' bar 'dod pa de la de kho na bzhin du rang 'dod pa'i gos dang rgyan la sogs pa sprul par byed do //
analyzed: bud med dag kyang skyes pa gang la dga' bar 'dod pa de la de kho na bzhin du rang 'dod pa'i gos dang rgyan la sogs pa sprul par byed do //
translated: Women also emanate whatever clothes, ornaments, and so on are desired by those who are attracted to men.

original: de ltar na 'dod pa gzhan dag gis sprul pa rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dod pa gzhan dag gis sprul pa rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, they are called ‚Äúemanations of others‚Äô desire.‚Äù

original: 'od mi gsal ba nyid du ni de las gzhan du skye ba rnams kyi gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni dga' ldan dang / 'thab bral dang sum cu rtsa gsum pa dang ; rgyal chen bzhi pa rnams dang / de bzhin du 'dzam bu'i gling la sogs par mi khyad par du 'phags pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'od mi gsal ba nyid du ni de las gzhan du skye ba rnams kyi gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni dga' ldan dang / 'thab bral dang sum cu rtsa gsum pa dang ; rgyal chen bzhi pa rnams dang / de bzhin du 'dzam bu'i gling la sogs par mi khyad par du 'phags pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Those of others are those born in other realms, such as the gods of Tu·π£ita, YƒÅma, TrƒÅyastri·πÉ≈õa, and the Four Great Kings, and humans of Jambudvƒ´pa and so on.

original: rgyu dang tshad kyi khyad par dang // zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i khyad par dang tshad kyi khyad par te /
analyzed: rgyu dang tshad kyi khyad par dang // zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i khyad par dang tshad kyi khyad par te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdue to the difference in cause and size‚Äù means due to the difference in cause and the difference in size.

original: tshad kyi khyad par ni nur nur bo la sogs pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: tshad kyi khyad par ni nur nur bo la sogs pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The difference in measure is the state of the embryo, etc.

original: gal te de zhes bya ba ni dang por skye ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de zhes bya ba ni dang por skye ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it‚Äù means if the embryo, etc.

original: rgyu nyid kyis khyad par du ma gyur na zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i khyad par las skye ba khyad par can du ma gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu nyid kyis khyad par du ma gyur na zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i khyad par las skye ba khyad par can du ma gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúWere not different by cause‚Äù means if it were not different by arising from a different cause.

original: de nyid kyi phyir des na rgyu khyad par med pa'i phyir 'du byed kyi 'jug pa phyi ma'i khyad par phyi ma phyi ma dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir des na rgyu khyad par med pa'i phyir 'du byed kyi 'jug pa phyi ma'i khyad par phyi ma phyi ma dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For that very reason, the difference in the later activity of the formative forces would not be observed, because there would be no difference in the cause.

original: khyad par yod na ni de'i phyi ma phyi ma dag las de gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khyad par phyi ma phyi ma dag las skye ba de gzhan yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma nyid du 'grub po //
analyzed: khyad par yod na ni de'i phyi ma phyi ma dag las de gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khyad par phyi ma phyi ma dag las skye ba de gzhan yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma nyid du 'grub po //
translated: If there were a difference, it would be different from the later ones, because it arises from the later ones. It is established as momentary because it is different from the later ones, because it arises from the later ones.

original: skad cig re re la gzhan du gyur pa med par tshad khyad par yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni nur nur po dang mar mer po dang gor gor po dang rkang lag ma 'gyur pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: skad cig re re la gzhan du gyur pa med par tshad khyad par yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni nur nur po dang mar mer po dang gor gor po dang rkang lag ma 'gyur pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: This refers to the stages of kalala, arbuda, pe≈õin, ghana, and pra≈õƒÅkhƒÅ.

original: rten gnas bzhin du de la brten pa mi gnas par ni rung ba ma yin /
analyzed: rten gnas bzhin du de la brten pa mi gnas par ni rung ba ma yin /
translated: It is not reasonable that the supported does not remain when the support remains.

original: zhes bya ba ni mi gnas bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes pa 'gro bar ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi gnas bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes pa 'gro bar ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that the eye consciousness moves without remaining.

original: @153b mig gi rnam par shes pa skad cig ma nyid yin la /
analyzed: @153b mig gi rnam par shes pa skad cig ma nyid yin la /
translated: The eye consciousness is momentary.

original: mig skad cig ma nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mig skad cig ma nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The eye is not momentary.

original: gal te 'gro ba skyes pas chos yul gzhan du khyer ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'gro ba skyes pas chos yul gzhan du khyer ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the dharma is carried to another place by the arising of movement,

original: des na 'gro ba'i dus na gang du yang ma song bas /
analyzed: des na 'gro ba'i dus na gang du yang ma song bas /
translated: then at the time of movement, it has not gone anywhere.

original: gnas pa kho na la 'gro ba 'thad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ji skad du ji srid du 'gro ba'i bdag gi ngo bo ma thob pa de srid du 'du byed rnams la yul gzhan du 'gro ba'i bya ba med do zhes bshad pa yin
analyzed: gnas pa kho na la 'gro ba 'thad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ji skad du ji srid du 'gro ba'i bdag gi ngo bo ma thob pa de srid du 'du byed rnams la yul gzhan du 'gro ba'i bya ba med do zhes bshad pa yin
translated: It is not tenable that going exists only in that which is being gone over.üîΩAs it was said, ‚ÄúAs long as the nature of going is not obtained, there is no activity of going to another place in compounded phenomena.‚Äù

original: no // gnas pa ni yul gzhan du ma phyin pa'i phyir 'du byed yul de na gnas pa bzhin du 'gro bas khyer ro zhes bya ba ji ltar rung /
analyzed: no // gnas pa ni yul gzhan du ma phyin pa'i phyir 'du byed yul de na gnas pa bzhin du 'gro bas khyer ro zhes bya ba ji ltar rung /
translated: How could it be tenable to say that going carries off compounded phenomena that are being gone over, since abiding does not go to another place, just as compounded phenomena abide in that place?

original: skad cig ma tha ma la sa bon med pa nyid du rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma tha ma la sa bon med pa nyid du rung ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that the final moment is devoid of seeds.

original: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du gnas pa ni dus gzhan na sa bon med pa nyid du mi 'thad de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du gnas pa ni dus gzhan na sa bon med pa nyid du mi 'thad de /
translated: As it was said, ‚ÄúIt is not tenable that abiding is devoid of seeds at another time.‚Äù

original: gal te skad cig ma re re la 'du byed rnams gzhan nyid du 'gyur na ni des na nyon mongs pa skye bar 'dod pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa 'gags pas tha ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te skad cig ma re re la 'du byed rnams gzhan nyid du 'gyur na ni des na nyon mongs pa skye bar 'dod pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa 'gags pas tha ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If compounded phenomena were different in every moment, then for those who assert that afflictions arise, afflictions would cease in the final moment.

original: de med na tha ma nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gang med na zhe na /
analyzed: de med na tha ma nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gang med na zhe na /
translated: What does not exist?

original: skad cig re re la 'dus byas rnam pa gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba med na ste /
analyzed: skad cig re re la 'dus byas rnam pa gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba med na ste /
translated: The transformation of conditioned phenomena into something else moment by moment does not exist.

original: skad cig la 'jig pa'i ngang can yin na ni der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig la 'jig pa'i ngang can yin na ni der 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were to disintegrate moment by moment, that would be the case.

original: de gnyi ga la yang skad cig re re la yongs su 'gyur ba med pa mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de gnyi ga la yang skad cig re re la yongs su 'gyur ba med pa mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
translated: In both cases, the transformation of conditioned phenomena moment by moment does not exist.

original: gnyi ga ni 'phel ba dang 'bri ba ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga ni 'phel ba dang 'bri ba ste /
translated: Both refer to increase and decrease.

original: gal te chu de dag 'jig pa'i dang can zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te chu de dag 'jig pa'i dang can zhig yin na ni /
translated: If that water were to disintegrate,

original: des na chu mig dang mtsho dang mtshe'u la sogs pa yang gang bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na chu mig dang mtsho dang mtshe'u la sogs pa yang gang bar 'gyur la /
translated: then springs, lakes, and ponds would be filled with it.

original: dral na 'bab pa yang 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dral na 'bab pa yang 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it were to be dug up, it would flow.

original: de bzhin du gnas pa la ni 'bab pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas pa la ni 'bab pa med do //
translated: But it does not flow in that way.

original: skam pa yang de kho na dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: skam pa yang de kho na dang 'dra ste /
translated: Drying up is just like that.

original: gal te de dag dang po nyid nas skad cig la 'jig pa'i dang can gyis rnam par 'jig na ni des na 'grib par 'gyur gyi gnas pa rnams la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de dag dang po nyid nas skad cig la 'jig pa'i dang can gyis rnam par 'jig na ni des na 'grib par 'gyur gyi gnas pa rnams la ni ma yin no //
translated: If they were to perish through momentariness from the very beginning, then they would diminish, but not those that endure.

original: phyis kyang khyad par gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rim pa'i rgyu skad cig la dang gis 'jig pa ma gtogs par chu mig dang mtsho dang mtshe'u la sogs pa gang ba'am skams pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: phyis kyang khyad par gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rim pa'i rgyu skad cig la dang gis 'jig pa ma gtogs par chu mig dang mtsho dang mtshe'u la sogs pa gang ba'am skams pa'i khyad par gyi rgyu gzhan ni med do //
translated: Because there is no cause for a later distinction, that is, apart from the cause of sequence, momentariness, there is no other cause for the distinction of a spring, lake, or pond being full or empty.

original: dus kyis byas pa ni dus gzhan gyi bar du yongs su gnas pas so //üîΩzhes bya ba ni dus gzhan gyi @154a * //
analyzed: dus kyis byas pa ni dus gzhan gyi bar du yongs su gnas pas so // zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan gyi @154a * //
translated: That which is due to time is due to the duration of a certain time.üîΩThat which is due to the duration of a certain time is due to the duration of a certain place, such as a village, town, etc.

original: bar du yongs su gnas pas yul dang gnas grong dang grong khyer la sogs pa dgon par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bar du yongs su gnas pas yul dang gnas grong dang grong khyer la sogs pa dgon par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That which is due to the duration of a certain place is due to the duration of a certain time, such as a forest, etc.

original: kha dog dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams ni sa la sogs pa dang rgyu 'dra ba'i phyir de kho na bzhin du skad cig ma nyid du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni skam pa dang 'phel ba ba dang rang bzhin gyis g-yo ba dang 'phel
analyzed: kha dog dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams ni sa la sogs pa dang rgyu 'dra ba'i phyir de kho na bzhin du skad cig ma nyid du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni skam pa dang 'phel ba ba dang rang bzhin gyis g-yo ba dang 'phel
translated: Color, odor, taste, and tactility are momentary because they are similar to earth and so on, their cause.

original: ba dang 'grib pa srid pa'i phyir dang / yongs su 'gyur ba bzhi la sogs pa'i rgyus te /
analyzed: ba dang 'grib pa srid pa'i phyir dang / yongs su 'gyur ba bzhi la sogs pa'i rgyus te /
translated: This is because it is possible that they dry up, increase, move naturally, increase and decrease, and so on, due to the cause of the four types of transformation and so on.

original: 'di ltar rgyud byas pa'i gzugs ni 'byung ba la brten pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyud byas pa'i gzugs ni 'byung ba la brten pa yin pas /
translated: Thus form that is a continuum is dependent on the primary elements.

original: de ltar skom pa dang 'phel ba la sogs pa'i rgyus 'byung ba rnams skad cig ma nyid du bstan pa ltar kha dog la sogs pa yang de kho na dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar skom pa dang 'phel ba la sogs pa'i rgyus 'byung ba rnams skad cig ma nyid du bstan pa ltar kha dog la sogs pa yang de kho na dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Just as the primary elements are taught to be momentary due to the cause of drying up, increasing and so on, so too color and so on should be understood to be just like that.üîΩWhen fire arises, fuel that coexists with it does not remain just as it is.

original: me 'byung na med dang lhan cig byung ba'i bud shing de kho na bzhin du gnas pa ni med do zhes bya ba ni me byung na bud shing 'jig ste /
analyzed: me 'byung na med dang lhan cig byung ba'i bud shing de kho na bzhin du gnas pa ni med do zhes bya ba ni me byung na bud shing 'jig ste /
translated: When fire arises, fuel is destroyed.

original: bud shing zhig pa las byung ba'i me gang yin pa de ji ltar brtan pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: bud shing zhig pa las byung ba'i me gang yin pa de ji ltar brtan pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: How could fire that arises from the destruction of fuel be stable?

original: mjug du bud shing med pa yang gnas par 'gyur du 'ong bas bud shing tshig pa'i me yang gnas par nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mjug du bud shing med pa yang gnas par 'gyur du 'ong bas bud shing tshig pa'i me yang gnas par nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: And it is not possible for fire that consumes fuel to endure, since it would follow that it would endure without fuel in the end.

original: bud shing med pa'i gnas skabs ni thal ba'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: bud shing med pa'i gnas skabs ni thal ba'i gnas skabs te /
translated: The state of being without fuel is the state of being ashes.

original: mdag me'i gnas skabs kyi me la ni bud shing phra mo yod do //
analyzed: mdag me'i gnas skabs kyi me la ni bud shing phra mo yod do //
translated: Fire in the state of embers has subtle fuel.

original: de med pas thal bar 'gyur te de'i me'o //
analyzed: de med pas thal bar 'gyur te de'i me'o //
translated: When that is consumed, it becomes ashes, and that is its fire.

original: gal te de de kho na bzhin du gnas par gyur na rang gi ngang gis 'jigs pas /
analyzed: gal te de de kho na bzhin du gnas par gyur na rang gi ngang gis 'jigs pas /
translated: If it were to endure just as it is, it would not disintegrate by itself.

original: rnam par 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It would not disintegrate.

original: mjug tu thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mjug tu thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The point is that it would not become ashes in the end.

original: gal te 'di snyam du mar me la sogs pa ni de dag las gzhan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mar me la sogs pa ni skad cig ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du mar me la sogs pa ni de dag las gzhan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mar me la sogs pa ni skad cig ma yin la /
translated: If you think that a lamp, etc. is different from those, because of the difference in their characteristics, a lamp, etc. is momentary,

original: ri la sogs pa ni brtan pa yin te /
analyzed: ri la sogs pa ni brtan pa yin te /
translated: a mountain, etc. is stable,

original: 'di ni mi 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mi 'dra ba yin no //
translated: this is a difference.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mar me la sogs pa skad cig ma nyid du rab tu grub pa rnams te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mar me la sogs pa skad cig ma nyid du rab tu grub pa rnams te /
translated: Therefore, a lamp, etc. is well established as momentary,

original: dper rjod par byed do //
analyzed: dper rjod par byed do //
translated: and is given as an example.

original: de dag rab tu grub na mar me la sogs pa rab tu grub pa dag gis ri la sogs pa 'du byed gzhan rab tu ma grub pa gang dag yin pa skad cig ma nyid du sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de dag rab tu grub na mar me la sogs pa rab tu grub pa dag gis ri la sogs pa 'du byed gzhan rab tu ma grub pa gang dag yin pa skad cig ma nyid du sgrub par byed do //
translated: When that is well established, by the well established lamp, etc. whatever other formations, such as a mountain, etc. are not well established, are established as momentary.

original: mi 'dra ba rnam pa gnyis la ngo bo nyid @154b mi 'dra ba ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung la sogs pa'i sra ba la sogs pa phan tshun rang gi mtshan nyid kyis mi 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba rnam pa gnyis la ngo bo nyid @154b mi 'dra ba ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung la sogs pa'i sra ba la sogs pa phan tshun rang gi mtshan nyid kyis mi 'dra ba yin no //
translated: There are two kinds of differences: difference in nature, such as the mutual difference in the intrinsic identity of earth, water, fire, wind, etc. as solid, etc.

original: 'jug pa mi 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni mar me la sogs pa'i 'jug pa yang gzhan la /
analyzed: 'jug pa mi 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni mar me la sogs pa'i 'jug pa yang gzhan la /
translated: Different engagement refers to the fact that the engagement of a butter lamp and so on is different from the engagement of the eye and so forth.üîΩ

original: ri la sogs pa'i yang gzhan no //
analyzed: ri la sogs pa'i yang gzhan no //
translated: ‚ÄúDifferent modes of activity‚Äù means that the mode of activity of a lamp, etc. is one thing, and that of a mountain, etc. is another.

original: 'jug pa ni tshul te ji ltar mar me la sogs pa'i rgyun mi 'jug pa skad cig ma nyid du mngon pa ltar /
analyzed: 'jug pa ni tshul te ji ltar mar me la sogs pa'i rgyun mi 'jug pa skad cig ma nyid du mngon pa ltar /
translated: ‚ÄúActivity‚Äù means mode of activity. Just as the mode of activity of a lamp, etc. is momentary, because it does not continue,

original: ri la sogs pa'i ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: ri la sogs pa'i ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: so the mode of activity of a mountain, etc. is not like that.

original: de'i rgyun gyis zhes bya ba ni mar me'i rgyun gyis so //
analyzed: de'i rgyun gyis zhes bya ba ni mar me'i rgyun gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy its continuum‚Äù means by the continuum of the lamp.

original: snying po skad cig re re la 'gyur ba skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni snying po yang skad cig re re la mar me 'gyur bas skye bar shes so //
analyzed: snying po skad cig re re la 'gyur ba skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni snying po yang skad cig re re la mar me 'gyur bas skye bar shes so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the essence is born anew in each moment‚Äù means that the essence is known to be born anew in each moment because the lamp is renewed.

original: 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúAll formations are impermanent‚Äù means that

original: mi rtag pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: impermanence is of two kinds:

original: mi rtag pa'i don med pa'i don zhes bya ba ni shin tu med pa'i mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i don med pa'i don zhes bya ba ni shin tu med pa'i mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe meaning of non-existence‚Äù means the impermanence of complete non-existence.

original: skad cig la 'jig pa'i don yang mi rtag pa'i don du rig par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: skad cig la 'jig pa'i don yang mi rtag pa'i don du rig par bya ba yin pas /
translated: The meaning of destruction in a moment should also be understood as the meaning of impermanence.

original: skad cig la 'jig pa'i mi rtag pa nyid bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig la 'jig pa'i mi rtag pa nyid bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: The impermanence of momentary destruction is established.

original: nga ni chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba gang zag la bdag med pa sgrub po //
analyzed: nga ni chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba gang zag la bdag med pa sgrub po //
translated: I teach that all things are selfless, establishing the selflessness of persons.

original: ji ltar mgo gcig tu ma yin pa'i smra ba yongs su gzung na zhes bya ba ni mgo gcig tu gang zag yod do zhe'am /
analyzed: ji ltar mgo gcig tu ma yin pa'i smra ba yongs su gzung na zhes bya ba ni mgo gcig tu gang zag yod do zhe'am /
translated: If one accepts the doctrine of non-one-sidedness,

original: med do zhes smra ba yongs su gzung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: med do zhes smra ba yongs su gzung bar mi bya ste /
translated: one should not accept the doctrine that the person exists or does not exist.

original: de'i phyir mgo gcig tu ma yin pa'i smra ba yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mgo gcig tu ma yin pa'i smra ba yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
translated: Therefore, one accepts the doctrine of non-one-sidedness.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni blos rtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni blos rtogs pa yin na /
translated: If the object is that which is perceived by the mind,

original: gang zag ni gang zag tu smra ba rnams kyis blos mi rtogs pa yang ma yin la zhes bya ba 'di ni gang zag tu mngon par zhen pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: gang zag ni gang zag tu smra ba rnams kyis blos mi rtogs pa yang ma yin la zhes bya ba 'di ni gang zag tu mngon par zhen pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: the person is not imperceptible to the mind, according to those who believe in the person. This is the statement of the attachment to the person.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mjug thogs su bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang mthong ba'i chos kho na la bdag tu dmigs shing 'dogs par byed do zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mjug thogs su bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang mthong ba'i chos kho na la bdag tu dmigs shing 'dogs par byed do zhes gsungs na /
translated: Therefore, immediately after that, the Lord also said, ‚ÄúOne observes and designates the self in relation to the present phenomena alone.‚Äù

original: ji ltar mi dmigs pa yin zhas lung gis gang zag dmigs par ston to //üîΩgcig dang gzhan du brjod bya min //
analyzed: ji ltar mi dmigs pa yin zhas lung gis gang zag dmigs par ston to // gcig dang gzhan du brjod bya min //
translated: If that is so, how can it be said that the self is not observed?üîΩThe statement that the self is not described as the same or different

original: zhes bya ba ni gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
