analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gcig pa nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: means that it is not described as either the same or different.

original: gzhan nyid yin na ni gang zag rdzas su yod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rang bzhin @155a * //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin na ni gang zag rdzas su yod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rang bzhin @155a * //
translated: If it were different, it would follow, absurdly, that the person would be substantially existent.

original: gang yin pa de phung po dag gi rang bzhin yin par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang yin pa de phung po dag gi rang bzhin yin par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúthe nature of the self would be different from the nature of the aggregates‚Äù is this:

original: gal te rdzas yod brjod min pa'i //
analyzed: gal te rdzas yod brjod min pa'i //
translated: If it were substantially existent,

original: dgongs pa yang ni brjod dgos so //
analyzed: dgongs pa yang ni brjod dgos so //
translated: you would have to explain the Buddha‚Äôs intention.

original: zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir rdzas su yod pa yang yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir rdzas su yod pa yang yin la /
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúif it were substantially existent‚Äù is this: Why is it that the Buddha said that the self is not described as either the same as or different from the aggregates?

original: brjod par bya ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa brjod dgos so //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa brjod dgos so //
translated: The meaning of this statement must be explained.

original: 'di ltar me rlung gis khyer ba ni 'bar ba bzhin du rgyang bcad par yang 'gro'o zhes bya ba la me zhes smos pas ni me lce bzung ste bud shing med bzhin du rlung gis me 'bar ba bzhin du rgyang bcad par 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar me rlung gis khyer ba ni 'bar ba bzhin du rgyang bcad par yang 'gro'o zhes bya ba la me zhes smos pas ni me lce bzung ste bud shing med bzhin du rlung gis me 'bar ba bzhin du rgyang bcad par 'gro'o //
translated: When fire is carried by the wind, it travels far, as if it were ablaze without fuel. The word ‚Äúfire‚Äù refers to the flame, which, without fuel, is carried by the wind and travels far, as if it were ablaze.

original: rnam par shes pa 'di lta bur gyur cig ces bya ba de la bdag po yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di lta bur gyur cig ces bya ba de la bdag po yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúMay consciousness become like this‚Äù ‚Äî the person is the dominant condition for that.

original: de'i rkyen can zhes bya ba ni gang zag gi rkyen can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i rkyen can zhes bya ba ni gang zag gi rkyen can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúConditioned by that‚Äù means conditioned by the person.

original: nyes pa gsum 'byung ba'i phyir byed pa rang byung ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: nyes pa gsum 'byung ba'i phyir byed pa rang byung ba yang ma yin la /
translated: Consciousness does not arise from a creator, because three faults would ensue.

original: byed pa po ma yin pa la sogs pas nyes pa 'chad par 'gyur ba gsum po de nyid kyi phyir gang zag gi rkyen can yang ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin pa la sogs pas nyes pa 'chad par 'gyur ba gsum po de nyid kyi phyir gang zag gi rkyen can yang ma yin no //
translated: Consciousness does not arise from a creator, because three faults would ensue. The three faults are those that will be explained as applying to the creator, etc.

original: lta sogs byed pa med pa yin //
analyzed: lta sogs byed pa med pa yin //
translated: Seeing, etc. are without activity.

original: zhes bya ba ni byed pa med par yang rkyen tshogs na mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa 'di thams cad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byed pa med par yang rkyen tshogs na mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa 'di thams cad du 'gyur te /
translated: This is because all of these, seeing, hearing, etc., would occur even without an agent, if conditions were to assemble.

original: gang gi phyir rkyen tshogs na 'di thams cad du 'gyur ba de'i phyir gang zag la byed pa med pas lta ba la sogs pa la lta ba po nyid med pa nas rnam par shes pa po nyid kyi bar med do //üîΩ'on te byed pa gang zag gi rkyen can yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gang zag gis byed pa byed pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rkyen tshogs na 'di thams cad du 'gyur ba de'i phyir gang zag la byed pa med pas lta ba la sogs pa la lta ba po nyid med pa nas rnam par shes pa po nyid kyi bar med do // 'on te byed pa gang zag gi rkyen can yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gang zag gis byed pa byed pa'am /
translated: Since all of these would occur if conditions assemble, therefore, since the person does not perform the action, he is not a seer in terms of seeing, up to and he is not a cognizer in terms of cognizing.üîΩBut if the action is conditioned by the person,

original: de la brten nas byed pa skye na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: de la brten nas byed pa skye na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: this means that the person performs the action or that the action arises in dependence on the person.

original: de bzhin du gnas pa de ni rkyen nyid du rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas pa de ni rkyen nyid du rung ba ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, that which endures is not suitable as a condition.

original: snga na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rtag tu nye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snga na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rtag tu nye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it does not exist prior to the action, this means that it is always present.

original: snga na med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snga na med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it does not exist prior to the action,

original: byed pa skyes pa'i sngon rol byed pa skyes par ma gyur pa gang yin pa de ni sngon gyi gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: byed pa skyes pa'i sngon rol byed pa skyes par ma gyur pa gang yin pa de ni sngon gyi gnas skabs yin no //
translated: The state prior to the arising of the agent is the state in which the agent has not yet arisen.

original: 'on te de'i tshe gang zag med de des na byed pa skyes par ma gyur to zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'on te de'i tshe gang zag med de des na byed pa skyes par ma gyur to zhes zer na /
translated: But if you say that the person does not exist at that time, and therefore the agent has not yet arisen,

original: de la nyes pa 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la nyes pa 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: then this error would ensue.

original: zhig pa yang rkyen nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: zhig pa yang rkyen nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: The past state would not be a condition.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: gang zag mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang zag mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that the person would be impermanent.

original: de yang gang zag tu smra ba rnams mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de yang gang zag tu smra ba rnams mi 'dod do //
translated: But the proponents of the person do not accept that.

original: lnga pa las ni bdag tu @155b dmigs pa la nyes dmigs lnga bstan to zhes bya ba ni gcig las 'phros pa'i lung las chos lnga lnga'i dbang du byas nas chos bshad pa ni lnga pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lnga pa las ni bdag tu @155b dmigs pa la nyes dmigs lnga bstan to zhes bya ba ni gcig las 'phros pa'i lung las chos lnga lnga'i dbang du byas nas chos bshad pa ni lnga pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The fifth chapter explains five faults in the observation of the self.

original: bdag tu lta ba dag srog tu lta bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gcig tu ba lta'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dag srog tu lta bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gcig tu ba lta'o //
translated: The view of the self is the view of the life force.

original: stong pa nyid la yang 'di'i sems 'jug par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la yang 'di'i sems 'jug par mi 'gyur /
translated: And his mind does not enter into emptiness,

original: dad par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dad par mi 'gyur /
translated: he does not have faith in it,

original: yang dag par gnas par mi 'gyur mos par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba yang gcig tu bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par gnas par mi 'gyur mos par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba yang gcig tu bya'o //
translated: he does not abide in it correctly, he does not aspire to it.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i gang zag dag /üîΩkhur khyer ba'i gang zag dang / dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i bar du dbye bas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i gang zag dag / khur khyer ba'i gang zag dang / dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i bar du dbye bas /
translated: The Bhagavat has distinguished the person who is endowed with complete knowledge,üîΩthe person who takes up a burden, the person who follows trust, the person who follows the teaching, and so on.

original: gang zag kyang de dang des las bshad de /
analyzed: gang zag kyang de dang des las bshad de /
translated: The person is explained by these and other such distinctions.

original: zhes zer ba ni bdag tu smra ba'o //
analyzed: zhes zer ba ni bdag tu smra ba'o //
translated: To say this is to propound a self.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gang zag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gang zag ces bya ba la /
translated: In the state of defilement, the person is called the defiled person because he possesses the dharmas of defilement.

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba'i gnas skabs na ni rnam par byang ba'i gang zag go zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyi bye brag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba'i gnas skabs na ni rnam par byang ba'i gang zag go zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyi bye brag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar byed pa yin no //
translated: In the state of purification, he is a person of purification, because he is endowed with the qualities of purification.üîΩIn regard to these very states of affliction and purification, he is a person who afflicts or purifies, because he is the one who afflicts or purifies.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba de dag kho na la 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //üîΩ'di ni rnam par byang ba'o zhes bya ba ni gcod pa'i bye brag ste /üîΩgnas skabs kyi bye brag dang / gcod pa'i bye brag 'di dag thams cad kyang tha snyad gdags pa'i don du gang zag gi tha snyad kyis ston to //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba de dag kho na la 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o // 'di ni rnam par byang ba'o zhes bya ba ni gcod pa'i bye brag ste / gnas skabs kyi bye brag dang / gcod pa'i bye brag 'di dag thams cad kyang tha snyad gdags pa'i don du gang zag gi tha snyad kyis ston to //
translated: In regard to these very states of affliction and purification, he is a person who afflicts or purifies, because he is the one who afflicts or purifies.üîΩIn regard to these very states of affliction and purification, he is a person who afflicts or purifies, because he is the one who afflicts or purifies.üîΩIn regard to these very states of affliction and purification, he is a person who afflicts or purifies, because he is the one who afflicts or purifies.üîΩIn regard to these very states of affliction and purification, he is a person who afflicts or purifies, because he is the one who afflicts or purifies.üîΩIn regard to these very states of affliction and purification, he is a person who afflicts or purifies, because he is the one who afflicts or purifies.üîΩIn regard to these very states of affliction and purification, he is a person who afflicts or purifies, because he is the one who afflicts or purifies.üîΩIn regard to these very states of affliction and purification, he is a person who afflicts or purifies, because he is the one who afflicts or purifies.üîΩIn regard to these very states of affliction and purification, he is a person who afflicts or purifies, because he is the one who afflicts or purifies.üîΩIn regard to these very states of affliction and purification, he is a person who afflicts or purifies, because he is the one who afflicts or purifies.üîΩIn regard to these very states of affliction and purification, he is a person who afflicts or purifies, because he is the one who afflicts or purifies.üîΩIn regard to these very states of affliction and purification, he is a person who afflicts or purifies, because he is the one who afflicts or purifies.

original: de la gnas skabs kyi bye brag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yang chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag gis te /
analyzed: de la gnas skabs kyi bye brag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yang chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag gis te /
translated: In regard to these very states of affliction and purification, he is a person who afflicts or purifies, because he is the one who afflicts or purifies.

original: rnam par byang ba yang de kho na dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba yang de kho na dang 'dra'o //
translated: In regard to these very states of

original: gang zag kyang 'di ni 'dod chang chung ngo //
analyzed: gang zag kyang 'di ni 'dod chang chung ngo //
translated: The person is also distinguished: This one has little desire,

original: 'di ni 'dod chags 'bring ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod chags 'bring ngo //
translated: this one has medium desire,

original: 'di ni 'dod chags chen po'i zhes bya ba dang ; rnam par byang ba la yang gang zag 'di ni lam chung ngu thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod chags chen po'i zhes bya ba dang ; rnam par byang ba la yang gang zag 'di ni lam chung ngu thob pa'o //
translated: this one has great desire, and This person has attained the small path,

original: 'di ni lam 'bring dang chen po thob pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyis bye brag yin no //üîΩkun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag gis gcod pa'i bye brag ni gang zag gang zhig gcig tu mi @156a * //
analyzed: 'di ni lam 'bring dang chen po thob pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyis bye brag yin no // kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag gis gcod pa'i bye brag ni gang zag gang zhig gcig tu mi @156a * //
translated: this one has attained the medium path, this one has attained the great path, in terms of purification.üîΩThe distinction of cutting off in terms of defilement and purification is as follows: The person who always performs non-virtuous actions is distinguished as being defiled.

original: dge ba'i las byed pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yin par gcod pa'i bye brag dang gang zhig gcig tu rnam par byang ba'i las byed pa de ni rnam par byang ba yin par gcod pa'i bye brag go //
analyzed: dge ba'i las byed pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yin par gcod pa'i bye brag dang gang zhig gcig tu rnam par byang ba'i las byed pa de ni rnam par byang ba yin par gcod pa'i bye brag go //
translated: The person who always performs purified actions is distinguished as being purified.

original: de dag gi 'jug pa'i bye brag dang / rgyun gyi bye brag ces bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dag ge'o //
analyzed: de dag gi 'jug pa'i bye brag dang / rgyun gyi bye brag ces bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dag ge'o //
translated: The specific engagement and the specific continuum refer to defilement and purification.

original: 'jug pa ni 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa ni 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Engagement is engagement in the sense of being engaged.

original: tha snyad pa'i gang zag gang zhig la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'am /
analyzed: tha snyad pa'i gang zag gang zhig la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'am /
translated: The specific engagement is the engagement of a conventional person in the absence of defilement orüîΩthe engagement in purification.

original: rnam par byang ba rab tu 'jug pa de ni 'jug pa'i bye brag yin la /üîΩrgyun gyis 'jug pa de ni /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba rab tu 'jug pa de ni 'jug pa'i bye brag yin la / rgyun gyis 'jug pa de ni /
translated: The specific continuum is the engagement of a continuum.

original: rgyun gyi bye brag yin no //
analyzed: rgyun gyi bye brag yin no //
translated: The specific continuum is the engagement of a continuum.

original: yongs su shes par bya ba'i chos rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa dag go //
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba'i chos rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa dag go //
translated: The dharmas that are to be fully understood are defilement, i.e., the truths of suffering and origin.

original: yongs su shes pa ni rnam par byang ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa dag ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa ni rnam par byang ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa dag ste /
translated: Full understanding is purification, i.e., the truths of cessation and path.

original: 'gog pa dang bden pa la yongs su shes pa nyid ces bya ba ni yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu yin pas 'bras bu las rgyu nye bar brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang bden pa la yongs su shes pa nyid ces bya ba ni yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu yin pas 'bras bu las rgyu nye bar brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The truth of cessation is called ‚Äúcomplete knowledge‚Äù because it is the result of complete knowledge.

original: khur ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: khur ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of suffering is the burden.

original: khur khyer ba ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: khur khyer ba ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of origin is the taking up of the burden.

original: khung 'dor ba ni rnam par byang ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa dag ste /
analyzed: khung 'dor ba ni rnam par byang ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa dag ste /
translated: The truth of cessation is the laying down of the burden, and the truth of the path is the means of laying it down.

original: ji ltar de gnyis khur 'dor ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de gnyis khur 'dor ba yin zhe na /
translated: How are these two the laying down of the burden?

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa'i phyir dang / kun 'byung spong phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa'i phyir dang / kun 'byung spong phyir ro //
translated: Because suffering is completely known through the knowledge of the noble ones, and because origin is abandoned.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la kun shes pa dang / ldan pa zhes bya ba dang khur khyer ba zhes bya bar tha snyad gdags par mi nus kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gang zag brtags pa ni tha snyad gdags par bya bas de'i phyir tha snyad kyi don du gang zag gdags pa
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po la kun shes pa dang / ldan pa zhes bya ba dang khur khyer ba zhes bya bar tha snyad gdags par mi nus kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gang zag brtags pa ni tha snyad gdags par bya bas de'i phyir tha snyad kyi don du gang zag gdags pa
translated: But the imputed person who is afflicted or purified is to be conventionally designated, and therefore the person is designated for the sake of conventional usage.

original: mdzad do // de ltar yon tan de dag dang // rtag ldan zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mdzad do // de ltar yon tan de dag dang // rtag ldan zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúEndowed with those virtues‚Äù means endowed with the virtues of conscience, etc.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on the factors of enlightenment is completed.

original: // /'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa'i dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyi khyad par gyi sgo nas bslab pa'i lam rnam pa thams cad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: // /'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa'i dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyi khyad par gyi sgo nas bslab pa'i lam rnam pa thams cad bstan pa yin te /
translated: This chapter has presented the entire path of training from the point of view of the bodhisattvas‚Äô training, its objective, its aspects, and its essential nature.

original: @156b de la slob pa rnams bsgrub pa'i yon tan dang rab tu bsngags pa'i yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: @156b de la slob pa rnams bsgrub pa'i yon tan dang rab tu bsngags pa'i yon tan dang ldan par 'gyur bas /
translated: Since those in training come to possess the qualities of accomplishment and the qualities of high praise,

original: de'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i 'og tu yon tan gyi skabs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i 'og tu yon tan gyi skabs so //
translated: the chapter on qualities follows immediately after the chapter on the elements that lead to enlightenment.

original: de la sgrub pa'i yon tan ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la sgrub pa'i yon tan ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The qualities of accomplishment are threefold:

original: rgyu mthun pa'i yon tan dang / bral ba'i yon tan dang / sems can la mngon du phyogs pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i yon tan dang / bral ba'i yon tan dang / sems can la mngon du phyogs pa'i yon tan no //
translated: the qualities of natural outcome, the qualities of freedom and the qualities that are directed toward sentient beings.

original: da la rgyu mthun pa'i yon tan ni /
analyzed: da la rgyu mthun pa'i yon tan ni /
translated: The qualities of natural outcome

original: yun ring po nas bslab pa'i lam la goms pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yun ring po nas bslab pa'i lam la goms pa'i phyir /
translated: are the path of accumulation that is close to the path of training,üîΩthe path that is taught to be irreversible and the path that is gentle and long-lasting.

original: dge ba'i tshogs dang nye bar gyur pa'i lam phyi phyir zhing gzhan du mi 'gyur bar bstan pa dang / des pa dang yun ring bar 'jug pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: dge ba'i tshogs dang nye bar gyur pa'i lam phyi phyir zhing gzhan du mi 'gyur bar bstan pa dang / des pa dang yun ring bar 'jug pa nyid yin te /
translated: They are the absence of relishing

original: brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang bsam gtan gyi /üîΩbde la ro myong med /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang bsam gtan gyi /üîΩbde la ro myong med /
translated: in effort and meditative concentration.

original: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis kyis ni rgyu mthun pa'i yon tan bshad do //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis kyis ni rgyu mthun pa'i yon tan bshad do //
translated: These two verses explain the qualities of natural outcome.

original: bral ba'i 'bras bu ni mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam dag gis de dag gis spang bar bya ba'i gnas ngan len spangs pa'i phyir gnas dri ma med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: bral ba'i 'bras bu ni mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam dag gis de dag gis spang bar bya ba'i gnas ngan len spangs pa'i phyir gnas dri ma med pa nyid yin te /
translated: The effect of separation is the stainlessness of the stage, because the paths of seeing and cultivation eliminate the negative tendencies eliminated by those paths.

original: de bzhin gshegs rigs skye ba dang // zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba 'di ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs rigs skye ba dang // zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba 'di ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: The birth in the family of the Tathagata, which will be explained, is the path of seeing.

original: de yan chad sa brgyad pa la lung bstan pa thob pa dang / sa bcu pa la dbang bskur ba thob pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: de yan chad sa brgyad pa la lung bstan pa thob pa dang / sa bcu pa la dbang bskur ba thob pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: From there on, up to the attainment of the prediction on the eighth stage and the attainment of consecration on the tenth stage, is the path of cultivation.

original: byang chub thob pa ni sangs rgyas kyis la'o //
analyzed: byang chub thob pa ni sangs rgyas kyis la'o //
translated: The attainment of enlightenment is the buddha stage.

original: de ltar yon tan phul du 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ngo mtshar mi che ba'i yon tan thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yon tan phul du 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ngo mtshar mi che ba'i yon tan thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because of possessing the most excellent qualities, one attains the quality of being free from amazement.

original: sems can thams cad la bdag dang / sems mnyam pa'i skabs nas /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la bdag dang / sems mnyam pa'i skabs nas /
translated: The section on the equality of self and others begins with the verse:

original: ji ltar blo ldan sems can la //
analyzed: ji ltar blo ldan sems can la //
translated: As will be explained in the verse:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba lta bu yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe wise one is always engaged in benefiting sentient beings.üîΩ‚Äù

original: sems mnyam pa ni rtag tu phan par bya ba la rab tu 'jug ste /üîΩphan 'dogs pa nyid rnam par dbye ba las /
analyzed: sems mnyam pa ni rtag tu phan par bya ba la rab tu 'jug ste / phan 'dogs pa nyid rnam par dbye ba las /
translated: The equality of mind is always engaged in benefiting.

original: snod nyid du ni byed pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa bcu drug 'byung ba lta bu yin te /
analyzed: snod nyid du ni byed pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa bcu drug 'byung ba lta bu yin te /
translated: The verse with sixteen quarter, beginning with ‚Äúmaking them fit vessels‚Äù is the analysis of the quality of benefiting.

original: phan 'dogs pa nyid kyi yon tan 'di ni sems can la mngon du phyogs pa'i yon tan yin par shes par bya'o //üîΩlan du phan 'dogs pa yang 'dod de /üîΩlan du phan 'dogs pa rnam par dbye ba las /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa nyid kyi yon tan 'di ni sems can la mngon du phyogs pa'i yon tan yin par shes par bya'o // lan du phan 'dogs pa yang 'dod de / lan du phan 'dogs pa rnam par dbye ba las /
translated: This quality of benefiting should be understood as a quality that faces sentient beings.

original: longs spyod rnams la ma chags dang // zhes @157a * //
analyzed: longs spyod rnams la ma chags dang // zhes @157a * //
translated: The verse beginning with ‚Äúnot desiring anything in return‚Äù is the analysis of the quality of benefiting without seeking anything in return.üîΩAs will be explained:üîΩ‚ÄúNot attached to wealth,üîΩ‚Äù

original: bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: and so on.

original: de ltar rab tu brtson pa ni rtag tu de dag la phan pa dang bde bar 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar rab tu brtson pa ni rtag tu de dag la phan pa dang bde bar 'dod do //
translated: Thus, one who is so engaged always desires the benefit and happiness of sentient beings.

original: smon pa rnam par dbye ba las //
analyzed: smon pa rnam par dbye ba las //
translated: The verse beginning with ‚Äúthe aspiration for the Great Vehicle‚Äù is the analysis of the quality of aspiration.

original: rtag tu 'phel dang nyams pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: rtag tu 'phel dang nyams pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba lta bu yin no //
translated: as will be explained in the verse: ‚Äúalways increasing and decreasing.

original: de ltar phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa can ni de dag la sbyor ba chud mi za bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa can ni de dag la sbyor ba chud mi za bar byed do //
translated: ‚Äù Thus, one who has the attitude of benefit and happiness makes their practice inexhaustible.

original: chud mi za ba nyid rnam par dbye ba las /
analyzed: chud mi za ba nyid rnam par dbye ba las /
translated: The inexhaustible is divided into:üîΩabandoning fear, and generating.

original: 'jigs spangs yang dag bskyed pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba lta bu yin te /
analyzed: 'jigs spangs yang dag bskyed pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba lta bu yin te /
translated: as will be explained.

original: 'di ni sgrub pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par gong nas gong du sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sgrub pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par gong nas gong du sgrub pa yin no //
translated: This is the accomplishment of the distinctive qualities of practice, higher and higher.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' phan yon gyi yon tan gyi khyad par gyi sgo nas lung bstan pa 'thob kyi /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' phan yon gyi yon tan gyi khyad par gyi sgo nas lung bstan pa 'thob kyi /
translated: There, the bodhisattva obtains the prophecy by way of the distinctive quality of the benefit and virtue.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: But not the ≈õrƒÅvaka and pratyekabuddha.

original: lung bstan pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lung bstan pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The prophecy is the state of irreversibility.

original: de la gnas pa ni gdon mi za bar bya dgos pa la mi brjed pa'i chos nyid thob po //
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni gdon mi za bar bya dgos pa la mi brjed pa'i chos nyid thob po //
translated: Abiding in that, one necessarily attains the nature of non-forgetfulness regarding what must be done.

original: de ltar mi brjed pa'i chos can ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu gdags pa rnams kyi nang du 'dogs pa mdzad cing bya ba thams cad kyang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar mi brjed pa'i chos can ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu gdags pa rnams kyi nang du 'dogs pa mdzad cing bya ba thams cad kyang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur /
translated: He does not fail by failing to realize what has been increased.üîΩHe does not fail by failing to manifest what has been realized.üîΩHe does not fail by failing to teach what has been manifested.üîΩHe does not fail by failing to purify what has been taught.üîΩHe does not fail by failing to attain what has been purified.üîΩHe does not fail by failing to maintain what has been attained.üîΩHe does not fail by failing to increase what has been maintained.üîΩHe does not fail by failing to realize what has been increased.

original: mi thob pa las yongs su nyams pas kyang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi thob pa las yongs su nyams pas kyang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He does not fail by failing to manifest what has been realized.üîΩHe does not fail by failing to teach what has been manifested.üîΩHe does not fail by failing to purify what has been taught.üîΩHe does not fail by failing to attain what has been purified.üîΩHe does not fail by failing to maintain what has been attained.

original: yongs su mi nyams pa ni zla ba yar gyi ngo la skye ba bzhin du rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i chos rnams kyis 'phel bas /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' chen por 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: yongs su mi nyams pa ni zla ba yar gyi ngo la skye ba bzhin du rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i chos rnams kyis 'phel bas / byang chub sems dpa' chen por 'gyur gyi /
translated: He does not fail by failing to increase what has been maintained.üîΩHe does not fail by failing to realize what has been increased.üîΩHe does not fail by failing to manifest what has been realized.üîΩHe does not fail by failing to teach what has been manifested.üîΩHe does not fail by failing to purify what has been taught.üîΩHe does not fail by failing to attain what has been purified.üîΩHe does not fail by failing to maintain what has been attained.

original: bcos ma ni ma yin no //üîΩyang dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can gdul ba'i thabs rnam pa thams cad shes so //
analyzed: bcos ma ni ma yin no // yang dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can gdul ba'i thabs rnam pa thams cad shes so //
translated: He does not fail by failing to increase what has been maintained.

original: de shes pa ni de rnam par gzhag pa la mkhas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de shes pa ni de rnam par gzhag pa la mkhas par 'gyur te /
translated: He does not fail by failing to realize what has been increased.üîΩHe does not fail by failing to manifest what has been realized.üîΩHe does not fail by failing to teach what has been manifested.üîΩHe does not fail by failing to purify what has been taught.üîΩHe does not fail by failing to attain what has been purified.üîΩHe does not fail by failing to maintain what has been attained.üîΩHe does not fail by failing to increase what has been maintained.üîΩHe does not fail by failing to realize what has been increased.üîΩHe does not fail by failing to manifest what has been realized.

original: gang dang ji ltar brtsal bar bya ba de dag rnam par 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: gang dang ji ltar brtsal bar bya ba de dag rnam par 'jog par byed do //
translated: He does not fail by failing to teach what

original: rnam par gzhag ba la mkhas pa ni gdams ngag la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag ba la mkhas pa ni gdams ngag la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Skill in positing is skill in instruction.

original: gdams ngag la mkhas pa ni tshad med pa la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po 'thob po //
analyzed: gdams ngag la mkhas pa ni tshad med pa la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po 'thob po //
translated: Skill in instruction is the attainment of the king of samadhis, which has immeasurable objects.

original: ting nge 'dzin de 'thob pa ni chos bshad pa don yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de 'thob pa ni chos bshad pa don yod par 'gyur te /
translated: The attainment of that samadhi is the success of the explanation of the Dharma.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs kyis bshad pa 'bras bu dang bcas par yar byed /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs kyis bshad pa 'bras bu dang bcas par yar byed /
translated: It is the performance of the various explanations with their fruits.

original: @157b theg pa chen po la nges par 'byung ba yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @157b theg pa chen po la nges par 'byung ba yang 'gyur ro //
translated: One also becomes liberated in the Mahayana.

original: chen po nyid du nges par 'byung ba ni theg pa chen po bsdus pa la mkhas par 'gyur te /üîΩde ltar na rgyu mthun pa dang bral ba dang / sems can la mngon par phyogs pa'i yon tan gsum po 'di dag ni ngo mtshar che ba dang ngo mtshar mi che ba rab tu dbye ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: chen po nyid du nges par 'byung ba ni theg pa chen po bsdus pa la mkhas par 'gyur te / de ltar na rgyu mthun pa dang bral ba dang / sems can la mngon par phyogs pa'i yon tan gsum po 'di dag ni ngo mtshar che ba dang ngo mtshar mi che ba rab tu dbye ba nas bzung ste /
translated: Liberation in the great is skill in the collection of the Mahayana.

original: theg pa chen po bsdu ba'i skabs kyi bar gyis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdu ba'i skabs kyi bar gyis shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, these three qualities of natural outcome, freedom, and orientation toward sentient beings should be understood from the division of the marvelous and the not marvelous up to the section on the collection of the Mahayana.

original: de'i 'og tu ni byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan bstan pas rab tu bsngags pa'i yon tan 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan bstan pas rab tu bsngags pa'i yon tan 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, the qualities of the bodhisattva are taught, and the qualities of praise are explained.üîΩIn the verse,

original: tshigs su bcad pa las /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa las /
translated: it is said:

original: sdom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdom pa'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of restraint,

original: phun sum tshogs pa yongs su gtong ba dang // zhes bshad pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa yongs su gtong ba dang // zhes bshad pa gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: one gives up perfection.

original: ched kyi 'dun par bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: ched kyi 'dun par bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is explained for the purpose of intention.

original: sdom pa'i ched du phun sum tshogs pa gtong pa 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ngo mtshar che ba yin no //
analyzed: sdom pa'i ched du phun sum tshogs pa gtong pa 'di ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ngo mtshar che ba yin no //
translated: Giving up perfection for the sake of restraint is the marvel of the perfection of morality.

original: lus dang srog la mi lta bar brtson 'grus rtsom pa gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ngo mtshar che ba yin no //
analyzed: lus dang srog la mi lta bar brtson 'grus rtsom pa gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ngo mtshar che ba yin no //
translated: The marvel of the perfection of effort is the effort that is undertaken without regard for body or life.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la brten nas sbyin pa la sbyor ba ngo mtshar mi che'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dngos po srung stong ri ba gang yin pa de la 'dod chags dang bral ba bskyed nas yongs su gtong ngo zhes bya ba 'di
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la brten nas sbyin pa la sbyor ba ngo mtshar mi che'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dngos po srung stong ri ba gang yin pa de la 'dod chags dang bral ba bskyed nas yongs su gtong ngo zhes bya ba 'di
translated: It is not surprising that one who is free from attachment should practice generosity.

original: ni ngo mtshar mi che'o //
analyzed: ni ngo mtshar mi che'o //
translated: This is not surprising, since a bodhisattva generates freedom from attachment toward the very things that he protects and then gives them away.

original: snying rje ni sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: snying rje ni sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i rnam pa yin te /
translated: Compassion is the aspect of freedom from suffering.

original: snying rje la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams gzhan la sdug bsngal skyed par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ngo mtshar mi che'o //
analyzed: snying rje la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams gzhan la sdug bsngal skyed par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ngo mtshar mi che'o //
translated: It is not surprising that bodhisattvas, on the basis of compassion, do not inflict suffering on others.

original: snying rje ba yang gzhan dag las lus dang ngag gi mi 'dod pa 'byung ba thams cad bzod pas bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la ngo mtshar mi che'o //
analyzed: snying rje ba yang gzhan dag las lus dang ngag gi mi 'dod pa 'byung ba thams cad bzod pas bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la ngo mtshar mi che'o //
translated: Compassion is also the patience of accepting the unwanted, since one patiently accepts all the unwanted things that happen to one from others.

original: sems mnyam pa nyid kyang bslab pa'i phan yon yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: sems mnyam pa nyid kyang bslab pa'i phan yon yin pa kho na ste /
translated: The equality of mind is also a benefit of the training.

original: sems can rnams ni bdag nyid la sogs pa la byams pa mnyam pa nyid dang ; ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la byams pa yang gzhan du yin la /
analyzed: sems can rnams ni bdag nyid la sogs pa la byams pa mnyam pa nyid dang ; ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la byams pa yang gzhan du yin la /
translated: Sentient beings are not endowed with the same loving kindness toward themselves and others.

original: bu dang bshes dang chung ma la sogs pa la yang gzhan du ma yin pas so //
analyzed: bu dang bshes dang chung ma la sogs pa la yang gzhan du ma yin pas so //
translated: Loving kindness toward oneself is one thing, and toward children, friends, spouses, and so on is another.üîΩThey are not permanent.

original: gtan du ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba de bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar res 'ga' bdag nyid kyang gsod par byed do zhes bya @158a * //üîΩba smos so //
analyzed: gtan du ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba de bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar res 'ga' bdag nyid kyang gsod par byed do zhes bya @158a * // ba smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it says, ‚ÄúFor sometimes they even kill themselves.‚ÄùüîΩBecause they never violate even the slightest moral discipline.

original: tshul khrims la ni rtag tu phra ba rab tsam yang mi nyams pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba'i bslab pa'i gzhi 'dral bar mi byed pa ltar bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba rtsva gcod pa la sogs
analyzed: tshul khrims la ni rtag tu phra ba rab tsam yang mi nyams pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba'i bslab pa'i gzhi 'dral bar mi byed pa ltar bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba rtsva gcod pa la sogs
translated: Just as they do not violate the precepts of natural morality, so too they do not violate the precepts of moral training in regard to the minor faults of cutting grass and so on.

original: pa yang de dang 'dra ste /üîΩde ltar na mnyam pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: pa yang de dang 'dra ste /üîΩde ltar na mnyam pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus they are the same.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don dang dge ba thams cad kyi don du mnyam par sbyor ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don dang dge ba thams cad kyi don du mnyam par sbyor ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus dang sbyor ro //
translated: because it is applied equally for the sake of self and other and for the sake of all virtue.

original: sems can la mngon par phyogs pa'i yon tan ni ma la sogs pa dang 'dra ba nyid kyis ston par byed do //
analyzed: sems can la mngon par phyogs pa'i yon tan ni ma la sogs pa dang 'dra ba nyid kyis ston par byed do //
translated: The qualities of being directed toward sentient beings are shown by being like a mother, etc.

original: khong na 'dzin par byed ces bya ba ni lto na 'dzin par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: khong na 'dzin par byed ces bya ba ni lto na 'dzin par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It holds them in its belly means it holds them in its womb.

original: lto yang kha cig tu khong zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: lto yang kha cig tu khong zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: In some places, the word ‚Äúbelly‚Äù is expressed by the word ‚Äúwomb.‚Äù

original: bsam pa ni khong lta bu ste /
analyzed: bsam pa ni khong lta bu ste /
translated: The intention is like a belly.

original: bsam pa mnyam zhing mtshungs pas sems can la 'dzin par byed pas na /
analyzed: bsam pa mnyam zhing mtshungs pas sems can la 'dzin par byed pas na /
translated: Because it holds sentient beings with an equal, uniform intention,

original: bsam pa mnyam pas sems can rnams 'dzin par byed ces bya'o ;
analyzed: bsam pa mnyam pas sems can rnams 'dzin par byed ces bya'o ;
translated: it is said that it holds sentient beings with an equal intention.

original: /'phags pa'i sa ni 'phags pa'i chos yin zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i chos te /
analyzed: /'phags pa'i sa ni 'phags pa'i chos yin zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i chos te /
translated: The ƒÅrya stage is the ƒÅrya dharmas, which are the uncontaminated dharmas.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi rjes la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam dang / de dag gis thob par bya ba so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi rjes la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam dang / de dag gis thob par bya ba so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa'o //
translated: For the sravakas, the path of seeing is the path of preparation, the path of application, the uninterrupted path, the path of liberation, and the distinctive path.üîΩThe path of preparation is the supreme mundane state.üîΩThe path of application is the perseverance for the knowledge of the doctrine with regard to suffering and so on.üîΩThe uninterrupted path is the knowledge of the doctrine with regard to suffering and so on.üîΩThe path of liberation is the perseverance for the subsequent knowledge of the doctrine with regard to suffering and so on.üîΩThe distinctive path is the path of liberation and the uninterrupted path.üîΩThe result of the path of seeing is the state of an arhat and the analytical cessation obtained by that.üîΩ

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dang po thob pa'i dus nas bzung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dang po thob pa'i dus nas bzung ste /
translated: For the sravakas, the path of insight is the path of the spiritual trainees and the path of the adept, which are subsequent to the supreme mundane events, such as the acquiescence to the knowledge of the teaching on suffering, and the cessation that is attained by them, which is the cessation due to deliberation.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang / de'i spyod yul /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang / de'i spyod yul /
translated: For the bodhisattvas, it is the nonimaginative wisdom and its domain,

original: de bzhin nyid do //üîΩsnun par byed /üîΩgso bar byed /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid do // snun par byed / gso bar byed /
translated: suchness.üîΩIt is the one action ofüîΩnourishing,

original: kun tu skyed par byed ces bya ba ni las gcig ste /
analyzed: kun tu skyed par byed ces bya ba ni las gcig ste /
translated: rearing,üîΩandüîΩdeveloping.

original: snun pa ni nu ma snun pa'o //üîΩgso ba ni zhun mar dang mar dkar la sogs pas gso ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: snun pa ni nu ma snun pa'o // gso ba ni zhun mar dang mar dkar la sogs pas gso ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Nourishing is the nourishing of the breast.üîΩRearing is the rearing by means of ghee, milk, etc.

original: kun tu skyed par byed pa ni byis pa la bsku mnye la sogs pas yan lag dang nying lag rnams bskyed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu skyed par byed pa ni byis pa la bsku mnye la sogs pas yan lag dang nying lag rnams bskyed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Developing is the development of the major and minor limbs by means of massage, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang sems can rnams bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis bsdus nas gsos te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang sems can rnams bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis bsdus nas gsos te /
translated: The bodhisattva also nourishes sentient beings by gathering them with the four social practices such as giving material things, and so on.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams kyis kun tu skyed bar byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams kyis kun tu skyed bar byed do //
translated: He causes them to grow by means of mundane and supramundane virtuous qualities.

original: bshes gnyen dam pa dag la 'doms par byed ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: bshes gnyen dam pa dag la 'doms par byed ces bya ba ni /
translated: He instructs them in the presence of holy superiors.

original: sangs rgyas la gsol ba 'debs pa'i sgo nas te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la gsol ba 'debs pa'i sgo nas te /
translated: This means that he prays to the Buddhas.

original: bshes gnyen @158b dam pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: bshes gnyen @158b dam pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: The holy superiors are the Buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: chags nyen med par byed ces bya ba ni sgrib pa spong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags nyen med par byed ces bya ba ni sgrib pa spong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He makes them free from danger by eliminating the obscurations.

original: 'os pa ma yin pa dag la zab mo bshad pa gsang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thos ba nyung du ni chos zab mo bshad par 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'os pa ma yin pa dag la zab mo bshad pa gsang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thos ba nyung du ni chos zab mo bshad par 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: He does not explain the profound to those who are not suitable vessels, because it is secret. Those who have little learning are not suitable vessels for the explanation of the profound.

original: 'jig rten pa'i phun sum tshogs pa ni bde ba ste zhes bya ba ni 'khor los sgyur ba dang / brgya byin dang tshangs pa nyid la sogs yongs su bsdus pa de ni 'jig rten pa'i phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i phun sum tshogs pa ni bde ba ste zhes bya ba ni 'khor los sgyur ba dang / brgya byin dang tshangs pa nyid la sogs yongs su bsdus pa de ni 'jig rten pa'i phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: The mundane perfection is happiness, which is included in the universal monarchs, Sakra, Brahma, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' snying rje'i bsam pas yongs su zin pa rnams ni skyo ba med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba las mi byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' snying rje'i bsam pas yongs su zin pa rnams ni skyo ba med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba las mi byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas, who are imbued with the spirit of enlightenment, do not become weary, and so they do not fail in the duties of a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bran lta bu yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bran lta bu yin te /
translated: The bodhisattvas are like servants.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams yang dag pa'i nges par 'byung bar 'byung ba sma ba nyid kyis mi slu ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams yang dag pa'i nges par 'byung bar 'byung ba sma ba nyid kyis mi slu ba yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas are not deceptive, because they are dedicated to the true deliverance of all beings.

original: phun sum tshogs pa gnyis ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams phun sum tshogs pa gnyis sbyin par byed pa gnyis kyis bzod pa yin te /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa gnyis ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams phun sum tshogs pa gnyis sbyin par byed pa gnyis kyis bzod pa yin te /
translated: The two perfections are mundane and supramundane. The bodhisattvas are patient with the two perfections, which are given to the two kinds of beings.

original: sems can rnams kyis thams cad bye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis thams cad bye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because all sentient beings are to be caused to enter it.

original: bdag nyid legs par bslabs pa yin zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i lam thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid legs par bslabs pa yin zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i lam thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who is well trained is one who has attained the path of no-more-learning, because he has attained the acceptance of the non-arising of all dharmas on the eighth stage.

original: rnal 'byor grub par sbyor ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor grub par sbyor ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The application to the accomplishment of yoga is as follows:

original: rnal 'byor grub pa ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi rnal 'byor te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor grub pa ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi rnal 'byor te /
translated: The accomplishment of yoga is the yoga of serenity and insight.

original: nyan thos sam byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pas /
analyzed: nyan thos sam byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pas /
translated: The beginner bodhisattva

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la ji ltar sbyar bar bya ba'i sbyor ba de ston pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la ji ltar sbyar bar bya ba'i sbyor ba de ston pa'i phyir /
translated: should apply himself to serenity and insight in the following way.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam ni rnal 'byor grub pa ston par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam ni rnal 'byor grub pa ston par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is called the one who shows the accomplishment of yoga.

original: nges pa'i rang bzhin can ni tshig snyan pa sbyin pa la sogs pas khro gnyer dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i rang bzhin can ni tshig snyan pa sbyin pa la sogs pas khro gnyer dang bral ba yin no //
translated: The one who is of a certain nature is the one who is free from frowns through giving kind words and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' shin tu brtson pa rnams ni tshogs thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' shin tu brtson pa rnams ni tshogs thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: The bodhisattvas who are very diligent complete all the collections.

original: tshogs rdzogs pa ni rab tu byung ba dang chos mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: tshogs rdzogs pa ni rab tu byung ba dang chos mthun pa yin no //
translated: The completion of the collections is similar to full ordination.

original: tshogs bsags myur du grol bar byed //
analyzed: tshogs bsags myur du grol bar byed //
translated: The accumulation of the collections quickly brings liberation.

original: ces bya ba ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang chos mthun pa yin te /üîΩgang zag bsnyen par rdzogs pa ni bslab pa'i /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang chos mthun pa yin te / gang zag bsnyen par rdzogs pa ni bslab pa'i /
translated: This is similar to full ordination,

original: @159a * // gzhi nyis brgya lnga bcu bsrung ba'i sgo nas bya ba ma yin pa'i chos dag las grol bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: @159a * // gzhi nyis brgya lnga bcu bsrung ba'i sgo nas bya ba ma yin pa'i chos dag las grol bar 'gyur bas /
translated: because the person who is fully ordained is liberated from actions that are not to be done by observing the two hundred and fifty precepts.

original: de'i phyir tshogs bsags pa dag myur du grol bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs bsags pa dag myur du grol bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the accumulation of the collections quickly brings liberation.üîΩA verse on the non-wastage of application

original: sbyor ba chud mi za ba nyid rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa spang pa la sogs pa'i don du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyor ba chud mi za ba yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba chud mi za ba nyid rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa spang pa la sogs pa'i don du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyor ba chud mi za ba yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas‚Äô application is not wasted, because it is never overcome, because it is irreproachable, because it is not deficient, and because it is continuous.

original: nga rgyal ni bzod pa'i yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i skal pa can gyi chos yin no zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal gyis mi bzod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga rgyal ni bzod pa'i yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i skal pa can gyi chos yin no zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal gyis mi bzod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Pride is the quality that leads to the degeneration of patience, because one who is proud is not patient.üîΩOne verse on the analysis of pretended and real virtues.

original: bcos ma'i yon tan rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la sgos ni sprul pa la sogs pa sgrub pa dang bral ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yon tan bcos ma yin la /
analyzed: bcos ma'i yon tan rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba la sgos ni sprul pa la sogs pa sgrub pa dang bral ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yon tan bcos ma yin la /
translated: Pretended virtues are the virtues of bodhisattvas that are not accompanied by the perfections.

original: de dag nyid sgrub pa dang ldan pa ni yang dag pa'i yon tan yin no //
analyzed: de dag nyid sgrub pa dang ldan pa ni yang dag pa'i yon tan yin no //
translated: Real virtues are those that are accompanied by the perfections.

original: byang chub tu lung ston pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub tu lung ston pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: The prediction of enlightenment is the prediction of the bodhisattvas by the Lord Buddhas to unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

original: lung ston par lung ston pa zhes bya ba ni nyid du lung mi ston gyi gzhan 'di skad du lung ston to zhes bya ba ste /üîΩde nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: lung ston par lung ston pa zhes bya ba ni nyid du lung mi ston gyi gzhan 'di skad du lung ston to zhes bya ba ste / de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The prediction of the prediction is not a prediction of the present, but a prediction of the future, At such a time, you will receive a prediction from the Tathagata named so-and-so.

original: 'di'i dus che ge mo zhig na de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan 'di zhes bya bas lung ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'di'i dus che ge mo zhig na de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan 'di zhes bya bas lung ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: For this very reason, it is said, At that time, the Tathagata named so-and-so will give you a prediction.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par lung bstan pas nga rgyal spangs pa dang mtshan ma'i rtsol ba thams cad spangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par lung bstan pas nga rgyal spangs pa dang mtshan ma'i rtsol ba thams cad spangs par 'gyur te /
translated: By receiving the prediction of the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas, one abandons pride and all efforts based on signs.

original: de'i phyir / mi skye bzod pa thob pa yi //
analyzed: de'i phyir / mi skye bzod pa thob pa yi //
translated: For this reason, it is said, The acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: nga rgyal dang rtsol pa spangs pa'i sgo nas lung bstan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang rtsol pa spangs pa'i sgo nas lung bstan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: By abandoning pride and effort, one is said to receive a prediction.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa kun tu spyod pas phun sum tshogs pa dang skye ba la sogs pa la gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ni des nges par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa kun tu spyod pas phun sum tshogs pa dang skye ba la sogs pa la gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ni des nges par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The perfection of the perfection of practice is the perfection of the perfection of practice. The certainty of birth and so on is the certainty of birth and so on.

original: rtag tu lhun gyis grub par rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa la sogs pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pas lhun gyis grub par rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye
analyzed: rtag tu lhun gyis grub par rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa la sogs pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pas lhun gyis grub par rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye
translated: Because he always abides in nonconceptual intuition, spontaneously and effortlessly.

original: shes kyis gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes kyis gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: On the eighth stage and so on, the perfection of wisdom is fulfilled, and he abides in nonconceptual intuition, spontaneously and effortlessly.

original: rtag tu bya ba ni rgyun du bya ba nyid yin gyis gdon mi za bar bya dgos pa ni rtag par rgyun chags su gdon mi za @159b bar bya dgos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag tu bya ba ni rgyun du bya ba nyid yin gyis gdon mi za bar bya dgos pa ni rtag par rgyun chags su gdon mi za @159b bar bya dgos pa ma yin no //
translated: Always means continuously, not necessarily always, not necessarily continuously.üîΩKnowing the Disappointment of Desire

original: 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs shes pa dang // zhes bya ba la gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams ni 'dod par byed bar 'dod pa dag ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs shes pa dang // zhes bya ba la gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams ni 'dod par byed bar 'dod pa dag ste /
translated: The objects of form, etc., are called desirable because they are desired.

original: de dag ni rus gong gi dum bu dang / sha'i kham tshad la sogs pa lta bu dang chos mthun pa dang ldan pa'i phyir nyes dmigs dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni rus gong gi dum bu dang / sha'i kham tshad la sogs pa lta bu dang chos mthun pa dang ldan pa'i phyir nyes dmigs dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: They are accompanied by disappointment, because they are similar to a skeleton, a lump of flesh, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni nyes dmigs dang bcas pa'i shes pa skyes pas gnas skabs gang du yang nam yang 'dod pa rnams la chags par mi 'gyur bas 'dod pa rnams la nyes dmigs su lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni nyes dmigs dang bcas pa'i shes pa skyes pas gnas skabs gang du yang nam yang 'dod pa rnams la chags par mi 'gyur bas 'dod pa rnams la nyes dmigs su lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva, by producing the knowledge of the disadvantages, never becomes attached to the objects of desire at any time. Therefore, it is called the view of the disadvantages of the objects of desire.

original: bde la ro myang med nyid dang // zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dag la ro myang bar mi byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bde la ro myang med nyid dang // zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dag la ro myang bar mi byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: The absence of relishing the pleasure is the absence of relishing the meditative concentrations.

original: so so thar pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa dang / bsam gtan gyi sdom pas bsdus pa'i tshul khrims gang dag yin pa de dag pas ni zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa'i tshul khrims gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: so so thar pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa dang / bsam gtan gyi sdom pas bsdus pa'i tshul khrims gang dag yin pa de dag pas ni zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa'i tshul khrims gtso bo yin no //
translated: The morality included in the vow of individual liberation and the morality included in the vow of meditative concentration are not as important as the morality included in the vow of undefiled morality.

original: sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / gnod par byed pa dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa yang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / gnod par byed pa dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa yang /
translated: The patience of accepting suffering, the patience of accepting the harm done by others, and the patience of certainty about the Dharma are not as important as the patience of certainty about the Dharma.

original: sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba'i bzod pa gang yin pa de rnam pas ni de kho na'i don gyi phyogs gcig gi rjes su zhugs pa dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bzod pa gang yin pa 'di dag gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba'i bzod pa gang yin pa de rnam pas ni de kho na'i don gyi phyogs gcig gi rjes su zhugs pa dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bzod pa gang yin pa 'di dag gtso bo yin no //
translated: The patience that follows the sound is the patience that is associated with the concentration that is endowed with the entry into one part of the meaning of that.

original: chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / bden pa dang rig pa dang theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / bden pa dang rig pa dang theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The establishment of the designation of the Dharma, the establishment of the designation of the truths, and the establishment of the designation of the vehicles.

original: mdo'i sde dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag gis rig pa'i gnas lnga rnam par gzhag pa ni chos rnam par gzhag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo'i sde dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag gis rig pa'i gnas lnga rnam par gzhag pa ni chos rnam par gzhag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The establishment of the Dharma should be understood as the establishment of the five sciences, with their specific aspects of the class of discourses, the class of metrical exhortations, and so on.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rig pa'i gnas rnams ni de'i khongs su 'dus pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rig pa'i gnas rnams ni de'i khongs su 'dus pa kho na ste /
translated: The other sciences are included within those.

original: theg pa chen po las byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bshad do zhes bya ba ni nang rig pa ni theg pa chen po ste rig pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po las byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bshad do zhes bya ba ni nang rig pa ni theg pa chen po ste rig pa'o //
translated: The inner science is the Great Vehicle, because it is the vehicle for the bodhisattvas.

original: gnas gzhan bzhi po gso ba dang / gtan tshigs dang / sgra dang / bzo'i las kyi rig pa'i gnas rnams ni de'i khongs su 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas gzhan bzhi po gso ba dang / gtan tshigs dang / sgra dang / bzo'i las kyi rig pa'i gnas rnams ni de'i khongs su 'dus pa yin no //
translated: The other four fields of knowledge‚Äîhealing, logic, grammar, and the arts and crafts‚Äîare included within these.

original: 'jug pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: The suchness of engagement is as follows.

original: 'jug pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'khor ba ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'khor ba ste /
translated: The nature of engagement is sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: @160a * // 'di ni 'khor ba'i bden pa yin no //
analyzed: @160a * // 'di ni 'khor ba'i bden pa yin no //
translated: This is the truth of sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: de'i ngo bo ni de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni de bzhin nyid de /
translated: Its suchness is as follows.

original: 'di lta ste 'jug pa'i ngo bo nyid du phyin ci ma log pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'jug pa'i ngo bo nyid du phyin ci ma log pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is the nonerroneous nature of engagement.

original: mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid ni ngo bo nyid gsum mo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid ni ngo bo nyid gsum mo //
translated: The suchness of characteristics is the three natures.

original: rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The suchness of representations is as follows.

original: khams gsum pa 'di ni rnam par rig pa tsam mo zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: khams gsum pa 'di ni rnam par rig pa tsam mo zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: This threefold world is mere representation.

original: 'di lta ste chos thams cad ni rnam par rig pa tsam mo zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dir bden zhing phyin ci ma log pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste chos thams cad ni rnam par rig pa tsam mo zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dir bden zhing phyin ci ma log pa yin no //
translated: This is the truth and nonerroneous nature of all phenomena.

original: gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //üîΩlog par sgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid ni kun 'byung gi bden pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o // log par sgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid ni kun 'byung gi bden pa ste /
translated: The reality of the state is the truth of suffering.üîΩThe reality of wrong practice is the truth of the origin of suffering.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of the origin of suffering has the characteristic of action and affliction.

original: log par sgrub pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams dang / de dag gis rab tu bcug pa'i las te /
analyzed: log par sgrub pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams dang / de dag gis rab tu bcug pa'i las te /
translated: Wrong practice is the afflictions and the action that they instigate.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: log par bsgrub pa 'di ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa de bzhin nyid phyin ci ma log pa yin no //üîΩrnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid ni 'gog pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: log par bsgrub pa 'di ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa de bzhin nyid phyin ci ma log pa yin no // rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid ni 'gog pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: This wrong practice is the reality of the truth of the origin of suffering.üîΩThe reality of purification is the truth of cessation.

original: rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of cessation has the nature of purification.

original: 'di ni 'di'i phyin ci ma log pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'i phyin ci ma log pa yin te /
translated: This is its non-erroneous nature.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi dmigs pa der sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa 'gog pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi dmigs pa der sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa 'gog pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because suffering together with its cause ceases in that object of reality.

original: / yang dag pa'i sgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid ni lam gyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: / yang dag pa'i sgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid ni lam gyi bden pa ste /
translated: The reality of right practice is the truth of the path.

original: lam 'dis 'phags pa rnams thar pa sgrub pa'i phyir 'di ni phyin ci ma log pa'i de bzhin nyid yin no //
analyzed: lam 'dis 'phags pa rnams thar pa sgrub pa'i phyir 'di ni phyin ci ma log pa'i de bzhin nyid yin no //
translated: Since the noble ones attain liberation by this path, this is the undistorted suchness.

original: de la ltos nas rkyen des 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gang yang dag pa'i lta ba skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la ltos nas yang dag pa'i lta ba skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de la ltos nas rkyen des 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gang yang dag pa'i lta ba skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la ltos nas yang dag pa'i lta ba skye ba yin no //
translated: In dependence on that, the supramundane correct view arises through that condition. This is saying that correct view arises in dependence on proper mental attention.

original: bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The principle of functional performance is that correct view is accompanied by its result.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba'i bya ba byed pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba'i bya ba byed pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The functional performance of correct view is as follows.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu sgrub pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu sgrub pa 'di yin no //
translated: It accomplishes a result that is in accordance with it.

original: de'i 'bras bu gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is its result?

original: rnam par grol ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba yin no //
translated: It is liberation.

original: 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas yongs su rtog pa'o zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pas gzugs la sogs pa dang / bu ba sa med dang / byas pa nyid la sogs @160b pas sgra mi rtag par yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa 'di ni 'thad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas yongs su rtog pa'o zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pas gzugs la sogs pa dang / bu ba sa med dang / byas pa nyid la sogs @160b pas sgra mi rtag par yongs su rtog pa gang yin pa 'di ni 'thad pa kho na yin no //
translated: The reasoning of tenability is the thorough examination by the valid cognitions of direct perception and so forth.

original: bsam pa ji lta ba dang 'dod pa ji lta bar chos bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gdul ba rnams kyi bsam pa dman pa dang 'bring dang mchog de kho na ji lta ba bzhin du shes nas chos 'chad pa yin no //üîΩde gnyis 'brel ba la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsam pa ji lta ba dang 'dod pa ji lta bar chos bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gdul ba rnams kyi bsam pa dman pa dang 'bring dang mchog de kho na ji lta ba bzhin du shes nas chos 'chad pa yin no // de gnyis 'brel ba la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The explanation of the Dharma is in accordance with the thoughts and desires of the disciples.

original: rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba 'brel pa la ste /
analyzed: rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba 'brel pa la ste /
translated: The connection between those two is the connection between the expression and the object of expression.

original: rjod pa ni ming ngo //
analyzed: rjod pa ni ming ngo //
translated: The expression is the name.

original: brjod par bya ba ni dngos pa'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ni dngos pa'o //
translated: The object of expression is the thing.

original: de dag 'brel pa ni de gnyis 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de dag 'brel pa ni de gnyis 'brel pa'o //
translated: The connection between those two is the connection between the two.

original: ngo bo nyid 'dogs pa ni gzugs ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid 'dogs pa ni gzugs ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The investigation of the designation of intrinsic reality is such as: ‚ÄúForm is the intrinsic reality of that which is capable of material form.

original: tshor ba ni nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: tshor ba ni nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Feeling is the intrinsic reality of experience.

original: zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.üîΩüîΩ

original: khyad par 'dogs pa yongs su tshol ba ni gzugs ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / stong pa dang / 'dogs par gtogs pa dang / 'dus byas dang / gzag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: khyad par 'dogs pa yongs su tshol ba ni gzugs ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / stong pa dang / 'dogs par gtogs pa dang / 'dus byas dang / gzag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: The investigation of the designation of a particular is such as: ‚ÄúForm is impermanent, painful, empty, afflicted, compounded, and subject to defilement.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: ‚Äù The same is to be applied to feeling, etc.

original: ngo bo nyid dang khyad par 'dogs pa yongs su tshol ba gang yin pa 'di ni brtag pa tsam du yongs su tshol ba yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang khyad par 'dogs pa yongs su tshol ba gang yin pa 'di ni brtag pa tsam du yongs su tshol ba yin no //
translated: This investigation of the designation of intrinsic reality and the particular is the investigation of mere conceptual differentiation.

original: de la rten rgyu mtshan ni /
analyzed: de la rten rgyu mtshan ni /
translated: The basis, the causal-sign,

original: snod kyi 'jig rten no zhes bya ba ni de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu mtshan dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten no zhes bya ba ni de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu mtshan dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: the world of the container is the objective support of the causal-sign of the store-consciousness.

original: 'di ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gnas rnam par rig pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gnas rnam par rig pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the storehouse consciousness is the place that is the representation of the arising of the other forms of consciousness.

original: longs spyod kyi rgyu mtshan ni gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: longs spyod kyi rgyu mtshan ni gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The representations of the objects of enjoyment are the five sense objects, form, etc.

original: longs spyod ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa drug go //üîΩde dag gi rgyu mtshan te dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: longs spyod ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa drug go // de dag gi rgyu mtshan te dmigs pa ni /
translated: The objects of enjoyment are the six consciousnesses, such as visual consciousness, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams yin no //
translated: The representations of those are the five sense objects, form, etc.

original: sa bon rgyu mtshan ni de dag gi sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa bshad ma thag pa rnams kyi sa bon 'jog pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon rgyu mtshan ni de dag gi sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa bshad ma thag pa rnams kyi sa bon 'jog pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The representations of the seeds are those that are the seeds of those, i.e., the storehouse consciousness.

original: rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rten rgyu mtshan dang longs spyod rgyu mtshan dang sa bon rgyu mtshan zhes re re la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rten rgyu mtshan dang longs spyod rgyu mtshan dang sa bon rgyu mtshan zhes re re la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúrepresentation‚Äù is to be applied to each of the three kinds of representations, i.e., as the representation of the support, the representation of the objects of enjoyment, and the representation of the seeds.

original: de la rten nyid rgyu mtshan yin pas na rten rgyu mtshan te /
analyzed: de la rten nyid rgyu mtshan yin pas na rten rgyu mtshan te /
translated: The support itself is the representation because it is the support.

original: las 'dzin par tshig bsdu'o //üîΩlongs spyod @161a * //
analyzed: las 'dzin par tshig bsdu'o // longs spyod @161a * //
translated: The agent is included in the word ‚Äúenjoyer.‚Äù

original: kyi rgyu mtshan yin pas na longs spyod rgyu mtshan te /
analyzed: kyi rgyu mtshan yin pas na longs spyod rgyu mtshan te /
translated: The reason for enjoyment is the reason for enjoyment.

original: de'i skyes bur tshig bsdu'o //
analyzed: de'i skyes bur tshig bsdu'o //
translated: The person is included in the word ‚Äúenjoyer.‚Äù

original: sa bon nyid rgyu mtshan yin pas na sa bon rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: sa bon nyid rgyu mtshan yin pas na sa bon rgyu mtshan no //
translated: The reason for the seed is the seed.

original: rten ni mig la sogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa lnga'i rten ni mig la sogs pa'o //
