analyzed: rten ni mig la sogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa lnga'i rten ni mig la sogs pa'o //
translated: The eye, etc. are the basis, i.e., the basis of the five consciousnesses beginning with the visual consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do //
translated: The mental consciousness is the afflicted mind.

original: bdag nyid 'dug pa ni sa dang ka ba dang bum pa la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'dug pa ni sa dang ka ba dang bum pa la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The self-abiding is whatever is the earth, the pillar, the pot, etc.

original: de ltar mi rtog pa'i rim pa de lta bus zhes brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni thams cad la mi rtog pa'i rnal 'byor gyis byang chub mchog thob po //
analyzed: de ltar mi rtog pa'i rim pa de lta bus zhes brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni thams cad la mi rtog pa'i rnal 'byor gyis byang chub mchog thob po //
translated: Thus, by this kind of non-discursive process, one should say.

original: rim gyis sgom par byed pa'i rnal 'byor gyis byang chub kyi mchog thob po zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rim gyis sgom par byed pa'i rnal 'byor gyis byang chub kyi mchog thob po zhes bya ba ste /
translated: By the yoga of gradual meditation, one attains supreme enlightenment.

original: de ni 'di skad du rten dang longs spyod dang sa bon la sogs pa'i 'ching ba yongs su shes par byas nas mdun du gzhan la sogs pa'i rim gyis thar pa la 'jug pa de ltar na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du rten dang longs spyod dang sa bon la sogs pa'i 'ching ba yongs su shes par byas nas mdun du gzhan la sogs pa'i rim gyis thar pa la 'jug pa de ltar na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa
translated: That is to say, having fully understood the bonds of the basis, enjoyments, seeds, and so on, one enters into liberation by means of the stages of the other, and so on, in front.

original: yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, it is said that one should apply ‚Äúcorrect thorough understanding just as it is.‚Äù

original: mtshan ma'i gnyen po ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i gnyen po ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The antidote to signs is nonconceptual wisdom,

original: de thob pas mtshan ma thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de thob pas mtshan ma thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because by attaining that, one becomes free from all signs.

original: sngar ni bzhag pa rus gong la sogs pa'i mtshan ma mi mthong la /
analyzed: sngar ni bzhag pa rus gong la sogs pa'i mtshan ma mi mthong la /
translated: Previously, one does not see the signs of skeletons, and so on, that were placed.

original: phyis ni bdag nyid 'dug pa ka ba dang bum pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: phyis ni bdag nyid 'dug pa ka ba dang bum pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Later, one sees oneself sitting, and so on, as pillars, vases, and so on.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: This is stated in the following:

original: ji ltar rus pa'i rus gong la sogs pa dmigs pa nyid du yongs su ma grub kyi rang gi sems 'di nyid rus gong la sogs pa nyid du snang ba ltar ka ba dang bum pa la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bshad pa yin no /
analyzed: ji ltar rus pa'i rus gong la sogs pa dmigs pa nyid du yongs su ma grub kyi rang gi sems 'di nyid rus gong la sogs pa nyid du snang ba ltar ka ba dang bum pa la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bshad pa yin no /
translated: Just as the skeleton, etc., are not established as objects, this very mind appears as a skeleton, etc. In the same way, pillars, vases, etc. are also like that.

original: de zad mi byed par zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan gyi 'dun pa yin te /
analyzed: de zad mi byed par zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan gyi 'dun pa yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwithout exhausting it‚Äù is the intention of the reason.

original: zad par byed cing de zad par byed pa'i ched yin no //
analyzed: zad par byed cing de zad par byed pa'i ched yin no //
translated: It is exhausted, and it is for the sake of exhausting it.

original: rnam pa tha dad pa med pa bsgoms pa ni mtshan ma dang de bzhin nyid dag tha mi dad pa nyid du thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba mtshan ma'i ngo bo nyid ni 'khor ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad pa med pa bsgoms pa ni mtshan ma dang de bzhin nyid dag tha mi dad pa nyid du thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba mtshan ma'i ngo bo nyid ni 'khor ba ste /
translated: The meditation on the absence of different aspects is because of attaining the non-difference of the sign and suchness. The nature of the sign is sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rnam par mi rtog pa ye shes thob pa'i phyir mtshan ma dang de bzhin nyid dag la tha dad pa nyid du mi lta'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rnam par mi rtog pa ye shes thob pa'i phyir mtshan ma dang de bzhin nyid dag la tha dad pa nyid du mi lta'o //
translated: Because bodhisattvas attain non-conceptual wisdom, they do not view the sign and suchness as different.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mjug thogs su //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mjug thogs su //
translated: For that very reason, immediately after that,

original: byis pa yang dag nyid bsgribs nas //
analyzed: byis pa yang dag nyid bsgribs nas //
translated: The child is obscured from reality,

original: yang dag ma yin kun tu snang //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun tu snang //
translated: and unreal appearances manifest.

original: zhes @161b bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes @161b bya ba la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is explained in the following lines.

original: de dag ni mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa dag tha dad pa nyid du mthong bas zhes bya bas ni nyan thos rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ni mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa dag tha dad pa nyid du mthong bas zhes bya bas ni nyan thos rnams so //
translated: They see signs and signlessness as separate.

original: ji ltar tha dad pa nyid du mthong zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar tha dad pa nyid du mthong zhe na /
translated: How do they see them as separate?

original: mtshan ma'i rang bzhin ni 'khor ba ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i rang bzhin ni 'khor ba ste /
translated: The nature of signs is samsara,

original: de la ni ma zhi ba nyid du rtog go //
analyzed: de la ni ma zhi ba nyid du rtog go //
translated: and they conceive of it as not being peace.

original: mtshan ma med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pas te /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pas te /
translated: Signlessness is nirvana,

original: de la ni zhi ba nyid du rtog go //
analyzed: de la ni zhi ba nyid du rtog go //
translated: and they conceive of it as peace.

original: rnam par rtog pa ji lta ba bzhin du don thams cad sgrub pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni gang dang gang la rnam par rtog pa'i don de dang de 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ji lta ba bzhin du don thams cad sgrub pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni gang dang gang la rnam par rtog pa'i don de dang de 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: In accordance with their conceptions, all objects are accomplished.

original: gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba de bzhin nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bar rigs mthun par snang ngo zhes bya ba ni sa dang ri la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba de bzhin nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bar rigs mthun par snang ngo zhes bya ba ni sa dang ri la sogs pa ste /
translated: This is the suchness of the arising of one thing after another.

original: ji srid du snod kyi 'jig rten skad cig gcig 'jigs pas rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du ma mthong ba de srid du /
analyzed: ji srid du snod kyi 'jig rten skad cig gcig 'jigs pas rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du ma mthong ba de srid du /
translated: As long as one does not see the world of sentient beings and the physical world as mere representation, because of the momentary destruction of the world of sentient beings and the physical world,

original: phyin ci log tu gyur ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩgzhan dang gzhan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par mi 'gyur ro // gzhan dang gzhan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the world of sentient beings and the physical world will not become a pure land of the Buddha, due to the error of taking what is not a self to be a self.üîΩOne thing after another

original: gzhan dang gzhan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: means one thing after another.üîΩThe realm of those to be trained is suitable for ripening.

original: yongs su smin par byar rung ba ni gdul ba'i khams so zhes bya ba ni gdul bar 'os pa gang yin pa de ni gdul bar rung ba yin no //
analyzed: yongs su smin par byar rung ba ni gdul ba'i khams so zhes bya ba ni gdul bar 'os pa gang yin pa de ni gdul bar rung ba yin no //
translated: That which is suitable to be trained is suitable for training.

original: gang du bye brag tu ma phye ba yongs su smin par bya ba'i dngos po ni sems can gyi khams khyad par med pa'o zhes bshad mod kyi /
analyzed: gang du bye brag tu ma phye ba yongs su smin par bya ba'i dngos po ni sems can gyi khams khyad par med pa'o zhes bshad mod kyi /
translated: Although it is said that the realm of sentient beings is the undifferentiated entity to be ripened,

original: 'on kyang de la gdul ba nyid du 'os pa gang yin pa de kho na gdul bar rung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de la gdul ba nyid du 'os pa gang yin pa de kho na gdul bar rung ba yin te /
translated: But only those who are fit to be disciplined are disciplined,

original: nyi ma shar bas padma smin pa kha 'byed pa bzhin no //üîΩyang dag par bshad pa'i dngos po ni gdul ba'i khams kyi thabs so zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni thabs gang dang gang gis 'dod chags spyod pa la sogs pa gdul bar 'gyur ba mi sdug pa bshad pa la sogs pa thabs de dang
analyzed: nyi ma shar bas padma smin pa kha 'byed pa bzhin no // yang dag par bshad pa'i dngos po ni gdul ba'i khams kyi thabs so zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni thabs gang dang gang gis 'dod chags spyod pa la sogs pa gdul bar 'gyur ba mi sdug pa bshad pa la sogs pa thabs de dang
translated: just as only the lotuses in the pond open up when the sun rises.üîΩThe means of the spiritual gene of those to be disciplined is the thing that is correctly taught.üîΩThe bodhisattvas discipline sentient beings by whatever means, such as the meditation on the impurity of the body, etc.

original: des sems can rnams 'dul bar byed do //
analyzed: des sems can rnams 'dul bar byed do //
translated: , by which those who practice desire, etc.üîΩare disciplined.

original: dngos po zhes bya ba'i sgra ni lnga po re re la sbyar ro //
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba'i sgra ni lnga po re re la sbyar ro //
translated: The word thing is to be supplied after each of the five.üîΩThe holy Dharma also endures for a long time because of the transmission.

original: brgyud de 'dzin pas dam pa'i chos kyang yun ring du gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' gang dag la dam pa'i chos bshad pa de dag gis kyang thos nas /
analyzed: brgyud de 'dzin pas dam pa'i chos kyang yun ring du gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' gang dag la dam pa'i chos bshad pa de dag gis kyang thos nas /
translated: The holy Dharma is taught to those bodhisattvas, and they, having heard it,

original: mar mes mar me sbar ba'i tshul du gzhan dag la 'chad par byed pa yin no //üîΩgnyis sgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis sgrub pa'i sgo @162a * //üîΩnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩthabs la mkhas pa chen po nyid ni /
analyzed: mar mes mar me sbar ba'i tshul du gzhan dag la 'chad par byed pa yin no // gnyis sgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis sgrub pa'i sgo @162a * // nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // thabs la mkhas pa chen po nyid ni /
translated: It is like the way one lamp is lit from another lamp.

original: theg pa chen po ni 'di tsam du zad do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po ni 'di tsam du zad do //
translated: The Great Vehicle is just this much.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rigs ni skye mched drug gi khyad par chos nyid kyis thob pa thog ma med pa'i dus nas brgyud de 'ongs pa nyid de 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rigs ni skye mched drug gi khyad par chos nyid kyis thob pa thog ma med pa'i dus nas brgyud de 'ongs pa nyid de 'dra ba yin no //
translated: In this regard, the family of the bodhisattvas is a special six sense bases, obtained by the nature of things, and has come down from beginningless time.

original: rigs kyi stobs kyis theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba bshad pa la mos pa gang yin pa de ni mos pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi stobs kyis theg pa chen po'i chos zab cing rgya che ba bshad pa la mos pa gang yin pa de ni mos pa'o //
translated: The power of the family is the aspiration to the teaching of the profound and magnificent Dharma of the Great Vehicle.

original: de'i 'og tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed par byed do //
translated: After that, one generates the thought of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

original: de nas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la 'jug go //
analyzed: de nas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la 'jug go //
translated: Then one enters into the six perfections such as generosity.

original: de nas bskal pa grangs med pa dang po la bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par bsgrubs pas sa dang po thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas bskal pa grangs med pa dang po la bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par bsgrubs pas sa dang po thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, in the first incalculable eon, one attains the first stage by accomplishing the accumulations of merit and knowledge.

original: lhag ma ni gzhung gi gzhi nyid las legs par bris par zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni gzhung gi gzhi nyid las legs par bris par zad do //
translated: The rest is well written in the text itself.

original: da ni rab tu bsngags pa'i yon tan la brten nas /
analyzed: da ni rab tu bsngags pa'i yon tan la brten nas /
translated: Now, in dependence on the qualities of the highest praise,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan bsngags pa bstan pas ston te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan bsngags pa bstan pas ston te /
translated: he teaches the praise of the qualities of the bodhisattva.

original: mos pa dang ldan pa'i mos pas spyod pa'i sa la'o //
analyzed: mos pa dang ldan pa'i mos pas spyod pa'i sa la'o //
translated: The one with faith is on the stage of faithful action.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa ni sa bcu pa dag la'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa ni sa bcu pa dag la'o //
translated: The one with pure superior intention is on the ten stages.

original: de nyid zab mo mthong ba ni bdag med pa gnyis kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid zab mo mthong ba ni bdag med pa gnyis kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pa yin te /
translated: The one who sees the profound is the one who has attained the non-conceptual wisdom of the two kinds of selflessness.

original: 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa ston to //
translated: This shows the practice of the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dga' ldan zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dga' ldan zhes bya ba la /
translated: The bodhisattva named Tu·π£ita

original: dga' ba ni 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: dga' ba ni 'dod pa ste /
translated: is so called because delight is desire.

original: 'dis ni byang chub chen por smon pa ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni byang chub chen por smon pa ston to //
translated: This shows the aspiration for great enlightenment.

original: phan 'dogs byed pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas so //
analyzed: phan 'dogs byed pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas so //
translated: The one who benefits is through the perfection of generosity.

original: gnod pa med par lta ba ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas so //
analyzed: gnod pa med par lta ba ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas so //
translated: The one who views without harm is through the perfection of morality.

original: gzhan gyi gnod pa dang du len pa ni bzod pa'i @162b pha rol tu phyin pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gnod pa dang du len pa ni bzod pa'i @162b pha rol tu phyin pas so //
translated: The one who patiently accepts harm from others is through the perfection of patience.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol rol tu phyin pa la goms pas rang gi yongs su gzung ba la nyes dmigs su blta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol rol tu phyin pa la goms pas rang gi yongs su gzung ba la nyes dmigs su blta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By cultivating the perfection of generosity, one sees the danger in one‚Äôs own possessions.

original: longs spyod la ma chags pa ni longs spyod rnams spongs nas tshul khrims yang dag par len to //
analyzed: longs spyod la ma chags pa ni longs spyod rnams spongs nas tshul khrims yang dag par len to //
translated: Not being attached to wealth, one gives up wealth and takes up morality.

original: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pas rnal 'byor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pas rnal 'byor zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúYoga‚Äù is said to be endowed with the perfection of effort.

original: lta ngan med pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ngan med pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFree from bad views‚Äù is due to being endowed with the perfection of wisdom.

original: nang du rab gnas pa ni smon lam chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang du rab gnas pa ni smon lam chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAbiding internally‚Äù is due to being endowed with the great aspiration.

original: brtse ba dang ldan pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas so //
analyzed: brtse ba dang ldan pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúCompassionate‚Äù is due to the perfection of generosity.

original: ngo tsha ba ni yon tan gyi chos dang ldan pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam la yang 'jigs par ldan pas /
analyzed: ngo tsha ba ni yon tan gyi chos dang ldan pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam la yang 'jigs par ldan pas /
translated: ‚ÄúModest‚Äù is due to being endowed with the qualities of virtue, being fearful even of the slightest wrongdoing.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one becomes endowed with morality.

original: theg pa mi 'khrugs pa ni smon lam chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa mi 'khrugs pa ni smon lam chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The vehicle is unshakable because of the great vow.

original: sdug bsngal khas len pa ni smon lam chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: sdug bsngal khas len pa ni smon lam chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: The vow is great because of the acceptance of suffering.

original: / chos la mi dga' ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas so //
analyzed: / chos la mi dga' ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas so //
translated: Lack of delight in the Dharma is due to the transcendence of generosity.

original: rang bzhin chos la dga' ba ni rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims kyis so //
analyzed: rang bzhin chos la dga' ba ni rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims kyis so //
translated: Delight in the Dharma by nature is due to natural morality.

original: longs spyod bag yod pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas so //
analyzed: longs spyod bag yod pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas so //
translated: Carefulness in wealth is due to the transcendence of generosity.

original: chags pa dang bral ba'i phyir bde la bag yod pa ste /
analyzed: chags pa dang bral ba'i phyir bde la bag yod pa ste /
translated: Carefulness in happiness is due to freedom from attachment,

original: bsam gtan gyi bde ba dag la ma chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi bde ba dag la ma chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of nonattachment to the happiness of meditative concentration.

original: lta ba chung ngus ngo tsha ba zhes bya ba ni chos su 'dzin pa'i lta ba chung ngus kyang ngo tsha ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba chung ngus ngo tsha ba zhes bya ba ni chos su 'dzin pa'i lta ba chung ngus kyang ngo tsha ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Shame in inferior views is due to shame even at inferior views that grasp at the Dharma.

original: tshul khrims kyis ni skye ba khyad par can thob nas /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ni skye ba khyad par can thob nas /
translated: Having attained a special rebirth through morality,

original: gzhan du sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par 'jug go //
analyzed: gzhan du sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par 'jug go //
translated: one engages in benefiting sentient beings in other ways.

original: dbang 'byor pa nyid thob pas ni ;
analyzed: dbang 'byor pa nyid thob pas ni ;
translated: Having attained mastery,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas 'bar ba dang / chu 'bebs pa dang / kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul la sogs pa'i dbang 'byor ba nyid kyis ni sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas 'bar ba dang / chu 'bebs pa dang / kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul la sogs pa'i dbang 'byor ba nyid kyis ni sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the perfection of meditative stabilization, one benefits sentient beings through the power of the miracles of blazing fire, pouring water, and so on.üîΩThe line ‚Äúthe realization of the self‚Äù means that the foundation consciousness is engaged in a continuous stream like the flow of a river.

original: bdag rjes rtogs zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni chu bo'i rgyun bzhin du rgyun chags su 'jug pa ni byes pa rnams thog ma med pa'i dus nas bdag tu 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pas /üîΩbdag nyid du mngon par chags shing de la bdag tu nye bar 'dogs pas de rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag rjes rtogs zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni chu bo'i rgyun bzhin du rgyun chags su 'jug pa ni byes pa rnams thog ma med pa'i dus nas bdag tu 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pas / bdag nyid du mngon par chags shing de la bdag tu nye bar 'dogs pas de rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Since beginningless time, ordinary beings have been attached to the conception of a self.üîΩThey are attached to the self and impute a self to that foundation consciousness.

original: bdag rjes su rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag rjes su rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúthe realization of the self.‚Äù

original: lta ba phra rtogs zhes bya ba ni nyon @163a * //
analyzed: lta ba phra rtogs zhes bya ba ni nyon @163a * //
translated: The line ‚Äúthe realization of subtle views‚Äù means

original: mongs pa can gyi yid rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mongs pa can gyi yid rtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: the realization of the afflicted mind.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa bzhi dang ldan pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bdag nyid du mngon par zhen pa ni lta ba'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa bzhi dang ldan pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bdag nyid du mngon par zhen pa ni lta ba'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The defiled mind is the four afflictions such as the view of the transitory collection, and so on. The clinging to the store consciousness as a self is called the essence of the view.

original: de rnams kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa nyid du rtogs pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po dag log par kun tu rtogs pa la goms pas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa nyid du rtogs pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po dag log par kun tu rtogs pa la goms pas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: And they are understood as unreal imagination. The bodhisattva understands the store consciousness, the defiled mind, and the six active consciousnesses as unreal imagination because he is accustomed to the realization that they are unreal imagination.

original: dngos med rtogs zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos med rtogs zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And he understands the nonexistence of things. This means that he understands the imagined nature.

original: ma rtogs pa nyid du rtogs pa so sor rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa nyid du rtogs pa so sor rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The realization of non-realization is called ‚Äúrealization.‚ÄùüîΩIt is the realization that the objects of form, etc., which are clung to as subject and object in the world, are clung to as the realization of the perfect reality.

original: 'jig rten gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams la yang dag pa nyid du rtogs par mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa byis pas kun brtags pa'i ma rtogs pa'i de la byis pa rnams kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin
analyzed: 'jig rten gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams la yang dag pa nyid du rtogs par mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa byis pas kun brtags pa'i ma rtogs pa'i de la byis pa rnams kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin
translated: The non-realization imagined by the foolish is the non-realization of that.üîΩThe realization of that by the foolish is their clinging to subject and object.

original: par mngon par zhen pas rtogs pas gang yin pa 'di ni ma rtogs pa yin no zhes bya bar so sor rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: par mngon par zhen pas rtogs pas gang yin pa 'di ni ma rtogs pa yin no zhes bya bar so sor rtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is non-realization.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' 'dis gnyis su 'dzin pa las rnam par grol ba yang /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' 'dis gnyis su 'dzin pa las rnam par grol ba yang /
translated: Thus, this Bodhisattva, liberated from the duality of subject and object,

original: yongs su dag par rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yongs su dag par rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: realizes the purity of the object.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called a Bodhisattva.

original: don med rtogs zhes bya ba ni log par kun nas rtogs pa la goms pa'i bag chags dang ldan pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni don med par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: don med rtogs zhes bya ba ni log par kun nas rtogs pa la goms pa'i bag chags dang ldan pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni don med par gyur pa ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe unreal imagined‚Äù means that the other-dependent nature is unreal because it is endowed with the habitual propensities of the unreal imagination.

original: de rtogs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de rtogs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: And because it is realized, one is called a bodhisattva.

original: don rtogs kun zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: don rtogs kun zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe real is realized‚Äù means that

original: skye mched bcu gnyis po byis pa rnams kyis gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa nyid du kun brtags pa de dag rtogs pa'i phyir kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis po byis pa rnams kyis gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa nyid du kun brtags pa de dag rtogs pa'i phyir kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni rtogs pa yin no //
translated: the imagined reality is realized because the twelve sense spheres are imagined by the childish to be the subject and object of perception.

original: rtogs bya rtogs gzhi rtogs pa rtogs pa'i rgyu //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtogs bya rtogs gzhi rtogs pa rtogs pa'i rgyu // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The object to be realized, the basis of realization, realization, and the cause of realization.

original: rtogs par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba'i don to //
translated: The object to be realized is the ultimate.

original: rtogs pa ni de'i yul can gyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni de'i yul can gyi shes pa'o //
translated: Realization is the consciousness that has that as its object.

original: rtogs pa'i gzhi ni skye mched drug ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i gzhi ni skye mched drug ste /
translated: The basis of realization is the six sense spheres.

original: rtogs par bya ba dang / rtogs @163b pa po dang / rtogs pa rnams kun brtags pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba dang / rtogs @163b pa po dang / rtogs pa rnams kun brtags pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The object to be realized, the realizer, and realization are all imagined.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the complete purification of the three sectors.

original: gnas rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni kun tu ston par byed pa rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni kun tu ston par byed pa rtogs pa'o //
translated: The realization of the basis is the realization of the teaching.

original: rtogs pa ma thob pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus so //
analyzed: rtogs pa ma thob pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus so //
translated: The non-realization of the realization is the future time.

original: rtogs pa ma thob pa ji ltar rtogs pa rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: rtogs pa ma thob pa ji ltar rtogs pa rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: How is the non-realization of the realization established?

original: 'di dge ba'i chos la rtag tu gus par byas te sbyor bas ma 'ongs pa na rtogs par nus te rtogs par bya ba'i mthu thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dge ba'i chos la rtag tu gus par byas te sbyor bas ma 'ongs pa na rtogs par nus te rtogs par bya ba'i mthu thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is called one who is able to realize in the future through constant devotion to wholesome dharmas, because he obtains the power to realize.

original: so sor 'chad par byed pa'i rtogs pa ni rags pa'o zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i gnas skabs na bshad pa'i chos kyis rjes su 'brangs te /
analyzed: so sor 'chad par byed pa'i rtogs pa ni rags pa'o zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i gnas skabs na bshad pa'i chos kyis rjes su 'brangs te /
translated: The realization of the explanation is gross, that is, the realization that follows the Dharma that is explained in the stage of hearing.

original: rtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is the realization of the explanation.

original: yon tan gyi skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: yon tan gyi skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on the qualities is completed.

original: // / yang byang chub sems dpa' yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa de dag gi ming yang dag pa'i don dang mthun pa'i phyir rab tu rnam par dbye bas de dag la bstod pa bsgrags pas de ltar rnam par 'phel ba'i yon tan rgya chen po sna
analyzed: // / yang byang chub sems dpa' yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa de dag gi ming yang dag pa'i don dang mthun pa'i phyir rab tu rnam par dbye bas de dag la bstod pa bsgrags pas de ltar rnam par 'phel ba'i yon tan rgya chen po sna
translated: Thus, by the proclamation of their praise, they are exalted in this way.

original: tshogs dang / bsam pa bzang po dang / spyod pa'i bsam pa'i rnam pa dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams yin no //
analyzed: tshogs dang / bsam pa bzang po dang / spyod pa'i bsam pa'i rnam pa dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams yin no //
translated: With a variety of extensive, excellent qualities, with good intentions, and with the aspects of the intention to practice, they are Bodhisattvas.

original: zhes bya bar yongs su gcod pa de rab tu dbye ba'i phyir yon tan gyi skabs kyi 'og tu brtags te /
analyzed: zhes bya bar yongs su gcod pa de rab tu dbye ba'i phyir yon tan gyi skabs kyi 'og tu brtags te /
translated: This is determined in the section on the virtues immediately following the analysis.

original: gang gis na byang chub sems dpa' rnams su mngon par byed cing mtshon par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gis na byang chub sems dpa' rnams su mngon par byed cing mtshon par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By what are the Bodhisattvas manifested and indicated? This is the meaning.

original: brtse ba ni byang chub tu sems kyis sems can yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtse ba ni byang chub tu sems kyis sems can yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Affection is the taking up of sentient beings by the mind of enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can yongs su gzung ba'i ched du ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can yongs su gzung ba'i ched du ste /
translated: This is for the sake of taking up sentient beings.

original: sems can yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to take care of sentient beings,

original: sems can rnams 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las bsgral bar bya'o zhes byang chub tu sems skyed par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las bsgral bar bya'o zhes byang chub tu sems skyed par byed do //
translated: one generates the Thought of Awakening, thinking, ‚ÄúI will liberate sentient beings from the ocean of cyclic existence.‚Äù

original: brtan pa nyid kyi rtags don gang la yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtan pa nyid kyi rtags don gang la yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the meaning of the term ‚Äústeadfastness,‚Äù

original: dka' ba spyod pa la sogs pas mi skyo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dka' ba spyod pa la sogs pas mi skyo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it says, ‚Äúbecause of not being discouraged by difficult practices and so on.‚Äù

original: yongs su gzung ba la sogs pa ni brtse ba la sogs pa'i las dang mdor bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba la sogs pa ni brtse ba la sogs pa'i las dang mdor bsdu ba yin no //
translated: Taking care and so on are the actions of love and so on, and are summarized.

original: brtse ba ni bsam pa'i sgo nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: brtse ba ni bsam pa'i sgo nas rig par bya'o //
translated: Love should be understood in terms of attitude.

original: lhag ma ni sbyor ba'i sgo nas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhag ma ni sbyor ba'i sgo nas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The rest are in terms of application.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la mos pa thob pa la sogs par bya ba'i phyir snyan par smra ba la sogs pas rab tu sbyor @164a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la mos pa thob pa la sogs par bya ba'i phyir snyan par smra ba la sogs pas rab tu sbyor @164a * //
translated: In order to attain faith in the teaching of the Bhagavat and so on, one applies oneself with pleasant speech and so on.

original: te ; brtse ba ni bsam pa'i sgo kho na nas yin gyi /
analyzed: te ; brtse ba ni bsam pa'i sgo kho na nas yin gyi /
translated: Love is only in terms of attitude.

original: sbyor ba'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not in terms of application.

original: rtags de yang khyim pa dang / dge sbyong la brten nas 'jug ste /
analyzed: rtags de yang khyim pa dang / dge sbyong la brten nas 'jug ste /
translated: The signs are manifested in the householder and in the ascetic.

original: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu de'i rten rab tu rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu de'i rten rab tu rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: Therefore, immediately after the signs, the analysis of their basis.

original: yang dag par len pas thob pa'i rab tu byung ba ni slob ma dang / slob dpon du 'brel ba'i gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis kyang gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par len pas thob pa'i rab tu byung ba ni slob ma dang / slob dpon du 'brel ba'i gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis kyang gang yin pa'o //
translated: Ordination is obtained by right acceptance, and also by the rite of the four requests and the proclamation of the Buddha‚Äôs word.

original: chos nyid kyis thob pa ni rtog pa'i dus na mi byed pa'i sdom pa thob pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos nyid kyis thob pa ni rtog pa'i dus na mi byed pa'i sdom pa thob pa'i phyir te /
translated: Ordination is obtained by the nature of things when one obtains the vow of restraint through the realization of the truth.

original: de kho na nyid rtogs pa gang zhig 'di snyam du bdag gi dmyal ba yang zad /üîΩdud 'gro yang zad /
analyzed: de kho na nyid rtogs pa gang zhig 'di snyam du bdag gi dmyal ba yang zad / dud 'gro yang zad /
translated: When one realizes reality, one thinks, ‚ÄúMy hell has ended,üîΩmy animal state has ended,

original: yi dvags kyang zad de /üîΩde bdag ni yang sdig pa'i las byas nas /
analyzed: yi dvags kyang zad de / de bdag ni yang sdig pa'i las byas nas /
translated: my ghost state has ended.üîΩI am not fortunate enough to create evil karma

original: ngan song rnams su rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub pa'i skal pa can ma yin no snyam du sems pa yin no //
analyzed: ngan song rnams su rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub pa'i skal pa can ma yin no snyam du sems pa yin no //
translated: and actualize its fruition in the miserable states.‚Äù

original: de ltar phyogs gnyis la bslab pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa na dka' ba spyod pa la bsam pa brtan po 'thob par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de ltar phyogs gnyis la bslab pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa na dka' ba spyod pa la bsam pa brtan po 'thob par 'gyur bas /
translated: Thus, when one trains in both of these, one attains a firm resolve in the practice of austerities.

original: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu bsam pa'i khyad par te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu bsam pa'i khyad par te /
translated: Therefore, after that, there is the distinctive resolve.

original: bsam pa'i stobs can ni gzhan gyi don la zhum par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam pa'i stobs can ni gzhan gyi don la zhum par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One who has the power of resolve does not become discouraged about the benefit of others.

original: mya ngan las 'das par 'dod pa ni de gnyi ga'i lhag pa'i bsam pa kho na yin pas zhes bya ba ni phan pa dang bde ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa ste /üîΩsems can phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas 'di nyid la phan pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par 'dod pa ni de gnyi ga'i lhag pa'i bsam pa kho na yin pas zhes bya ba ni phan pa dang bde ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa ste / sems can phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas 'di nyid la phan pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The desire for nirvana is the distinctive resolve for both of those.üîΩThose who attain nirvana with remainder have the benefit of this life because they have abandoned all afflictions.

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa rnams ni phyi ma la skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang bral bas bde bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa rnams ni phyi ma la skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang bral bas bde bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Those who attain nirvana without remainder have the benefit of the next life because they are free from the suffering of birth and so on.

original: mya ngan las 'das par 'dod pa ni de gnyi ga'i lhag pa'i bsam pa yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par 'dod pa ni de gnyi ga'i lhag pa'i bsam pa yin zhes bya'o //
translated: The superior intention of both is called the desire for nirvana.

original: gzhan dag na re bdag gi lhag pa'i bsam pa ni mthong ba'i chos la bde ba la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bdag gi lhag pa'i bsam pa ni mthong ba'i chos la bde ba la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Others say: The superior intention of self is for the application to happiness in this life.

original: phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa ni tshe phyi ma la bde ba la sbyor ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa ni tshe phyi ma la bde ba la sbyor ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: The superior intention of benefit is for the application to happiness in future lives.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa ni mi g-yo ba la sogs pa gsum ste /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa ni mi g-yo ba la sogs pa gsum ste /
translated: The stage of nonregression is the three stages beginning with the immovable.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i lam las mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i lam las mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not regress from the path of no more learning.

original: de ltar lhag pa'i bsam pa'i stobs dang ldan pa ni gzhan gyi don la zhum par mi 'gyur bas de'i 'og tu sems can nye bar len @164b pa ste ;
analyzed: de ltar lhag pa'i bsam pa'i stobs dang ldan pa ni gzhan gyi don la zhum par mi 'gyur bas de'i 'og tu sems can nye bar len @164b pa ste ;
translated: Thus, one who possesses the power of superior intention does not become discouraged about the aims of others. Therefore, after that, there is the stage of taking up the burden.

original: sems can yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems can yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called the stage of taking up sentient beings, that is, the stage of taking up the burden of sentient beings.

original: bdag pos yongs su 'dzin pa ni rje bor gyur pa ni 'di gang dag gi rje bo yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa rje bor gyur pa gling bzhi pa'i dbang phyug nyid yin pas gling bzhi pa la sogs pa'i sems can
analyzed: bdag pos yongs su 'dzin pa ni rje bor gyur pa ni 'di gang dag gi rje bo yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa rje bor gyur pa gling bzhi pa'i dbang phyug nyid yin pas gling bzhi pa la sogs pa'i sems can
translated: The master is the lord, and the beings are those who are the lord's subjects.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The universal monarch and so on are the lord, and the beings of the four continents and so on are the subjects.

original: de ltar smon lam la sogs kyis yongs su bzung bas mi gtang ba'i bsam pa yongs su 'dzin pa rnams kyang tshe gcig pa'i lus re zhig pas 'di dag gi don bsgrub par mi nus pas /
analyzed: de ltar smon lam la sogs kyis yongs su bzung bas mi gtang ba'i bsam pa yongs su 'dzin pa rnams kyang tshe gcig pa'i lus re zhig pas 'di dag gi don bsgrub par mi nus pas /
translated: Since the beings who are the subjects of the master are not abandoned due to being taken up by the vow and so on, they are not able to accomplish the aims of those beings due to the destruction of their bodies in a single lifetime.

original: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu srid par skye ba'i khyad par te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu srid par skye ba'i khyad par te ;
translated: Therefore, after that, the special birth in existence is stated.

original: las kyi dbang gis 'dod pa'i gnas su skye ba zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la las dkar po yongs su gzung ba'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: las kyi dbang gis 'dod pa'i gnas su skye ba zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la las dkar po yongs su gzung ba'i dbang gis so //
translated: Birth in a desirable place due to the power of karma refers to the power of maintaining virtuous karma on the level of devoted engagement.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dud 'gro la sogs pa'i gnas dman par yang skye zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i dus na /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dud 'gro la sogs pa'i gnas dman par yang skye zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i dus na /
translated: And for the sake of maturing sentient beings, they are born in inferior states such as the animal state.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ngan 'gro rnams ldog ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ngan 'gro rnams ldog ste /
translated: When bodhisattvas realize this, they turn away from the lower realms.

original: log kyang smon lam gyi stobs kyis ngan 'gror skye'o //
analyzed: log kyang smon lam gyi stobs kyis ngan 'gror skye'o //
translated: But even though they have turned away from them, through the power of their prayers they are born in the lower realms.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis ni bsam gtan rnams bzlog nas 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis ni bsam gtan rnams bzlog nas 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Through the power of concentration, they turn away from the absorptions and are born in the desire realm.

original: mdo sde dag las byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan bzlog pa la mkhas pa 'byung na /
analyzed: mdo sde dag las byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan bzlog pa la mkhas pa 'byung na /
translated: The sutras state that bodhisattvas are skilled in turning away from the absorptions.

original: bsam gtan ldog pa ci bsam gtan yongs su gtong ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan ldog pa ci bsam gtan yongs su gtong ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: If they turn away from the absorptions, do they give up the absorptions?

original: smras pa / ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / ma yin no //
translated: They do not.

original: bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu ldog pa ni bsam gtan bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu ldog pa ni bsam gtan bzlog pa ste /
translated: Turning away from the result of the absorptions means turning away from the absorptions.

original: bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu gzugs kyi khams su skye ba de bzlog nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu gzugs kyi khams su skye ba de bzlog nas /
translated: Having turned away from the result of the absorptions, birth in the form realm,

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba yin no //
translated: they are born in the desire realm.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi skye ba bshad ma thag pa de yang skyes pa'i rabs kyi dbye bas mtha' yas te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi skye ba bshad ma thag pa de yang skyes pa'i rabs kyi dbye bas mtha' yas te /
translated: The births of the noble ones, just explained, are also infinite, classified as birth stories.

original: sems can rnam par dag pas che chung gi rnam pa gang dag la rnam par gzhag pa brjod dgos pas de'i phyir de'i 'og tu rnam par dag pa'i gnas skabs kyi sa bcu'o //
analyzed: sems can rnam par dag pas che chung gi rnam pa gang dag la rnam par gzhag pa brjod dgos pas de'i phyir de'i 'og tu rnam par dag pa'i gnas skabs kyi sa bcu'o //
translated: Since it is necessary to describe the classification of the great and small types of births in terms of the purification of sentient beings, therefore, after that, there are the ten grounds of the stage of purification.

original: bzhi pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pas mang du gnas kyang /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pas mang du gnas kyang /
translated: The fourth is that although one dwells in the many aspects of the factors conducive to enlightenment,üîΩone should dedicate the factors conducive to enlightenment to samsara.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa rnams 'khor bar yongs su bsngo ba yin no zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams ni gcig tu 'khor ba la sdud pa yin na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa rnams 'khor bar yongs su bsngo ba yin no zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams ni gcig tu 'khor ba la sdud pa yin na /
translated: Since the factors conducive to enlightenment are exclusively conducive to samsara,

original: @165a * // byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pas byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sgom pa snying rje chen pos yongs su zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @165a * // byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pas byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sgom pa snying rje chen pos yongs su zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the bodhisattva, skilled in means, cultivates the factors conducive to enlightenment, embracing them with great compassion.

original: de ni 'gro ba la 'khyud nas 'dug pa lta bu yin pas snying rje chen pos yongs su zin pa'i phyir 'khor bar yongs su bsngos pa rna bas sems can la phan par byed kyi gtan du 'khor ba la rgyab kyis phyogs te 'dug pa ni ma yin
analyzed: de ni 'gro ba la 'khyud nas 'dug pa lta bu yin pas snying rje chen pos yongs su zin pa'i phyir 'khor bar yongs su bsngos pa rna bas sems can la phan par byed kyi gtan du 'khor ba la rgyab kyis phyogs te 'dug pa ni ma yin
translated: Since it is as if he were embracing beings while sitting, he is not averse to samsara, for he is completely taken up with great compassion.

original: no // lnga pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhis mang du gnas pas kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: no // lnga pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhis mang du gnas pas kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He is not defiled by the afflictions, for he dwells much in the four noble truths.

original: des na sems la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: des na sems la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: Thus, since his mind is undefiled, he brings beings to maturity.

original: 'di ni sa lnga ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sa lnga ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: This is the defining characteristic of the fifth stage.

original: der kun nas nyon mongs pa rjes su sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di'i ched du bsams nas srid par skye ba gang yin pa der rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas lan mang du gnas pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba yin
analyzed: der kun nas nyon mongs pa rjes su sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di'i ched du bsams nas srid par skye ba gang yin pa der rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas lan mang du gnas pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba yin
translated: He is not defiled by the afflictions, for he dwells much in the dependent origination of the stage of the wise.

original: no ; / bdun pa ni 'dres pa nye bar 'dres pa nyid kyis bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam gnas brgyad dang 'brel pa /
analyzed: no ; / bdun pa ni 'dres pa nye bar 'dres pa nyid kyis bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam gnas brgyad dang 'brel pa /
translated: The seventh is the path of single progress, which is connected with the eight abodes, since it is mixed and fully mixed.

original: mtshan ma med par gcig tu nges pa'i lam yin no zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: mtshan ma med par gcig tu nges pa'i lam yin no zhes bya ba de la /
translated: It is the path of single progress that is definitely destined for the signless.

original: 'dres pa ni byang chub sems dpa' mtshan ma med par gnas pa sa bdun pa la gnas pa rnams dang ngo ;
analyzed: 'dres pa ni byang chub sems dpa' mtshan ma med par gnas pa sa bdun pa la gnas pa rnams dang ngo ;
translated: The mixed refers to the bodhisattvas who abide in the signless and abide on the seventh spiritual level.

original: / nye bar 'dres pa ni byang chub sems dpa' mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i lam thob pa sa brgyad pa la gnas pa rnams dang ngo //
analyzed: / nye bar 'dres pa ni byang chub sems dpa' mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i lam thob pa sa brgyad pa la gnas pa rnams dang ngo //
translated: The fully mixed refers to the bodhisattvas who have attained the path without formative influence and abide on the eighth spiritual level.

original: brgyad pa ma thob na ji ltar nye bar 'dres pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad pa ma thob na ji ltar nye bar 'dres pa yin zhe na /
translated: If the eighth level has not been attained, how can there be a state of being fully mixed?

original: nye ba zhes bya ba'i nye bar gyur pa 'di ni khad nye ba la bya ste de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa'i 'di ni mtshan ma med par gnas pa'i mthar thug par gyur pa'i spyi bo la gnas pa mngon par 'du byed pa med par gnas
analyzed: nye ba zhes bya ba'i nye bar gyur pa 'di ni khad nye ba la bya ste de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa'i 'di ni mtshan ma med par gnas pa'i mthar thug par gyur pa'i spyi bo la gnas pa mngon par 'du byed pa med par gnas
translated: The prefix sam in the compound samprata is to be understood as meaning samƒ´pa, proximity. Thus, this bodhisattva is one who is proximate to the summit which is the culmination of the bodhisattvas' abode in the signless. He is one who abides in the signless without formative influence.

original: par gyur pa dang / khad nye bar gnas shing bar chad med par thob pa yin pas nye bar 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: par gyur pa dang / khad nye bar gnas shing bar chad med par thob pa yin pas nye bar 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and they are close to it, since they have attained it without interruption.

original: yang na mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa'i lam bsgom pa'i phyir 'dres pa nye bar 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa'i lam bsgom pa'i phyir 'dres pa nye bar 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, they are mixed and well mixed because they cultivate the path with and without added effort.

original: gang zag dang chos su lta ba'i gnyen po'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag dang chos su lta ba'i gnyen po'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have attained the knowledge that is the antidote to the views of the individual and phenomena.

original: gsum pa la ni mi nyams pa'i bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phyir @165b mnyam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs gzhan gyi gnas skabs na yang bsam gtan dag las nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni mi nyams pa'i bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phyir @165b mnyam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs gzhan gyi gnas skabs na yang bsam gtan dag las nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the third, they are in equipoise because they have attained the concentration and meditative stabilization that do not decline.

original: bzhi pa la ni mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos la tha dad pa nyid kyi nga rgyal spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos la tha dad pa nyid kyi nga rgyal spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: In the fourth, they have eliminated the pride that is the difference between the s≈´tras and so forth.

original: chos la nga rgyal spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sa gsum pa la byang chub sems dpa'i chos la gus pa dang / chos rin che bar byed pa bdag gis chos kyi tshig gcig gi don du yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po mes rab tu gang bar tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nas bdag nyid dor bar spro na /
analyzed: chos la nga rgyal spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sa gsum pa la byang chub sems dpa'i chos la gus pa dang / chos rin che bar byed pa bdag gis chos kyi tshig gcig gi don du yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po mes rab tu gang bar tshangs pa'i 'jig rten nas bdag nyid dor bar spro na /
translated: The phrase the bodhisattva abandons pride with regard to the Dharma refers to the third stage. The bodhisattva's respect for the Dharma and the Dharma's high value are such that he would gladly throw himself from the Brahma heaven into a great billion world universe filled with fire for the sake of a single word of Dharma.

original: me'i 'obs tha mal ba lta smos kyang ci dgos snyam pa gang yin pa des /
analyzed: me'i 'obs tha mal ba lta smos kyang ci dgos snyam pa gang yin pa des /
translated: How much more so would he do so for an ordinary fire pit?

original: sa bzhi pa la ldog go //
analyzed: sa bzhi pa la ldog go //
translated: This is the reversal of the fourth stage.

original: ji ltar ldog ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar ldog ce na /
translated: How is there a reversal?

original: de 'di snyam du gcig tu chos tshol ba gang yin pa 'di ni sems g-yeng bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du gcig tu chos tshol ba gang yin pa 'di ni sems g-yeng bar 'gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattva thinks, The search for the Dharma is a distraction.

original: de bas na chos tshol ba btang la byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa bsgom pa la 'jug go snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de bas na chos tshol ba btang la byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa bsgom pa la 'jug go snyam du sems so //
translated: Therefore, I will abandon the search for the Dharma and enter into the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment.

original: lnga pa la ni sems dang bsam pa rnam par dag pa bcus rgyud tha dad par nga rgyal med pa yin no //
analyzed: lnga pa la ni sems dang bsam pa rnam par dag pa bcus rgyud tha dad par nga rgyal med pa yin no //
translated: On the fifth stage, the bodhisattva is free of pride with regard to the diversity of mindstreams, due to the purity of mind and intention.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
translated: the sameness of intention regarding the purity of the qualities of the buddhas of the past, and likewise the sameness of intention regarding the purity of the qualities of the buddhas of the future and the present; the sameness of intention regarding the purity of discipline;

original: sems rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / lta ba dang / the tshom dang / yid gnyis dang / 'gyod pa sel bas rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / lam dang lam ma yin pa shes pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / lta ba dang / the tshom dang / yid gnyis dang / 'gyod pa sel bas rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / lam dang lam ma yin pa shes pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
translated: the sameness of intention regarding the purity of mind; the sameness of intention regarding the purity of eliminating views, doubts, uncertainty, and regret; the sameness of intention regarding the purity of knowing what is and is not the path;

original: lam shes pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thams cad gong ma gong mas rnam par 'jig pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: lam shes pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thams cad gong ma gong mas rnam par 'jig pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The purity of bringing all sentient beings to maturity is the same intention.

original: sems dang bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid bcu po 'di dag gis sa lnga pa la 'jug ste /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' sa lnga pa thob pas ji ltar 'das pa la sogs pa'i @166a * //
analyzed: sems dang bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid bcu po 'di dag gis sa lnga pa la 'jug ste / byang chub sems dpa' sa lnga pa thob pas ji ltar 'das pa la sogs pa'i @166a * //
translated: One enters the fifth level by means of these ten same intentions that are pure thoughts and intentions.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa de kho na bzhin du bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang ring po mi thogs par rnam par dag par 'gyur ro snyam pa de lta bu'i bsam pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa de kho na bzhin du bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang ring po mi thogs par rnam par dag par 'gyur ro snyam pa de lta bu'i bsam pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who has attained the fifth level obtains the intention that the purity of the buddhadharmas will be just like that of the past, future, and present Lord Buddhas, and that his own buddhadharmas will not be long in becoming pure in the same way.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid de ni rang bzhin kho nas rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid de ni rang bzhin kho nas rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: That suchness of dependent origination is pure by its very nature.

original: de la ma rig pa'i rkyen can la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba glo bur bas dri ma can du gyur pa gang yin pa'am /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa'i rkyen can la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba glo bur bas dri ma can du gyur pa gang yin pa'am /
translated: The suchness of dependent origination is not defiled by the adventitious defilements of the process of dependent origination in terms of affliction, such as ignorance as a condition, etc.

original: ma rig pa 'gags pa la sogs pa dkar po'i phyogs kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas rnam par dag pa gang yin pa 'di ni de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags pa la sogs pa dkar po'i phyogs kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas rnam par dag pa gang yin pa 'di ni de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it purified by the process of dependent origination in terms of the side of virtue, such as the cessation of ignorance, etc.

original: de bas na nag po dang dkar po'i phyogs dag gis /
analyzed: de bas na nag po dang dkar po'i phyogs dag gis /
translated: Therefore,

original: de bzhin nyid la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar mi lta ba'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid kyis mang du gnas pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba tha dad pa'i nga rgyal dang 'brel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar mi lta ba'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid kyis mang du gnas pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba tha dad pa'i nga rgyal dang 'brel bar 'gyur te /
translated: since suchness is not seen as defiled or purified by the dark and light sides, respectively, it is associated with the pride of the difference between defilement and purification because it abides in the suchness of dependent origination.

original: de bzhin nyid rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because suchness is pure by nature.

original: bdun pa la ni skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i blo thob pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sa de kho na las ji skad bshad pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: bdun pa la ni skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i blo thob pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sa de kho na las ji skad bshad pa lta bu ste /
translated: On the seventh, they attain the cognition that is endowed with a single instant of mind.

original: sa bdun pa 'di nyid la sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kun nas slong bas /
analyzed: sa bdun pa 'di nyid la sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kun nas slong bas /
translated: On this seventh level, they are able to activate all the attributes of the Buddha and

original: skad cig skad cig la lhag par byang chub kyi yan lag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig skad cig la lhag par byang chub kyi yan lag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: in each instant they complete all the elements that lead to enlightenment.

original: dgu pa la ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: dgu pa la ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la mkhas pa ste /
translated: On the ninth, they are skilled in bringing sentient beings to full maturity.

original: snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni so so yang dag par rig pa shin tu rnam par dag pa thob pas sems can yongs su smin par 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni so so yang dag par rig pa shin tu rnam par dag pa thob pas sems can yongs su smin par 'grub pa ste /
translated: As before, they attain the utterly pure aspects of correct understanding and they bring sentient beings to full maturity.

original: rnam pa thams cad du sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthu rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthu rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They have acquired the power to bring sentient beings to full maturity in every way.

original: sa bcu po dag la bslab pa gsum rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: sa bcu po dag la bslab pa gsum rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The three trainings are presented on the ten levels.

original: sa dang po la chos nyid de bzhin nyid rtogs nas ;
analyzed: sa dang po la chos nyid de bzhin nyid rtogs nas ;
translated: Having realized reality suchness on the first ground,

original: gnyis pa la lhag pa'i tshul khrims la slob po zhes bya ba ni dang po la yang lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: gnyis pa la lhag pa'i tshul khrims la slob po zhes bya ba ni dang po la yang lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yod mod kyi /
translated: on the second, one trains in superior morality. Although the training in superior morality exists on the first ground,

original: de rnam par dag par ni sa gnyis pa la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnam par dag par ni sa gnyis pa la 'gyur ro //
translated: it is purified on the second ground.

original: gang gi phyir rmi lam na yang kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i lam la mi 'jug pas de la @166b bslab pa de rnam par dag par 'gyur ba de'i phyir gnyis pa la lhag pa'i tshul khrims la slob po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rmi lam na yang kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i lam la mi 'jug pas de la @166b bslab pa de rnam par dag par 'gyur ba de'i phyir gnyis pa la lhag pa'i tshul khrims la slob po zhes bya'o //
translated: Because one does not engage in the path that is associated with misdeeds even in dreams, the training in superior morality is purified. Therefore it is said that on the second ground one trains in superior morality.

original: gsum pa la ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa mnyam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa mnyam par gzhag go //
translated: On the third, one trains in superior mind, which is meditative equipoise.

original: bzhi pa la ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa bsgoms pas lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'o//
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa bsgoms pas lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'o//
translated: On the fourth, one trains in superior wisdom, which is the cultivation of the factors conducive to enlightenment.

original: shes rab de yang spyod yul gnyis pa can de zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa gnyis pa can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes rab de yang spyod yul gnyis pa can de zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa gnyis pa can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That wisdom has two objects. It has two objects means it has two focal objects.

original: de mi shes pa dang shes pa la sogs pa'i 'jug pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs dang mi mthun pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de mi shes pa dang shes pa la sogs pa'i 'jug pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs dang mi mthun pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The forward and reverse processes of dependent origination are the processes of ignorance, knowledge, etc.

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ;
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ;
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to

original: bden pa bzhi bzung ste /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi bzung ste /
translated: the four noble truths.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen can la sogs pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni de mi shes pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen can la sogs pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni de mi shes pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: Dependent origination with ignorance as a condition, etc. is the nature of ignorance, etc.

original: rig pa la sogs pa ni shes pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: rig pa la sogs pa ni shes pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: Knowledge, etc. is the nature of knowledge, etc.

original: de lta bas na sa gnyis ka la yang chos kyi de kho na nyid dang / de mi shes pa dang shes pa la dmigs pa nyid kyis lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de lta bas na sa gnyis ka la yang chos kyi de kho na nyid dang / de mi shes pa dang shes pa la dmigs pa nyid kyis lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the training in wisdom is presented in both stages by focusing on the reality of the Dharma and on the ignorance and knowledge of that reality.

original: bslab pa rnams dang bslab pa bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu bzhi ni sa ring du song ba la sogs pa bzhi la rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: bslab pa rnams dang bslab pa bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu bzhi ni sa ring du song ba la sogs pa bzhi la rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The four trainings and the four results of cultivating the trainings are presented in the four stages, the Gone Afar, etc.

original: de ltar na bslab pa gsum po 'di dag rgyu dang 'bras bur bcas te sa bcu la rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar na bslab pa gsum po 'di dag rgyu dang 'bras bur bcas te sa bcu la rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, these three trainings are established on the ten stages, together with their causes and results.

original: 'di man chad ni zag pa med pa'i phung po sa bcu la ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa de bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni zag pa med pa'i phung po sa bcu la ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa de bsam par bya ste /
translated: From here on, one should consider how the uncontaminated aggregates are established on the ten stages.

original: sa dang po la chos nyid rab tu rtogs nas gnyis pa la tshul khrims kyi phung po sbyong ngo //
analyzed: sa dang po la chos nyid rab tu rtogs nas gnyis pa la tshul khrims kyi phung po sbyong ngo //
translated: Having realized reality on the first stage, one purifies the aggregate of morality on the second stage.

original: sa dang po la yang chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa na tshul khrims kyi phung po thob pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: sa dang po la yang chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa na tshul khrims kyi phung po thob pa yod mod kyi /
translated: Although one obtains the aggregate of morality on the first stage when one realizes the realm of Dharma,

original: yongs su dag pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa ni ma yin te /
translated: it is not completely pure.

original: gnyis pa la de yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa la de yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: On the second stage, it becomes completely pure.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po ni sa gsum pa la rnam pa dag go //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po ni sa gsum pa la rnam pa dag go //
translated: The aggregate of meditative stabilization is purified on the third stage.

original: shes rab kyi phung po ni sa bzhi pa la byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa bsgoms pas rnam par dag go //
analyzed: shes rab kyi phung po ni sa bzhi pa la byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa bsgoms pas rnam par dag go //
translated: The aggregate of wisdom is purified on the fourth stage by cultivating the factors of enlightenment.

original: lnga pa la bden pa bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: lnga pa la bden pa bsgoms pas so //
translated: On the fifth stage, it is purified by cultivating the truths.

original: drug pa la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun pa bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: drug pa la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun pa bsgoms pas so //
translated: On the sixth, by cultivating the forward and reverse forms of dependent origination.

original: rnam par grol ba dang rnam par grol ba'i ye shes kyi phung po gnyis ni sa bdun pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba dang rnam par grol ba'i ye shes kyi phung po gnyis ni sa bdun pa nas bzung ste /
translated: The two aggregates of liberation and the knowledge of liberation are purified from the seventh stage on,

original: @167a * // de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i bar la rnam par dag go //
analyzed: @167a * // de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i bar la rnam par dag go //
translated: up to the stage of the Tathagata.

original: rnam par grol ba de yang 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi'i sgrib pa la rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba de yang 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi'i sgrib pa la rig par bya'o //
translated: And that liberation should be understood as the obscuration to the four results.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni thogs pa'i sgrib pa las te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni thogs pa'i sgrib pa las te zhes bya ba la /
translated: On the Buddha stage, it is from the obscuration of the blockages.

original: 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi ni bshad ma thag pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi ni bshad ma thag pa ste /
translated: The four results have just been explained.

original: mtshan ma med pa 'du byed dang bcas pa ni sa bdun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa 'du byed dang bcas pa ni sa bdun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result of the seventh stage is the signless with application.

original: 'bras bu gnyis pa de nyid mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa ni sa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gnyis pa de nyid mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa ni sa brgyad pa'o //
translated: The second result, that very signless without application and the purification of the Buddha field, is the eighth stage.

original: 'bras bu gsum pa sems can rnams yongs su smin pa 'grub pa ni sa dgu pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gsum pa sems can rnams yongs su smin pa 'grub pa ni sa dgu pa'i'o //
translated: The third result, the accomplishment of the complete maturation of sentient beings, is on the ninth stage.

original: 'bras bu bzhi pa ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs 'grub pa ni sa bcu pa'i ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu bzhi pa ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs 'grub pa ni sa bcu pa'i ste /
translated: The fourth result, the accomplishment of meditative concentration and retention, is on the tenth stage.

original: 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi po 'di'i sgrib pa mtshan ma dang / mngon par 'du byed pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi po 'di'i sgrib pa mtshan ma dang / mngon par 'du byed pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Because of the absence of obscurations to the four results, such as signs and the formative influence of meditative concentration,

original: rnam par grol ba'i phung po rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i phung po rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: the aggregate of liberation is pure.

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes kyi phung po ni ;
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes kyi phung po ni ;
translated: The aggregate of the knowledge of liberation

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa la'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa la'o //
translated: is on the Buddha stage.

original: de ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la rnam par dag ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la rnam par dag ce na /
translated: How is it pure on the Tathagata stage?

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩsangs rgyas rnams ni gang gis na /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir / sangs rgyas rnams ni gang gis na /
translated: In order to demonstrate that,üîΩit is said:

original: gzhan dag shes pa thogs par 'gyur ba de las rnam par grol bas thams cad la ye shes thogs pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gzhan dag shes pa thogs par 'gyur ba de las rnam par grol bas thams cad la ye shes thogs pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because the Buddhas are free from that which would obstruct the knowledge of others, they have unobstructed knowledge of everything.

original: rnam par grol ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni /
translated: Liberation

original: 'gog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: is the nature of cessation.

original: 'gog pa yang 'dus ma byas yin la /
analyzed: 'gog pa yang 'dus ma byas yin la /
translated: Cessation is unconditioned.

original: phung po'i don yang spungs pa'i don yin na /
analyzed: phung po'i don yang spungs pa'i don yin na /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúaggregate‚Äù is a heap.

original: ji ltar 'dus ma byas phung por rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dus ma byas phung por rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: How can the unconditioned be posited as an aggregate?

original: bstan bcos gzhan dag las kyang /üîΩphung po dag tu 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: bstan bcos gzhan dag las kyang / phung po dag tu 'dus ma byas //
translated: Other treatises also explain:üîΩThe unconditioned is not explained

original: don du mi rung phyir ma bshad //üîΩces bshad do zhe na /
analyzed: don du mi rung phyir ma bshad // ces bshad do zhe na /
translated: as an aggregate because it is not suitable as an object.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi rnam par grol ba ni phung po ni nyid du rnam par mi 'jog go //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi rnam par grol ba ni phung po ni nyid du rnam par mi 'jog go //
translated: Unconditioned liberation is not posited as an aggregate.

original: rnam par grol ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Liberation is twofold:

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mos pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mos pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of abandoning afflictions and the characteristic of aspiration.

original: de la mos pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i phung por rnam par 'dog  pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de la mos pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i phung por rnam par 'dog  pas nyes pa med do //
translated: Since the characteristic of aspiration is conditioned, it is posited as an aggregate of liberation.

original: de lta ma yin na rnam par grol ba'i phung po 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rnam par grol ba'i phung po 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, liberation would not be subsumed by the aggregate of formation.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la ni sa rnams ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la ni sa rnams ma grub pa ste /
translated: On the level of resolute practice, the levels are not established.

original: gnas skabs de na gcig kyang ma thob na @167b thams cad ma grub pa kho nar brjod do //
analyzed: gnas skabs de na gcig kyang ma thob na @167b thams cad ma grub pa kho nar brjod do //
translated: If one does not obtain any of them at that time, it is said that none are accomplished.
