original: lhag ma rnams ni grub pa ste zhes bya ba ni de dag gis thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni grub pa ste zhes bya ba ni de dag gis thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The rest are accomplished, because they are obtained.

original: grub pa dag la yang bdun ni ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lam mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: grub pa dag la yang bdun ni ma grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lam mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: And seven of the accomplished ones are not accomplished, because the path operates with exertion.

original: sa brgyad pa la sogs pa la ltos nas ma grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la sogs pa la ltos nas ma grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In relation to the eighth stage and so on, they are called not accomplished.

original: gang dag gong du sa rab tu dga' ba grub pa bshad pa zhes bya ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang / chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i gags gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir grub pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang dag gong du sa rab tu dga' ba grub pa bshad pa zhes bya ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang / chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i gags gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir grub pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Those that were previously explained as accomplished on the stage of joy are called accomplished because one is free from the afflictions that are to be eliminated by the path of vision, and because one is free from the obstruction to the realization of the dharma-dhƒÅtu, which is the apprehension of subject and object.

original: gang gi tshes rnam par gzhag pa de rtog pa tsam du shes shing zhes bya ba ni ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnam par gzhag pas /üîΩsa rnam par bzhag pa gang yin pa de la /
analyzed: gang gi tshes rnam par gzhag pa de rtog pa tsam du shes shing zhes bya ba ni ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnam par gzhag pas / sa rnam par bzhag pa gang yin pa de la /
translated: The statement ‚Äúone understands that the presentation of time is merely conceptual‚Äù refers to the presentation of the collection of names, the collection of phrases, and the collection of letters.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúone understands that the presentation of the stages is merely conceptual‚Äù refers to the presentation of the stages of the ten ƒÅrya bodhisattva stages.

original: sems 'di nyid sa rnam par gzhag par snang gi //
analyzed: sems 'di nyid sa rnam par gzhag par snang gi //
translated: The mind itself appears as the presentation of the stages.üîΩThere is no external object that is other than the mind.üîΩAfter that, one understands that the mind only is the apprehender.

original: sems las gzhan pa phyi'i don ni med do zhes sems tsam du shes shing de'i 'og tu gzung ba med na gang la 'dzin par byed ces gzur ba med pa ni 'dzin par byed pa rtog pa tsam de la yang rtog par mi byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sems las gzhan pa phyi'i don ni med do zhes sems tsam du shes shing de'i 'og tu gzung ba med na gang la 'dzin par byed ces gzur ba med pa ni 'dzin par byed pa rtog pa tsam de la yang rtog par mi byed pa yin te /
translated: One does not conceive of the conceptualization that is the mere conceptualization of the apprehender.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: de nas de ni 'jig rten las /üîΩ'das pa'i ye shes bla med pa //
analyzed: de nas de ni 'jig rten las / 'das pa'i ye shes bla med pa //
translated: after that, one attains the supramundane,üîΩunsurpassed pristine wisdom,

original: rnam par mi rtog dri ma med //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog dri ma med //
translated: which is nonconceptual, stainless,

original: 'dzin pa gnyis dang bral ba 'thob //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gnyis dang bral ba 'thob //
translated: and free from the two apprehensions.

original: de 'di'i gnas yongs gyur ba ste //
analyzed: de 'di'i gnas yongs gyur ba ste //
translated: That is the complete transformation of the basis,

original: sa ni dang po yin par 'dod //
analyzed: sa ni dang po yin par 'dod //
translated: which is asserted to be the first stage.

original: ces bya ba de lta bur sa yongs su grub pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: ces bya ba de lta bur sa yongs su grub pa zhes bshad do //
translated: This is called the perfected stage of the bodhisattva.

original: sa la bzhugs pa'i rtags rnam par 'byed pa las thams cad rab tu rtogs pa ni de dag la mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sa mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas pa'i phyir te /üîΩsa dang po thob pa ni don gyis thams cad rab tu rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: sa la bzhugs pa'i rtags rnam par 'byed pa las thams cad rab tu rtogs pa ni de dag la mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sa mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas pa'i phyir te / sa dang po thob pa ni don gyis thams cad rab tu rtogs pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is in the stage of certain destiny is said to have attained the realization of everything, because he is skilled in the realization of the stages.üîΩHe is skilled in the realization of the stages, because he has attained the first stage.

original: sa dang po las ji skad bshad pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: sa dang po las ji skad bshad pa lta bu yin no //
translated: He is said to have attained the realization of everything, because he has attained the first stage, as it is explained in the first stage.

original: chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs pa na chos thams cad rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs pa na chos thams cad rtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: He is said to have attained the realization of everything, because he has attained the realization of the realm of the Dharma, since he has realized all dharmas.

original: 'di ltar de'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyis mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas pa thob pa'i phyir thams cad la phyin ci ma log par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyis mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas pa thob pa'i phyir thams cad la phyin ci ma log par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, after that, he attains skill in realization through the knowledge that is attained, and he becomes unmistaken in all things.

original: bkrir mi btub pa nyid ni snyan pa dang mi snyan pa'i sgra dag gis so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bkrir mi btub pa nyid ni snyan pa dang mi snyan pa'i sgra dag gis so zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is said to be unassailable, because he is not assailed by either pleasant or unpleasant sounds.

original: snyan pa ni yon tan sgrogs pa ste /
analyzed: snyan pa ni yon tan sgrogs pa ste /
translated: Pleasant sounds are those that proclaim his good qualities.

original: yon tan bsgrags pas sa dag las bkrir mi btub cing /
analyzed: yon tan bsgrags pas sa dag las bkrir mi btub cing /
translated: Since their qualities are proclaimed, they cannot be led astray by the grounds.üîΩ

original: rnam @168a * //
analyzed: rnam @168a * //
translated: He cannot be led away from the stages by the proclamation of good qualities.

original: par mi g-yos pas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: par mi g-yos pas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He is unshakable, i.e., he is not shaken from the stages by the praise of outsiders.

original: bstod pa ni yon tan bsngags pa ste /
analyzed: bstod pa ni yon tan bsngags pa ste /
translated: Praise is the proclamation of good qualities.

original: 'di las phyi rol pa dag gis bstod kyang sa dag las rnam par g-yos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa dag gis bstod kyang sa dag las rnam par g-yos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He is not shaken from the stages even by the praise of outsiders.

original: thabs la mkhas pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Skill in means is nonconceptual intuition, i.e., nonapprehending.üîΩThese are the other signs.

original: 'di dag ni rtags gzhan yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gong du yang spyir /
analyzed: 'di dag ni rtags gzhan yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gong du yang spyir /
translated: Thus, above, in general, the signs were explained as:

original: brtse dang snyan par smra ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtags bshad pas /
analyzed: brtse dang snyan par smra ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtags bshad pas /
translated: Compassion, sweet speech, etc.

original: de la ltos nas gzhan zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de la ltos nas gzhan zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In relation to that, the other signs are mentioned.

original: rtag tu pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sgrub pa'i 'dun pa dang bral ba nyid ces bya ba ni bsgrub pas sbyin pa la sogs pas rab tu sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: rtag tu pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sgrub pa'i 'dun pa dang bral ba nyid ces bya ba ni bsgrub pas sbyin pa la sogs pas rab tu sbyor ba yin no //
translated: He is always free from the desire to practice the perfections, i.e., he is engaged in generosity, etc.

original: chags dang khu ba'i snying med khro min le lo med //
analyzed: chags dang khu ba'i snying med khro min le lo med //
translated: He is not attached, nor is he without compassion, nor is he angry, nor is he lazy,

original: byams dang snying rje min pa'i bsam pa med //
analyzed: byams dang snying rje min pa'i bsam pa med //
translated: He has no thoughts that are not loving and compassionate.

original: blo gros ngan rtog rnam rtog 'phrogs pa med //
analyzed: blo gros ngan rtog rnam rtog 'phrogs pa med //
translated: He is not carried away by evil thoughts and discursive thinking.

original: ces bya ba 'di dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba 'di dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos te /
translated: These are the qualities that are the opposites of the six perfections.

original: de dag dang rtag tu bral ba yin no //üîΩbyams dang snying rje min pa'i bsam pa med //
analyzed: de dag dang rtag tu bral ba yin no // byams dang snying rje min pa'i bsam pa med //
translated: He is always free of them.üîΩHe has no thoughts that are not loving and compassionate.

original: ces bya ba ni byams pa ma yin pa'i bsam pa med pa dang / snying rje ma yin pa'i bsam pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni byams pa ma yin pa'i bsam pa med pa dang / snying rje ma yin pa'i bsam pa med pa'o //
translated: He has no thoughts that are not loving and compassionate.

original: byams pa dang snying rje dang ldan pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa yin par shes te /
analyzed: byams pa dang snying rje dang ldan pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa yin par shes te /
translated: He is known to have the fourth meditation, because he has loving and compassionate thoughts.

original: byams pa dang snying rje dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byams pa dang snying rje dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he has loving and compassionate thoughts,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba spangs pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba spangs pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: the perfection of meditation is explained as the avoidance of the opposites of meditation, namely, malice and violence.

original: blo gros ngan rtog rnam rtog 'phrogs pa med //
analyzed: blo gros ngan rtog rnam rtog 'phrogs pa med //
translated: He is not carried away by evil thoughts and discursive thinking.

original: ces bya ba 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa'i rtags yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa'i rtags yin no //
translated: This is the sign of attaining the perfection of wisdom.

original: theg pa gzhan yid la byed pas sems rnam par ma g-yengs pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'di'i sems theg pa gzhan gyis rnam par mi g-yengs pa yin no //
analyzed: theg pa gzhan yid la byed pas sems rnam par ma g-yengs pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'di'i sems theg pa gzhan gyis rnam par mi g-yengs pa yin no //
translated: His mind is not distracted by attention to other vehicles.

original: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes dang bral ba'i chos dga' ba la dga' ba yang thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i chos kyi mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes dang bral ba'i chos dga' ba la dga' ba yang thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i chos kyi mtshan ma'am /
translated: He attains the joy of delight in the Dharma, free from the perception of variety.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos kyi mtshan ma yang rung /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos kyi mtshan ma yang rung /
translated: The signs of conditioned and unconditioned phenomena,üîΩwhether they have form or are formless,

original: de lta bu la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thams cad yid la mi byed pas spangs nas /
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thams cad yid la mi byed pas spangs nas /
translated: are all abandoned by not attending to them in this way and so on.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pas chos kyi dga' ba 'thob ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pas chos kyi dga' ba 'thob ste /
translated: He attains the joy of the Dharma through the aspect of signlessness.

original: zhi gnas 'thob pas rnam par mi g-yeng ngo zhes bya ba'i @168b tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhi gnas 'thob pas rnam par mi g-yeng ngo zhes bya ba'i @168b tha tshig go //
translated: He is not distracted by attaining ≈õamatha. This is the meaning.

original: thams cad du rnam par yongs su ma chad pa'i chos kyi snang ba tshad med pa yang yang dag par shes par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i chos rnams kyi rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'i chos kyi snang ba yangüîΩdag par shes so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du rnam par yongs su ma chad pa'i chos kyi snang ba tshad med pa yang yang dag par shes par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i chos rnams kyi rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'i chos kyi snang ba yang dag par shes so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This means that he knows the light of the Dharma, which is the unhindered aspect of all dharmas, both those with form and those without form.

original: yang na thams cad du rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcur rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'i chos kyi snang ba yang dag par shes so zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: yang na thams cad du rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcur rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'i chos kyi snang ba yang dag par shes so zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Or else, the light of the Dharma, which is not cut off in any way, means that he knows the light of the Dharma, which is not cut off in any way in the ten directions.

original: gzhung la legs par zhugs pa gsal ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhung la legs par zhugs pa gsal ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like a lamp that is well placed.

original: sa'i nges pa'i tshig rnam par dbye ba la /
analyzed: sa'i nges pa'i tshig rnam par dbye ba la /
translated: The etymology of the stages.üîΩHe is close to enlightenment.

original: byang chub la ni nye ba dang // zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po thob pa na 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: byang chub la ni nye ba dang // zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po thob pa na 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: When a bodhisattva attains the first stage, he thinks as follows.

original: bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi sa dang nye bar gyur to zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩsems can don sgrub mthong ba la //
analyzed: bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi sa dang nye bar gyur to zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro // sems can don sgrub mthong ba la //
translated: I am close to the Buddha stage.

original: zhes bya ba ji ltar sems can gyi don sgrub pa mthong zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ji ltar sems can gyi don sgrub pa mthong zhe na /
translated: How does one see the accomplishment of the aims of beings?

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because one obtains nonconceptual intuition and because one perfects the transcendence of generosity.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dga' bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dga' bar 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, one becomes joyful.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sa rab tu dga' ba zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sa rab tu dga' ba zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this stage is called the Joyous.

original: theg pa gzhan yid la byed pa'i dri ma las 'das pa'i khungs su mdo sde'i dum bu de lta bas na bdag gis sgrub tu mtshungs pa la rnam pa thams cad yongs su sbyang ba mngon par bsgrub pa kho na la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba ni
analyzed: theg pa gzhan yid la byed pa'i dri ma las 'das pa'i khungs su mdo sde'i dum bu de lta bas na bdag gis sgrub tu mtshungs pa la rnam pa thams cad yongs su sbyang ba mngon par bsgrub pa kho na la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba ni
translated: The source for the transcendence of the other vehicles is the passage from the sutra that begins, Therefore, I will strive to perfect the purification of all aspects in the equality of practice.

original: sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: sbyin par byed de /
translated: One gives to the bodhisattvas,

original: nyan thos kyis mngon par bsgrub pa la ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyan thos kyis mngon par bsgrub pa la ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: not to the disciples.

original: bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam ni sngar bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa'i ni 'dres pa nye bar 'dres pa nyid kyis bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam gnas pa brgyad dang 'brel pa mtshan ma med par gcig tu nges pa'i lam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam ni sngar bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa'i ni 'dres pa nye bar 'dres pa nyid kyis bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam gnas pa brgyad dang 'brel pa mtshan ma med par gcig tu nges pa'i lam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The path of single progress is the path of definite progress in signlessness, connected with the eight abodes, by the mixing and thorough mixing of the aspiration.

original: sbyor ba'i mthar thug par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i mthar thug par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it goes to the end of application.

original: ji ltar sprin gyis nam mkha' khyab pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar sprin gyis nam mkha' khyab pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the sky is pervaded by clouds,

original: ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs kyi sprin gyis thob pa'i chos rten la yod pa nam mkha' lta bu la khyab pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs kyi sprin gyis thob pa'i chos rten la yod pa nam mkha' lta bu la khyab pa'i phyir te /
translated: so the sky-like Dharma that is obtained and exists in the support is pervaded by the clouds of samadhi and dharani.

original: sngar sa dgu pa la gnas pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams las thos pa'i chos rten la gnas pa gang yin pa de ni sa bcu la ltos na chung ngu yin no //
analyzed: sngar sa dgu pa la gnas pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams las thos pa'i chos rten la gnas pa gang yin pa de ni sa bcu la ltos na chung ngu yin no //
translated: The Dharma that the one abiding on the ninth ground previously heard from the Bhagavan Buddhas and exists in the support is small in comparison to the tenth ground.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs kyi sgo'i sprin gyis khyab pa ni de dag gi stobs kyis sangs @169a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs kyi sgo'i sprin gyis khyab pa ni de dag gi stobs kyis sangs @169a * //
translated: The pervasion by the clouds of the doors of samadhi and dharani is due to the power of those samadhis and dharanis.

original: rgyas bye ba khrag khrig mang po dag las chos nyan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyas bye ba khrag khrig mang po dag las chos nyan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the many hundreds of thousands of millions of bodhisattvas who have come to listen to the Dharma.

original: sa de dag nyid dge ba sna tshogs mngon par bsgrub pa nyid kyis gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa de dag nyid dge ba sna tshogs mngon par bsgrub pa nyid kyis gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those very stages are called abodes because of the accomplishment of various virtues.

original: dge ba bsgrub pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni dge ba bsgrub pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi ched du ste 'di ni ched kyi bdun pa yin te /
analyzed: dge ba bsgrub pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni dge ba bsgrub pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi ched du ste 'di ni ched kyi bdun pa yin te /
translated: Because of the accomplishment of various virtues means for the sake of the accomplishment of various virtues. This is the seventh case, the dative.

original: 'di ni sa rnams kyi gnas pa rnam par dbye ba'i don gyis nges pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sa rnams kyi gnas pa rnam par dbye ba'i don gyis nges pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is the verbal root meaning of the stages in terms of the meaning of abode.

original: sa rnam par dbye ba'i don gyis nges pa'i tshig ni /
analyzed: sa rnam par dbye ba'i don gyis nges pa'i tshig ni /
translated: The verbal root meaning of the stages in terms of the meaning of differentiation is stated:

original: 'byung po dpag med 'jigs med phyir //
analyzed: 'byung po dpag med 'jigs med phyir //
translated: Because of the fearlessness of countless beings,

original: dpag tu med pa de dag la //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa de dag la //
translated: on those immeasurable stages,

original: phyi phyir gong du 'gro ldan phyir //
analyzed: phyi phyir gong du 'gro ldan phyir //
translated: because of the possession of ever increasing progress,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: and so on.

original: re re la yang tshad med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis sa rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: re re la yang tshad med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis sa rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: Because each stage is immeasurable is the verbal root meaning of the stages in terms of the method of verbal expression.

original: sdom pa'i tshigs su bcad pa las /
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshigs su bcad pa las /
translated: The Verses Summarizing the Levels states:üîΩThe levels are so called

original: nges pa'i tshig dang thob pa yis //üîΩgnas pa dang ni sa nyid do //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig dang thob pa yis // gnas pa dang ni sa nyid do //
translated: because of their etymologies and attainments.

original: zhes bshad pa gang yin pa der ni gnas pa'i nges tshig dang sa'i nges pa'i tshig ces go rims bzhin du sbyar bar yang blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa gang yin pa der ni gnas pa'i nges tshig dang sa'i nges pa'i tshig ces go rims bzhin du sbyar bar yang blta bar bya ste /
translated: The etymologies of the levels and the attainments should be understood in the order in which they are presented in that passage.

original: sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i nges pa'i tshig so so ba yang yin la /
analyzed: sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i nges pa'i tshig so so ba yang yin la /
translated: The individual levels, such as the Joyous, are also called levels because of their etymologies.

original: spyir yang / dpag tu med pa de dag la //
analyzed: spyir yang / dpag tu med pa de dag la //
translated: In general, the levels are so called because they are the foundations for the qualities that are immeasurable,

original: phyi phyir gong du 'gro ldan phyir //üîΩzhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi phyir gong du 'gro ldan phyir // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: for they are the foundations for the qualities that are immeasurable and for the qualities that are immeasurable and increase further and further.

original: de'i 'og tu /üîΩthob pa rnam par dbye ba la mos pas thob pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la ji skad bshad pa la mos pas so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu / thob pa rnam par dbye ba la mos pas thob pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la ji skad bshad pa la mos pas so //
translated: The next verse states:üîΩAttainment through interest is on the level of earnest aspiration, as explained above.

original: zhes bya ba ni /üîΩji skad du /üîΩbskal pa grangs med nges 'byung zhing //üîΩmos pa rnam par 'phel byed pa //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni / ji skad du / bskal pa grangs med nges 'byung zhing // mos pa rnam par 'phel byed pa //
translated: The levels are called levels of attainment because they are the foundations for the qualities that are immeasurable, for they are the foundations for the qualities that are immeasurable and for the qualities that are immeasurable and increase further and further.üîΩThe levels are also called levels of attainment because they are the foundations for the qualities that are immeasurable, for they are the foundations for the qualities that are immeasurable and for the qualities that are immeasurable and increase further and further.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis bstan pa lta bu yin no /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis bstan pa lta bu yin no /
translated: The levels are also called levels of attainment because they are the foundations for the qualities that are immeasurable, for they are the foundations for the qualities that are immeasurable and for the qualities that are immeasurable and increase further and further.

original: 'di man chad ni mthar thug pa'i skabs te /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni mthar thug pa'i skabs te /
translated: From here on is the ultimate stage.

original: de ltar rang gi rgyud kyi gnas skabs rnam pa thams cad du yongs su byang zhing nor bu rin po che ltar sems can thams cad kyi don gyi ston par 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' 'di ni rnam pa thams cad du 'jig rten pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar rang gi rgyud kyi gnas skabs rnam pa thams cad du yongs su byang zhing nor bu rin po che ltar sems can thams cad kyi don gyi ston par 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' 'di ni rnam pa thams cad du 'jig rten pa dang /
translated: Thus, this bodhisattva, whose mindstream is completely purified in every way, like a precious jewel, is a teacher for the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pas nges par 'byung ba la 'doms par bzod pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pas nges par 'byung ba la 'doms par bzod pa yin pas /
translated: He is patient in instructing others in the renunciation that is completely purified in every way, both in the mundane and supramundane spheres.

original: de'i 'og tu theg pa thams cad kyis nges par 'byung ba'i spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu theg pa thams cad kyis nges par 'byung ba'i spyod pa ste /
translated: After that, there is the practice of renunciation through all the vehicles.

original: spyod pa rnam par dag pa bzhi ni 'phags pa gtsug na rin chen gyi mdo las ji skad 'byung ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: spyod pa rnam par dag pa bzhi ni 'phags pa gtsug na rin chen gyi mdo las ji skad 'byung ba lta bu yin no //
translated: The four pure practices are as they appear in the noble S≈´tra of the Jewel at the Crown of the Head.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun @169b pa'i spyod pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun @169b pa'i spyod pa ni /
translated: The practice of the elements that lead to enlightenment

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mos pa rnams kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtso bo smos nas brjod pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mos pa rnams kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtso bo smos nas brjod pa ste /
translated: This is said by way of the principal.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i spyod pa med pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i spyod pa med pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: It is not that the bodhisattvas do not have the practice of the factors of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i bsgoms pas ni gtsor nyan thos rnams rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i bsgoms pas ni gtsor nyan thos rnams rnam par grol lo //
translated: However, it is primarily through the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment that the disciples are liberated.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang pha rol tu phyin pa kun tu spyod pa gtso bor gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang pha rol tu phyin pa kun tu spyod pa gtso bor gyur pa yin te /
translated: For the bodhisattvas, the practice of the perfections is primary.

original: de nyid kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa ni theg pa chen po la mos pa rnams kyi phyir bshad do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa spyod pa ni theg pa chen po la mos pa rnams kyi phyir bshad do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the practice of the perfections is explained for the sake of those devoted to the Great Vehicle.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i spyod pa ni gnyis po nyid kyis yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtso bor ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i spyod pa ni gnyis po nyid kyis yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtso bor ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa yin no //
translated: The practice of bringing sentient beings to maturity is for the sake of their complete maturation by means of the two.

original: nyan thos rnams la yang sbyin pa dang snyan par smra ba la sogs pa bsdu ba'i dngos po dag yod pas gnyi ga'i yang bshad do //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams la yang sbyin pa dang snyan par smra ba la sogs pa bsdu ba'i dngos po dag yod pas gnyi ga'i yang bshad do //
translated: The listeners also have the means of gathering disciples such as generosity and speaking pleasantly, so they are explained as being both.

original: bsam pa bzang po de lta bu dang ldan pa ni yang dag pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i las kyis rnam pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa mthar thug pa thob nas /
analyzed: bsam pa bzang po de lta bu dang ldan pa ni yang dag pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i las kyis rnam pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa mthar thug pa thob nas /
translated: Those who have such a good intention are endowed with correct practice. By the activity of correct practice, they attain the ultimate universal vehicle practice of the bodhisattvas in all its aspects.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rnam par dag pa mthar thug rjes su thob par 'os pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rnam par dag pa mthar thug rjes su thob par 'os pas /
translated: They are worthy to attain the ultimate purity of the tathagatas.

original: de'i 'og tu bla na med pa yang dag pa rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi yon tan thun mong ma yin pa gang dag yin pa de dag gis ston to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bla na med pa yang dag pa rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi yon tan thun mong ma yin pa gang dag yin pa de dag gis ston to //
translated: Then, the uncommon qualities of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment are taught.

original: 'dir sems can rnams la snying brtse ba nyid ni phan pa dang bde ba'i dgongs pa nyid kyis bstan to zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa gsum gyis bde ba'i bsam pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir sems can rnams la snying brtse ba nyid ni phan pa dang bde ba'i dgongs pa nyid kyis bstan to zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa gsum gyis bde ba'i bsam pa nyid bstan to //
translated: Here, compassion for sentient beings is taught by the intention for benefit and happiness. The intention for happiness is taught by the three immeasurables.

original: bzhi pas ni phan pa'i bsam pa nyid do //
analyzed: bzhi pas ni phan pa'i bsam pa nyid do //
translated: The intention for benefit is by the fourth.

original: de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa nyid kyi dgongs pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa nyid kyi dgongs pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, it should be known that the characteristic of the intention is the absence of affliction. The affliction of sentient beings is twofold:

original: rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba'o //
translated: attachment and aversion.

original: btang snyoms kyis ni 'di ltar sems can rnams bde ba'i tshor ba la rjes su chags pa dang / sdug bsngal la khong khro bar mi 'gyur bar chags pa med cing zhen pa med pa dang sdang ba med par gyur cig ces mos par byad do //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyis ni 'di ltar sems can rnams bde ba'i tshor ba la rjes su chags pa dang / sdug bsngal la khong khro bar mi 'gyur bar chags pa med cing zhen pa med pa dang sdang ba med par gyur cig ces mos par byad do //
translated: By means of equanimity, one should will that sentient beings not be attached to the feeling of pleasure and not be averse to the feeling of pain, but be free of attachment, free of clinging, and free of aversion.

original: rnam par thar pa ni brgyad de /üîΩgzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par @170a * //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa ni brgyad de / gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par @170a * //
translated: The eight liberations are as follows:

original: thar pa dang po'o //
analyzed: thar pa dang po'o //
translated: The first liberation is to see material forms while having a conception of materiality.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //üîΩsdug pa ni rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o // sdug pa ni rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas te /
translated: The second liberation is to see external material forms while having a conception of internal non-materiality.üîΩThe third liberation is to have a pleasant liberation that is achieved by the body and perfected by the mind.

original: rdzogs par byas nas gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o //üîΩde la rnam pa thams cad du /üîΩgzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: rdzogs par byas nas gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o // de la rnam pa thams cad du / gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: The fourth liberation is to have a liberation that is achieved by the mind and perfected by the mind.üîΩThe fifth liberation is to have a liberation that is achieved by the mind and perfected by the mind.

original: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing /
analyzed: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing /
translated: The sixth liberation is to have a liberation that is achieved by the mind and perfected by the mind.üîΩThe seventh liberation is to have a liberation that is achieved by the mind and perfected by the mind.üîΩThe eighth liberation is to have a liberation that is achieved by the mind and perfected by the mind.

original: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas /
translated: Having completely transcended the sphere of infinite space, he thinks, ‚ÄúConsciousness is infinite.‚ÄùüîΩHaving completely transcended the sphere of infinite consciousness, he thinks, ‚ÄúThere is nothing at all.‚ÄùüîΩHaving completely transcended the sphere of nothingness, he enters and remains in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar ba bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar ba bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the sixth liberation.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas /
translated: Having completely transcended the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, he enters and remains in the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa lnga ba'o //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa lnga ba'o //
translated: This is the seventh liberation.üîΩ‚ÄúHaving thus attained the liberation of mind and liberation by wisdom, he perfectly knows as it truly is: ‚ÄòMy freedom has been attained; this is my last birth; now there is no continuation of existence.‚Äô‚Äù

original: de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te ci yang med do snyam nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te ci yang med do snyam nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa drug pa'o //
translated: This is the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, which I have said is to be realized.üîΩ‚ÄúAnd what, monks, is the noble truth of the path leading to the cessation of suffering, which I have said should be developed?

original: de rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das nas 'du shes med /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das nas 'du shes med /
translated: It is simply this noble eightfold path, namely: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.

original: 'du shes med min skye mched rdzogs par byas te /
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched rdzogs par byas te /
translated: Having completed the base of neither perception nor non-perception,

original: gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa bdun pa'o //
translated: to abide is the seventh liberation.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: Having completely transcended the base of neither perception nor non-perception,

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas rdzogs par byas te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas nas rdzogs par byas te gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa brgyad pa'o //
translated: to abide having actualized with the body the cessation of perception and feeling is the eighth liberation.

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad de /
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad de /
translated: There are eight bases of overpowering.

original: nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chung ngu kha dog bzang po dang kha dog ngan pa rnams la lta zhing /
analyzed: nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chung ngu kha dog bzang po dang kha dog ngan pa rnams la lta zhing /
translated: With the perception of inner form, to see small external forms, good-colored and bad-colored,

original: gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan nas shes zil gyis mnan nas mthong ste /
analyzed: gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan nas shes zil gyis mnan nas mthong ste /
translated: to see those forms having overpowered them,

original: de lta bur 'du shes par gyur pa 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang po'o ;
analyzed: de lta bur 'du shes par gyur pa 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang po'o ;
translated: to have the perception of them in that way is the first base of overpowering.

original: / nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chen por gyur pa kha dog bzang po dang kha dog ngan pa rnams la lta zhing gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan nas mthong ste /
analyzed: / nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chen por gyur pa kha dog bzang po dang kha dog ngan pa rnams la lta zhing gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan nas mthong ste /
translated: The second is when one perceives forms internally and sees external forms that are large, beautiful, and ugly, and one sees those forms as subdued,

original: de lta bur 'du shes par 'gyur pa 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bur 'du shes par 'gyur pa 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched gnyis pa'o //
translated: and one has the perception of them in that way.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du @170b shes pas phyir rol gyi gzugs rnams la de kho na bzhin du chung ngu dang chen por rim gyis lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched gsum pa dang bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du @170b shes pas phyir rol gyi gzugs rnams la de kho na bzhin du chung ngu dang chen por rim gyis lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched gsum pa dang bzhi pa'o //
translated: The third and fourth are when one perceives forms internally and sees external forms in the same way, small and large, respectively.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phir rol gyis gzugs sngon por dang kha dog sngon po lta bur ston pa 'od sngon po 'byung ba rnams la lta ste ;
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phir rol gyis gzugs sngon por dang kha dog sngon po lta bur ston pa 'od sngon po 'byung ba rnams la lta ste ;
translated: The fifth is when one perceives forms internally and sees external forms that are blue, with blue color, blue luster, and blue glow,

original: dper na zar ma'i me tog gam /
analyzed: dper na zar ma'i me tog gam /
translated: like the Indragopa flower,üîΩor like Benares cloth that is dyed blue.

original: yul b'a r'a na s'i'i ras phun sum tshogs pa sngon po sngon du lta bur ston pa 'od sngon po 'byung ba de bzhin du nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs sngon po kha dog sngon po sngon po lta bur ston pa /
analyzed: yul b'a r'a na s'i'i ras phun sum tshogs pa sngon po sngon du lta bur ston pa 'od sngon po 'byung ba de bzhin du nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs sngon po kha dog sngon po sngon po lta bur ston pa /
translated: and show as blue, shining with blue light.

original: 'od sngon po 'byung ba rnams la lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'od sngon po 'byung ba rnams la lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth base of subjugation.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs ser po kha dog ser po //
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs ser po kha dog ser po //
translated: With the perception of no inner form, one sees external forms that are yellow, have a yellow color,

original: ser po lta bur ston pa 'od ser po 'byung ba rnams la lta ste /
analyzed: ser po lta bur ston pa 'od ser po 'byung ba rnams la lta ste /
translated: and show as yellow, shining with yellow light.

original: dper na dong ka'i me tog gam /
analyzed: dper na dong ka'i me tog gam /
translated: For example, it is like the kar·πáikƒÅra flower,üîΩor the excellent cloth of VƒÅrƒÅ·πáasƒ´ that is yellow, has a yellow color,

original: yul b'a r'a na s'i'i ras phun sum tshogs pa ser po kha dog ser po ser po lta bur ston pa /
analyzed: yul b'a r'a na s'i'i ras phun sum tshogs pa ser po kha dog ser po ser po lta bur ston pa /
translated: and shows as yellow, shining with yellow light.

original: 'od ser po 'byung ba de bzhin du nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs ser po kha dog ser po ser po lta bur ston pa /
analyzed: 'od ser po 'byung ba de bzhin du nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs ser po kha dog ser po ser po lta bur ston pa /
translated: In the same way, with the perception of no inner form, one sees external forms that are yellow, have a yellow color, and show as yellow, shining with yellow light.

original: 'od ser po 'byung ba rnams la lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mche drug pa'o //
analyzed: 'od ser po 'byung ba rnams la lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mche drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixth sphere of mastery.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs dmar po kha dog dmar po //
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs dmar po kha dog dmar po //
translated: ‚ÄúWith the perception of the absence of form internally, one sees external forms that are red,

original: dmar po lta bur ston pa /
analyzed: dmar po lta bur ston pa /
translated: the color of red,

original: 'do dmar po 'byung ba rnams la lta ste /
analyzed: 'do dmar po 'byung ba rnams la lta ste /
translated: shining with red light.

original: dper na ban du dzi ba ka'i me tog gam /
analyzed: dper na ban du dzi ba ka'i me tog gam /
translated: For example, it is like the bandhujƒ´vaka flower,

original: yul b'a r'a na s'i'i ras phun sum tshogs pa mdar po /
analyzed: yul b'a r'a na s'i'i ras phun sum tshogs pa mdar po /
translated: or like cloth from VƒÅrƒÅ·πáasƒ´ that is perfectly red,

original: kha dog dmar po dmar po lta bur ston pa /üîΩ'od dmar po 'byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: kha dog dmar po dmar po lta bur ston pa / 'od dmar po 'byung ba de bzhin du /
translated: the color of red, shining with red light.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs dmar po //
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs dmar po //
translated: In the same way, with the perception of the absence of form internally, one sees external forms that are red,

original: kha dog dmar po dmar po lta bur ston pa /
analyzed: kha dog dmar po dmar po lta bur ston pa /
translated: the color of red, shining with red light.

original: 'od dmar po 'byung ba rnams la lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched bdun pa'o //
analyzed: 'od dmar po 'byung ba rnams la lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the seventh sphere of mastery.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs dkar po kha dog dkar po dkar po lta bur ston pa /
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs dkar po kha dog dkar po dkar po lta bur ston pa /
translated: ‚ÄúWith the perception of the absence of form internally, one sees external forms that are white, the color of white,üîΩshining with white light.

original: 'od dkar po 'byung ba rnams la lta ste /
analyzed: 'od dkar po 'byung ba rnams la lta ste /
translated: One sees the arising of white light.

original: dper na skar ma bsangs kyi mdog gam /
analyzed: dper na skar ma bsangs kyi mdog gam /
translated: For example, it is like the color of the star SujƒÅtƒÅ,

original: yul b'a r'a na s'i'i ras phun sum tshogs pa dkar po kha dog dkar po //
analyzed: yul b'a r'a na s'i'i ras phun sum tshogs pa dkar po kha dog dkar po //
translated: or like the excellent cloth of VƒÅrƒÅ·πáasƒ´, which is white, has a white color,

original: dkar po lta bur ston pa /üîΩ'od dkar po 'byung ba de bzhin du nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi @171a * //
analyzed: dkar po lta bur ston pa / 'od dkar po 'byung ba de bzhin du nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi @171a * //
translated: appears as white,üîΩand emits white light.üîΩIn the same way, with the perception of the internal as non-existent, one sees external forms that are white, have a white color,

original: gzugs dkar po kha dog dkar po dkar po lta bur ston pa /
analyzed: gzugs dkar po kha dog dkar po dkar po lta bur ston pa /
translated: appear as white,

original: 'od dkar po 'byung ba rnams la lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'od dkar po 'byung ba rnams la lta ba 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad pa'o //
translated: and emit white light. This is the eighth sphere of mastery.

original: zad par gyi skye mched ni bcu ste /
analyzed: zad par gyi skye mched ni bcu ste /
translated: The spheres of totalization are ten.

original: la la zad par sa'o //
analyzed: la la zad par sa'o //
translated: Some have totalization of earth,

original: zad par chu'o //
analyzed: zad par chu'o //
translated: totalization of water,

original: zad par me'o //
analyzed: zad par me'o //
translated: totalization of fire,

original: zad par rlung ngo //üîΩzad par sngon po'o ;
analyzed: zad par rlung ngo // zad par sngon po'o ;
translated: totalization of wind,üîΩtotalization of blue,

original: / zad par ser po'o //
analyzed: / zad par ser po'o //
translated: totalization of yellow,

original: zad par dmar po'o //
analyzed: zad par dmar po'o //
translated: totalization of red,

original: zad par dkar po'o //
analyzed: zad par dkar po'o //
translated: totalization of white,üîΩand totalization of space.

original: zad par nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched do zhes steng dang 'og dang thad kar gnyis su med cing tshad med par 'du shes par byed do //
analyzed: zad par nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched do zhes steng dang 'og dang thad kar gnyis su med cing tshad med par 'du shes par byed do //
translated: The sphere of infinite space is the sphere of infinite space.

original: la la zad par rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched do zhes steng dang 'og dang thad kar gnyis su med cing tshad med par 'du shes su byed do //
analyzed: la la zad par rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched do zhes steng dang 'og dang thad kar gnyis su med cing tshad med par 'du shes su byed do //
translated: Some, the sphere of infinite consciousness is the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: nyan thos rnams ni rnam par thar pa gsum gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar byed do //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni rnam par thar pa gsum gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar byed do //
translated: The Listeners are liberated from the obscurations to nirvana by means of the three liberations.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa ni rnam par thar pa bzhis zhi ba'i rnam par thar pa la ma chags pa'i sgrib pa 'joms so //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa ni rnam par thar pa bzhis zhi ba'i rnam par thar pa la ma chags pa'i sgrib pa 'joms so //
translated: The sphere of infinite space and so on conquer the obscurations to the liberation of peace by means of the four liberations.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i rnam par thar pa de'i sgrib pa thag sring bar byed do //
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i rnam par thar pa de'i sgrib pa thag sring bar byed do //
translated: The liberation of the cessation of discriminations and feelings distances one from the obscurations to that.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad las nges par grol ba nyid kyis khyad par du 'phags te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad las nges par grol ba nyid kyis khyad par du 'phags te /
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are superior because they are definitely liberated from all the afflictions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: rnam par thar pa rnams kyis ni dmigs pa la mos pa mdzad do //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams kyis ni dmigs pa la mos pa mdzad do //
translated: The liberations cause them to will the object.

original: nyan thos ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams kyis dmigs pa zil gyis mnan to //
analyzed: nyan thos ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams kyis dmigs pa zil gyis mnan to //
translated: The sravakas, by the spheres of mastery, overpower the object.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jig rten thams cad zil gyis gnon pa dang / nyid kyi thugs las mnga' bsgyur bas ji ltar bzhed pa las dmigs pa dang sprul pa la sogs pa sprul par mdzad pas 'di ni khyad par yin no ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jig rten thams cad zil gyis gnon pa dang / nyid kyi thugs las mnga' bsgyur bas ji ltar bzhed pa las dmigs pa dang sprul pa la sogs pa sprul par mdzad pas 'di ni khyad par yin no ;
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, overpower the entire world and, by the mastery of their own minds, emanate whatever objects they wish, such as emanations, and so on. This is the difference.

original: / nyan thos rnams ni zad par gyi skye mched dag gis rten dang bcas pa'i gzugs zad par sa la sogs par rgyas par byed do //
analyzed: / nyan thos rnams ni zad par gyi skye mched dag gis rten dang bcas pa'i gzugs zad par sa la sogs par rgyas par byed do //
translated: The sravakas, by the spheres of totality, expand the form with its basis, such as earth, and so on, to totality.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni ye shes kyis shes bya thams cad khyab pa nyid kyis khyad par du 'phags so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni ye shes kyis shes bya thams cad khyab pa nyid kyis khyad par du 'phags so //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are distinguished by the fact that their knowledge pervades all objects of knowledge.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the absence of conflict?

original: bsam gtan la brten nas gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa skye ba'i rkyen rjes su srung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang yin pa de dag mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: bsam gtan la brten nas gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa skye ba'i rkyen rjes su srung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang yin pa de dag mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: It consists of concentration and wisdom‚Äîthe rest as before‚Äîin the accomplishment of the absence of conflict through the protection of the conditions for the arising of the defilements of others.

original: smon nas shes pa'i chos gang zhe na /
analyzed: smon nas shes pa'i chos gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cognition resulting from a resolve?

original: bsam gtan la brten nas 'di shes par bya'o snyam pa'i smon lam 'grub pa'i ting nge @171b 'dzin dang shes rab gang yin pa dang / de dag la mtshungs par ldan pa sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: bsam gtan la brten nas 'di shes par bya'o snyam pa'i smon lam 'grub pa'i ting nge @171b 'dzin dang shes rab gang yin pa dang / de dag la mtshungs par ldan pa sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: It consists of concentration and wisdom‚Äîthe rest as before‚Äîin the accomplishment of the resolve: ‚ÄúMay I know thus and thus!‚ÄùüîΩWhat is the cognition of the Path?üîΩIt consists of concentration and wisdom‚Äîthe rest as before‚Äîin the accomplishment of the cognition of the Path.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa /
translated: correct knowledge of languages,üîΩand correct knowledge of eloquence.

original: chos rnams kyi rnam grangs dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / nges pa'i tshig dang rnam par dbye ba las 'phags pa rnams kyi ye shes thogs pa mi mnga' zhing /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rnam grangs dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / nges pa'i tshig dang rnam par dbye ba las 'phags pa rnams kyi ye shes thogs pa mi mnga' zhing /
translated: The four correct knowledges are the knowledge of the noble ones that is unimpeded with regard to the categories of phenomena, their individual characteristics, their definitions, and their classifications.

original: ma chags pa dang yin pa ste /
analyzed: ma chags pa dang yin pa ste /
translated: They are unattached and unimpeded.

original: 'di dag ni rnam grangs bzhin du chos dang / don dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rnam grangs bzhin du chos dang / don dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa yin no //
translated: These are the correct knowledges of phenomena, meanings, languages, and eloquence, respectively.

original: mngon par shes pa drug ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul dang lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / zag pa zad par shes pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul dang lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / zag pa zad par shes pa ste /
translated: The six higher perceptions are the perceptions of the domain of miracles, divine eye, divine ear, knowledge of others' minds, recollection of past lives, and knowledge of the exhaustion of defilements.

original: 'di dag ni mngon par shes pa drug go //
analyzed: 'di dag ni mngon par shes pa drug go //
translated: These are the six higher perceptions.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis la /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis la /
translated: The thirty-two marks of the Great Man are as follows:

original: skyes bu chen po zhabs shin tu gnas pas sa la mnyam par gshegs pa 'di ni ;
analyzed: skyes bu chen po zhabs shin tu gnas pas sa la mnyam par gshegs pa 'di ni ;
translated: The soles of his feet are well-placed and level when he walks.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan yin no //
translated: This is a mark of the Great Man.üîΩThe soles of his two feet have a thousand-spoked wheel with a hub and a rim, complete in every way.

original: zhabs gnyis kyi mthil la 'khor lo rtsibs stong pa mu khyud dang bcas shing rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa mnga' ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ni mtshan yin no //
analyzed: zhabs gnyis kyi mthil la 'khor lo rtsibs stong pa mu khyud dang bcas shing rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa mnga' ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ni mtshan yin no //
translated: These are the marks.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu la /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu la /
translated: The eighty minor marks are as follows:üîΩThe twenty fingers and toes are well-formed and have beautiful nails.

original: phyag dang zhabs dag gi sor mo nyi shu'i tshigs legs pa dang sen mo bzang ba ni dpe byad bzang po nyi shu ste /
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs dag gi sor mo nyi shu'i tshigs legs pa dang sen mo bzang ba ni dpe byad bzang po nyi shu ste /
translated: These are the twenty minor marks.

original: de lta bu la sogs pas /
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pas /
translated: In this way,

original: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rgyas par ni /
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rgyas par ni /
translated: the major and minor marks are extensive.

original: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde dag dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde dag dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa las shes par bya'o //
translated: They should be known in detail from the MahƒÅyƒÅna s≈´tras and the Bodhisattva Levels.

original: yongs su dag pa bzhi ni rten yongs su dag pa dang / dmigs pa yongs su dag pa dang / thugs yongs su dag pa dang ye shes yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa bzhi ni rten yongs su dag pa dang / dmigs pa yongs su dag pa dang / thugs yongs su dag pa dang ye shes yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The four purities are the purity of the support, the purity of the object, the purity of mind and the purity of pristine awareness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu ni /üîΩgnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu ni / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: The ten powers of the tathagatas are

original: mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: the power of knowing what is correct and what is incorrect; the power of knowing the fully ripened effects of actions; the power of knowing the various dhƒÅtus; the power of knowing the various inclinations; the power of knowing the various faculties; the power of knowing the paths that lead everywhere; the power of knowing all the meditative absorptions, liberations, samƒÅdhis and samƒÅpattis; the power of knowing one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô former lives; the power of knowing death, transition and rebirth; and the power of knowing the exhaustion of all contaminations.

original: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i @172a * //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i @172a * //
translated: The power of the knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants

original: stobs te ; 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yin no //
analyzed: stobs te ; 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yin no //
translated: These are the ten powers of the Tathagata.

original: rgyas par ni stobs bcu'i mdo las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par ni stobs bcu'i mdo las rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood in detail in the Dasabalacakra-sutra.

original: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro'i thabs la rab tu slu bzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro'i thabs la rab tu slu bzhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Mara of the method for good and bad destinies is a great deceiver.

original: bdud ni phyugs gsod pa dang / mer 'jug pa la sogs pas bde 'gror 'gro ba'i thabs su ston par byed pa'i phyir bde 'gro'i thabs la rab tu slu bar byed pa yin no //üîΩbzlog pas ni ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes de ltar lung 'bogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdud ni phyugs gsod pa dang / mer 'jug pa la sogs pas bde 'gror 'gro ba'i thabs su ston par byed pa'i phyir bde 'gro'i thabs la rab tu slu bar byed pa yin no // bzlog pas ni ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes de ltar lung 'bogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Mara is a great deceiver of the method for good destinies because he teaches the method for going to good destinies through killing cattle, entering fire, and so on.

original: de ltar bdud ni ngan 'gro'i thabs la yang rab tu slu bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bdud ni ngan 'gro'i thabs la yang rab tu slu bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Because he gives such instructions, he is also a great deceiver of the method for going to bad destinies.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis stobs gang gis bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro'i thabs la rab tu slu bar byed pa'i bdud bcom pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis stobs gang gis bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro'i thabs la rab tu slu bar byed pa'i bdud bcom pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the power by which the Bhagavan conquered Mara, the great deceiver of the method for good and bad destinies,üîΩthe text says:

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni bcom ldan 'das don dang po la bdud 'joms par mdzad pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩbcom ldan 'das ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis srog gcod pa la sogs pas dmyal ba la sogs par skye ba gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni bcom ldan 'das don dang po la bdud 'joms par mdzad pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te / bcom ldan 'das ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis srog gcod pa la sogs pas dmyal ba la sogs par skye ba gang yin pa de ni gnas yod do //
translated: The power of knowledge of the proper and improper is the first object of the Bhagavan's subjugation.

original: bde 'gror skye ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med do zhes rgyu la yang rgyur /üîΩ'bras bu la yang 'bras bur /
analyzed: bde 'gror skye ba gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med do zhes rgyu la yang rgyur / 'bras bu la yang 'bras bur /
translated: The Bhagavan knows by the power of knowledge of the proper and improper that birth in the hells and so on from killing and so forth is proper and that birth in happy realms is improper and impossible.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen cing /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen cing /
translated: He knows the cause of that as it is and he also knows the result of that as it is.

original: rgyu med pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyur smra ba'i dge sbyong dang bram ze dag kyang tshar gcod par mdzad do //
analyzed: rgyu med pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyur smra ba'i dge sbyong dang bram ze dag kyang tshar gcod par mdzad do //
translated: He also refutes the claims of ascetics and brahmins who propound causelessness and discordant causes.

original: lha la sogs pa skyabs ma yin pa la skyabs su rab tu slu ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lha la sogs pa skyabs ma yin pa la skyabs su rab tu slu ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He also refutes those who deceive by claiming that gods and so on are refuges when they are not refuges.

original: lha rnams ni nges par 'byung ba'i lam mngon par mi shes pa'i phyir skyabs ma yin no //
analyzed: lha rnams ni nges par 'byung ba'i lam mngon par mi shes pa'i phyir skyabs ma yin no //
translated: The gods are not a refuge because they do not know the path to deliverance.

original: skyabs kyi don ni skyob pa'i don yin na /üîΩde rnams ni thabs mi shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyabs kyi don ni skyob pa'i don yin na / de rnams ni thabs mi shes pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of refuge is the meaning of protection.

original: 'khor ba dang ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa thams cad las sems can rnams skyob par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa thams cad las sems can rnams skyob par mi nus so //
translated: But they are not able to protect beings from all the fears of cyclic existence and unfortunate rebirths, because they do not know the means.

original: bdud ni de dag kyang 'jig rten gyi skyabs nyid du ston pa na skyabs su rab tu slu bar byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdud ni de dag kyang 'jig rten gyi skyabs nyid du ston pa na skyabs su rab tu slu bar byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Mara is called the one who deceives about refuge because he teaches that the gods are a refuge for the world.

original: lha rnams ni thabs ma yin pa rdzu 'phrul dang / dam pa sbyin pa la sogs pas 'jig rten la rab tu slu bar byed do //
analyzed: lha rnams ni thabs ma yin pa rdzu 'phrul dang / dam pa sbyin pa la sogs pas 'jig rten la rab tu slu bar byed do //
translated: The gods deceive the world with their magical powers and their gifts of holiness, etc., which are not the means.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis bdud las rgyal ba'i phyir bdud 'joms par mdzad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis bdud las rgyal ba'i phyir bdud 'joms par mdzad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One is called the one who conquers Mara because he has conquered Mara by the power of his knowledge of the karma of beings.

original: theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung ba la rab tu slu bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni bdud ni las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la /
analyzed: theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung ba la rab tu slu bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni bdud ni las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la /
translated: It is a deception regarding the Great Vehicle, which is the means of deliverance.

original: de'i bsngags pa ma yin pa bsgrags pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa las bdun @172b pa bzlog nas nyan thos kyi theg pa la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i bsngags pa ma yin pa bsgrags pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa las bdun @172b pa bzlog nas nyan thos kyi theg pa la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Mara, by proclaiming the faults of the bodhisattva, turns the beginner away from the bodhisattva way and joins him to the Disciple Vehicle.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni stobs lhag ma dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa la sogs pas theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung ba la rab tu slu bar byed pa'i bdud bcom nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni stobs lhag ma dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa la sogs pas theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung ba la rab tu slu bar byed pa'i bdud bcom nas /
translated: The Lord Buddhas, by means of the remaining powers, such as that of the knowledge of what is correct and incorrect, etc., destroy the Mara who deceives regarding the Great Vehicle, which is the means of deliverance.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor zhing 'doms par mdzad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la sbyor zhing 'doms par mdzad do //
translated: They join the bodhisattvas to the bodhisattva way and instruct them.

original: 'di'i phyir yang bcom ldan 'das kyang bdud 'joms par mdzad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang bcom ldan 'das kyang bdud 'joms par mdzad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: For this reason also the Lord is called the destroyer of Mara.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi ni kye ma nga mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par zhal gyis 'che ba la /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi ni kye ma nga mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par zhal gyis 'che ba la /
translated: The four forms of fearlessness are as follows: ‚ÄúI declare, ‚ÄòI am a fully enlightened Buddha.‚Äô

original: lha dang bcas /
analyzed: lha dang bcas /
translated: In this world with its gods,

original: bdud dang bcas /
analyzed: bdud dang bcas /
translated: with MƒÅra,

original: tshangs pa dang bcas /
analyzed: tshangs pa dang bcas /
translated: with BrahmƒÅ,

original: dge sbyong dang bram ze'i skye dgur bcas /
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze'i skye dgur bcas /
translated: with its monastics and brahmins,

original: lha dang / mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten 'di ni chos 'di dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes nga la 'ga' yang chos dang mthun pas gleng bar byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: lha dang / mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten 'di ni chos 'di dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes nga la 'ga' yang chos dang mthun pas gleng bar byed pa'i rgyu mtshan yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
translated: with its gods and humans, I do not see any reason for anyone to legitimately accuse me, saying, ‚ÄòWhile you claim to be fully enlightened, you have not realized this or that aspect of the Dharma.‚Äô

original: rgyu mtshan yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas 'di na nga bde ba thob pa dang / 'jigs pa med par gyur cing gnas te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas 'di na nga bde ba thob pa dang / 'jigs pa med par gyur cing gnas te /
translated: Since I do not see any reason for this, I have attained happiness, fearlessness, and stability.

original: khyu mchog gi gnas rlabs po che zhal gyis 'che zhing tshogs pa'i 'khor lo sngon 'jig rten na dge sbyong dang bram ze sus kyang chos dang mthun par ma bskor ba bskor ba mdzad do //
analyzed: khyu mchog gi gnas rlabs po che zhal gyis 'che zhing tshogs pa'i 'khor lo sngon 'jig rten na dge sbyong dang bram ze sus kyang chos dang mthun par ma bskor ba bskor ba mdzad do //
translated: I declare the exalted state of the bull, and I turn the wheel of the Dharma that has not been turned in any way by any of the monastics, brahmins, gods, or humans in the world.‚Äù

original: kye ma nga zag pa zad par zhal gyis 'che ba la 'di na zag pa 'di dag yongs su ma zad do zhes 'ga' yang zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //üîΩngas par du gcod pa'i chos gsungs pa gang dag yin pa de dag bsten bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba thams cad do //
analyzed: kye ma nga zag pa zad par zhal gyis 'che ba la 'di na zag pa 'di dag yongs su ma zad do zhes 'ga' yang zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no // ngas par du gcod pa'i chos gsungs pa gang dag yin pa de dag bsten bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba thams cad do //
translated: No one can say to me, You have not eliminated this contaminant, as before.üîΩ No one can say to me, The factors of abandonment that I have taught do not lead to abandonment, as before.

original: ngas nges par 'byin pa'i chos su bshad pa gang dag yin pa de dag bsten na de byed pa'i sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par byed par nges par 'byung ba yin no zhes 'di na nga la 'ga' yang zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin du rig par
analyzed: ngas nges par 'byin pa'i chos su bshad pa gang dag yin pa de dag bsten na de byed pa'i sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par byed par nges par 'byung ba yin no zhes 'di na nga la 'ga' yang zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin du rig par
translated: No one can say to me, The factors of definite emergence that I have taught do not lead to the definite emergence that is the complete cessation of suffering, as before.

original: bya ste / 'di dag ni mi 'jigs pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: bya ste / 'di dag ni mi 'jigs pa bzhi yin no //
translated: These are the four forms of fearlessness.

original: bsrung ba med pa gsum ni /
analyzed: bsrung ba med pa gsum ni /
translated: The three forms of awareness that do not require protection are as follows.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i phrin las dang gsung dang thugs kyi phrin las bsrung ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i phrin las dang gsung dang thugs kyi phrin las bsrung ba med pa ste /
translated: The tathƒÅgatas have no need to protect their physical, verbal, and mental actions.

original: bsrung ba med pa gsum gyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyes pa mdzad pa 'chab pa rnam pa thams cad spangs pa 'di yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: bsrung ba med pa gsum gyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyes pa mdzad pa 'chab pa rnam pa thams cad spangs pa 'di yongs su bstan to //
translated: The three types of absence of protection indicate that the Tathagata has completely abandoned all concealment of misdeeds.

original: gang yang dgra bcom pa la brgya lam na res 'ga' zhig brjed nas ngan par byas pa /
analyzed: gang yang dgra bcom pa la brgya lam na res 'ga' zhig brjed nas ngan par byas pa /
translated: Even though arhats sometimes forget and do something wrong,

original: lung du ma bstan pa cung zad tsam yod pa de yang /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa cung zad tsam yod pa de yang /
translated: they have a few indeterminate actions.üîΩBut the Tathagata has none of these, so he is the essence of what he claims to be.üîΩHe is not like the tirthikas who claim to be omniscient but are not.üîΩHe has completely abandoned all misdeeds and is therefore the essence of what he claims to be.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la thams cad kyi thams cad du mi mnga' bas de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ni ji @173a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la thams cad kyi thams cad du mi mnga' bas de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ni ji @173a * //
translated: He is not like the tirthikas who claim to be omniscient but are not.

original: ltar zhal gyis 'che ba de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid yin no //üîΩnyan thos rnams tshar bcad cing tshar bcad nas ngor lhangs por 'doms shing de dag kha cig ni brgyad /
analyzed: ltar zhal gyis 'che ba de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid yin no // nyan thos rnams tshar bcad cing tshar bcad nas ngor lhangs por 'doms shing de dag kha cig ni brgyad /
translated: He has completely abandoned all misdeeds and is therefore the essence of what he claims to be.üîΩHe is not like the tirthikas who claim to be omniscient but are not.üîΩHe has completely abandoned all misdeeds and is therefore the essence of what he claims to be.üîΩHe is not like the tirthikas who claim to be omniscient but are not.üîΩHe has completely abandoned all misdeeds and is therefore the essence of what he claims to be.üîΩHe is not like the tirthikas who claim to be omniscient but are not.üîΩHe has completely abandoned all misdeeds and is therefore the essence of what he claims to be.üîΩHe is not like the tirthikas who claim to be omniscient but are not.üîΩHe has completely abandoned all misdeeds and is therefore the essence of what he claims to be.üîΩHe is not like the tirthikas who claim to be omniscient but are not.üîΩHe has completely abandoned all misdeeds and is therefore the essence of what he claims to be.üîΩHe is not like the tirthikas who claim to be omniscient but are not.üîΩHe has completely abandoned all misdeeds and is therefore the essence of what he claims to be.üîΩHe is not like the tirthikas who claim to be omniscient but are not.üîΩHe has completely abandoned all misdeeds and is therefore the essence of what he claims to be.

original: kha cig ni skrod pas brlang por mdzad kyang 'di la ni 'di dag la bdag nyan thos rnams dang gnas pa'i rgyus /
analyzed: kha cig ni skrod pas brlang por mdzad kyang 'di la ni 'di dag la bdag nyan thos rnams dang gnas pa'i rgyus /
translated: He is not like the tirthikas who claim to be omniscient but are not.üîΩHe has completely abandoned all misdeeds and is therefore the essence of what he claims to be.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs yongs su ma dag pa kun tu spyod pa rig nas gzhi des yi ma rangs shing ma mgu ba rnams gleng bar 'gyur zhing gzhan dag la yang sgrogs par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pa'i bsrung ba mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs yongs su ma dag pa kun tu spyod pa rig nas gzhi des yi ma rangs shing ma mgu ba rnams gleng bar 'gyur zhing gzhan dag la yang sgrogs par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pa'i bsrung ba mi 'byung ngo //
translated: If they were to speak about it, others might hear and think, It is inappropriate for them to engage in conduct that is impure in terms of body, speech, and mind.

original: ma 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three types of closely placed recollection that are not shared?

original: 'di ni ston pa thugs brtse ba thugs rje can don bzhed pa phan par bzhed pa nyan thos rnams la kye dge slong dag 'di ni khyed la phan par byed pa /
analyzed: 'di ni ston pa thugs brtse ba thugs rje can don bzhed pa phan par bzhed pa nyan thos rnams la kye dge slong dag 'di ni khyed la phan par byed pa /
translated: The Teacher, who is compassionate, who has a heart full of compassion, who desires to benefit, and who desires to bring happiness, teaches the Dharma to the assembly of disciples, saying, ‚ÄúMonks, this is for your benefit.

original: 'di ni khyod la bde bar byed pa /
analyzed: 'di ni khyod la bde bar byed pa /
translated: This is for your happiness.üîΩThis is for your benefit and happiness.‚Äù

original: 'di ni khyed la phan pa dang bde bar byed pa'o zhes 'khor gyi nang du chos ston par mdzad cing de na nyan thos rnams de la gus par byas te nyan par byed /
analyzed: 'di ni khyed la phan pa dang bde bar byed pa'o zhes 'khor gyi nang du chos ston par mdzad cing de na nyan thos rnams de la gus par byas te nyan par byed /
translated: The disciples there listen with devotion to that teaching.

original: rna gtod par byed /
analyzed: rna gtod par byed /
translated: They lend their ears.

original: kun shes pa'i sems nye bar 'jog par byed na ;
analyzed: kun shes pa'i sems nye bar 'jog par byed na ;
